microsoft.exchange.accepteddomain.description: This resource configures the Accepted Email Domains in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.accepteddomain.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.accepteddomain

Identity.description: Specify the Fully Qualified Domain Name for the AcceptedDomain.
Identity.title: Identity

Ensure.description: Specify if the AcceptedDomain should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

DomainType.description: The type of AcceptedDomain.  Currently the EXOAcceptedDomain DSC Resource accepts a value of 'Authoritative' and 'InternalRelay'.
DomainType.title: DomainType

MatchSubDomains.description: The MatchSubDomains parameter must be false on Authoritative domains. The default value is false.
MatchSubDomains.title: MatchSubDomains

OutboundOnly.description: OutboundOnly can only be enabled if the DomainType parameter is set to Authoritative or InternalRelay. The default value is false.
OutboundOnly.title: OutboundOnly

microsoft.exchange.activesyncdeviceacces.description: This resource configures Active Sync Device Access Rules in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.activesyncdeviceacces.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.activesyncdeviceaccessrule

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the identity of the device access rule.
Identity.title: Identity

AccessLevel.description: The AccessLevel parameter specifies whether the devices are allowed, blocked or quarantined.
AccessLevel.title: AccessLevel

Characteristic.description: The Characteristic parameter specifies the device characteristic or category that's used by the rule.
Characteristic.title: Characteristic

QueryString.description: The QueryString parameter specifies the device identifier that's used by the rule. This parameter uses a text value that's used with Characteristic parameter value to define the device.
QueryString.title: QueryString

Ensure.description: Specify if the Active Sync Device Access Rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.addressbookpolicy.description: This resource configures Address Book Policies in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.addressbookpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.addressbookpolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the name that you want this address book policy to be called.
Name.title: Name

AddressLists.description: The AddressLists parameter specifies the address lists that will be used by mailbox users who are assigned this address book policy. This parameter accepts multiple values.
AddressLists.title: AddressLists

GlobalAddressList.description: The GlobalAddressList parameter specifies the identity of the global address list (GAL) that will be used by mailbox users who are assigned this address book policy. You can specify only one GAL for each address book policy.
GlobalAddressList.title: GlobalAddressList

OfflineAddressBook.description: The OfflineAddressBook parameter specifies the identity of the offline address book (OAB) that will be used by mailbox users who are assigned this address book policy. You can specify only one OAB for each address book policy.
OfflineAddressBook.title: OfflineAddressBook

RoomList.description: The RoomList parameter specifies the name of the room address list.
RoomList.title: RoomList

Ensure.description: Specify if the Address Book Policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.addresslist.description: This resource configures Exchange Online address lists.
microsoft.exchange.addresslist.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.addresslist

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies a unique name for the address list.
Name.title: Name

ConditionalCompany.description: The ConditionalCompany parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's Company property.
ConditionalCompany.title: ConditionalCompany

ConditionalCustomAttribute1.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute1 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute1 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute1.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute1

ConditionalCustomAttribute10.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute10 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute10 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute10.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute10

ConditionalCustomAttribute11.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute11 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute11 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute11.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute11

ConditionalCustomAttribute12.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute12 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute12 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute12.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute12

ConditionalCustomAttribute13.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute13 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute13 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute13.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute13

ConditionalCustomAttribute14.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute14 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute14 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute14.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute14

ConditionalCustomAttribute15.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute15 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute15 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute15.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute15

ConditionalCustomAttribute2.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute2 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute2 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute2.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute2

ConditionalCustomAttribute3.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute3 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute3 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute3.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute3

ConditionalCustomAttribute4.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute4 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute4 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute4.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute4

ConditionalCustomAttribute5.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute5 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute5 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute5.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute5

ConditionalCustomAttribute6.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute6 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute6 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute6.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute6

ConditionalCustomAttribute7.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute7 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute7 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute7.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute7

ConditionalCustomAttribute8.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute8 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute8 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute8.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute8

ConditionalCustomAttribute9.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute9 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute9 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute9.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute9

ConditionalDepartment.description: The ConditionalDepartment parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's Department property.
ConditionalDepartment.title: ConditionalDepartment

ConditionalStateOrProvince.description: The ConditionalStateOrProvince parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's StateOrProvince property.
ConditionalStateOrProvince.title: ConditionalStateOrProvince

DisplayName.description: The DisplayName parameter specifies the display name of the address list.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

IncludedRecipients.description: The IncludedRecipients parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the recipient type.
IncludedRecipients.title: IncludedRecipients

RecipientFilter.description: The RecipientFilter parameter specifies a custom OPath filter that's based on the value of any available recipient property.
RecipientFilter.title: RecipientFilter

Ensure.description: Specifies if this AddressList should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.antiphishpolicy.description:
This resource configures an Anti-Phish Policy in Exchange Online.
Reference: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/exchange/advanced-threat-protection/new-antiphishpolicy?view=exchange-ps
microsoft.exchange.antiphishpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.antiphishpolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the name of the antiphishing policy that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

AdminDisplayName.description: The AdminDisplayName parameter specifies a description for the policy.
AdminDisplayName.title: AdminDisplayName

PhishThresholdLevel.description: The PhishThresholdLevel parameter specifies the tolerance level that's used by machine learning in the handling of phishing messages.
PhishThresholdLevel.title: PhishThresholdLevel

AuthenticationFailAction.description: The AuthenticationFailAction parameter specifies the action to take when the message fails composite authentication.
AuthenticationFailAction.title: AuthenticationFailAction

TargetedUserProtectionAction.description: The TargetedUserProtectionAction parameter specifies the action to take on detected user impersonation messages for the users specified by the TargetedUsersToProtect parameter.
TargetedUserProtectionAction.title: TargetedUserProtectionAction

Enabled.description: Specify if this policy should be enabled. Default is $true.
Enabled.title: Enabled

EnableFirstContactSafetyTips.description: The EnableFirstContactSafetyTips parameter specifies whether to enable or disable the safety tip that's shown when recipients first receive an email from a sender or do not often receive email from a sender.
EnableFirstContactSafetyTips.title: EnableFirstContactSafetyTips

EnableMailboxIntelligence.description: The EnableMailboxIntelligence parameter specifies whether to enable or disable mailbox intelligence (the first contact graph) in domain and user impersonation protection.
EnableMailboxIntelligence.title: EnableMailboxIntelligence

EnableMailboxIntelligenceProtection.description: The EnableMailboxIntelligenceProtection specifies whether to enable or disable enhanced impersonation results based on each user's individual sender map. This intelligence allows Microsoft 365 to customize user impersonation detection and better handle false positives.
EnableMailboxIntelligenceProtection.title: EnableMailboxIntelligenceProtection

EnableOrganizationDomainsProtection.description: The EnableOrganizationDomainsProtection parameter specifies whether to enable domain impersonation protection for all registered domains in the Office 365 organization.
EnableOrganizationDomainsProtection.title: EnableOrganizationDomainsProtection

EnableSimilarDomainsSafetyTips.description: The EnableSimilarDomainsSafetyTips parameter specifies whether to enable safety tips that are shown to recipients in messages for domain impersonation detections.
EnableSimilarDomainsSafetyTips.title: EnableSimilarDomainsSafetyTips

EnableSimilarUsersSafetyTips.description: The EnableSimilarUsersSafetyTips parameter specifies whether to enable safety tips that are shown to recipients in messages for user impersonation detections.
EnableSimilarUsersSafetyTips.title: EnableSimilarUsersSafetyTips

EnableSpoofIntelligence.description: The EnableSpoofIntelligence parameter specifies whether to enable or disable antispoofing protection for the policy.
EnableSpoofIntelligence.title: EnableSpoofIntelligence

EnableTargetedDomainsProtection.description: The EnableTargetedDomainsProtection parameter specifies whether to enable domain impersonation protection for a list of specified domains.
EnableTargetedDomainsProtection.title: EnableTargetedDomainsProtection

EnableTargetedUserProtection.description: The EnableTargetedUserProtection parameter specifies whether to enable user impersonation protection for the users specified by the TargetedUsersToProtect parameter
EnableTargetedUserProtection.title: EnableTargetedUserProtection

EnableUnauthenticatedSender.description: The EnableUnauthenticatedSender parameter enables or disables unauthenticated sender identification in Outlook.
EnableUnauthenticatedSender.title: EnableUnauthenticatedSender

EnableUnusualCharactersSafetyTips.description: The EnableUnusualCharactersSafetyTips parameter specifies whether to enable safety tips that are shown to recipients in messages for unusual characters in domain and user impersonation detections.
EnableUnusualCharactersSafetyTips.title: EnableUnusualCharactersSafetyTips

EnableViaTag.description: This setting is part of spoof protection. The EnableViaTag parameter enables or disables adding the via tag to the From address in Outlook.
EnableViaTag.title: EnableViaTag

MakeDefault.description: Make this the default antiphishing policy
MakeDefault.title: MakeDefault

ExcludedDomains.description: The ExcludedDomains parameter specifies trusted domains that are excluded from scanning by antiphishing protection. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
ExcludedDomains.title: ExcludedDomains

ExcludedSenders.description: The ExcludedSenders parameter specifies a list of trusted sender email addresses that are excluded from scanning by antiphishing protection. You can specify multiple email addresses separated by commas.
ExcludedSenders.title: ExcludedSenders

HonorDmarcPolicy.description: The HonorDmarcPolicy enables or disables using the sender's DMARC policy to determine what to do to messages that fail DMARC checks.
HonorDmarcPolicy.title: HonorDmarcPolicy

ImpersonationProtectionState.description: The ImpersonationProtectionState parameter specifies the configuration of impersonation protection.
ImpersonationProtectionState.title: ImpersonationProtectionState

MailboxIntelligenceProtectionAction.description: The MailboxIntelligenceProtectionAction parameter specifies what to do with messages that fail mailbox intelligence protection.
MailboxIntelligenceProtectionAction.title: MailboxIntelligenceProtectionAction

MailboxIntelligenceProtectionActionRecip.description: The MailboxIntelligenceProtectionActionRecipients parameter specifies the recipients to add to detected messages when the MailboxIntelligenceProtectionAction parameter is set to the value Redirect or BccMessage.
MailboxIntelligenceProtectionActionRecip.title: MailboxIntelligenceProtectionActionRecipients

MailboxIntelligenceQuarantineTag.description: The MailboxIntelligenceQuarantineTag specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined by mailbox intelligence.
MailboxIntelligenceQuarantineTag.title: MailboxIntelligenceQuarantineTag

SpoofQuarantineTag.description: The SpoofQuarantineTag specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined by spoof intelligence.
SpoofQuarantineTag.title: SpoofQuarantineTag

TargetedDomainActionRecipients.description: The TargetedDomainActionRecipients parameter specifies the recipients to add to detected domain impersonation messages when the TargetedDomainProtectionAction parameter is set to the value Redirect or BccMessage. A valid value for this parameter is an email address. You can specify multiple email addresses separated by commas.
TargetedDomainActionRecipients.title: TargetedDomainActionRecipients

TargetedDomainProtectionAction.description: The TargetedDomainProtectionAction parameter specifies the action to take on detected domain impersonation messages.
TargetedDomainProtectionAction.title: TargetedDomainProtectionAction

TargetedDomainsToProtect.description: The TargetedDomainsToProtect parameter specifies the domains that are included in domain impersonation protection when the EnableTargetedDomainsProtection parameter is set to $true.
TargetedDomainsToProtect.title: TargetedDomainsToProtect

TargetedDomainQuarantineTag.description: The TargetedDomainQuarantineTag specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined by domain impersonation protection.
TargetedDomainQuarantineTag.title: TargetedDomainQuarantineTag

TargetedUserActionRecipients.description: The TargetedUserActionRecipients parameter specifies the replacement or additional recipients for detected user impersonation messages when the TargetedUserProtectionAction parameter is set to the value Redirect or BccMessage. A valid value for this parameter is an email address. You can specify multiple email addresses separated by commas.
TargetedUserActionRecipients.title: TargetedUserActionRecipients

TargetedUsersToProtect.description: The TargetedUsersToProtect parameter specifies the users that are included in user impersonation protection when the EnableTargetedUserProtection parameter is set to $true.
TargetedUsersToProtect.title: TargetedUsersToProtect

TargetedUserQuarantineTag.description: The TargetedUserQuarantineTag specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined by user impersonation protection.
TargetedUserQuarantineTag.title: TargetedUserQuarantineTag

microsoft.exchange.antiphishrule.description:
This resource configures an Anti-Phish Rule in Exchange Online.
Reference: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/exchange/advanced-threat-protection/new-antiphishRule?view=exchange-ps
microsoft.exchange.antiphishrule.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.antiphishrule

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the name of the antiphishing rule that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

AntiPhishPolicy.description: The AntiPhishPolicy parameter specifies the name of the antiphishing policy that's associated with the antiphishing rule.
AntiPhishPolicy.title: AntiPhishPolicy

Enabled.description: Specify if this rule should be enabled. Default is $true.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies a priority value for the rule that determines the order of rule processing. A lower integer value indicates a higher priority, the value 0 is the highest priority, and rules can't have the same priority value.
Priority.title: Priority

Comments.description: The Comments parameter specifies informative comments for the rule, such as what the rule is used for or how it has changed over time. The length of the comment can't exceed 1024 characters.
Comments.title: Comments

ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.title: ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs

ExceptIfSentTo.description: The ExceptIfSentTo parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
ExceptIfSentTo.title: ExceptIfSentTo

ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.description: The ExceptIfSentToMemberOf parameter specifies an exception that looks for messages sent to members of groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.title: ExceptIfSentToMemberOf

RecipientDomainIs.description: The RecipientDomainIs parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
RecipientDomainIs.title: RecipientDomainIs

SentTo.description: The SentTo parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
SentTo.title: SentTo

SentToMemberOf.description: The SentToMemberOf parameter looks for messages sent to members of groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
SentToMemberOf.title: SentToMemberOf

microsoft.exchange.applicationaccesspoli.description: This resource configures Applications Access Policies in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.applicationaccesspoli.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.applicationaccesspolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the application access policy that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

AccessRight.description: The AccessRight parameter specifies the permission that you want to assign in the application access policy.
AccessRight.title: AccessRight

AppID.description: The AppID parameter specifies the GUID of the apps to include in the policy.
AppID.title: AppID

PolicyScopeGroupId.description: The PolicyScopeGroupID parameter specifies the recipient to define in the policy. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
PolicyScopeGroupId.title: PolicyScopeGroupId

Description.description: The Description parameter specifies a description for the policy.
Description.title: Description

Ensure.description: Specify if the Application Access Policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.atppolicyforo365.description:
This resource configures the Advanced Threat Protection (ATP) policy
in Office 365.  Tenant must be subscribed to ATP.
microsoft.exchange.atppolicyforo365.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.atppolicyforo365

IsSingleInstance.description: Specifies the resource is a single instance, the value must be 'Yes'
IsSingleInstance.title: IsSingleInstance

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the ATP policy that you want to modify. There's only one policy named Default.
Identity.title: Identity

Ensure.description: Since there is only one policy, the default policy, this must be set to 'Present'
Ensure.title: Ensure

AllowSafeDocsOpen.description: The AllowSafeDocsOpen parameter specifies whether users can click through and bypass the Protected View container even when Safe Documents identifies a file as malicious.
AllowSafeDocsOpen.title: AllowSafeDocsOpen

EnableATPForSPOTeamsODB.description: The EnableATPForSPOTeamsODB parameter specifies whether ATP is enabled for SharePoint Online, OneDrive for Business and Microsoft Teams. Default is $false.
EnableATPForSPOTeamsODB.title: EnableATPForSPOTeamsODB

EnableSafeDocs.description: The EnableSafeDocs parameter specifies whether to enable the Safe Documents feature in the organization. Default is $false.
EnableSafeDocs.title: EnableSafeDocs

microsoft.exchange.authenticationpolicy.description: This resource configures Authentication Policies in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.authenticationpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.authenticationpolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the authentication policy you want to view or modify.
Identity.title: Identity

AllowBasicAuthActiveSync.description: The AllowBasicAuthActiveSync switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with Exchange Active Sync.
AllowBasicAuthActiveSync.title: AllowBasicAuthActiveSync

AllowBasicAuthAutodiscover.description: The AllowBasicAuthAutodiscover switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with Autodiscover.
AllowBasicAuthAutodiscover.title: AllowBasicAuthAutodiscover

AllowBasicAuthImap.description: The AllowBasicAuthImap switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with IMAP.
AllowBasicAuthImap.title: AllowBasicAuthImap

AllowBasicAuthMapi.description: The AllowBasicAuthMapi switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with MAPI.
AllowBasicAuthMapi.title: AllowBasicAuthMapi

AllowBasicAuthOfflineAddressBook.description: The AllowBasicAuthOfflineAddressBook switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with Offline Address Books.
AllowBasicAuthOfflineAddressBook.title: AllowBasicAuthOfflineAddressBook

AllowBasicAuthOutlookService.description: The AllowBasicAuthOutlookService switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with the Outlook service.
AllowBasicAuthOutlookService.title: AllowBasicAuthOutlookService

AllowBasicAuthPop.description: The AllowBasicAuthPop switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with POP.
AllowBasicAuthPop.title: AllowBasicAuthPop

AllowBasicAuthPowershell.description: The AllowBasicAuthPowerShell switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with PowerShell.
AllowBasicAuthPowershell.title: AllowBasicAuthPowershell

AllowBasicAuthReportingWebServices.description: The AllowBasicAuthReporting Web Services switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with reporting web services.
AllowBasicAuthReportingWebServices.title: AllowBasicAuthReportingWebServices

AllowBasicAuthRpc.description: The AllowBasicAuthRpc switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with RPC.
AllowBasicAuthRpc.title: AllowBasicAuthRpc

AllowBasicAuthSmtp.description: The AllowBasicAuthSmtp switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with SMTP.
AllowBasicAuthSmtp.title: AllowBasicAuthSmtp

AllowBasicAuthWebServices.description: The AllowBasicAuthWebServices switch specifies whether to allow Basic authentication with Exchange Web Services (EWS).
AllowBasicAuthWebServices.title: AllowBasicAuthWebServices

Ensure.description: Specify if the authentication Policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.authenticationpolicya.description: This resource assigns Exchange Online Authentication Policies to users.
microsoft.exchange.authenticationpolicya.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.authenticationpolicyassignment

UserName.description: Name of the user assigned to the authentication policy.
UserName.title: UserName

Ensure.description: Specify if the authentication Policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.availabilityaddresssp.description: Create a new AvailabilityAddressSpace in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.availabilityaddresssp.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.availabilityaddressspace

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the AvailabilityAddressSpace you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

AccessMethod.description: The AccessMethod parameter specifies how the free/busy data is accessed. Valid values are:PerUserFB, OrgWideFB, OrgWideFBToken, OrgWideFBBasic,InternalProxy
AccessMethod.title: AccessMethod

Credentials.description: The Credentials parameter specifies the username and password that's used to access the Availability services in the target forest.
Credentials.title: Credentials

ForestName.description: The ForestName parameter specifies the SMTP domain name of the target forest for users whose free/busy data must be retrieved. If your users are distributed among multiple SMTP domains in the target forest, run the Add-AvailabilityAddressSpace command once for each SMTP domain.
ForestName.title: ForestName

TargetAutodiscoverEpr.description: The TargetAutodiscoverEpr parameter specifies the Autodiscover URL of Exchange Web Services for the external organization. Exchange uses Autodiscover to automatically detect the correct server endpoint for external requests.
TargetAutodiscoverEpr.title: TargetAutodiscoverEpr

TargetServiceEpr.description: The TargetServiceEpr parameter specifies the Exchange Online Calendar Service URL of the external Microsoft 365 organization that you're trying to read free/busy information from.
TargetServiceEpr.title: TargetServiceEpr

TargetTenantId.description: The TargetTenantID parameter specifies the tenant ID of the external Microsoft 365 organization that you're trying to read free/busy information from.
TargetTenantId.title: TargetTenantId

Ensure.description: Specifies if this AvailabilityAddressSpace should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.availabilityconfig.description: This resource configures the Availability Config in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.availabilityconfig.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.availabilityconfig

OrgWideAccount.description: Specify the OrgWideAccount for the AvailabilityConfig.
OrgWideAccount.title: OrgWideAccount

Ensure.description: Specify if the AvailabilityConfig should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.calendarprocessing.description: This resource configures the Calendar Processing settings Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.calendarprocessing.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.calendarprocessing

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the resource mailbox that you want to view. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the mailbox.
Identity.title: Identity

AddAdditionalResponse.description: The AddAdditionalResponse parameter specifies whether additional information (the value of the AdditionalResponse parameter) is added to meeting request responses
AddAdditionalResponse.title: AddAdditionalResponse

AdditionalResponse.description: The AdditionalResponse parameter specifies the additional information to be included in responses to meeting requests when the value of the AddAdditionalResponse parameter is $true. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
AdditionalResponse.title: AdditionalResponse

AddNewRequestsTentatively.description: The AddNewRequestsTentatively parameter specifies whether new meeting requests are added to the calendar as tentative
AddNewRequestsTentatively.title: AddNewRequestsTentatively

AddOrganizerToSubject.description: The AddOrganizerToSubject parameter specifies whether the meeting organizer's name is used as the subject of the meeting request.
AddOrganizerToSubject.title: AddOrganizerToSubject

AllBookInPolicy.description: The AllBookInPolicy parameter specifies whether to automatically approve in-policy requests from all users to the resource mailbox.
AllBookInPolicy.title: AllBookInPolicy

AllowConflicts.description: The AllowConflicts parameter specifies whether to allow conflicting meeting requests.
AllowConflicts.title: AllowConflicts

AllowRecurringMeetings.description: The AllowRecurringMeetings parameter specifies whether to allow recurring meetings in meeting requests.
AllowRecurringMeetings.title: AllowRecurringMeetings

AllRequestInPolicy.description: The AllRequestInPolicy parameter specifies whether to allow all users to submit in-policy requests to the resource mailbox.
AllRequestInPolicy.title: AllRequestInPolicy

AllRequestOutOfPolicy.description: The AllRequestOutOfPolicy parameter specifies whether to allow all users to submit out-of-policy requests to the resource mailbox.
AllRequestOutOfPolicy.title: AllRequestOutOfPolicy

AutomateProcessing.description: The AutomateProcessing parameter enables or disables calendar processing on the mailbox.
AutomateProcessing.title: AutomateProcessing

BookingType.description: The BookingType parameter specifies how reservations work on the resource mailbox.
BookingType.title: BookingType

BookingWindowInDays.description: The BookingWindowInDays parameter specifies the maximum number of days in advance that the resource can be reserved. A valid value is an integer from 0 through 1080. The default value is 180 days. The value 0 means today.
BookingWindowInDays.title: BookingWindowInDays

BookInPolicy.description: The BookInPolicy parameter specifies users or groups who are allowed to submit in-policy meeting requests to the resource mailbox that are automatically approved. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the user or group.
BookInPolicy.title: BookInPolicy

ConflictPercentageAllowed.description: The ConflictPercentageAllowed parameter specifies the maximum percentage of meeting conflicts for new recurring meeting requests. A valid value is an integer from 0 through 100. The default value is 0.
ConflictPercentageAllowed.title: ConflictPercentageAllowed

DeleteAttachments.description: The DeleteAttachments parameter specifies whether to remove attachments from all incoming messages.
DeleteAttachments.title: DeleteAttachments

DeleteComments.description: The DeleteComments parameter specifies whether to remove or keep any text in the message body of incoming meeting requests.
DeleteComments.title: DeleteComments

DeleteNonCalendarItems.description: The DeleteNonCalendarItems parameter specifies whether to remove or keep all non-calendar-related messages that are received by the resource mailbox.
DeleteNonCalendarItems.title: DeleteNonCalendarItems

DeleteSubject.description: The DeleteSubject parameter specifies whether to remove or keep the subject of incoming meeting requests.
DeleteSubject.title: DeleteSubject

EnableResponseDetails.description: The EnableResponseDetails parameter specifies whether to include the reasons for accepting or declining a meeting in the response email message.
EnableResponseDetails.title: EnableResponseDetails

EnforceCapacity.description: The EnforceCapacity parameter specifies whether to restrict the number of attendees to the capacity of the workspace. For example, if capacity is set to 10, then only 10 people can book the workspace.
EnforceCapacity.title: EnforceCapacity

EnforceSchedulingHorizon.description: The EnforceSchedulingHorizon parameter controls the behavior of recurring meetings that extend beyond the date specified by the BookingWindowInDays parameter.
EnforceSchedulingHorizon.title: EnforceSchedulingHorizon

ForwardRequestsToDelegates.description: The ForwardRequestsToDelegates parameter specifies whether to forward incoming meeting requests to the delegates that are configured for the resource mailbox.
ForwardRequestsToDelegates.title: ForwardRequestsToDelegates

MaximumConflictInstances.description: The MaximumConflictInstances parameter specifies the maximum number of conflicts for new recurring meeting requests when the AllowRecurringMeetings parameter is set to $true. A valid value is an integer from 0 through INT32 (2147483647). The default value is 0.
MaximumConflictInstances.title: MaximumConflictInstances

MaximumDurationInMinutes.description: The MaximumDurationInMinutes parameter specifies the maximum duration in minutes for meeting requests. A valid value is an integer from 0 through INT32 (2147483647). The default value is 1440 (24 hours).
MaximumDurationInMinutes.title: MaximumDurationInMinutes

MinimumDurationInMinutes.description: The MinimumDurationInMinutes parameter specifies the minimum duration in minutes for meeting requests in workspace mailboxes. A valid value is an integer from 0 through INT32 (2147483647). The default value is 0, which means there is no minimum duration.
MinimumDurationInMinutes.title: MinimumDurationInMinutes

OrganizerInfo.description: The OrganizerInfo parameter specifies whether the resource mailbox sends organizer information when a meeting request is declined because of conflicts.
OrganizerInfo.title: OrganizerInfo

ProcessExternalMeetingMessages.description: The ProcessExternalMeetingMessages parameter specifies whether to process meeting requests that originate outside the Exchange organization.
ProcessExternalMeetingMessages.title: ProcessExternalMeetingMessages

RemoveCanceledMeetings.description: The RemoveCanceledMeetings parameter specifies whether to automatically delete meetings that were cancelled by the organizer from the resource mailbox's calendar.
RemoveCanceledMeetings.title: RemoveCanceledMeetings

RemoveForwardedMeetingNotifications.description: The RemoveForwardedMeetingNotifications parameter specifies whether forwarded meeting notifications are moved to the Deleted Items folder after they're processed by the Calendar Attendant.
RemoveForwardedMeetingNotifications.title: RemoveForwardedMeetingNotifications

RemoveOldMeetingMessages.description: The RemoveOldMeetingMessages parameter specifies whether the Calendar Attendant removes old and redundant updates and responses.
RemoveOldMeetingMessages.title: RemoveOldMeetingMessages

RemovePrivateProperty.description: The RemovePrivateProperty parameter specifies whether to clear the private flag for incoming meetings that were sent by the organizer in the original requests.
RemovePrivateProperty.title: RemovePrivateProperty

RequestInPolicy.description: The RemovePrivateProperty parameter specifies whether to clear the private flag for incoming meetings that were sent by the organizer in the original requests.
RequestInPolicy.title: RequestInPolicy

RequestOutOfPolicy.description: The RequestOutOfPolicy parameter specifies users who are allowed to submit out-of-policy requests that require approval by a resource mailbox delegate. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the user.
RequestOutOfPolicy.title: RequestOutOfPolicy

ResourceDelegates.description: The ResourceDelegates parameter specifies users can approve or reject requests that are sent to the resource mailbox. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the user.
ResourceDelegates.title: ResourceDelegates

ScheduleOnlyDuringWorkHours.description: The ScheduleOnlyDuringWorkHours parameter specifies whether to allow meetings to be scheduled outside of the working hours that are defined for the resource mailbox.
ScheduleOnlyDuringWorkHours.title: ScheduleOnlyDuringWorkHours

TentativePendingApproval.description: The TentativePendingApproval parameter specifies whether to mark pending requests as tentative on the calendar.
TentativePendingApproval.title: TentativePendingApproval

Ensure.description: Determines whether or not the instance exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.casmailboxplan.description:
This resource configures Client Access services (CAS) mailbox plans
in cloud-based organizations.
microsoft.exchange.casmailboxplan.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.casmailboxplan

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the CAS Mailbox Plan that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

DisplayName.description: The display name of the CAS Mailbox Plan.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

Ensure.description: CASMailboxPlans cannot be created/removed in O365.  This must be set to 'Present'
Ensure.title: Ensure

ActiveSyncEnabled.description: The ActiveSyncEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox by using Exchange Active Sync. Default is $true.
ActiveSyncEnabled.title: ActiveSyncEnabled

ImapEnabled.description: The ImapEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox by using IMAP4 clients. The default value is $true for all CAS mailbox plans except ExchangeOnlineDeskless which is $false by default.
ImapEnabled.title: ImapEnabled

OwaMailboxPolicy.description: The OwaMailboxPolicy parameter specifies the Outlook on the web (formerly known as Outlook Web App) mailbox policy for the mailbox plan. The default value is OwaMailboxPolicy-Default. You can use the Get-OwaMailboxPolicy cmdlet to view the available Outlook on the web mailbox policies.
OwaMailboxPolicy.title: OwaMailboxPolicy

PopEnabled.description: The PopEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox by using POP3 clients. Default is $true.
PopEnabled.title: PopEnabled

microsoft.exchange.casmailboxsettings.description: This resource configures CAS mailbox settings.
microsoft.exchange.casmailboxsettings.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.casmailboxsettings

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the mailbox that you want to configure.
Identity.title: Identity

ActiveSyncAllowedDeviceIDs.description: TheActiveSyncAllowedDeviceIDs parameter specifies one or more Exchange ActiveSync device IDs that are allowed to synchronize with the mailbox.
ActiveSyncAllowedDeviceIDs.title: ActiveSyncAllowedDeviceIDs

ActiveSyncBlockedDeviceIDs.description: The ActiveSyncBlockedDeviceIDs parameter specifies one or more Exchange ActiveSync device IDs that aren't allowed to synchronize with the mailbox.
ActiveSyncBlockedDeviceIDs.title: ActiveSyncBlockedDeviceIDs

ActiveSyncDebugLogging.description: The ActiveSyncDebugLogging parameter enables or disables Exchange ActiveSync debug logging for the mailbox.
ActiveSyncDebugLogging.title: ActiveSyncDebugLogging

ActiveSyncEnabled.description: The ActiveSyncEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using Exchange ActiveSync.
ActiveSyncEnabled.title: ActiveSyncEnabled

ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy.description: The ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy parameter specifies the Exchange ActiveSync mailbox policy for the mailbox.
ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy.title: ActiveSyncMailboxPolicy

ActiveSyncSuppressReadReceipt.description: The ActiveSyncSuppressReadReceipt parameter controls the behavior of read receipts for Exchange ActiveSync clients that access the mailbox.
ActiveSyncSuppressReadReceipt.title: ActiveSyncSuppressReadReceipt

EwsAllowEntourage.description: The EwsAllowEntourage parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox by Microsoft Entourage clients that use Exchange Web Services.
EwsAllowEntourage.title: EwsAllowEntourage

EwsAllowList.description: The EwsAllowList parameter specifies the Exchange Web Services applications (user agent strings) that are allowed to access the mailbox.
EwsAllowList.title: EwsAllowList

EwsAllowMacOutlook.description: The EwsAllowMacOutlook parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox by Outlook for Mac clients that use Exchange Web Services.
EwsAllowMacOutlook.title: EwsAllowMacOutlook

EwsAllowOutlook.description: The EwsAllowOutlook parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox by Outlook clients that use Exchange Web Services.
EwsAllowOutlook.title: EwsAllowOutlook

EwsApplicationAccessPolicy.description: The EwsApplicationAccessPolicy parameter controls access to the mailbox using Exchange Web Services applications.
EwsApplicationAccessPolicy.title: EwsApplicationAccessPolicy

EwsBlockList.description: The EwsBlockList parameter specifies the Exchange Web Services applications (user agent strings) that aren't allowed to access the mailbox using Exchange Web Services.
EwsBlockList.title: EwsBlockList

EwsEnabled.description: The EwsEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using Exchange Web Services clients.
EwsEnabled.title: EwsEnabled

ImapEnabled.description: The ImapEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using IMAP4 clients.
ImapEnabled.title: ImapEnabled

ImapMessagesRetrievalMimeFormat.description: The ImapMessagesRetrievalMimeFormat parameter specifies the message format for IMAP4 clients that access the mailbox.
ImapMessagesRetrievalMimeFormat.title: ImapMessagesRetrievalMimeFormat

ImapForceICalForCalendarRetrievalOption.description: The ImapForceICalForCalendarRetrievalOption parameter specifies how meeting requests are presented to IMAP4 clients that access the mailbox.
ImapForceICalForCalendarRetrievalOption.title: ImapForceICalForCalendarRetrievalOption

ImapSuppressReadReceipt.description: The ImapSuppressReadReceipt parameter controls the behavior of read receipts for IMAP4 clients that access the mailbox.
ImapSuppressReadReceipt.title: ImapSuppressReadReceipt

ImapUseProtocolDefaults.description: The ImapUseProtocolDefaults parameter specifies whether to use the IMAP4 protocol defaults for the mailbox.
ImapUseProtocolDefaults.title: ImapUseProtocolDefaults

MacOutlookEnabled.description: The MacOutlookEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using Outlook for Mac clients that use Microsoft Sync technology.
MacOutlookEnabled.title: MacOutlookEnabled

MAPIEnabled.description: The MAPIEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using MAPI clients (for example, Outlook).
MAPIEnabled.title: MAPIEnabled

OneWinNativeOutlookEnabled.description: The OneWinNativeOutlookEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using the new Outlook for Windows.
OneWinNativeOutlookEnabled.title: OneWinNativeOutlookEnabled

OutlookMobileEnabled.description: The OutlookMobileEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using Outlook for iOS and Android.
OutlookMobileEnabled.title: OutlookMobileEnabled

OWAEnabled.description: The OWAEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using Outlook on the web (formerly known as Outlook Web App or OWA).
OWAEnabled.title: OWAEnabled

OWAforDevicesEnabled.description: The OWAforDevicesEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using the older Outlook Web App (OWA) app on iOS and Android devices.
OWAforDevicesEnabled.title: OWAforDevicesEnabled

OwaMailboxPolicy.description: The OwaMailboxPolicy parameter specifies the Outlook on the web mailbox policy for the mailbox.
OwaMailboxPolicy.title: OwaMailboxPolicy

PopEnabled.description: The PopEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using POP3 clients.
PopEnabled.title: PopEnabled

PopForceICalForCalendarRetrievalOption.description: The PopForceICalForCalendarRetrievalOption parameter specifies how meeting requests are presented to POP3 clients that access the mailbox.
PopForceICalForCalendarRetrievalOption.title: PopForceICalForCalendarRetrievalOption

PopMessagesRetrievalMimeFormat.description: The PopMessagesRetrievalMimeFormat parameter specifies the message format for POP3 clients that access the mailbox.
PopMessagesRetrievalMimeFormat.title: PopMessagesRetrievalMimeFormat

PopSuppressReadReceipt.description: The PopSuppressReadReceipt parameter controls the behavior of read receipts for POP3 clients that access the mailbox.
PopSuppressReadReceipt.title: PopSuppressReadReceipt

PopUseProtocolDefaults.description: The PopUseProtocolDefaults parameter specifies whether to use the POP3 protocol defaults for the mailbox.
PopUseProtocolDefaults.title: PopUseProtocolDefaults

PublicFolderClientAccess.description: The PublicFolderClientAccess parameter enables or disables access to public folders in Microsoft Outlook.
PublicFolderClientAccess.title: PublicFolderClientAccess

ShowGalAsDefaultView.description: The ShowGalAsDefaultView parameter specifies whether the global address list (GAL) is the default recipient picker for messages.
ShowGalAsDefaultView.title: ShowGalAsDefaultView

SmtpClientAuthenticationDisabled.description: The SmtpClientAuthenticationDisabled parameter specifies whether to disable authenticated SMTP (SMTP AUTH) for the mailbox.
SmtpClientAuthenticationDisabled.title: SmtpClientAuthenticationDisabled

UniversalOutlookEnabled.description: The UniversalOutlookEnabled parameter enables or disables access to the mailbox using Windows 10 Mail and Calendar.
UniversalOutlookEnabled.title: UniversalOutlookEnabled

Ensure.description: Present ensures the Mailbox CAS settings are applied.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.clientaccessrule.description:
This resource configures Client Access sRules.
Client Access Rules help you control access to your organization based
on the properties of the connection.

Note: Not all authentication types are supported for all protocols.

The supported authentication types per protocol can be found here:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/clients-and-mobile-in-exchange-online/client-access-rules/client-access-rules
microsoft.exchange.clientaccessrule.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.clientaccessrule

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the client access rule that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Action.description: The Action parameter specifies the action for the client access rule. Valid values for this parameter are AllowAccess and DenyAccess.
Action.title: Action

AnyOfAuthenticationTypes.description: The AnyOfAuthenticationTypes parameter specifies a condition for the client access rule that is based on the client's authentication type. Valid values for this parameter are AdfsAuthentication, BasicAuthentication, CertificateBasedAuthentication, NonBasicAuthentication, OAuthAuthentication.
AnyOfAuthenticationTypes.title: AnyOfAuthenticationTypes

AnyOfClientIPAddressesOrRanges.description: The AnyOfClientIPAddressesOrRanges parameter specifies a condition for the client access rule that is based on the client's IP address. Valid values for this parameter are: A single IP address, an IP address range, a CIDR IP.
AnyOfClientIPAddressesOrRanges.title: AnyOfClientIPAddressesOrRanges

AnyOfProtocols.description: The AnyOfProtocols parameter specifies a condition for the client access rule that is based on the client's protocol. Valid values for this parameter are ExchangeActiveSync,ExchangeAdminCenter,ExchangeWebServices,IMAP4,OfflineAddressBook,OutlookAnywhere,OutlookWebApp,POP3,PowerShellWebServices,RemotePowerShell,REST,UniversalOutlook.
AnyOfProtocols.title: AnyOfProtocols

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter specifies whether the client access rule is enabled or disabled. Default is $true.
Enabled.title: Enabled

ExceptAnyOfAuthenticationTypes.description: The ExceptAnyOfAuthenticationTypes parameter specifies an exception for the client access rule that is based on the client's authentication type. Valid values for this parameter are AdfsAuthentication, BasicAuthentication, CertificateBasedAuthentication, NonBasicAuthentication, OAuthAuthentication.
ExceptAnyOfAuthenticationTypes.title: ExceptAnyOfAuthenticationTypes

ExceptAnyOfClientIPAddressesOrRanges.description: The ExceptAnyOfClientIPAddressesOrRanges parameter specifies an exception for the client access rule that is based on the client's IP address. Valid values for this parameter are: A single IP address, an IP address range, a CIDR IP.
ExceptAnyOfClientIPAddressesOrRanges.title: ExceptAnyOfClientIPAddressesOrRanges

ExceptAnyOfProtocols.description: The ExceptAnyOfProtocols parameter specifies an exception for the client access rule that is based on the client's protocol. Valid values for this parameter are ExchangeActiveSync,ExchangeAdminCenter,ExchangeWebServices,IMAP4,OfflineAddressBook,OutlookAnywhere,OutlookWebApp,POP3,PowerShellWebServices,RemotePowerShell,REST,UniversalOutlook.
ExceptAnyOfProtocols.title: ExceptAnyOfProtocols

ExceptUsernameMatchesAnyOfPatterns.description: The ExceptUsernameMatchesAnyOfPatterns parameter specifies an exception for the client access rule that is based on the user's account name.
ExceptUsernameMatchesAnyOfPatterns.title: ExceptUsernameMatchesAnyOfPatterns

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies a priority value for the client access rule. A lower integer value indicates a higher priority, and a higher priority rule is evaluated before a lower priority rule. The default value is 1.
Priority.title: Priority

RuleScope.description: The RuleScope parameter specifies the scope of the client access rule. Valid values are All and Users
RuleScope.title: RuleScope

UserRecipientFilter.description: The UserRecipientFilter parameter specifies a condition for the client access rule that uses OPath filter syntax to identify the user.
UserRecipientFilter.title: UserRecipientFilter

UsernameMatchesAnyOfPatterns.description: The UsernameMatchesAnyOfPatterns parameter specifies a condition for the client access rule that is based on the user's account name.
UsernameMatchesAnyOfPatterns.title: UsernameMatchesAnyOfPatterns

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Client Access Rule should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.dataclassification.description: Create a new data classification policy in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.dataclassification.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.dataclassification

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the data classification rule that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Description.description: The Description parameter specifies a description for the data classification rule. You use the Description parameter with the Locale and Name parameters to specify descriptions for the data classification rule in different languages.
Description.title: Description

Fingerprints.description: The Fingerprints parameter specifies the byte-encoded document files that are used as fingerprints by the data classification rule.
Fingerprints.title: Fingerprints

IsDefault.description: IsDefault is used with the Locale parameter to specify the default language for the data classification rule.
IsDefault.title: IsDefault

Locale.description: The Locale parameter adds or removes languages that are associated with the data classification rule.
Locale.title: Locale

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies a name for the data classification rule. The value must be less than 256 characters.
Name.title: Name

Ensure.description: Specifies if this policy should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.dataencryptionpolicy.description: Create a new Data Encryption policy in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.dataencryptionpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.dataencryptionpolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the data encryption policy that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

AzureKeyIDs.description: The AzureKeyIDs parameter specifies the URI values of the Azure Key Vault keys to associate with the data encryption policy.
AzureKeyIDs.title: AzureKeyIDs

Description.description: The Description parameter specifies an optional description for the data encryption policy
Description.title: Description

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter enables or disable the data encryption policy.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name for the data encryption policy.
Name.title: Name

PermanentDataPurgeContact.description: The PermanentDataPurgeContact parameter specifies a contact for the purge of all data that's encrypted by the data encryption policy.
PermanentDataPurgeContact.title: PermanentDataPurgeContact

PermanentDataPurgeReason.description: The PermanentDataPurgeReason parameter specifies a descriptive reason for the purge of all data that's encrypted by the data encryption policy
PermanentDataPurgeReason.title: PermanentDataPurgeReason

Ensure.description: Specifies if this policy should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.distributiongroup.description: This resource configures Exchange Online distribution groups.
microsoft.exchange.distributiongroup.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.distributiongroup

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the distribution group or mail-enabled security group that you want to modify. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
Identity.title: Identity

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies a unique name for the address list.
Name.title: Name

Alias.description: Exchange alias (also known as the mail nickname) for the recipient
Alias.title: Alias

BccBlocked.description: Is Bcc blocked for the distribution group.
BccBlocked.title: BccBlocked

BypassNestedModerationEnabled.description: The ByPassNestedModerationEnabled parameter specifies how to handle message approval when a moderated group contains other moderated groups as members.
BypassNestedModerationEnabled.title: BypassNestedModerationEnabled

Description.description: Description of the distribution group.
Description.title: Description

DisplayName.description: The DisplayName parameter specifies the display name of the group. The display name is visible in the Exchange admin center and in address lists. The maximum length is 256 characters.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled.description: The HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled switch specifies whether to hide the members of the distribution group from members of the group and users who aren't members of the group.
HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled.title: HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled

ManagedBy.description: The ManagedBy parameter specifies an owner for the group. A group must have at least one owner.
ManagedBy.title: ManagedBy

MemberDepartRestriction.description: The MemberDepartRestriction parameter specifies the restrictions that you put on requests to leave the group. Valid values are: Open & Closed
MemberDepartRestriction.title: MemberDepartRestriction

MemberJoinRestriction.description: The MemberJoinRestriction parameter specifies the restrictions that you put on requests to join the group. Valid values are: Open, Closed & ApprovalRequired
MemberJoinRestriction.title: MemberJoinRestriction

Members.description: The Members parameter specifies the recipients (mail-enabled objects) that are members of the group. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
Members.title: Members

ModeratedBy.description: The ModeratedBy parameter specifies one or more moderators for this group. A moderator approves messages sent to the group before the messages are delivered. A moderator must be a mailbox, mail user, or mail contact in your organization. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the moderator.
ModeratedBy.title: ModeratedBy

ModerationEnabled.description: The ModerationEnabled parameter specifies whether moderation is enabled for this recipient.
ModerationEnabled.title: ModerationEnabled

Notes.description: The Notes parameters specifies additional information about the object.
Notes.title: Notes

OrganizationalUnit.description: The OrganizationalUnit parameter specifies the location in Active Directory where the group is created.
OrganizationalUnit.title: OrganizationalUnit

PrimarySmtpAddress.description: The PrimarySmtpAddress parameter specifies the primary return email address that's used for the recipient.
PrimarySmtpAddress.title: PrimarySmtpAddress

RequireSenderAuthenticationEnabled.description: The RequireSenderAuthenticationEnabled parameter specifies whether to accept messages only from authenticated (internal) senders.
RequireSenderAuthenticationEnabled.title: RequireSenderAuthenticationEnabled

RoomList.description: The RoomList switch specifies that all members of this distribution group are room mailboxes. You don't need to specify a value with this switch.
RoomList.title: RoomList

AcceptMessagesOnlyFrom.description: The AcceptMessagesOnlyFrom parameter specifies who is allowed to send messages to this recipient. Messages from other senders are rejected.
AcceptMessagesOnlyFrom.title: AcceptMessagesOnlyFrom

AcceptMessagesOnlyFromDLMembers.description: The AcceptMessagesOnlyFromDLMembers parameter specifies who is allowed to send messages to this recipient. Messages from other senders are rejected.
AcceptMessagesOnlyFromDLMembers.title: AcceptMessagesOnlyFromDLMembers

AcceptMessagesOnlyFromSendersOrMembers.description: The AcceptMessagesOnlyFromSendersOrMembers parameter specifies who is allowed to send messages to this recipient. Messages from other senders are rejected.
AcceptMessagesOnlyFromSendersOrMembers.title: AcceptMessagesOnlyFromSendersOrMembers

CustomAttribute1.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute1 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute1.title: CustomAttribute1

CustomAttribute2.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute2 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute2.title: CustomAttribute2

CustomAttribute3.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute3 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute3.title: CustomAttribute3

CustomAttribute4.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute4 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.

You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute5.title: CustomAttribute5

You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute6.title: CustomAttribute6

You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute7.title: CustomAttribute7

CustomAttribute8.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute8 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute8.title: CustomAttribute8

CustomAttribute9.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute9 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute9.title: CustomAttribute9

CustomAttribute10.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute10 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute10.title: CustomAttribute10

CustomAttribute11.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute11 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute11.title: CustomAttribute11

CustomAttribute12.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute12 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute12.title: CustomAttribute12

CustomAttribute13.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute13 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute13.title: CustomAttribute13

CustomAttribute14.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute14 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute14.title: CustomAttribute14

CustomAttribute15.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute15 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomAttribute15.title: CustomAttribute15

EmailAddresses.description: The EmailAddresses parameter specifies all email addresses (proxy addresses) for the recipient, including the primary SMTP address. In on-premises Exchange organizations, the primary SMTP address and other proxy addresses are typically set by email address policies. However, you can use this parameter to configure other proxy addresses for the recipient.
EmailAddresses.title: EmailAddresses

GrantSendOnBehalfTo.description: The GrantSendOnBehalfTo parameter specifies who can send on behalf of this group. Although messages send on behalf of the group clearly show the sender in the From field (<Sender> on behalf of <Group>), replies to these messages are delivered to the group, not the sender.
GrantSendOnBehalfTo.title: GrantSendOnBehalfTo

HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled.description: The HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled parameter specifies whether this recipient is visible in address lists.
HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled.title: HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled

SendOofMessageToOriginatorEnabled.description: The SendOofMessageToOriginatorEnabled parameter specifies how to handle out of office (OOF) messages for members of the group.
SendOofMessageToOriginatorEnabled.title: SendOofMessageToOriginatorEnabled

SendModerationNotifications.description: The SendModerationNotifications parameter specifies when moderation notification messages are sent. Valid values are: Always, Internal, Never.
SendModerationNotifications.title: SendModerationNotifications

Type.description: The Type parameter specifies the type of group that you want to create. Valid values are: Distribution, Security
Type.title: Type

Ensure.description: Specifies if this AddressList should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.dkimsigningconfig.description:
This resource configures the DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signing policy
settings for domains in a cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.dkimsigningconfig.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.dkimsigningconfig

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the DKIM signing policy that you want to modify.  This should be the FQDN.
Identity.title: Identity

AdminDisplayName.description: The AdminDisplayName parameter specifies a description for the policy.
AdminDisplayName.title: AdminDisplayName

BodyCanonicalization.description: The BodyCanonicalization parameter specifies the canonicalization algorithm that's used to create and verify the message body part of the DKIM signature. This value effectively controls the sensitivity of DKIM to changes to the message body in transit. Valid values are 'Simple' or 'Relaxed'.  'Relaxed' is the default.
BodyCanonicalization.title: BodyCanonicalization

HeaderCanonicalization.description: The HeaderCanonicalization parameter specifies the canonicalization algorithm that's used to create and verify the message header part of the DKIM signature. This value effectively controls the sensitivity of DKIM to changes to the message headers in transit. Valid values are 'Simple' or 'Relaxed'.  'Relaxed' is the default.
HeaderCanonicalization.title: HeaderCanonicalization

KeySize.description: The KeySize parameter specifies the size in bits of the public key that's used in the DKIM signing policy. Valid values are 1024 and 2048
KeySize.title: KeySize

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter specifies whether the DKIM Signing Configuration is enabled or disabled. Default is $true.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Client Access Rule should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.emailaddresspolicy.description: This resource configures Email address policies in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.emailaddresspolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.emailaddresspolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the email address policy. The maximum length is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies the order that the email address policies are evaluated. By default, every time that you add a new email address policy, the policy is assigned a priority of N+1, where N is the number of email address policies that you've created.
Priority.title: Priority

EnabledEmailAddressTemplates.description: The EnabledEmailAddressTemplates parameter specifies the rules in the email address policy that are used to generate email addresses for recipients.
EnabledEmailAddressTemplates.title: EnabledEmailAddressTemplates

EnabledPrimarySMTPAddressTemplate.description: The EnabledPrimarySMTPAddressTemplate parameter specifies the specifies the rule in the email address policy that's used to generate the primary SMTP email addresses for recipients. You can use this parameter instead of the EnabledEmailAddressTemplates if the policy only applies the primary email address and no additional proxy addresses.
EnabledPrimarySMTPAddressTemplate.title: EnabledPrimarySMTPAddressTemplate

ManagedByFilter.description: The ManagedByFilter parameter specifies the email address policies to apply to Office 365 groups based on the properties of the users who create the Office 365 groups.
ManagedByFilter.title: ManagedByFilter

Ensure.description: Specify if the Email Address Policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.eopprotectionpolicyru.description: This resource configures EOP Protection Policy Rules.
microsoft.exchange.eopprotectionpolicyru.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.eopprotectionpolicyrule

Comments.description: The Comments parameter specifies informative comments for the rule, such as what the rule is used for or how it has changed over time. The length of the comment can't exceed 1024 characters.
Comments.title: Comments

ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients with email addresses in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.title: ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs

ExceptIfSentTo.description: The ExceptIfSentTo parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
ExceptIfSentTo.title: ExceptIfSentTo

ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.description: The ExceptIfSentToMemberOf parameter specifies an exception that looks for messages sent to members of groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.title: ExceptIfSentToMemberOf

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the rule that you want to view. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the rule.
Identity.title: Identity

State.description: This parameter define if the rule is enabled or disabled
State.title: State

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies a unique name for the rule. The maximum length is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies a priority value for the rule that determines the order of rule processing. A lower integer value indicates a higher priority, the value 0 is the highest priority, and rules can't have the same priority value.
Priority.title: Priority

RecipientDomainIs.description: The RecipientDomainIs parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients with email addresses in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
RecipientDomainIs.title: RecipientDomainIs

SentTo.description: The SentTo parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
SentTo.title: SentTo

SentToMemberOf.description: The SentToMemberOf parameter specifies a condition that looks for messages sent to members of distribution groups, dynamic distribution groups, or mail-enabled security groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
SentToMemberOf.title: SentToMemberOf

Ensure.description: Present ensures the instance exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.externalinoutlook.description: This resource will use Set-ExternalInOutlook cmdlet to modify the configuration of external sender identification that's available in Outlook, Outlook for Mac, Outlook on the web, and Outlook for iOS and Android.
microsoft.exchange.externalinoutlook.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.externalinoutlook

Identity.description: OrganisationIDParameter, not needed for cmdlet Functionality, use 'ExternalinOutlook' to use the same configuration for multiple Tenants
Identity.title: Identity

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter enables or disables external sender identification in supported versions of Outlook. Valid values are:$true: External sender identification in Outlook is enabled. An External icon is added in the area of the subject line of messages from external senders. To exempt specific senders or sender domains from this identification, use the AllowList parameter.$false: External sender identification in Outlook is disabled.
Enabled.title: Enabled

AllowList.description: The AllowList parameter specifies exceptions to external sender identification in supported versions of Outlook. Messages received from the specified senders or senders in the specified domains don't receive native External sender identification. The allow list uses the 5322.From address (also known as the From address or P2 sender). Valid values are an individual domain (contoso.com), a domain and all subdomains (*.contoso.com) or email addresses (admin@contoso.com).
AllowList.title: AllowList

Ensure.description: Present ensures the instance exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.globaladdresslist.description: This resource configures Global Address Lists in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.globaladdresslist.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.globaladdresslist

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the GAL. The maximum length is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

ConditionalCompany.description: The ConditionalCompany parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's Company property.
ConditionalCompany.title: ConditionalCompany

ConditionalCustomAttribute1.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute1 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute1 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute1.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute1

ConditionalCustomAttribute10.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute10 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute10 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute10.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute10

ConditionalCustomAttribute11.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute11 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute11 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute11.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute11

ConditionalCustomAttribute12.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute12 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute12 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute12.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute12

ConditionalCustomAttribute13.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute13 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute13 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute13.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute13

ConditionalCustomAttribute14.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute14 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute14 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute14.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute14

ConditionalCustomAttribute15.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute15 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute15 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute15.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute15

ConditionalCustomAttribute2.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute2 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute2 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute2.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute2

ConditionalCustomAttribute3.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute3 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute3 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute3.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute3

ConditionalCustomAttribute4.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute4 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute4 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute4.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute4

ConditionalCustomAttribute5.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute5 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute5 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute5.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute5

ConditionalCustomAttribute6.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute6 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute6 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute6.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute6

ConditionalCustomAttribute7.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute7 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute7 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute7.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute7

ConditionalCustomAttribute8.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute8 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute8 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute8.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute8

ConditionalCustomAttribute9.description: The ConditionalCustomAttribute9 parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's CustomAttribute9 property.
ConditionalCustomAttribute9.title: ConditionalCustomAttribute9

ConditionalDepartment.description: The ConditionalDepartment parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's Department property.
ConditionalDepartment.title: ConditionalDepartment

ConditionalStateOrProvince.description: The ConditionalStateOrProvince parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the value of the recipient's StateOrProvince property.
ConditionalStateOrProvince.title: ConditionalStateOrProvince

IncludedRecipients.description: The IncludedRecipients parameter specifies a precanned filter that's based on the recipient type.
IncludedRecipients.title: IncludedRecipients

RecipientFilter.description: The RecipientFilter parameter specifies an OPath filter that's based on the value of any available recipient property.
RecipientFilter.title: RecipientFilter

Ensure.description: Specify if the Global Address List should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.groupsettings.description:
This resource configures settings on groups
such as the custom attributes and language.
microsoft.exchange.groupsettings.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.groupsettings

DisplayName.description: The DisplayName parameter specifies the name of the Microsoft 365 Group. The display name is visible in the Exchange admin center, address lists, and Outlook. The maximum length is 64 characters.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

Id.description: The unique Id of the group
Id.title: Id
