AcceptMessagesOnlyFromSendersOrMembers.description: The AcceptMessagesOnlyFromSendersOrMembers parameter specifies who is allowed to send messages to this recipient. Messages from other senders are rejected.
AcceptMessagesOnlyFromSendersOrMembers.title: AcceptMessagesOnlyFromSendersOrMembers

AlwaysSubscribeMembersToCalendarEvents.description: The AlwaysSubscribeMembersToCalendarEvents switch controls the default subscription settings of new members that are added to the Microsoft 365 Group. Changing this setting doesn't affect existing group members.
AlwaysSubscribeMembersToCalendarEvents.title: AlwaysSubscribeMembersToCalendarEvents

AuditLogAgeLimit.description: The AlwaysSubscribeMembersToCalendarEvents switch controls the default subscription settings of new members that are added to the Microsoft 365 Group. Changing this setting doesn't affect existing group members.
AuditLogAgeLimit.title: AuditLogAgeLimit

AutoSubscribeNewMembers.description: The AutoSubscribeNewMembers switch specifies whether to automatically subscribe new members that are added to the Microsoft 365 Group to conversations and calendar events. Only users that are added to the group after you enable this setting are automatically subscribed to the group.
AutoSubscribeNewMembers.title: AutoSubscribeNewMembers

CalendarMemberReadOnly.description: The CalendarMemberReadOnly parameter specifies whether to set read-only Calendar permissions to the Microsoft 365 Group for members of the group.
CalendarMemberReadOnly.title: CalendarMemberReadOnly

Classification.description: The CalendarMemberReadOnly switch specifies whether to set read-only Calendar permissions to the Microsoft 365 Group for members of the group.
Classification.title: Classification

ConnectorsEnabled.description: The CalendarMemberReadOnly switch specifies whether to set read-only Calendar permissions to the Microsoft 365 Group for members of the group.
ConnectorsEnabled.title: ConnectorsEnabled

CustomAttribute1.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute1 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute1.title: CustomAttribute1

CustomAttribute2.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute2 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute2.title: CustomAttribute2

CustomAttribute3.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute3 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute3.title: CustomAttribute3

CustomAttribute4.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute4 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute4.title: CustomAttribute4

CustomAttribute5.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute5 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute5.title: CustomAttribute5

CustomAttribute6.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute6 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute6.title: CustomAttribute6

CustomAttribute7.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute7 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute7.title: CustomAttribute7

CustomAttribute8.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute8 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute8.title: CustomAttribute8

CustomAttribute9.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute9 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute9.title: CustomAttribute9

CustomAttribute10.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute10 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute10.title: CustomAttribute10

CustomAttribute11.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute11 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute11.title: CustomAttribute11

CustomAttribute12.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute12 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute12.title: CustomAttribute12

CustomAttribute13.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute13 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute13.title: CustomAttribute13

CustomAttribute14.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute14 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute14.title: CustomAttribute14

CustomAttribute15.description: This parameter specifies a value for the CustomAttribute15 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
CustomAttribute15.title: CustomAttribute15

DataEncryptionPolicy.description: The DataEncryptionPolicy parameter specifies the data encryption policy that's applied to the Microsoft 365 Group.
DataEncryptionPolicy.title: DataEncryptionPolicy

EmailAddresses.description: The EmailAddresses parameter specifies all the email addresses (proxy addresses) for the recipient, including the primary SMTP address.
EmailAddresses.title: EmailAddresses

ExtensionCustomAttribute1.description: This parameter specifies a value for the ExtensionCustomAttribute1 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. You can specify up to 1300 values separated by commas.
ExtensionCustomAttribute1.title: ExtensionCustomAttribute1

ExtensionCustomAttribute2.description: This parameter specifies a value for the ExtensionCustomAttribute2 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. You can specify up to 1300 values separated by commas.
ExtensionCustomAttribute2.title: ExtensionCustomAttribute2

ExtensionCustomAttribute3.description: This parameter specifies a value for the ExtensionCustomAttribute3 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. You can specify up to 1300 values separated by commas.
ExtensionCustomAttribute3.title: ExtensionCustomAttribute3

ExtensionCustomAttribute4.description: This parameter specifies a value for the ExtensionCustomAttribute4 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. You can specify up to 1300 values separated by commas.
ExtensionCustomAttribute4.title: ExtensionCustomAttribute4

ExtensionCustomAttribute5.description: This parameter specifies a value for the ExtensionCustomAttribute5 property on the recipient. You can use this property to store custom information about the recipient, and to identify the recipient in filters. You can specify up to 1300 values separated by commas.
ExtensionCustomAttribute5.title: ExtensionCustomAttribute5

GrantSendOnBehalfTo.description: The GrantSendOnBehalfTo parameter specifies who can send on behalf of this Microsoft 365 Group.
GrantSendOnBehalfTo.title: GrantSendOnBehalfTo

HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled.description: The GrantSendOnBehalfTo parameter specifies who can send on behalf of this Microsoft 365 Group.
HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled.title: HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled

HiddenFromExchangeClientsEnabled.description: The HiddenFromExchangeClientsEnabled switch specifies whether the Microsoft 365 Group is hidden from Outlook clients connected to Microsoft 365.
HiddenFromExchangeClientsEnabled.title: HiddenFromExchangeClientsEnabled

InformationBarrierMode.description: The InformationBarrierMode parameter specifies the information barrier mode for the Microsoft 365 Group.
InformationBarrierMode.title: InformationBarrierMode

IsMemberAllowedToEditContent.description: This parameter specifies whether or not members are allow to edit content.
IsMemberAllowedToEditContent.title: IsMemberAllowedToEditContent

Language.description: The Language parameter specifies language preference for the Microsoft 365 Group.
Language.title: Language

MailboxRegion.description: The MailboxRegion parameter specifies the preferred data location (PDL) for the Microsoft 365 Group in multi-geo environments.
MailboxRegion.title: MailboxRegion

MailTip.description: The MailTip parameter specifies the custom MailTip text for this recipient. The MailTip is shown to senders when they start drafting an email message to this recipient.
MailTip.title: MailTip

MailTipTranslations.description: The MailTipTranslations parameter specifies additional languages for the custom MailTip text that's defined by the MailTip parameter.
MailTipTranslations.title: MailTipTranslations

MaxReceiveSize.description: The MaxReceiveSize parameter specifies the maximum size of an email message that can be sent to this group. Messages that exceed the maximum size are rejected by the group.
MaxReceiveSize.title: MaxReceiveSize

MaxSendSize.description: The MaxSendSize parameter specifies the maximum size of an email message that can be sent by this group.
MaxSendSize.title: MaxSendSize

ModeratedBy.description: The ModeratedBy parameter specifies one or more moderators for this recipient. A moderator approves messages sent to the recipient before the messages are delivered. A moderator must be a mailbox, mail user, or mail contact in your organization. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the moderator.
ModeratedBy.title: ModeratedBy

ModerationEnabled.description: The ModerationEnabled parameter specifies whether moderation is enabled for this recipient.
ModerationEnabled.title: ModerationEnabled

Notes.description: The Notes parameter specifies the description of the Microsoft 365 Group. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Notes.title: Notes

PrimarySmtpAddress.description: The PrimarySmtpAddress parameter specifies the primary return email address that's used for the recipient. You can't use the EmailAddresses and PrimarySmtpAddress parameters in the same command.
PrimarySmtpAddress.title: PrimarySmtpAddress

RejectMessagesFromSendersOrMembers.description: The RejectMessagesFromSendersOrMembers parameter specifies who isn't allowed to send messages to this recipient. Messages from these senders are rejected.
RejectMessagesFromSendersOrMembers.title: RejectMessagesFromSendersOrMembers

RequireSenderAuthenticationEnabled.description: The RequireSenderAuthenticationEnabled parameter specifies whether to accept messages only from authenticated (internal) senders.
RequireSenderAuthenticationEnabled.title: RequireSenderAuthenticationEnabled

SensitivityLabelId.description: The SensitivityLabelId parameter specifies the GUID value of the sensitivity label that's assigned to the Microsoft 365 Group.
SensitivityLabelId.title: SensitivityLabelId

SubscriptionEnabled.description: The SubscriptionEnabled switch specifies whether the group owners can enable subscription to conversations and calendar events on the groups they own.
SubscriptionEnabled.title: SubscriptionEnabled

UnifiedGroupWelcomeMessageEnabled.description: The UnifiedGroupWelcomeMessageEnabled switch specifies whether to enable or disable sending system-generated welcome messages to users who are added as members to the Microsoft 365 Group.
UnifiedGroupWelcomeMessageEnabled.title: UnifiedGroupWelcomeMessageEnabled

microsoft.exchange.hostedconnectionfilte.description:
This resource configures the settings of connection filter policies
in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.hostedconnectionfilte.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.hostedconnectionfilterpolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the Hosted Connection Filter Policy that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

AdminDisplayName.description: The AdminDisplayName parameter specifies a description for the policy.
AdminDisplayName.title: AdminDisplayName

EnableSafeList.description: The EnableSafeList parameter enables or disables use of the safe list. The safe list is a dynamic allow list in the Microsoft datacenter that requires no customer configuration. Valid input for this parameter is $true or $false. The default value is $false.
EnableSafeList.title: EnableSafeList

IPAllowList.description: The IPAllowList parameter specifies IP addresses from which messages are always allowed. Messages from the IP addresses you specify won't be identified as spam, despite any other spam characteristics of the messages. Valid values for this parameter are: A single IP address, an IP address range, a CIDR IP.
IPAllowList.title: IPAllowList

IPBlockList.description: The IPBlockList parameter specifies IP addresses from which messages are never allowed. Messages from the IP addresses you specify are blocked without any further spam scanning. Valid values for this parameter are: A single IP address, an IP address range, a CIDR IP.
IPBlockList.title: IPBlockList

MakeDefault.description: The MakeDefault parameter makes the specified policy the default connection filter policy. Default is $false.
MakeDefault.title: MakeDefault

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Hosted Connection Filter Policy should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.hostedcontentfilterpo.description:
This resource configures the settings of connection filter policies
in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.hostedcontentfilterpo.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.hostedcontentfilterpolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the name of the Hosted Content Filter Policy that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

AddXHeaderValue.description: The AddXHeaderValue parameter specifies the X-header value to add to spam messages when an action parameter is set to the value AddXHeader.
AddXHeaderValue.title: AddXHeaderValue

AdminDisplayName.description: The AdminDisplayName parameter specifies a description for the policy.
AdminDisplayName.title: AdminDisplayName

AllowedSenderDomains.description: The AllowedSenderDomains parameter specifies trusted domains that aren't processed by the spam filter.
AllowedSenderDomains.title: AllowedSenderDomains

AllowedSenders.description: The AllowedSenders parameter specifies a list of trusted senders that aren't processed by the spam filter.
AllowedSenders.title: AllowedSenders

BlockedSenderDomains.description: The BlockedSenderDomains parameter specifies domains that are always marked as spam sources.
BlockedSenderDomains.title: BlockedSenderDomains

BlockedSenders.description: The BlockedSenders parameter specifies senders that are always marked as spam sources.
BlockedSenders.title: BlockedSenders

BulkQuarantineTag.description: The BulkQuarantineTag parameter specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined as bulk email.
BulkQuarantineTag.title: BulkQuarantineTag

BulkSpamAction.description: The BulkSpamAction parameter specifies the action to take on messages that are classified as bulk email.
BulkSpamAction.title: BulkSpamAction

BulkThreshold.description: The BulkThreshold parameter specifies the Bulk Complaint Level (BCL) threshold setting. Valid values are from 1 - 9, where 1 marks most bulk email as spam, and 9 allows the most bulk email to be delivered. The default value is 7.
BulkThreshold.title: BulkThreshold

DownloadLink.description: The DownloadLink parameter shows or hides a link in end-user spam notification messages to download the Junk Email Reporting Tool plugin for Outlook. Valid input for this parameter is $true or $false. The default value is $false.
DownloadLink.title: DownloadLink

EnableEndUserSpamNotifications.description: The EnableEndUserSpamNotification parameter enables for disables sending end-user spam quarantine notification messages. Valid input for this parameter is $true or $false. The default value is $false.
EnableEndUserSpamNotifications.title: EnableEndUserSpamNotifications

EnableLanguageBlockList.description: The EnableLanguageBlockList parameter enables or disables blocking email messages that are written in specific languages, regardless of the message contents. Valid input for this parameter is $true or $false. The default value is $false.
EnableLanguageBlockList.title: EnableLanguageBlockList

EnableRegionBlockList.description: The EnableRegionBlockList parameter enables or disables blocking email messages that are sent from specific countries or regions, regardless of the message contents. Valid input for this parameter is $true or $false. The default value is $false.
EnableRegionBlockList.title: EnableRegionBlockList

EndUserSpamNotificationCustomSubject.description: The EndUserSpamNotificationCustomSubject parameter specifies a custom subject for end-user spam notification messages.
EndUserSpamNotificationCustomSubject.title: EndUserSpamNotificationCustomSubject

EndUserSpamNotificationFrequency.description: The EndUserSpamNotificationFrequency parameter specifies the repeat interval in days that end-user spam notification messages are sent. Valid input for this parameter is an integer between 1 and 15. The default value is 3.
EndUserSpamNotificationFrequency.title: EndUserSpamNotificationFrequency

EndUserSpamNotificationLanguage.description: The EndUserSpamNotificationLanguage parameter specifies the language of end-user spam notification messages. The default value is Default. This means the default language of end-user spam notification messages is the default language of the cloud-based organization.
EndUserSpamNotificationLanguage.title: EndUserSpamNotificationLanguage

HighConfidencePhishAction.description: The HighConfidencePhishAction parameter specifies the action to take on messages that are marked as high confidence phishing
HighConfidencePhishAction.title: HighConfidencePhishAction

HighConfidencePhishQuarantineTag.description: The HighConfidencePhishQuarantineTag parameter specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined as high confidence phishing.
HighConfidencePhishQuarantineTag.title: HighConfidencePhishQuarantineTag

HighConfidenceSpamAction.description: The HighConfidenceSpamAction parameter specifies the action to take on messages that are classified as high confidence spam.
HighConfidenceSpamAction.title: HighConfidenceSpamAction

HighConfidenceSpamQuarantineTag.description: The HighConfidenceSpamQuarantineTag parameter specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined as high confidence spam.
HighConfidenceSpamQuarantineTag.title: HighConfidenceSpamQuarantineTag

IncreaseScoreWithBizOrInfoUrls.description: The IncreaseScoreWithBizOrInfoUrls parameter increases the spam score of messages that contain links to .biz or .info domains. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
IncreaseScoreWithBizOrInfoUrls.title: IncreaseScoreWithBizOrInfoUrls

IncreaseScoreWithImageLinks.description: The IncreaseScoreWithImageLinks parameter increases the spam score of messages that contain image links to remote websites. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
IncreaseScoreWithImageLinks.title: IncreaseScoreWithImageLinks

IncreaseScoreWithNumericIps.description: The IncreaseScoreWithNumericIps parameter increases the spam score of messages that contain links to IP addresses. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
IncreaseScoreWithNumericIps.title: IncreaseScoreWithNumericIps

IncreaseScoreWithRedirectToOtherPort.description: The IncreaseScoreWithRedirectToOtherPort parameter increases the spam score of messages that contain links that redirect to other TCP ports. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
IncreaseScoreWithRedirectToOtherPort.title: IncreaseScoreWithRedirectToOtherPort

InlineSafetyTipsEnabled.description: The InlineSafetyTipsEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable safety tips that are shown to recipients in messages. The default is $true
InlineSafetyTipsEnabled.title: InlineSafetyTipsEnabled

IntraOrgFilterState.description: The IntraOrgFilterState parameter specifies whether to enable anti-spam filtering for messages sent between internal users (users in the same organization).
IntraOrgFilterState.title: IntraOrgFilterState

LanguageBlockList.description: The LanguageBlockList parameter specifies the languages to block when messages are blocked based on their language. Valid input for this parameter is a supported ISO 639-1 lowercase two-letter language code. You can specify multiple values separated by commas. This parameter is only use when the EnableRegionBlockList parameter is set to $true.
LanguageBlockList.title: LanguageBlockList

MakeDefault.description: The MakeDefault parameter makes the specified content filter policy the default content filter policy. The default value is $false
MakeDefault.title: MakeDefault

MarkAsSpamBulkMail.description: The MarkAsSpamBulkMail parameter classifies the message as spam when the message is identified as a bulk email message. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is On.
MarkAsSpamBulkMail.title: MarkAsSpamBulkMail

MarkAsSpamEmbedTagsInHtml.description: The MarkAsSpamEmbedTagsInHtml parameter classifies the message as spam when the message contains HTML <embed> tags. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamEmbedTagsInHtml.title: MarkAsSpamEmbedTagsInHtml

MarkAsSpamEmptyMessages.description: The MarkAsSpamEmptyMessages parameter classifies the message as spam when the message is empty. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamEmptyMessages.title: MarkAsSpamEmptyMessages

MarkAsSpamFormTagsInHtml.description: The MarkAsSpamFormTagsInHtml parameter classifies the message as spam when the message contains HTML <form> tags. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamFormTagsInHtml.title: MarkAsSpamFormTagsInHtml

MarkAsSpamFramesInHtml.description: The MarkAsSpamFramesInHtml parameter classifies the message as spam when the message contains HTML <frame> or <iframe> tags. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamFramesInHtml.title: MarkAsSpamFramesInHtml

MarkAsSpamFromAddressAuthFail.description: The MarkAsSpamFromAddressAuthFail parameter classifies the message as spam when Sender ID filtering encounters a hard fail. Valid values for this parameter are Off or On. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamFromAddressAuthFail.title: MarkAsSpamFromAddressAuthFail

MarkAsSpamJavaScriptInHtml.description: The MarkAsSpamJavaScriptInHtml parameter classifies the message as spam when the message contains JavaScript or VBScript. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamJavaScriptInHtml.title: MarkAsSpamJavaScriptInHtml

MarkAsSpamNdrBackscatter.description: The MarkAsSpamNdrBackscatter parameter classifies the message as spam when the message is a non-delivery report (NDR) to a forged sender. Valid values for this parameter are Off or On. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamNdrBackscatter.title: MarkAsSpamNdrBackscatter

MarkAsSpamObjectTagsInHtml.description: The MarkAsSpamObjectTagsInHtml parameter classifies the message as spam when the message contains HTML <object> tags. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamObjectTagsInHtml.title: MarkAsSpamObjectTagsInHtml

MarkAsSpamSensitiveWordList.description: The MarkAsSpamSensitiveWordList parameter classifies the message as spam when the message contains words from the sensitive words list. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamSensitiveWordList.title: MarkAsSpamSensitiveWordList

MarkAsSpamSpfRecordHardFail.description: The MarkAsSpamSpfRecordHardFail parameter classifies the message as spam when Sender Policy Framework (SPF) record checking encounters a hard fail. Valid values for this parameter are Off or On. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamSpfRecordHardFail.title: MarkAsSpamSpfRecordHardFail

MarkAsSpamWebBugsInHtml.description: The MarkAsSpamWebBugsInHtml parameter classifies the message as spam when the message contains web bugs. Valid values for this parameter are Off, On or Test. The default value is Off.
MarkAsSpamWebBugsInHtml.title: MarkAsSpamWebBugsInHtml

ModifySubjectValue.description: The ModifySubjectValue parameter specifies the text to prepend to the existing subject of spam messages when an action parameter is set to the value ModifySubject.
ModifySubjectValue.title: ModifySubjectValue

PhishSpamAction.description: The PhishSpamAction parameter specifies the action to take on messages that are classified as phishing
PhishSpamAction.title: PhishSpamAction

PhishQuarantineTag.description: The PhishQuarantineTag parameter specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined as phishing.
PhishQuarantineTag.title: PhishQuarantineTag

SpamQuarantineTag.description: The SpamQuarantineTag parameter specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined as spam.
SpamQuarantineTag.title: SpamQuarantineTag

QuarantineRetentionPeriod.description: The QuarantineRetentionPeriod parameter specifies the length of time in days that spam messages remain in the quarantine. Valid input for this parameter is an integer between 1 and 30. The default value is 15.
QuarantineRetentionPeriod.title: QuarantineRetentionPeriod

RedirectToRecipients.description: The RedirectToRecipients parameter specifies the replacement recipients in spam messages when an action parameter is set to the value Redirect. The action parameters that use the value of RedirectToRecipients are BulkSpamAction, HighConfidencePhishAction, HighConfidenceSpamAction, PhishSpamAction and SpamAction.
RedirectToRecipients.title: RedirectToRecipients

RegionBlockList.description: The RegionBlockList parameter specifies the region to block when messages are blocked based on their source region. Valid input for this parameter is a supported ISO 3166-1 uppercase two-letter country code. You can specify multiple values separated by commas. This parameter is only used when the EnableRegionBlockList parameter is set to $true.
RegionBlockList.title: RegionBlockList

SpamAction.description: The SpamAction parameter specifies the action to take on messages that are classified as spam (not high confidence spam, bulk email, or phishing).
SpamAction.title: SpamAction

TestModeAction.description: The TestModeAction parameter specifies the additional action to take on messages that match any of the IncreaseScoreWith or MarkAsSpam parameters that are set to the value Test.
TestModeAction.title: TestModeAction

TestModeBccToRecipients.description: The TestModeBccToRecipients parameter specifies the blind carbon copy recipients to add to spam messages when the TestModeAction action parameter is set to the value BccMessage.
TestModeBccToRecipients.title: TestModeBccToRecipients

PhishZapEnabled.description: The PhishZapEnabled parameter enables or disables zero-hour auto purge (ZAP) to detect phishing messages in delivered messages in Exchange Online mailboxes.
PhishZapEnabled.title: PhishZapEnabled

SpamZapEnabled.description: The SpamZapEnabled parameter enables or disables zero-hour auto purge (ZAP) to detect spam in delivered messages in Exchange Online mailboxes.
SpamZapEnabled.title: SpamZapEnabled

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.hostedcontentfilterru.description:
This resource configures an Hosted Content Filter Rule in Exchange Online.
Reference: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/exchange/advanced-threat-protection/new-HostedContentFilterRule?view=exchange-ps
microsoft.exchange.hostedcontentfilterru.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.hostedcontentfilterrule

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the name of the HostedContentFilter rule that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

HostedContentFilterPolicy.description: The HostedContentFilterPolicy parameter specifies the name of the HostedContentFilter policy that's associated with the HostedContentFilter rule.
HostedContentFilterPolicy.title: HostedContentFilterPolicy

Enabled.description: Specify if this rule should be enabled. Default is $true.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies a priority value for the rule that determines the order of rule processing. A lower integer value indicates a higher priority, the value 0 is the highest priority, and rules can't have the same priority value.
Priority.title: Priority

Comments.description: The Comments parameter specifies informative comments for the rule, such as what the rule is used for or how it has changed over time. The length of the comment can't exceed 1024 characters.
Comments.title: Comments

ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.title: ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs

ExceptIfSentTo.description: The ExceptIfSentTo parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
ExceptIfSentTo.title: ExceptIfSentTo

ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.description: The ExceptIfSentToMemberOf parameter specifies an exception that looks for messages sent to members of groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.title: ExceptIfSentToMemberOf

RecipientDomainIs.description: The RecipientDomainIs parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
RecipientDomainIs.title: RecipientDomainIs

SentTo.description: The SentTo parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
SentTo.title: SentTo

SentToMemberOf.description: The SentToMemberOf parameter looks for messages sent to members of groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
SentToMemberOf.title: SentToMemberOf

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.hostedoutboundspamfil.description:
This resource configures the settings of the outbound spam filter policy
in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.hostedoutboundspamfil.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.hostedoutboundspamfilterpolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the name of the policy that you want to modify. There is only one policy named 'Default'
Identity.title: Identity

AdminDisplayName.description: The AdminDisplayName parameter specifies a description for the policy.
AdminDisplayName.title: AdminDisplayName

BccSuspiciousOutboundAdditionalRecipient.description: The BccSuspiciousOutboundAdditionalRecipients parameter specifies the recipients to add to the Bcc field of outgoing spam messages. Valid input for this parameter is an email address. Separate multiple email addresses with commas.
BccSuspiciousOutboundAdditionalRecipient.title: BccSuspiciousOutboundAdditionalRecipients

BccSuspiciousOutboundMail.description: The BccSuspiciousOutboundMail parameter enables or disables adding recipients to the Bcc field of outgoing spam messages. Valid input for this parameter is $true or $false. The default value is $false. You specify the additional recipients using the BccSuspiciousOutboundAdditionalRecipients parameter.
BccSuspiciousOutboundMail.title: BccSuspiciousOutboundMail

NotifyOutboundSpam.description: The NotifyOutboundSpam parameter enables or disables sending notification messages to administrators when an outgoing message is determined to be spam. Valid input for this parameter is $true or $false. The default value is $false. You specify the administrators to notify by using the NotifyOutboundSpamRecipients parameter.
NotifyOutboundSpam.title: NotifyOutboundSpam

NotifyOutboundSpamRecipients.description: The NotifyOutboundSpamRecipients parameter specifies the administrators to notify when an outgoing message is determined to be spam. Valid input for this parameter is an email address. Separate multiple email addresses with commas.
NotifyOutboundSpamRecipients.title: NotifyOutboundSpamRecipients

RecipientLimitInternalPerHour.description: The RecipientLimitInternalPerHour parameter specifies the maximum number of internal recipients that a user can send to within an hour. A valid value is 0 to 10000. The default value is 0, which means the service defaults are used.
RecipientLimitInternalPerHour.title: RecipientLimitInternalPerHour

RecipientLimitPerDay.description: The RecipientLimitPerDay parameter specifies the maximum number of recipients that a user can send to within a day. A valid value is 0 to 10000. The default value is 0, which means the service defaults are used.
RecipientLimitPerDay.title: RecipientLimitPerDay

RecipientLimitExternalPerHour.description: The RecipientLimitExternalPerHour parameter specifies the maximum number of external recipients that a user can send to within an hour. A valid value is 0 to 10000. The default value is 0, which means the service defaults are used.
RecipientLimitExternalPerHour.title: RecipientLimitExternalPerHour

ActionWhenThresholdReached.description: The ActionWhenThresholdReached parameter specifies the action to take when any of the limits specified in the policy are reached. Valid values are: Alert, BlockUser, BlockUserForToday. BlockUserForToday is the default value.
ActionWhenThresholdReached.title: ActionWhenThresholdReached

AutoForwardingMode.description: The AutoForwardingMode specifies how the policy controls automatic email forwarding to outbound recipients. Valid values are: Automatic, On, Off.
AutoForwardingMode.title: AutoForwardingMode

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.hostedoutboundspamfil.description:
This resource configures an Hosted Content Filter Rule in Exchange Online.
Reference: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/exchange/new-hostedoutboundspamfilterrule?view=exchange-ps
microsoft.exchange.hostedoutboundspamfil.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.hostedoutboundspamfilterrule

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the name of the HostedOutboundSpamFilter rule that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

HostedOutboundSpamFilterPolicy.description: The HostedOutboundSpamFilterPolicy parameter specifies the name of the HostedOutboundSpamFilter policy that's associated with the HostedOutboundSpamFilter rule.
HostedOutboundSpamFilterPolicy.title: HostedOutboundSpamFilterPolicy

Enabled.description: Specify if this rule should be enabled. Default is $true.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies a priority value for the rule that determines the order of rule processing. A lower integer value indicates a higher priority, the value 0 is the highest priority, and rules can't have the same priority value.
Priority.title: Priority

Comments.description: The Comments parameter specifies informative comments for the rule, such as what the rule is used for or how it has changed over time. The length of the comment can't exceed 1024 characters.
Comments.title: Comments

ExceptIfSenderDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfSenderDomainIs parameter specifies an exception that looks for senders with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
ExceptIfSenderDomainIs.title: ExceptIfSenderDomainIs

ExceptIfFrom.description: The ExceptIfFrom parameter specifies an exception that looks for messages from specific senders. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the sender.
ExceptIfFrom.title: ExceptIfFrom

ExceptIfFromMemberOf.description: The ExceptIfFromMemberOf parameter specifies an exception that looks for messages sent by group members. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
ExceptIfFromMemberOf.title: ExceptIfFromMemberOf

SenderDomainIs.description: The SenderDomainIs parameter specifies a condition that looks for senders with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
SenderDomainIs.title: SenderDomainIs

From.description: The From parameter specifies a condition that looks for messages from specific senders. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the sender.
From.title: From

FromMemberOf.description: The FromMemberOf parameter specifies a condition that looks for messages sent by group members. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
FromMemberOf.title: FromMemberOf

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.inboundconnector.description: This resource configures an Inbound connector in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.inboundconnector.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.inboundconnector

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the outbound connector that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

AssociatedAcceptedDomains.description: The AssociatedAcceptedDomains parameter specifies the accepted domains that the connector applies to, thereby limiting its scope. For example, you can apply the connector to a specific accepted domain in your organization, such as contoso.com.
AssociatedAcceptedDomains.title: AssociatedAcceptedDomains

CloudServicesMailEnabled.description: The CloudServicesMailEnabled parameter specifies whether the connector is used for hybrid mail flow between an on-premises Exchange environment and Microsoft Office 365. Specifically, this parameter controls how certain internal X-MS-Exchange-Organization-* message headers are handled in messages that are sent between accepted domains in the on-premises and cloud organizations. These headers are collectively known as cross-premises headers. DO NOT USE MANUALLY!
CloudServicesMailEnabled.title: CloudServicesMailEnabled

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

ConnectorSource.description: The ConnectorSource parameter specifies how the connector is created. DO NOT CHANGE THIS!
ConnectorSource.title: ConnectorSource

ConnectorType.description: The ConnectorType parameter specifies a category for the domains that are serviced by the connector. Valid values are Partner and OnPremises
ConnectorType.title: ConnectorType

EFSkipIPs.description: The EFSkipIPs parameter specifies the source IP addresses to skip in Enhanced Filtering for Connectors when the EFSkipLastIP parameter value is $false.
EFSkipIPs.title: EFSkipIPs

EFSkipLastIP.description: The EFSkipLastIP parameter specifies the behavior of Enhanced Filtering for Connectors.
EFSkipLastIP.title: EFSkipLastIP

EFUsers.description: The EFUsers parameter specifies the recipients that Enhanced Filtering for Connectors applies to.
EFUsers.title: EFUsers

Enabled.description: Specifies whether connector is enabled.
Enabled.title: Enabled

RequireTls.description: The RequireTLS parameter specifies that all messages received by this connector require TLS transmission. Valid values for this parameter are $true or $false. The default value is $false. When the RequireTLS parameter is set to $true, all messages received by this connector require TLS transmission.
RequireTls.title: RequireTls

RestrictDomainsToCertificate.description: The RestrictDomainsToCertificate parameter specifies that Office 365 should identify incoming messages that are eligible for this connector by verifying that the remote server authenticates using a TLS certificate that has the TlsSenderCertificateName in the Subject.
RestrictDomainsToCertificate.title: RestrictDomainsToCertificate

RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses.description: The RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses parameter, when set to $true, automatically rejects mail from the domains specified by the SenderDomains parameter if the mail originates from an IP address that isn't specified by the SenderIPAddresses parameter.
RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses.title: RestrictDomainsToIPAddresses

SenderDomains.description: The SenderDomains parameter specifies the remote domains from which this connector accepts messages, thereby limiting its scope. You can use a wildcard character to specify all subdomains of a specified domain, as shown in the following example: *.contoso.com. However, you can't embed a wildcard character, as shown in the following example: domain.*.contoso.com.
SenderDomains.title: SenderDomains

SenderIPAddresses.description: The SenderIPAddresses parameter specifies the remote IP addresses from which this connector accepts messages.
SenderIPAddresses.title: SenderIPAddresses

TlsSenderCertificateName.description: The TlsSenderCertificateName parameter specifies the certificate used by the sender's domain when the RequireTls parameter is set to $true. Valid input for the TlsSenderCertificateName parameter is an SMTP domain.
TlsSenderCertificateName.title: TlsSenderCertificateName

TreatMessagesAsInternal.description: The TreatMessagesAsInternal parameter specifies an alternative method to identify messages sent from an on-premises organization as internal messages. You should only consider using this parameter when your on-premises organization doesn't use Exchange.
TreatMessagesAsInternal.title: TreatMessagesAsInternal

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Outbound connector should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.intraorganizationconn.description: Create a new EXOIntraOrganizationConnector in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.intraorganizationconn.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.intraorganizationconnector

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the intraorg connector that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

DiscoveryEndpoint.description: The DiscoveryEndpoint parameter specifies the externally-accessible URL that's used for the Autodiscover service for the domain that's configured in the Intra-Organization connector.
DiscoveryEndpoint.title: DiscoveryEndpoint

Enabled.description: Specifies whether connector is enabled.
Enabled.title: Enabled

TargetAddressDomains.description: The TargetAddressDomains parameter specifies the domain namespaces that will be used in the Intra-organization connector. These domains must have valid Autodiscover endpoints defined in their organizations. The domains and their associated Autodiscover endpoints are used by the Intra-Organization connector for feature and service connectivity. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
TargetAddressDomains.title: TargetAddressDomains

TargetSharingEpr.description: The TargetSharingEpr parameter specifies the URL of the target Exchange Web Services that will be used in the Intra-Organization connector.
TargetSharingEpr.title: TargetSharingEpr

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Intra-Organization connector should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.irmconfiguration.description: Modify the resource Configuration policy in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.irmconfiguration.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.irmconfiguration

AutomaticServiceUpdateEnabled.description: The AutomaticServiceUpdateEnabled parameter specifies whether to allow the automatic addition of new features within Azure Information Protection for your cloud-based organization.
AutomaticServiceUpdateEnabled.title: AutomaticServiceUpdateEnabled

AzureRMSLicensingEnabled.description: The AzureRMSLicensingEnabled parameter specifies whether the Exchange Online organization can to connect directly to Azure Rights Management.
AzureRMSLicensingEnabled.title: AzureRMSLicensingEnabled

DecryptAttachmentForEncryptOnly.description: The DecryptAttachmentForEncryptOnly parameter specifies whether mail recipients have unrestricted rights on the attachment or not for Encrypt-only mails sent using Microsoft Purview Message Encryption.
DecryptAttachmentForEncryptOnly.title: DecryptAttachmentForEncryptOnly

EDiscoverySuperUserEnabled.description: The EDiscoverySuperUserEnabled parameter specifies whether members of the Discovery Management role group can access IRM-protected messages in a discovery mailbox that were returned by a discovery search.
EDiscoverySuperUserEnabled.title: EDiscoverySuperUserEnabled

EnablePdfEncryption.description: The EnablePdfEncryption parameter specifies whether to enable the encryption of PDF attachments using Microsoft Purview Message Encryption.
EnablePdfEncryption.title: EnablePdfEncryption

InternalLicensingEnabled.description: The InternalLicensingEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable IRM features for messages that are sent to internal and external recipients.
InternalLicensingEnabled.title: InternalLicensingEnabled

JournalReportDecryptionEnabled.description: The JournalReportDecryptionEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable journal report decryption.
JournalReportDecryptionEnabled.title: JournalReportDecryptionEnabled

LicensingLocation.description: The LicensingLocation parameter specifies the RMS licensing URLs. You can specify multiple URL values separated by commas.
LicensingLocation.title: LicensingLocation

RejectIfRecipientHasNoRights.description: This parameter is available only in the cloud-based service.
RejectIfRecipientHasNoRights.title: RejectIfRecipientHasNoRights

RMSOnlineKeySharingLocation.description: The RMSOnlineKeySharingLocation parameter specifies the Azure Rights Management URL that's used to get the trusted publishing domain (TPD) for the Exchange Online organization.
RMSOnlineKeySharingLocation.title: RMSOnlineKeySharingLocation

SearchEnabled.description: The SearchEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable searching of IRM-encrypted messages in Outlook on the web (formerly known as Outlook Web App).
SearchEnabled.title: SearchEnabled

SimplifiedClientAccessDoNotForwardDisabl.description: The SimplifiedClientAccessDoNotForwardDisabled parameter specifies whether to disable Do not forward in Outlook on the web.
SimplifiedClientAccessDoNotForwardDisabl.title: SimplifiedClientAccessDoNotForwardDisabled

SimplifiedClientAccessEnabled.description: The SimplifiedClientAccessEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable the Protect button in Outlook on the web.
SimplifiedClientAccessEnabled.title: SimplifiedClientAccessEnabled

SimplifiedClientAccessEncryptOnlyDisable.description: The SimplifiedClientAccessEncryptOnlyDisabled parameter specifies whether to disable Encrypt only in Outlook on the web.
SimplifiedClientAccessEncryptOnlyDisable.title: SimplifiedClientAccessEncryptOnlyDisabled

TransportDecryptionSetting.description: The TransportDecryptionSetting parameter specifies the transport decryption configuration.
TransportDecryptionSetting.title: TransportDecryptionSetting

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Outbound connector should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.journalrule.description: This resource allows to configure Journal Rules in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.journalrule.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.journalrule

Name.description: Name of the Journal Rule
Name.title: Name

JournalEmailAddress.description: The JournalEmailAddress parameter specifies a recipient object to which journal reports are sent. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
JournalEmailAddress.title: JournalEmailAddress

Recipient.description: The Recipient parameter specifies the SMTP address of a mailbox, contact, or distribution group to journal. If you specify a distribution group, all recipients in that distribution group are journaled. All messages sent to or from a recipient are journaled.
Recipient.title: Recipient

Enabled.description: Specifies whether the Journal Rule is enabled or not.
Enabled.title: Enabled

RuleScope.description: The Scope parameter specifies the scope of email messages to which the journal rule is applied
RuleScope.title: RuleScope

Ensure.description: Present ensures the rule exists, Absent that it does not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.mailboxautoreplyconfi.description: This resource configures the Auto Reply settings of mailboxes.
microsoft.exchange.mailboxautoreplyconfi.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.mailboxautoreplyconfiguration

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the mailbox that you want to modify. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the mailbox.
Identity.title: Identity

Owner.description: User Principal Name of the mailbox owner
Owner.title: Owner

AutoDeclineFutureRequestsWhenOOF.description: The AutoDeclineFutureRequestsWhenOOF parameter specifies whether to automatically decline new meeting requests that are sent to the mailbox during the scheduled time period when Automatic Replies are being sent.
AutoDeclineFutureRequestsWhenOOF.title: AutoDeclineFutureRequestsWhenOOF

AutoReplyState.description: The AutoReplyState parameter specifies whether the mailbox is enabled for Automatic Replies. Valid values are: Enabled, Disabled, Scheduled
AutoReplyState.title: AutoReplyState

CreateOOFEvent.description: The CreateOOFEvent parameter specifies whether to create a calendar event that corresponds to the scheduled time period when Automatic Replies are being sent for the mailbox.
CreateOOFEvent.title: CreateOOFEvent

DeclineAllEventsForScheduledOOF.description: The DeclineAllEventsForScheduledOOF parameter specifies whether to decline all existing calendar events in the mailbox during the scheduled time period when Automatic Replies are being sent.
DeclineAllEventsForScheduledOOF.title: DeclineAllEventsForScheduledOOF

DeclineEventsForScheduledOOF.description: The DeclineEventsForScheduledOOF parameter specifies whether it's possible to decline existing calendar events in the mailbox during the scheduled time period when Automatic Replies are being sent.
DeclineEventsForScheduledOOF.title: DeclineEventsForScheduledOOF

DeclineMeetingMessage.description: The DeclineMeetingMessage parameter specifies the text in the message when meetings requests that are sent to the mailbox are automatically declined.
DeclineMeetingMessage.title: DeclineMeetingMessage

EndTime.description: The EndTime parameter specifies the end date and time that Automatic Replies are sent for the mailbox. You use this parameter only when the AutoReplyState parameter is set to Scheduled, and the value of this parameter is meaningful only when AutoReplyState is Scheduled.
EndTime.title: EndTime

EventsToDeleteIDs.description: The EventsToDeleteIDs parameter specifies the calendar events to delete from the mailbox when the DeclineEventsForScheduledOOF parameter is set to $true.
EventsToDeleteIDs.title: EventsToDeleteIDs

ExternalAudience.description: The ExternalAudience parameter specifies whether Automatic Replies are sent to external senders. Valid values are: None, Known, All
ExternalAudience.title: ExternalAudience

ExternalMessage.description: The ExternalMessage parameter specifies the Automatic Replies message that's sent to external senders or senders outside the organization. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
ExternalMessage.title: ExternalMessage

InternalMessage.description: The InternalMessage parameter specifies the Automatic Replies message that's sent to internal senders or senders within the organization. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
InternalMessage.title: InternalMessage

OOFEventSubject.description: The OOFEventSubject parameter specifies the subject for the calendar event that's automatically created when the CreateOOFEvent parameter is set to $true.
OOFEventSubject.title: OOFEventSubject

StartTime.description: The StartTime parameter specifies the start date and time that Automatic Replies are sent for the specified mailbox. You use this parameter only when the AutoReplyState parameter is set to Scheduled, and the value of this parameter is meaningful only when AutoReplyState is Scheduled.
StartTime.title: StartTime

Ensure.description: Represents the existence of the instance. This must be set to 'Present'
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.mailboxcalendarfolder.description:
This resource configures calendar publishing or sharing settings on a mailbox
for the visibility of calendar information to external users.
microsoft.exchange.mailboxcalendarfolder.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.mailboxcalendarfolder

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the calendar folder that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

DetailLevel.description: The DetailLevel parameter specifies the level of calendar detail that's published and available to anonymous users.
DetailLevel.title: DetailLevel

PublishDateRangeFrom.description: The PublishDateRangeFrom parameter specifies the start date of calendar information to publish (past information).
PublishDateRangeFrom.title: PublishDateRangeFrom

PublishDateRangeTo.description: The PublishDateRangeTo parameter specifies the end date of calendar information to publish (future information).
PublishDateRangeTo.title: PublishDateRangeTo

PublishEnabled.description: The PublishEnabled parameter specifies whether to publish the specified calendar information.
PublishEnabled.title: PublishEnabled

SearchableUrlEnabled.description: The SearchableUrlEnabled parameter specifies whether the published calendar URL is discoverable on the web.
SearchableUrlEnabled.title: SearchableUrlEnabled

SharedCalendarSyncStartDate.description: The SharedCalendarSyncStartDate parameter specifies the limit for past events in the shared calendar that are visible to delegates. A copy of the shared calendar within the specified date range is stored in the delegate's mailbox.
SharedCalendarSyncStartDate.title: SharedCalendarSyncStartDate

Ensure.description: Determines whether or not the instance exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.mailboxpermission.description: Use this resource to modify the permissions of mailbox.
microsoft.exchange.mailboxpermission.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.mailboxpermission

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the mailbox where you want to assign permissions to the user. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the mailbox.
Identity.title: Identity

AccessRights.description: The AccessRights parameter specifies the permission that you want to add for the user on the mailbox. Valid values are: ChangeOwner, ChangePermission, DeleteItem, ExternalAccount, FullAccess and ReadPermission.
AccessRights.title: AccessRights

User.description: The User parameter specifies who gets the permissions on the mailbox.
User.title: User

InheritanceType.description: The InheritanceType parameter specifies how permissions are inherited by folders in the mailbox. Valid values are: None, All, Children, Descendents, SelfAndChildren.
InheritanceType.title: InheritanceType

Owner.description: The Owner parameter specifies the owner of the mailbox object.
Owner.title: Owner

Deny.description: The Deny switch specifies that the permissions you're adding are Deny permissions.
Deny.title: Deny

Ensure.description: Determines whether or not the permission should exist on the mailbox.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.mailboxplan.description: Use this resource to modify the settings of mailbox plans in the cloud-based service.
microsoft.exchange.mailboxplan.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.mailboxplan

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the Mailbox Plan that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

DisplayName.description: The display name of the mailbox plan.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

Ensure.description: MailboxPlans cannot be created/removed in O365.  This must be set to 'Present'
Ensure.title: Ensure

IssueWarningQuota.description: The IssueWarningQuota parameter specifies the warning threshold for the size of the mailboxes that are created or enabled using the mailbox plan.
IssueWarningQuota.title: IssueWarningQuota

MaxReceiveSize.description: The MaxReceiveSize parameter specifies the maximum size of a message that can be sent to the mailbox.
MaxReceiveSize.title: MaxReceiveSize

MaxSendSize.description: The MaxSendSize parameter specifies the maximum size of a message that can be sent by the mailbox.
MaxSendSize.title: MaxSendSize

ProhibitSendQuota.description: The ProhibitSendQuota parameter specifies a size limit for the mailbox.
ProhibitSendQuota.title: ProhibitSendQuota

ProhibitSendReceiveQuota.description: The ProhibitSendReceiveQuota parameter specifies a size limit for the mailbox.
ProhibitSendReceiveQuota.title: ProhibitSendReceiveQuota

RetainDeletedItemsFor.description: The RetainDeletedItemsFor parameter specifies the length of time to keep soft-deleted items for the mailbox.
RetainDeletedItemsFor.title: RetainDeletedItemsFor

RetentionPolicy.description: The RetentionPolicy parameter specifies the retention policy that's applied to the mailbox.
RetentionPolicy.title: RetentionPolicy

RoleAssignmentPolicy.description: The RoleAssignmentPolicy parameter specifies the role assignment policy that's applied to the mailbox.
RoleAssignmentPolicy.title: RoleAssignmentPolicy

microsoft.exchange.mailboxsettings.description:
This resource configures settings on Mailboxes
such as the Regional settings and its timezone.
microsoft.exchange.mailboxsettings.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.mailboxsettings

DisplayName.description: The display name of the Shared Mailbox
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

TimeZone.description: The name of the Time Zone to assign to the mailbox
TimeZone.title: TimeZone

Locale.description: The code of the Locale to assign to the mailbox
Locale.title: Locale

Ensure.description: Present ensures the Mailbox Settings are applied
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.mailcontact.description: This resource configures Exchange Online address lists.
microsoft.exchange.mailcontact.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.mailcontact

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies a unique name for the mail contact.
Name.title: Name

ExternalEmailAddress.description: The ExternalEmailAddress parameter specifies the target email address of the mail contact or mail user. By default, this value is used as the primary email address of the mail contact or mail user.
ExternalEmailAddress.title: ExternalEmailAddress

Alias.description: The Alias parameter specifies the Exchange alias (also known as the mail nickname) for the recipient. This value identifies the recipient as a mail-enabled object, and shouldn't be confused with multiple email addresses for the same recipient (also known as proxy addresses). A recipient can have only one Alias value. The maximum length is 64 characters.
Alias.title: Alias

DisplayName.description: The DisplayName parameter specifies the display name of the mail contact. The display name is visible in the Exchange admin center and in address lists.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

FirstName.description: The FirstName parameter specifies the user's first name.
FirstName.title: FirstName

Initials.description: The Initials parameter specifies the user's middle initials.
Initials.title: Initials

LastName.description: The LastName parameter specifies the user's last name.
LastName.title: LastName

MacAttachmentFormat.description: The MacAttachmentFormat parameter specifies the Apple Macintosh operating system attachment format to use for messages sent to the mail contact or mail user. Valid values are: BinHex, UuEncode, AppleSingle, AppleDouble
MacAttachmentFormat.title: MacAttachmentFormat

MessageBodyFormat.description: The MessageBodyFormat parameter specifies the message body format for messages sent to the mail contact or mail user. Valid values are: Text, Html, TextAndHtml
MessageBodyFormat.title: MessageBodyFormat

MessageFormat.description: The MessageFormat parameter specifies the message format for messages sent to the mail contact or mail user. Valid values are: Mime, Text
MessageFormat.title: MessageFormat

ModeratedBy.description: The ModeratedBy parameter specifies one or more moderators for this mail contact. A moderator approves messages sent to the mail contact before the messages are delivered. A moderator must be a mailbox, mail user, or mail contact in your organization.
ModeratedBy.title: ModeratedBy

ModerationEnabled.description: The ModerationEnabled parameter specifies whether moderation is enabled for this recipient.
ModerationEnabled.title: ModerationEnabled

OrganizationalUnit.description: The OrganizationalUnit parameter specifies the location in Active Directory where the new contact is created.
OrganizationalUnit.title: OrganizationalUnit

SendModerationNotifications.description: The SendModerationNotifications parameter specifies when moderation notification messages are sent. Valid values are: ALways, Internal, Never
SendModerationNotifications.title: SendModerationNotifications

UsePreferMessageFormat.description: The UsePreferMessageFormat specifies whether the message format settings configured for the mail user or mail contact override the global settings configured for the remote domain or configured by the message sender
UsePreferMessageFormat.title: UsePreferMessageFormat

CustomAttribute1.description: The CustomAttribute1 parameter specifies the value of the CustomAttribute1
CustomAttribute1.title: CustomAttribute1

CustomAttribute2.description: The CustomAttribute2 parameter specifies the value of the CustomAttribute2
CustomAttribute2.title: CustomAttribute2

CustomAttribute3.description: The CustomAttribute3 parameter specifies the value of the CustomAttribute3

microsoft.exchange.mailtips.description: This resource allows to configure Mailtips behaviors in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.mailtips.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.mailtips

MailTipsGroupMetricsEnabled.description: Specifies whether MailTips that rely on group metrics data are enabled.
MailTipsGroupMetricsEnabled.title: MailTipsGroupMetricsEnabled

MailTipsLargeAudienceThreshold.description: Specifies what a large audience is.
MailTipsLargeAudienceThreshold.title: MailTipsLargeAudienceThreshold

MailTipsMailboxSourcedTipsEnabled.description: Specifies whether MailTips that rely on mailbox data (out-of-office or full mailbox) are enabled.
MailTipsMailboxSourcedTipsEnabled.title: MailTipsMailboxSourcedTipsEnabled

MailTipsExternalRecipientsTipsEnabled.description: Specifies whether MailTips for external recipients are enabled.
MailTipsExternalRecipientsTipsEnabled.title: MailTipsExternalRecipientsTipsEnabled

microsoft.exchange.malwarefilterpolicy.description: Create or modify a EXOMalwareFilterPolicy in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.malwarefilterpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.malwarefilterpolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the MalwareFilterPolicy you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

AdminDisplayName.description: The AdminDisplayName parameter specifies a description for the policy. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
AdminDisplayName.title: AdminDisplayName

CustomExternalBody.description: The CustomExternalBody parameter specifies the body of the custom notification message for malware detections in messages from external senders. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomExternalBody.title: CustomExternalBody

CustomExternalSubject.description: The CustomExternalSubject parameter specifies the subject of the custom notification message for malware detections in messages from external senders. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomExternalSubject.title: CustomExternalSubject

CustomFromAddress.description: The CustomFromAddress parameter specifies the From address of the custom notification message for malware detections in messages from internal or external senders.
CustomFromAddress.title: CustomFromAddress

CustomFromName.description: The CustomFromName parameter specifies the From name of the custom notification message for malware detections in messages from internal or external senders. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomFromName.title: CustomFromName

CustomInternalBody.description: The CustomInternalBody parameter specifies the body of the custom notification message for malware detections in messages from internal senders. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomInternalBody.title: CustomInternalBody

CustomInternalSubject.description: The CustomInternalSubject parameter specifies the subject of the custom notification message for malware detections in messages from internal senders. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
CustomInternalSubject.title: CustomInternalSubject

CustomNotifications.description: The CustomNotifications parameter enables or disables custom notification messages for malware detections in messages from internal or external senders. Valid values are: $true, $false.
CustomNotifications.title: CustomNotifications

EnableExternalSenderAdminNotifications.description: The EnableExternalSenderAdminNotifications parameter enables or disables sending malware detection notification messages to an administrator for messages from external senders. Valid values are: $true, $false.
EnableExternalSenderAdminNotifications.title: EnableExternalSenderAdminNotifications

EnableFileFilter.description: The EnableFileFilter parameter enables or disables common attachment blocking - also known as the Common Attachment Types Filter.Valid values are: $true, $false.
EnableFileFilter.title: EnableFileFilter

EnableInternalSenderAdminNotifications.description: The EnableInternalSenderAdminNotifications parameter enables or disables sending malware detection notification messages to an administrator for messages from internal senders. Valid values are: $true, $false.
EnableInternalSenderAdminNotifications.title: EnableInternalSenderAdminNotifications

ExternalSenderAdminAddress.description: The ExternalSenderAdminAddress parameter specifies the email address of the administrator who will receive notification messages for malware detections in messages from external senders.
ExternalSenderAdminAddress.title: ExternalSenderAdminAddress

FileTypeAction.description: The FileTypeAction parameter specifies what's done to messages that contain one or more attachments where the file extension is included in the FileTypes parameter (common attachment blocking). Valid values are Quarantine and Reject. The default value is Reject.
FileTypeAction.title: FileTypeAction

FileTypes.description: The FileTypes parameter specifies the file types that are automatically blocked by common attachment blocking (also known as the Common Attachment Types Filter), regardless of content.
FileTypes.title: FileTypes

InternalSenderAdminAddress.description: The InternalSenderAdminAddress parameter specifies the email address of the administrator who will receive notification messages for malware detections in messages from internal senders.
InternalSenderAdminAddress.title: InternalSenderAdminAddress

MakeDefault.description: MakeDefault makes this malware filter policy the default policy. Valid values are: $true, $false.
MakeDefault.title: MakeDefault

QuarantineTag.description: The QuarantineTag specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined as malware.
QuarantineTag.title: QuarantineTag

ZapEnabled.description: The ZapEnabled parameter enables or disables zero-hour auto purge (ZAP) for malware. ZAP detects malware in unread messages that have already been delivered to the user's Inbox. Valid values are: $true, $false.
ZapEnabled.title: ZapEnabled

Ensure.description: Specifies if this MalwareFilterPolicy should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.malwarefilterrule.description: Create or modify a new EXOMalwareFilterRule in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.malwarefilterrule.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.malwarefilterrule

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the EXO resource you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Comments.description: The Comments parameter specifies informative comments for the rule, such as what the rule is used for or how it has changed over time. The length of the comment can't exceed 1024 characters.
Comments.title: Comments

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter enables or disables the malware filter rule. Valid input for this parameter is $true or $false. The default value is $true.
Enabled.title: Enabled

ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.title: ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs

ExceptIfSentTo.description: The ExceptIfSentTo parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
ExceptIfSentTo.title: ExceptIfSentTo

ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.description: The ExceptIfSentToMemberOf parameter specifies an exception that looks for messages sent to members of groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.title: ExceptIfSentToMemberOf

MalwareFilterPolicy.description: The MalwareFilterPolicy parameter specifies the malware filter policy to apply to messages that match the conditions defined by this malware filter rule.
MalwareFilterPolicy.title: MalwareFilterPolicy

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies a priority value for the rule that determines the order of rule processing. A lower integer value indicates a higher priority, the value 0 is the highest priority, and rules can't have the same priority value.
Priority.title: Priority

RecipientDomainIs.description: The RecipientDomainIs parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
RecipientDomainIs.title: RecipientDomainIs

SentTo.description: The SentTo parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
SentTo.title: SentTo

SentToMemberOf.description: The SentToMemberOf parameter specifies a condition that looks for messages sent to members of distribution groups, dynamic distribution groups, or mail-enabled security groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
SentToMemberOf.title: SentToMemberOf

Ensure.description: Specifies if the Malware Filter Rule should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.managementrole.description: This resource configures RBAC Management Roles in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.managementrole.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.managementrole

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the name of the role. The maximum length of the name is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

Parent.description: The Parent parameter specifies the identity of the role to copy. Mandatory for management role creation/update or when Ensure=Present. Non-mandatory for Ensure=Absent
Parent.title: Parent

Description.description: The Description parameter specifies the description that's displayed when the management role is viewed using the Get-ManagementRole cmdlet.
Description.title: Description

Ensure.description: Specify if the Management Role should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.managementroleassignm.description: This resource configures RBAC Management Roles Assignments in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.managementroleassignm.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.managementroleassignment

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies a name for the new management role assignment. The maximum length of the name is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

Role.description: The Role parameter specifies the existing role to assign. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the role.
Role.title: Role

App.description: The App parameter specifies the service principal to assign the management role to. Specifically, the ServiceId GUID value from the output of the Get-ServicePrincipal cmdlet (for example, 6233fba6-0198-4277-892f-9275bf728bcc).
App.title: App

Policy.description: The Policy parameter specifies the name of the management role assignment policy to assign the management role to.
Policy.title: Policy

SecurityGroup.description: The SecurityGroup parameter specifies the name of the management role group or mail-enabled universal security group to assign the management role to.
SecurityGroup.title: SecurityGroup

User.description: The User parameter specifies the name or alias of the user to assign the management role to.
User.title: User

CustomRecipientWriteScope.description: The CustomRecipientWriteScope parameter specifies the existing recipient-based management scope to associate with this management role assignment.
CustomRecipientWriteScope.title: CustomRecipientWriteScope

CustomResourceScope.description: The CustomResourceScope parameter specifies the custom management scope to associate with this management role assignment. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the management scope.
CustomResourceScope.title: CustomResourceScope

ExclusiveRecipientWriteScope.description: The ExclusiveConfigWriteScope parameter specifies the exclusive configuration-based management scope to associate with the new role assignment.
ExclusiveRecipientWriteScope.title: ExclusiveRecipientWriteScope

RecipientAdministrativeUnitScope.description: The RecipientAdministrativeUnitScope parameter specifies the administrative unit to scope the new role assignment to.
RecipientAdministrativeUnitScope.title: RecipientAdministrativeUnitScope

RecipientOrganizationalUnitScope.description: The RecipientOrganizationalUnitScope parameter specifies the OU to scope the new role assignment to. If you use the RecipientOrganizationalUnitScope parameter, you can't use the CustomRecipientWriteScope or ExclusiveRecipientWriteScope parameters.
RecipientOrganizationalUnitScope.title: RecipientOrganizationalUnitScope

RecipientRelativeWriteScope.description: The RecipientRelativeWriteScope parameter specifies the type of restriction to apply to a recipient scope. The available types are None, Organization, MyGAL, Self, and MyDistributionGroups. The RecipientRelativeWriteScope parameter is automatically set when the CustomRecipientWriteScope or RecipientOrganizationalUnitScope parameters are used.
RecipientRelativeWriteScope.title: RecipientRelativeWriteScope

Ensure.description: Specify if the Management Role Assignment should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.managementroleentry.description: This resource configures RBAC Management Roles Entries in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.managementroleentry.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.managementroleentry

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the role entry that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Parameters.description: The Parameters parameter specifies the parameters to be added to or removed from the role entry.
Parameters.title: Parameters

Type.description: The Type parameter specifies the type of role entry to return.
Type.title: Type

microsoft.exchange.messageclassification.description: Create a new Message Classification policy in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.messageclassification.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.messageclassification

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the OME Configuration policy that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

ClassificationID.description: The ClassificationID parameter specifies the classification ID (GUID) of an existing message classification that you want to import and use in your Exchange organization.
ClassificationID.title: ClassificationID

DisplayName.description: The DisplayName parameter specifies the title of the message classification that's displayed in Outlook and selected by users.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

DisplayPrecedence.description: The DisplayPrecedence parameter specifies the relative precedence of the message classification to other message classifications that may be applied to a specified message.
DisplayPrecedence.title: DisplayPrecedence

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name for the message classification.
Name.title: Name

PermissionMenuVisible.description: The PermissionMenuVisible parameter specifies whether the values that you entered for the DisplayName and RecipientDescription parameters are displayed in Outlook as the user composes a message.
PermissionMenuVisible.title: PermissionMenuVisible

RecipientDescription.description: The RecipientDescription parameter specifies the detailed text that's shown to Outlook recipient when they receive a message that has the message classification applied.
RecipientDescription.title: RecipientDescription

RetainClassificationEnabled.description: The RetainClassificationEnabled parameter specifies whether the message classification should persist with the message if the message is forwarded or replied to.
RetainClassificationEnabled.title: RetainClassificationEnabled
