SenderDescription.description: The SenderDescription parameter specifies the detailed text that's shown to Outlook senders when they select a message classification to apply to a message before they send the message.
SenderDescription.title: SenderDescription

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Outbound connector should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.mobiledevicemailboxpo.description: This resource configures Mobile Device Mailbox Policies in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.mobiledevicemailboxpo.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.mobiledevicemailboxpolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the friendly name of the mobile device mailbox policy.
Name.title: Name

AllowApplePushNotifications.description: The AllowApplePushNotifications parameter specifies whether push notifications are allowed to Apple mobile devices.
AllowApplePushNotifications.title: AllowApplePushNotifications

AllowBluetooth.description: The AllowBluetooth parameter specifies whether the Bluetooth capabilities are allowed on the mobile phone. The available options are Disable, HandsfreeOnly, and Allow. The default value is Allow.
AllowBluetooth.title: AllowBluetooth

AllowBrowser.description: The AllowBrowser parameter indicates whether Microsoft Pocket Internet Explorer is allowed on the mobile phone. This parameter doesn't affect third-party browsers.
AllowBrowser.title: AllowBrowser

AllowCamera.description: The AllowCamera parameter specifies whether the mobile phone's camera is allowed.
AllowCamera.title: AllowCamera

AllowConsumerEmail.description: The AllowConsumerEmail parameter specifies whether the mobile phone user can configure a personal email account on the mobile phone.
AllowConsumerEmail.title: AllowConsumerEmail

AllowDesktopSync.description: The AllowDesktopSync parameter specifies whether the mobile phone can synchronize with a desktop computer through a cable.
AllowDesktopSync.title: AllowDesktopSync

AllowExternalDeviceManagement.description: The AllowExternalDeviceManagement parameter specifies whether an external device management program is allowed to manage the mobile phone.
AllowExternalDeviceManagement.title: AllowExternalDeviceManagement

AllowGooglePushNotifications.description: The AllowGooglePushNotifications parameter controls whether the user can receive push notifications from Google for Outlook on the web for devices.
AllowGooglePushNotifications.title: AllowGooglePushNotifications

AllowHTMLEmail.description: The AllowHTMLEmail parameter specifies whether HTML email is enabled on the mobile phone.
AllowHTMLEmail.title: AllowHTMLEmail

AllowInternetSharing.description: The AllowInternetSharing parameter specifies whether the mobile phone can be used as a modem to connect a computer to the Internet.
AllowInternetSharing.title: AllowInternetSharing

AllowIrDA.description: The AllowIrDA parameter specifies whether infrared connections are allowed to the mobile phone.
AllowIrDA.title: AllowIrDA

AllowMobileOTAUpdate.description: The AllowMobileOTAUpdate parameter specifies whether the Exchange ActiveSync mailbox policy can be sent to the mobile phone over a cellular data connection.
AllowMobileOTAUpdate.title: AllowMobileOTAUpdate

AllowMicrosoftPushNotifications.description: The AllowMicrosoftPushNotifications parameter specifies whether push notifications are enabled on the mobile device.
AllowMicrosoftPushNotifications.title: AllowMicrosoftPushNotifications

AllowNonProvisionableDevices.description: The AllowNonProvisionableDevices parameter specifies whether all mobile phones can synchronize with the server running Exchange.
AllowNonProvisionableDevices.title: AllowNonProvisionableDevices

AllowPOPIMAPEmail.description: The AllowPOPIMAPEmail parameter specifies whether the user can configure a POP3 or IMAP4 email account on the mobile phone.
AllowPOPIMAPEmail.title: AllowPOPIMAPEmail

AllowRemoteDesktop.description: The AllowRemoteDesktop parameter specifies whether the mobile phone can initiate a remote desktop connection.
AllowRemoteDesktop.title: AllowRemoteDesktop

AllowSimplePassword.description: The AllowSimplePassword parameter specifies whether a simple device password is allowed. A simple device password is a password that has a specific pattern, such as 1111 or 1234.
AllowSimplePassword.title: AllowSimplePassword

AllowSMIMEEncryptionAlgorithmNegotiation.description: The AllowSMIMEEncryptionAlgorithmNegotiation parameter specifies whether the messaging application on the mobile device can negotiate the encryption algorithm if a recipient's certificate doesn't support the specified encryption algorithm.
AllowSMIMEEncryptionAlgorithmNegotiation.title: AllowSMIMEEncryptionAlgorithmNegotiation

AllowSMIMESoftCerts.description: The AllowSMIMESoftCerts parameter specifies whether S/MIME software certificates are allowed.
AllowSMIMESoftCerts.title: AllowSMIMESoftCerts

AllowStorageCard.description: The AllowStorageCard parameter specifies whether the mobile phone can access information stored on a storage card.
AllowStorageCard.title: AllowStorageCard

AllowTextMessaging.description: The AllowTextMessaging parameter specifies whether text messaging is allowed from the mobile phone.
AllowTextMessaging.title: AllowTextMessaging

AllowUnsignedApplications.description: The AllowUnsignedApplications parameter specifies whether unsigned applications can be installed on the mobile phone.
AllowUnsignedApplications.title: AllowUnsignedApplications

AllowUnsignedInstallationPackages.description: The AllowUnsignedInstallationPackages parameter specifies whether unsigned installation packages can be executed on the mobile phone.
AllowUnsignedInstallationPackages.title: AllowUnsignedInstallationPackages

AllowWiFi.description: The AllowWiFi parameter specifies whether wireless Internet access is allowed on the mobile phone.
AllowWiFi.title: AllowWiFi

AlphanumericPasswordRequired.description: The AlphanumericPasswordRequired parameter specifies whether the password for the mobile phone must be alphanumeric.
AlphanumericPasswordRequired.title: AlphanumericPasswordRequired

ApprovedApplicationList.description: The ApprovedApplicationList parameter specifies a list of approved applications for the mobile phone.
ApprovedApplicationList.title: ApprovedApplicationList

AttachmentsEnabled.description: The AttachmentsEnabled parameter specifies whether attachments can be downloaded.
AttachmentsEnabled.title: AttachmentsEnabled

DeviceEncryptionEnabled.description: The DeviceEncryptionEnabled parameter specifies whether encryption is enabled.
DeviceEncryptionEnabled.title: DeviceEncryptionEnabled

DevicePolicyRefreshInterval.description: The DevicePolicyRefreshInterval parameter specifies how often the policy is sent from the server to the mobile phone.
DevicePolicyRefreshInterval.title: DevicePolicyRefreshInterval

IrmEnabled.description: The IrmEnabled parameter specifies whether Information Rights Management (IRM) is enabled for the mailbox policy.
IrmEnabled.title: IrmEnabled

IsDefault.description: The IsDefault parameter specifies whether this policy is the default Mobile Device mailbox policy.
IsDefault.title: IsDefault

MaxAttachmentSize.description: The MaxAttachmentSize parameter specifies the maximum size of attachments that can be downloaded to the mobile phone.
MaxAttachmentSize.title: MaxAttachmentSize

MaxCalendarAgeFilter.description: The MaxCalendarAgeFilter parameter specifies the maximum range of calendar days that can be synchronized to the device.
MaxCalendarAgeFilter.title: MaxCalendarAgeFilter

MaxEmailAgeFilter.description: The MaxEmailAgeFilter parameter specifies the maximum number of days of email items to synchronize to the mobile phone.
MaxEmailAgeFilter.title: MaxEmailAgeFilter

MaxEmailBodyTruncationSize.description: The MaxEmailBodyTruncationSize parameter specifies the maximum size at which email messages are truncated when synchronized to the mobile phone. The value is specified in kilobytes (KB).
MaxEmailBodyTruncationSize.title: MaxEmailBodyTruncationSize

MaxEmailHTMLBodyTruncationSize.description: The MaxEmailHTMLBodyTruncationSize parameter specifies the maximum size at which HTML-formatted email messages are synchronized to the mobile phone. The value is specified in KB.
MaxEmailHTMLBodyTruncationSize.title: MaxEmailHTMLBodyTruncationSize

MaxInactivityTimeLock.description: The MaxInactivityTimeDeviceLock parameter specifies the length of time that the mobile phone can be inactive before the password is required to reactivate it.
MaxInactivityTimeLock.title: MaxInactivityTimeLock

MaxPasswordFailedAttempts.description: The MaxPasswordFailedAttempts parameter specifies the number of attempts a user can make to enter the correct password for the mobile phone. You can enter any number from 4 through 16 or the value Unlimited.
MaxPasswordFailedAttempts.title: MaxPasswordFailedAttempts

MinPasswordComplexCharacters.description: The MinPasswordComplexCharacters parameter specifies the character sets that are required in the password of the mobile device.
MinPasswordComplexCharacters.title: MinPasswordComplexCharacters

MinPasswordLength.description: The MinPasswordLength parameter specifies the minimum number of characters in the mobile device password.
MinPasswordLength.title: MinPasswordLength

PasswordEnabled.description: The PasswordEnabled parameter specifies whether a password is required on the mobile device.
PasswordEnabled.title: PasswordEnabled

PasswordExpiration.description: The PasswordExpiration parameter specifies how long a password can be used on a mobile device before the user is forced to change the password.
PasswordExpiration.title: PasswordExpiration

PasswordHistory.description: The PasswordHistory parameter specifies the number of unique new passwords that need to be created on the mobile device before an old password can be reused.
PasswordHistory.title: PasswordHistory

PasswordRecoveryEnabled.description: The PasswordRecoveryEnabled parameter specifies whether the recovery password for the mobile device is stored in Exchange.
PasswordRecoveryEnabled.title: PasswordRecoveryEnabled

RequireDeviceEncryption.description: The RequireDeviceEncryption parameter specifies whether encryption is required on the mobile device.
RequireDeviceEncryption.title: RequireDeviceEncryption

RequireEncryptedSMIMEMessages.description: The RequireEncryptedSMIMEMessages parameter specifies whether the mobile device must send encrypted S/MIME messages.
RequireEncryptedSMIMEMessages.title: RequireEncryptedSMIMEMessages

RequireEncryptionSMIMEAlgorithm.description: The RequireEncryptionSMIMEAlgorithm parameter specifies the algorithm that's required to encrypt S/MIME messages on a mobile device.
RequireEncryptionSMIMEAlgorithm.title: RequireEncryptionSMIMEAlgorithm

RequireManualSyncWhenRoaming.description: The RequireSignedSMIMEAlgorithm parameter specifies the algorithm that's used to sign S/MIME messages on the mobile device.
RequireManualSyncWhenRoaming.title: RequireManualSyncWhenRoaming

RequireSignedSMIMEAlgorithm.description: The RequireSignedSMIMEAlgorithm parameter specifies the algorithm that's used to sign S/MIME messages on the mobile device.
RequireSignedSMIMEAlgorithm.title: RequireSignedSMIMEAlgorithm

RequireSignedSMIMEMessages.description: The RequireSignedSMIMEMessages parameter specifies whether the mobile device must send signed S/MIME messages.
RequireSignedSMIMEMessages.title: RequireSignedSMIMEMessages

RequireStorageCardEncryption.description: The RequireStorageCardEncryption parameter specifies whether storage card encryption is required on the mobile device.
RequireStorageCardEncryption.title: RequireStorageCardEncryption

UnapprovedInROMApplicationList.description: The UnapprovedInROMApplicationList parameter specifies a list of applications that can't be run in ROM on the mobile device.
UnapprovedInROMApplicationList.title: UnapprovedInROMApplicationList

UNCAccessEnabled.description: The UNCAccessEnabled parameter specifies whether access to Microsoft Windows file shares is enabled from the mobile device.
UNCAccessEnabled.title: UNCAccessEnabled

WSSAccessEnabled.description: The WSSAccessEnabled parameter specifies whether access to Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services is enabled from the mobile device.
WSSAccessEnabled.title: WSSAccessEnabled

Ensure.description: Specify if the Mobile Device Mailbox Policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.offlineaddressbook.description: This resource configures Offline Address Books in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.offlineaddressbook.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.offlineaddressbook

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the Offline Address Book. The maximum length is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

AddressLists.description: The AddressLists parameter specifies the address lists or global address lists that are included in the OAB. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the address list.
AddressLists.title: AddressLists

ConfiguredAttributes.description: The ConfiguredAttributes parameter specifies the recipient MAPI properties that are available in the OAB.
ConfiguredAttributes.title: ConfiguredAttributes

DiffRetentionPeriod.description: The DiffRetentionPeriod parameter specifies the number of days that the OAB difference files are stored on the server.
DiffRetentionPeriod.title: DiffRetentionPeriod

IsDefault.description: The IsDefault parameter specifies whether the OAB is used by all mailboxes and mailbox databases that don't have an OAB specified.
IsDefault.title: IsDefault

Ensure.description: Specify if the Offline Address Book should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.omeconfiguration.description: Create a new OME Configuration policy in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.omeconfiguration.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.omeconfiguration

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the OME Configuration policy that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

BackgroundColor.description: The BackgroundColor parameter specifies the background color
BackgroundColor.title: BackgroundColor

DisclaimerText.description: The DisclaimerText parameter specifies the disclaimer text in the email that contains the encrypted message
DisclaimerText.title: DisclaimerText

EmailText.description: The EmailText parameter specifies the default text that accompanies encrypted email messages.
EmailText.title: EmailText

ExternalMailExpiryInDays.description: The ExternalMailExpiryInDays parameter specifies the number of days that the encrypted message is available to external recipients in the Microsoft 365 portal. A valid value is an integer from 0 to 730.
ExternalMailExpiryInDays.title: ExternalMailExpiryInDays

IntroductionText.description: The IntroductionText parameter specifies the default text that accompanies encrypted email messages.
IntroductionText.title: IntroductionText

OTPEnabled.description: The OTPEnabled parameter specifies whether to allow recipients to use a one-time passcode to view encrypted messages.
OTPEnabled.title: OTPEnabled

PortalText.description: The PortalText parameter specifies the text that appears at the top of the encrypted email viewing portal.
PortalText.title: PortalText

PrivacyStatementUrl.description: The PrivacyStatementUrl parameter specifies the Privacy Statement link in the encrypted email notification message.
PrivacyStatementUrl.title: PrivacyStatementUrl

ReadButtonText.description: The ReadButtonText parameter specifies the text that appears on the 'Read the message' button.
ReadButtonText.title: ReadButtonText

SocialIdSignIn.description: The SocialIdSignIn parameter specifies whether a user is allowed to view an encrypted message in the Microsoft 365 admin center using their own social network id (Google, Yahoo, and Microsoft account).
SocialIdSignIn.title: SocialIdSignIn

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Outbound connector should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.onpremisesorganizatio.description: This resource configures On-Premises Organization in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.onpremisesorganizatio.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.onpremisesorganization

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the identity of the on-premises organization object.
Identity.title: Identity

HybridDomains.description: The HybridDomains parameter specifies the domains that are configured in the hybrid deployment between an Office 365 tenant and an on-premises Exchange organization. The domains specified in this parameter must match the domains listed in the HybridConfiguration Active Directory object for the on-premises Exchange organization configured by the Hybrid Configuration wizard.
HybridDomains.title: HybridDomains

InboundConnector.description: The InboundConnector parameter specifies the name of the inbound connector configured on the Microsoft Exchange Online Protection (EOP) service for a hybrid deployment configured with an on-premises Exchange organization.
InboundConnector.title: InboundConnector

OutboundConnector.description: The OutboundConnector parameter specifies the name of the outbound connector configured on the EOP service for a hybrid deployment configured with an on-premises Exchange organization.
OutboundConnector.title: OutboundConnector

OrganizationName.description: The OrganizationName parameter specifies the Active Directory object name of the on-premises Exchange organization.
OrganizationName.title: OrganizationName

OrganizationGuid.description: The OrganizationGuid parameter specifies the globally unique identifier (GUID) of the on-premises Exchange organization object in the Office 365 tenant.
OrganizationGuid.title: OrganizationGuid

OrganizationRelationship.description: The OrganizationRelationship parameter specifies the organization relationship configured by the Hybrid Configuration wizard on the Office 365 tenant as part of a hybrid deployment with an on-premises Exchange organization. This organization relationship defines the federated sharing features enabled on the Office 365 tenant.
OrganizationRelationship.title: OrganizationRelationship

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

Ensure.description: Specify if the On-Premises Organization should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.organizationconfig.description:
This resource configures the Exchange Online organization-wide
settings.
microsoft.exchange.organizationconfig.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.organizationconfig

ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutEnable.description: The ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutEnabled parameter specifies whether the timed logoff feature is enabled. The default value is $true
ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutEnable.title: ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutEnabled

ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutInterv.description: The ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutInterval parameter specifies the time span for logoff. You enter this value as a time span: hh:mm:ss where hh = hours, mm = minutes and ss = seconds. Valid values for this parameter are from 00:05:00 to 08:00:00 (5 minutes to 8 hours). The default value is 06:00:00 (6 hours).
ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutInterv.title: ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutInterval

ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutWithSi.description: The ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutWithSingleSignOnEnabled parameter specifies whether to keep single sign-on enabled. The default value is $true.
ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutWithSi.title: ActivityBasedAuthenticationTimeoutWithSingleSignOnEnabled

AppsForOfficeEnabled.description: The AppsForOfficeEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable apps for Outlook features. By default, the parameter is set to $true. If the flag is set to $false, no new apps can be activated for any user in the organization.
AppsForOfficeEnabled.title: AppsForOfficeEnabled

AsyncSendEnabled.description: The AsyncSendEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable async send in Outlook on the web.
AsyncSendEnabled.title: AsyncSendEnabled

AuditDisabled.description: The AuditDisabled parameter specifies whether to disable or enable mailbox auditing for the organization.
AuditDisabled.title: AuditDisabled

AutodiscoverPartialDirSync.description: Setting this parameter to $true will cause unknown users to be redirected to the on-premises endpoint and will allow on-premises users to discover their mailbox automatically.
AutodiscoverPartialDirSync.title: AutodiscoverPartialDirSync

AutoExpandingArchive.description: The AutoExpandingArchive switch enables the unlimited archiving feature (called auto-expanding archiving) in an Exchange Online organization. You don't need to specify a value with this switch.
AutoExpandingArchive.title: AutoExpandingArchive

BookingsAddressEntryRestricted.description: The BookingsAddressEntryRestricted parameter specifies whether addresses can be collected from Bookings customers.
BookingsAddressEntryRestricted.title: BookingsAddressEntryRestricted

BookingsAuthEnabled.description: The BookingsAuthEnabled parameter specifies whether to enforce authentication to access all published Bookings pages.
BookingsAuthEnabled.title: BookingsAuthEnabled

BookingsCreationOfCustomQuestionsRestric.description: The BookingsCreationOfCustomQuestionsRestricted parameter specifies whether Bookings admins can add custom questions.
BookingsCreationOfCustomQuestionsRestric.title: BookingsCreationOfCustomQuestionsRestricted

BookingsEnabled.description: The BookingsEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable Microsoft Bookings in an organization.
BookingsEnabled.title: BookingsEnabled

BookingsExposureOfStaffDetailsRestricted.description: The BookingsExposureOfStaffDetailsRestricted parameter specifies whether the attributes of internal Bookings staff members are visible to external Bookings customers.
BookingsExposureOfStaffDetailsRestricted.title: BookingsExposureOfStaffDetailsRestricted

BookingsMembershipApprovalRequired.description: The BookingsMembershipApprovalRequired parameter enables a membership approval requirement when new staff members are added to Bookings calendars.
BookingsMembershipApprovalRequired.title: BookingsMembershipApprovalRequired

BookingsNotesEntryRestricted.description: The BookingsNotesEntryRestricted parameter specifies whether appointment notes can be collected from Bookings customers.
BookingsNotesEntryRestricted.title: BookingsNotesEntryRestricted

BookingsPaymentsEnabled.description: The BookingsPaymentsEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable online payment node inside Bookings.
BookingsPaymentsEnabled.title: BookingsPaymentsEnabled

BookingsPhoneNumberEntryRestricted.description: The BookingsPhoneNumberEntryRestricted parameter specifies whether phone numbers can be collected from Bookings customers.
BookingsPhoneNumberEntryRestricted.title: BookingsPhoneNumberEntryRestricted

BookingsSocialSharingRestricted.description: The BookingsSocialSharingRestricted parameter allows you to control whether, or not, your users can see social sharing options inside Bookings.
BookingsSocialSharingRestricted.title: BookingsSocialSharingRestricted

ByteEncoderTypeFor7BitCharsets.description: The ByteEncoderTypeFor7BitCharsets parameter specifies the 7-bit transfer encoding method for MIME format for messages sent to this remote domain.
ByteEncoderTypeFor7BitCharsets.title: ByteEncoderTypeFor7BitCharsets

ConnectorsActionableMessagesEnabled.description: The ConnectorsActionableMessagesEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable actionable buttons in messages (connector cards) from connected apps on Outlook on the web.
ConnectorsActionableMessagesEnabled.title: ConnectorsActionableMessagesEnabled

ConnectorsEnabled.description: The ConnectorsEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable all connected apps in organization.
ConnectorsEnabled.title: ConnectorsEnabled

ConnectorsEnabledForOutlook.description: The ConnectorsEnabledForOutlook parameter specifies whether to enable or disable connected apps in Outlook on the web.
ConnectorsEnabledForOutlook.title: ConnectorsEnabledForOutlook

ConnectorsEnabledForSharepoint.description: The ConnectorsEnabledForSharepoint parameter specifies whether to enable or disable connected apps on Sharepoint.
ConnectorsEnabledForSharepoint.title: ConnectorsEnabledForSharepoint

ConnectorsEnabledForTeams.description: The ConnectorsEnabledForTeams parameter specifies whether to enable or disable connected apps on Teams.
ConnectorsEnabledForTeams.title: ConnectorsEnabledForTeams

ConnectorsEnabledForYammer.description: The ConnectorsEnabledForYammer parameter specifies whether to enable or disable connected apps on Yammer.
ConnectorsEnabledForYammer.title: ConnectorsEnabledForYammer

DefaultAuthenticationPolicy.description: The DefaultAuthenticationPolicy parameter specifies the authentication policy that's used for the whole organization. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the policy.
DefaultAuthenticationPolicy.title: DefaultAuthenticationPolicy

DefaultGroupAccessType.description: The DefaultGroupAccessType parameter specifies the default access type for Office 365 groups.
DefaultGroupAccessType.title: DefaultGroupAccessType

DefaultMinutesToReduceLongEventsBy.description: The DefaultMinutesToReduceLongEventsBy parameter specifies the number of minutes to reduce calendar events by if the events are 60 minutes or longer.
DefaultMinutesToReduceLongEventsBy.title: DefaultMinutesToReduceLongEventsBy

DefaultMinutesToReduceShortEventsBy.description: The DefaultMinutesToReduceShortEventsBy parameter specifies the number of minutes to reduce calendar events by if the events are less than 60 minutes long.
DefaultMinutesToReduceShortEventsBy.title: DefaultMinutesToReduceShortEventsBy

DefaultPublicFolderAgeLimit.description: The DefaultPublicFolderAgeLimit parameter specifies the default age limit for the contents of public folders across the entire organization. Content in a public folder is automatically deleted when this age limit is exceeded. This attribute applies to all public folders in the organization that don't have their own AgeLimit setting. To specify a value, enter it as a time span: dd.hh:mm:ss where d = days, h = hours, m = minutes, and s = seconds. Or, enter the value $null. The default value is blank ($null).
DefaultPublicFolderAgeLimit.title: DefaultPublicFolderAgeLimit

DefaultPublicFolderDeletedItemRetention.description: The DefaultPublicFolderDeletedItemRetention parameter specifies the default value of the length of time to retain deleted items for public folders across the entire organization. This attribute applies to all public folders in the organization that don't have their own RetainDeletedItemsFor attribute set.
DefaultPublicFolderDeletedItemRetention.title: DefaultPublicFolderDeletedItemRetention

DefaultPublicFolderIssueWarningQuota.description: The DefaultPublicFolderIssueWarningQuota parameter specifies the default value across the entire organization for the public folder size at which a warning message is sent to this folder's owners, warning that the public folder is almost full. This attribute applies to all public folders within the organization that don't have their own warning quota attribute set. The default value of this attribute is unlimited. The valid input range for this parameter is from 0 through 2199023254529 bytes(2 TB). If you enter a value of unlimited, no size limit is imposed on the public folder.
DefaultPublicFolderIssueWarningQuota.title: DefaultPublicFolderIssueWarningQuota

DefaultPublicFolderMaxItemSize.description: The DefaultPublicFolderMaxItemSize parameter specifies the default maximum size for posted items within public folders across the entire organization. Items larger than the value of the DefaultPublicFolderMaxItemSize parameter are rejected. This attribute applies to all public folders within the organization that don't have their own MaxItemSize attribute set. The default value of this attribute is unlimited.
DefaultPublicFolderMaxItemSize.title: DefaultPublicFolderMaxItemSize

DefaultPublicFolderMovedItemRetention.description: The DefaultPublicFolderMovedItemRetention parameter specifies how long items that have been moved between mailboxes are kept in the source mailbox for recovery purposes before being removed by the Public Folder Assistant.
DefaultPublicFolderMovedItemRetention.title: DefaultPublicFolderMovedItemRetention

DefaultPublicFolderProhibitPostQuota.description: The DefaultPublicFolderProhibitPostQuota parameter specifies the size of a public folder at which users are notified that the public folder is full. Users can't post to a folder whose size is larger than the DefaultPublicFolderProhibitPostQuota parameter value. The default value of this attribute is unlimited.
DefaultPublicFolderProhibitPostQuota.title: DefaultPublicFolderProhibitPostQuota

DirectReportsGroupAutoCreationEnabled.description: The DirectReportsGroupAutoCreationEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable the automatic creation of direct report Office 365 groups.
DirectReportsGroupAutoCreationEnabled.title: DirectReportsGroupAutoCreationEnabled

DisablePlusAddressInRecipients.description: The DisablePlusAddressInRecipients parameter specifies whether to enable or disable plus addressing (also known as subaddressing) for Exchange Online mailboxes.
DisablePlusAddressInRecipients.title: DisablePlusAddressInRecipients

DistributionGroupDefaultOU.description: The DistributionGroupDefaultOU parameter specifies the container where distribution groups are created by default.
DistributionGroupDefaultOU.title: DistributionGroupDefaultOU

DistributionGroupNameBlockedWordsList.description: The DistributionGroupNameBlockedWordsList parameter specifies words that can't be included in the names of distribution groups. Separate multiple values with commas.
DistributionGroupNameBlockedWordsList.title: DistributionGroupNameBlockedWordsList

DistributionGroupNamingPolicy.description: The DistributionGroupNamingPolicy parameter specifies the template applied to the name of distribution groups that are created in the organization. You can enforce that a prefix or suffix be applied to all distribution groups. Prefixes and suffixes can be either a string or an attribute, and you can combine strings and attributes.
DistributionGroupNamingPolicy.title: DistributionGroupNamingPolicy

ElcProcessingDisabled.description: The ElcProcessingDisabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable the processing of mailboxes by the Managed Folder Assistant.
ElcProcessingDisabled.title: ElcProcessingDisabled

EnableOutlookEvents.description: The EnableOutlookEvents parameter specifies whether Outlook or Outlook on the web automatically discovers events from email messages and adds them to user calendars.
EnableOutlookEvents.title: EnableOutlookEvents

EndUserDLUpgradeFlowsDisabled.description: The EndUserDLUpgradeFlowsDisabled parameter specifies whether to prevent users from upgrading their own distribution groups to Office 365 groups in an Exchange Online organization.
EndUserDLUpgradeFlowsDisabled.title: EndUserDLUpgradeFlowsDisabled

EwsAllowEntourage.description: The EwsAllowEntourage parameter specifies whether to enable or disable Entourage 2008 to access Exchange Web Services (EWS) for the entire organization.
EwsAllowEntourage.title: EwsAllowEntourage

EwsAllowList.description: The EwsAllowList parameter specifies the applications that are allowed to access EWS or REST when the EwsApplicationAccessPolicy parameter is set to EwsAllowList. Other applications that aren't specified by this parameter aren't allowed to access EWS or REST. You identify the application by its user agent string value. Wildcard characters (*) are supported.
EwsAllowList.title: EwsAllowList

EwsAllowMacOutlook.description: The EwsAllowMacOutlook parameter enables or disables access to mailboxes by Outlook for Mac clients that use Exchange Web Services (for example, Outlook for Mac 2011 or later).
EwsAllowMacOutlook.title: EwsAllowMacOutlook

EwsAllowOutlook.description: The EwsAllowOutlook parameter enables or disables access to mailboxes by Outlook clients that use Exchange Web Services. Outlook uses Exchange Web Services for free/busy, out-of-office settings, and calendar sharing.
EwsAllowOutlook.title: EwsAllowOutlook

EwsApplicationAccessPolicy.description: The EwsApplicationAccessPolicy parameter specifies the client applications that have access to EWS and REST.
EwsApplicationAccessPolicy.title: EwsApplicationAccessPolicy

EwsBlockList.description: The EwsBlockList parameter specifies the applications that aren't allowed to access EWS or REST when the EwsApplicationAccessPolicy parameter is set to EnforceBlockList. All other applications that aren't specified by this parameter are allowed to access EWS or REST. You identify the application by its user agent string value. Wildcard characters (*) are supported.
EwsBlockList.title: EwsBlockList

EwsEnabled.description: The EwsEnabled parameter specifies whether to globally enable or disable EWS access for the entire organization, regardless of what application is making the request.
EwsEnabled.title: EwsEnabled

ExchangeNotificationEnabled.description: The ExchangeNotificationEnabled parameter enables or disables Exchange notifications sent to administrators regarding their organizations. Valid input for this parameter is $true or $false.
ExchangeNotificationEnabled.title: ExchangeNotificationEnabled

ExchangeNotificationRecipients.description: The ExchangeNotificationRecipients parameter specifies the recipients for Exchange notifications sent to administrators regarding their organizations. If the ExchangeNotificationEnabled parameter is set to $false, no notification messages are sent. Be sure to enclose values that contain spaces in quotation marks and separate multiple values with commas. If this parameter isn't set, Exchange notifications are sent to all administrators.
ExchangeNotificationRecipients.title: ExchangeNotificationRecipients

FindTimeAttendeeAuthenticationEnabled.description: The FindTimeAttendeeAuthenticationEnabled parameter controls whether attendees are required to verify their identity in meeting polls using the FindTime Outlook add-in.
FindTimeAttendeeAuthenticationEnabled.title: FindTimeAttendeeAuthenticationEnabled

FindTimeAutoScheduleDisabled.description: The FindTimeAutoScheduleDisabled parameter controls automatically scheduling the meeting once a consensus is reached in meeting polls using the FindTime Outlook add-in.
FindTimeAutoScheduleDisabled.title: FindTimeAutoScheduleDisabled

FindTimeLockPollForAttendeesEnabled.description: The FindTimeLockPollForAttendeesEnabled controls whether the Lock poll for attendees setting is managed by the organization.
FindTimeLockPollForAttendeesEnabled.title: FindTimeLockPollForAttendeesEnabled

FindTimeOnlineMeetingOptionDisabled.description: The FindTimeOnlineMeetingOptionDisabled parameter controls the availability of the Online meeting checkbox for Teams in meeting polls using the FindTime Outlook add-in.
FindTimeOnlineMeetingOptionDisabled.title: FindTimeOnlineMeetingOptionDisabled

FocusedInboxOn.description: The FocusedInboxOn parameter enables or disables Focused Inbox for the organization.
FocusedInboxOn.title: FocusedInboxOn

HierarchicalAddressBookRoot.description: The HierarchicalAddressBookRoot parameter specifies the user, contact, or group to be used as the root organization for a hierarchical address book in the Exchange organization. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
HierarchicalAddressBookRoot.title: HierarchicalAddressBookRoot

IPListBlocked.description: The IPListBlocked parameter specifies the blocked IP addresses that aren't allowed to connect to Exchange Online organization. These settings affect client connections that use Basic authentication where on-premises Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) servers federate authentication with Azure Active Directory. Note that the new settings might take up to 4 hours to fully propagate across the service.
IPListBlocked.title: IPListBlocked

LeanPopoutEnabled.description: The LeanPopoutEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable faster loading of pop-out messages in Outlook on the web for Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge.
LeanPopoutEnabled.title: LeanPopoutEnabled

LinkPreviewEnabled.description: The LinkPreviewEnabled parameter specifies whether link preview of URLs in email messages is allowed for the organization.
LinkPreviewEnabled.title: LinkPreviewEnabled

MailTipsAllTipsEnabled.description: The MailTipsAllTipsEnabled parameter specifies whether MailTips are enabled. The default value is $true.
MailTipsAllTipsEnabled.title: MailTipsAllTipsEnabled

MailTipsExternalRecipientsTipsEnabled.description: The MailTipsExternalRecipientsTipsEnabled parameter specifies whether MailTips for external recipients are enabled. The default value is $false.
MailTipsExternalRecipientsTipsEnabled.title: MailTipsExternalRecipientsTipsEnabled

MailTipsGroupMetricsEnabled.description: The MailTipsGroupMetricsEnabled parameter specifies whether MailTips that rely on group metrics data are enabled. The default value is $true.
MailTipsGroupMetricsEnabled.title: MailTipsGroupMetricsEnabled

MailTipsLargeAudienceThreshold.description: The MailTipsLargeAudienceThreshold parameter specifies what a large audience is. The default value is 25.
MailTipsLargeAudienceThreshold.title: MailTipsLargeAudienceThreshold

MailTipsMailboxSourcedTipsEnabled.description: The MailTipsMailboxSourcedTipsEnabled parameter specifies whether MailTips that rely on mailbox data (out-of-office or full mailbox) are enabled.
MailTipsMailboxSourcedTipsEnabled.title: MailTipsMailboxSourcedTipsEnabled

MessageRecallEnabled.description: The MessageRecallEnabled parameter enables or disables the message recall feature in the organization.
MessageRecallEnabled.title: MessageRecallEnabled

MessageRemindersEnabled.description: The MessageRemindersEnabled parameter enables or disables the message reminders feature in the organization.
MessageRemindersEnabled.title: MessageRemindersEnabled

MobileAppEducationEnabled.description: The MobileAppEducationEnabled specifies whether to show or hide the Outlook for iOS and Android education reminder in Outlook on the web.
MobileAppEducationEnabled.title: MobileAppEducationEnabled

OAuth2ClientProfileEnabled.description: The OAuth2ClientProfileEnabled parameter enables or disables modern authentication in the Exchange organization.
OAuth2ClientProfileEnabled.title: OAuth2ClientProfileEnabled

OnlineMeetingsByDefaultEnabled.description: The OnlineMeetingsByDefaultEnabled parameter specifies whether to set all meetings as Teams by default during meeting creation.
OnlineMeetingsByDefaultEnabled.title: OnlineMeetingsByDefaultEnabled

OutlookGifPickerDisabled.description: The OutlookGifPickerDisabled parameter disables the GIF Search (powered by Bing) feature that's built into the Compose page in Outlook on the web.
OutlookGifPickerDisabled.title: OutlookGifPickerDisabled

OutlookMobileGCCRestrictionsEnabled.description: The OutlookMobileGCCRestrictionsEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable features within Outlook for iOS and Android that are not FedRAMP compliant for Office 365 US Government Community Cloud (GCC) customers.
OutlookMobileGCCRestrictionsEnabled.title: OutlookMobileGCCRestrictionsEnabled

OutlookPayEnabled.description: The OutlookPayEnabled parameter enables or disables Payments in Outlook in the Office 365 organization.
OutlookPayEnabled.title: OutlookPayEnabled

PublicComputersDetectionEnabled.description: The PublicComputersDetectionEnabled parameter specifies whether Outlook on the web will detect when a user signs from a public or private computer or network, and then enforces the attachment handling settings from public networks. The default is $false. However, if you set this parameter to $true, Outlook on the web will determine if the user is signing in from a public computer, and all public attachment handling rules will be applied and enforced.
PublicComputersDetectionEnabled.title: PublicComputersDetectionEnabled

PublicFoldersEnabled.description: The PublicFoldersEnabled parameter specifies how public folders are deployed in your organization.
PublicFoldersEnabled.title: PublicFoldersEnabled

PublicFolderShowClientControl.description: The PublicFolderShowClientControl parameter enables or disables access to public folders in Microsoft Outlook.
PublicFolderShowClientControl.title: PublicFolderShowClientControl

ReadTrackingEnabled.description: The ReadTrackingEnabled parameter specifies whether the tracking for read status for messages in an organization is enabled. The default value is $false.
ReadTrackingEnabled.title: ReadTrackingEnabled

RemotePublicFolderMailboxes.description: The RemotePublicFolderMailboxes parameter specifies the identities of the public folder objects (represented as mail user objects locally) corresponding to the public folder mailboxes created in the remote forest. The public folder values set here are used only if the public folder deployment is a remote deployment.
RemotePublicFolderMailboxes.title: RemotePublicFolderMailboxes

SendFromAliasEnabled.description: The SendFromAliasEnabled parameter allows mailbox users to send messages using aliases (proxy addresses). It does this by disabling the rewriting of aliases to their primary SMTP address. This change is implemented in the Exchange Online service
SendFromAliasEnabled.title: SendFromAliasEnabled

ShortenEventScopeDefault.description: The ShortenEventScopeDefault parameter specifies whether calendar events start late or end early in the organization.
ShortenEventScopeDefault.title: ShortenEventScopeDefault

SiteMailboxCreationURL.description: The SiteMailboxCreationURL parameter specifies the URL that's used to create site mailboxes. Site mailboxes improve collaboration and user productivity by allowing access to both SharePoint documents and Exchange email in Outlook 2013 or later.
SiteMailboxCreationURL.title: SiteMailboxCreationURL

SmtpActionableMessagesEnabled.description: The SmtpActionableMessagesEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable action buttons in email messages in Outlook on the web.
SmtpActionableMessagesEnabled.title: SmtpActionableMessagesEnabled

VisibleMeetingUpdateProperties.description: The VisibleMeetingUpdateProperties parameter specifies whether meeting message updates will be auto-processed on behalf of attendees. Auto-processed updates are applied to the attendee's calendar item, and then the meeting message is moved to the deleted items. The attendee never sees the update in their inbox, but their calendar is updated.
VisibleMeetingUpdateProperties.title: VisibleMeetingUpdateProperties

WebPushNotificationsDisabled.description: The WebPushNotificationsDisabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable Web Push Notifications in Outlook on the Web. This feature provides web push notifications which appear on a user's desktop while the user is not using Outlook on the Web. This brings awareness of incoming messages while they are working elsewhere on their computer.
WebPushNotificationsDisabled.title: WebPushNotificationsDisabled

WebSuggestedRepliesDisabled.description: The WebSuggestedRepliesDisabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable Suggested Replies in Outlook on the web. This feature provides suggested replies to emails so users can easily and quickly respond to messages.
WebSuggestedRepliesDisabled.title: WebSuggestedRepliesDisabled

WorkspaceTenantEnabled.description: The WorkspaceTenantEnabled parameter enables or disables workspace booking in the organization.
WorkspaceTenantEnabled.title: WorkspaceTenantEnabled

microsoft.exchange.organizationrelations.description: This resource configures the Organization Relationship in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.organizationrelations.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.organizationrelationship

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the organization relationship. The maximum length is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

ArchiveAccessEnabled.description: The ArchiveAccessEnabled parameter specifies whether the organization relationship has been configured to provide remote archive access.
ArchiveAccessEnabled.title: ArchiveAccessEnabled

DeliveryReportEnabled.description: The DeliveryReportEnabled parameter specifies whether Delivery Reports should be shared over the organization relationship.
DeliveryReportEnabled.title: DeliveryReportEnabled

DomainNames.description: The DomainNames parameter specifies the SMTP domains of the external organization. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
DomainNames.title: DomainNames

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter specifies whether to enable the organization relationship.
Enabled.title: Enabled

FreeBusyAccessEnabled.description: The FreeBusyAccessEnabled parameter specifies whether the organization relationship should be used to retrieve free/busy information from the external organization.
FreeBusyAccessEnabled.title: FreeBusyAccessEnabled

FreeBusyAccessLevel.description: The FreeBusyAccessLevel parameter specifies the maximum amount of detail returned to the requesting organization. Valid values are: None, AvailabilityOnly or LimitedDetails
FreeBusyAccessLevel.title: FreeBusyAccessLevel

FreeBusyAccessScope.description: The FreeBusyAccessScope parameter specifies a mail-enabled security group in the internal organization that contains users whose free/busy information is accessible by an external organization. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
FreeBusyAccessScope.title: FreeBusyAccessScope

MailboxMoveEnabled.description: The MailboxMoveEnabled parameter specifies whether the organization relationship enables moving mailboxes to or from the external organization.
MailboxMoveEnabled.title: MailboxMoveEnabled

MailboxMoveCapability.description: The MailboxMoveCapability parameter is used in cross-tenant mailbox migrations.
MailboxMoveCapability.title: MailboxMoveCapability

MailboxMovePublishedScopes.description: The MailboxMovePublishedScopes parameter is used in cross-tenant mailbox migrations to specify the mail-enabled security groups whose members are allowed to migrate.
MailboxMovePublishedScopes.title: MailboxMovePublishedScopes

MailTipsAccessEnabled.description: The MailTipsAccessEnabled parameter specifies whether MailTips for users in this organization are returned over this organization relationship.
MailTipsAccessEnabled.title: MailTipsAccessEnabled

MailTipsAccessLevel.description: The MailTipsAccessLevel parameter specifies the level of MailTips data externally shared over this organization relationship. This parameter can have the following values: All, Limited, None
MailTipsAccessLevel.title: MailTipsAccessLevel

MailTipsAccessScope.description: The MailTipsAccessScope parameter specifies a mail-enabled security group in the internal organization that contains users whose free/busy information is accessible by an external organization. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
MailTipsAccessScope.title: MailTipsAccessScope

OauthApplicationId.description: The OAuthApplicationId is used in cross-tenant mailbox migrations to specify the application ID of the mailbox migration app that you consented to.
OauthApplicationId.title: OauthApplicationId

OrganizationContact.description: The OrganizationContact parameter specifies the email address that can be used to contact the external organization (for example, administrator@fourthcoffee.com).
OrganizationContact.title: OrganizationContact

PhotosEnabled.description: The PhotosEnabled parameter specifies whether photos for users in the internal organization are returned over the organization relationship.
PhotosEnabled.title: PhotosEnabled

TargetApplicationUri.description: The TargetApplicationUri parameter specifies the target Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the external organization. The TargetApplicationUri parameter is specified by Exchange when requesting a delegated token to retrieve free and busy information, for example, mail.contoso.com.
TargetApplicationUri.title: TargetApplicationUri

TargetAutodiscoverEpr.description: The TargetAutodiscoverEpr parameter specifies the Autodiscover URL of Exchange Web Services for the external organization. Exchange uses Autodiscover to automatically detect the correct Exchangeserver endpoint to use for external requests.
TargetAutodiscoverEpr.title: TargetAutodiscoverEpr

TargetOwaURL.description: The TargetOwaURL parameter specifies the Outlook on the web (formerly Outlook Web App) URL of the external organization that's defined in the organization relationship. It is used for Outlook on the web redirection in a cross-premise Exchange scenario. Configuring this attribute enables users in the organization to use their current Outlook on the web URL to access Outlook on the web in the external organization.
TargetOwaURL.title: TargetOwaURL

TargetSharingEpr.description: The TargetSharingEpr parameter specifies the URL of the target Exchange Web Services for the external organization.
TargetSharingEpr.title: TargetSharingEpr

Ensure.description: Specify if the OrganizationRelationship should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.outboundconnector.description: Create a new Inbound connector in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.outboundconnector.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.outboundconnector

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the outbound connector that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Enabled.description: Specifies whether connector is enabled.
Enabled.title: Enabled

UseMXRecord.description: Specifies whether connector should use MXRecords for target resolution.
UseMXRecord.title: UseMXRecord

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

ConnectorSource.description: The ConnectorSource parameter specifies how the connector is created. DO NOT CHANGE THIS!
ConnectorSource.title: ConnectorSource

ConnectorType.description: The ConnectorType parameter specifies a category for the domains that are serviced by the connector.
ConnectorType.title: ConnectorType

RecipientDomains.description: The RecipientDomains parameter specifies the domain that the Outbound connector routes mail to. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
RecipientDomains.title: RecipientDomains

SmartHosts.description: The SmartHosts parameter specifies the smart hosts the Outbound connector uses to route mail. This parameter is required if you set the UseMxRecord parameter to $false and must be specified on the same command line.
SmartHosts.title: SmartHosts

TlsDomain.description: The TlsDomain parameter specifies the domain name that the Outbound connector uses to verify the FQDN of the target certificate when establishing a TLS secured connection. This parameter is only used if the TlsSettings parameter is set to DomainValidation. Valid input for the TlsDomain parameter is an SMTP domain. You can use a wildcard character to specify all subdomains of a specified domain, as shown in the following example: *.contoso.com. However, you can't embed a wildcard character, as shown in the following example: domain.*.contoso.com
TlsDomain.title: TlsDomain

TlsSettings.description: The TlsSettings parameter specifies the TLS authentication level that's used for outbound TLS connections established by this Outbound connector.
TlsSettings.title: TlsSettings

IsTransportRuleScoped.description: The IsTransportRuleScoped parameter specifies whether the Outbound connector is associated with a transport rule (also known as a mail flow rule).
IsTransportRuleScoped.title: IsTransportRuleScoped

RouteAllMessagesViaOnPremises.description: The RouteAllMessagesViaOnPremises parameter specifies that all messages serviced by this connector are first routed through the on-premises messaging system (Centralized mailrouting).
RouteAllMessagesViaOnPremises.title: RouteAllMessagesViaOnPremises

CloudServicesMailEnabled.description: The CloudServicesMailEnabled parameter specifies whether the connector is used for hybrid mail flow between an on-premises Exchange environment and Microsoft Office 365. Specifically, this parameter controls how certain internal X-MS-Exchange-Organization-* message headers are handled in messages that are sent between accepted domains in the on-premises and cloud organizations. These headers are collectively known as cross-premises headers. DO NOT USE MANUALLY!
CloudServicesMailEnabled.title: CloudServicesMailEnabled

AllAcceptedDomains.description: The AllAcceptedDomains parameter specifies whether the Outbound connector is used in hybrid organizations where message recipients are in accepted domains of the cloud-based organization.
AllAcceptedDomains.title: AllAcceptedDomains

SenderRewritingEnabled.description: The SenderRewritingEnabled parameter specifies that all messages that normally qualify for SRS rewriting are rewritten for routing through the on-premises email system.
SenderRewritingEnabled.title: SenderRewritingEnabled

TestMode.description: The TestMode parameter specifies whether you want to enabled or disable test mode for the Outbound connector.
TestMode.title: TestMode

ValidationRecipients.description: The ValidationRecipients parameter specifies the email addresses of the validation recipients for the Outbound connector. You can specify multiple email addresses separated by commas.
ValidationRecipients.title: ValidationRecipients

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Outbound connector should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.owamailboxpolicy.description: This resource configures OWA Mailbox Policies in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.owamailboxpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.owamailboxpolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name for the policy. The maximum length is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

AccountTransferEnabled.description: The AccountTransferEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable QR code sign-in. By default, QR code sign-in is enabled.
AccountTransferEnabled.title: AccountTransferEnabled

ActionForUnknownFileAndMIMETypes.description: The ActionForUnknownFileAndMIMETypes parameter specifies how to handle file types that aren't specified in the Allow, Block, and Force Save lists for file types and MIME types
ActionForUnknownFileAndMIMETypes.title: ActionForUnknownFileAndMIMETypes

ActiveSyncIntegrationEnabled.description: The ActiveSyncIntegrationEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable Exchange ActiveSync settings in Outlook on the web.
ActiveSyncIntegrationEnabled.title: ActiveSyncIntegrationEnabled

AdditionalStorageProvidersAvailable.description: The AdditionalStorageProvidersAvailable parameter specifies whether to allow additional storage providers (for example, Box, Dropbox, Facebook, Google Drive, Egnyte, personal OneDrive) attachments in Outlook on the web.
AdditionalStorageProvidersAvailable.title: AdditionalStorageProvidersAvailable

AllAddressListsEnabled.description: The AllAddressListsEnabled parameter specifies which address lists are available in Outlook on the web.
AllAddressListsEnabled.title: AllAddressListsEnabled

AllowCopyContactsToDeviceAddressBook.description: The AllowCopyContactsToDeviceAddressBook parameter specifies whether users can copy the contents of their Contacts folder to a mobile device's native address book when using Outlook on the web for devices.
AllowCopyContactsToDeviceAddressBook.title: AllowCopyContactsToDeviceAddressBook

AllowedFileTypes.description: The AllowedFileTypes parameter specifies the attachment file types (file extensions) that can be saved locally or viewed from Outlook on the web.
AllowedFileTypes.title: AllowedFileTypes

AllowedMimeTypes.description: The AllowedMimeTypes parameter specifies the MIME extensions of attachments that allow the attachments to be saved locally or viewed from Outlook on the web.
AllowedMimeTypes.title: AllowedMimeTypes

BlockedFileTypes.description: The BlockedFileTypes parameter specifies a list of attachment file types (file extensions) that can't be saved locally or viewed from Outlook on the web.
BlockedFileTypes.title: BlockedFileTypes

BlockedMimeTypes.description: The BlockedMimeTypes parameter specifies MIME extensions in attachments that prevent the attachments from being saved locally or viewed from Outlook on the web.
BlockedMimeTypes.title: BlockedMimeTypes

ClassicAttachmentsEnabled.description: The ClassicAttachmentsEnabled parameter specifies whether users can attach local files as regular email attachments in Outlook on the web.
ClassicAttachmentsEnabled.title: ClassicAttachmentsEnabled

ConditionalAccessPolicy.description: The ConditionalAccessPolicy parameter specifies the Outlook on the Web Policy for limited access. For this feature to work properly, you also need to configure a Conditional Access policy in the Azure Active Directory Portal.
ConditionalAccessPolicy.title: ConditionalAccessPolicy

DefaultTheme.description: The DefaultTheme parameter specifies the default theme that's used in Outlook on the web when the user hasn't selected a theme. The default value is blank ($null).
DefaultTheme.title: DefaultTheme

DirectFileAccessOnPrivateComputersEnable.description: The DirectFileAccessOnPrivateComputersEnabled parameter specifies the left-click options for attachments in Outlook on the web for private computer sessions.
DirectFileAccessOnPrivateComputersEnable.title: DirectFileAccessOnPrivateComputersEnabled

DirectFileAccessOnPublicComputersEnabled.description: The DirectFileAccessOnPrivateComputersEnabled parameter specifies the left-click options for attachments in Outlook on the web for public computer sessions.
DirectFileAccessOnPublicComputersEnabled.title: DirectFileAccessOnPublicComputersEnabled

DisableFacebook.description: The DisableFacebook switch specifies whether users can synchronize their Facebook contacts to their Contacts folder in Outlook on the web. By default, Facebook integration is enabled.
DisableFacebook.title: DisableFacebook

DisplayPhotosEnabled.description: The DisplayPhotosEnabled parameter specifies whether users see sender photos in Outlook on the web.
DisplayPhotosEnabled.title: DisplayPhotosEnabled

ExplicitLogonEnabled.description: The ExplicitLogonEnabled parameter specifies whether to allow a user to open someone else's mailbox in Outlook on the web (provided that user has permissions to the mailbox).
ExplicitLogonEnabled.title: ExplicitLogonEnabled

ExternalImageProxyEnabled.description: The ExternalImageProxyEnabled parameter specifies whether to load all external images through the Outlook external image proxy.
ExternalImageProxyEnabled.title: ExternalImageProxyEnabled

ExternalSPMySiteHostURL.description: The ExternalSPMySiteHostURL specifies the My Site Host URL for external users.
ExternalSPMySiteHostURL.title: ExternalSPMySiteHostURL

FeedbackEnabled.description: The FeedbackEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable inline feedback surveys in Outlook on the web.
FeedbackEnabled.title: FeedbackEnabled

ForceSaveAttachmentFilteringEnabled.description: The ForceSaveAttachmentFilteringEnabled parameter specifies whether files are filtered before they can be saved from Outlook on the web.
ForceSaveAttachmentFilteringEnabled.title: ForceSaveAttachmentFilteringEnabled

ForceSaveFileTypes.description: The ForceSaveFileTypes parameter specifies the attachment file types (file extensions) that can only be saved from Outlook on the web (not opened).
ForceSaveFileTypes.title: ForceSaveFileTypes

ForceSaveMimeTypes.description: The ForceSaveMimeTypes parameter specifies the MIME extensions in attachments that only allow the attachments to be saved locally (not opened).
ForceSaveMimeTypes.title: ForceSaveMimeTypes

ForceWacViewingFirstOnPrivateComputers.description: The ForceWacViewingFirstOnPrivateComputers parameter specifies whether private computers must first preview an Office file as a web page in Office Online Server (formerly known as Office Web Apps Server and Web Access Companion Server) before opening the file in the local application.
ForceWacViewingFirstOnPrivateComputers.title: ForceWacViewingFirstOnPrivateComputers

ForceWacViewingFirstOnPublicComputers.description: The ForceWacViewingFirstOnPublicComputers parameter specifies whether public computers must first preview an Office file as a web page in Office Online Server before opening the file in the local application.
ForceWacViewingFirstOnPublicComputers.title: ForceWacViewingFirstOnPublicComputers

FreCardsEnabled.description: The FreCardsEnabled parameter specifies whether the theme, signature, and phone cards are available in Outlook on the web.
FreCardsEnabled.title: FreCardsEnabled

GlobalAddressListEnabled.description: The GlobalAddressListEnabled parameter specifies whether the global address list is available in Outlook on the web.
GlobalAddressListEnabled.title: GlobalAddressListEnabled

GroupCreationEnabled.description: The GroupCreationEnabled parameter specifies whether Office 365 group creation is available in Outlook on the web.
GroupCreationEnabled.title: GroupCreationEnabled

InstantMessagingEnabled.description: The InstantMessagingEnabled parameter specifies whether instant messaging is available in Outlook on the web.
InstantMessagingEnabled.title: InstantMessagingEnabled

InstantMessagingType.description: The InstantMessagingType parameter specifies the type of instant messaging provider in Outlook on the web.
InstantMessagingType.title: InstantMessagingType

InterestingCalendarsEnabled.description: The InterestingCalendarsEnabled parameter specifies whether interesting calendars are available in Outlook on the web.
InterestingCalendarsEnabled.title: InterestingCalendarsEnabled

InternalSPMySiteHostURL.description: The InternalSPMySiteHostURL specifies the My Site Host URL for internal users.
InternalSPMySiteHostURL.title: InternalSPMySiteHostURL

IRMEnabled.description: The IRMEnabled parameter specifies whether Information Rights Management (IRM) features are available in Outlook on the web.
IRMEnabled.title: IRMEnabled

IsDefault.description: The IsDefault switch specifies whether the Outlook on the web policy is the default policy that's used to configure the Outlook on the web settings for new mailboxes.
IsDefault.title: IsDefault

JournalEnabled.description: The JournalEnabled parameter specifies whether the Journal folder is available in Outlook on the web.
JournalEnabled.title: JournalEnabled

LocalEventsEnabled.description: The LocalEventsEnabled parameter specifies whether local events calendars are available in Outlook on the web.
LocalEventsEnabled.title: LocalEventsEnabled

LogonAndErrorLanguage.description: The LogonAndErrorLanguage parameter specifies the language that used in Outlook on the web for forms-based authentication and for error messages when a user's current language setting can't be read. A valid value is a supported Microsoft Windows Language Code Identifier (LCID). For example, 1033 is US English.
LogonAndErrorLanguage.title: LogonAndErrorLanguage

NotesEnabled.description: The NotesEnabled parameter specifies whether the Notes folder is available in Outlook on the web.
NotesEnabled.title: NotesEnabled

NpsSurveysEnabled.description: The NpsSurveysEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable the Net Promoter Score (NPS) survey in Outlook on the web. The survey allows uses to rate Outlook on the web on a scale of 1 to 5, and to provide feedback and suggested improvements in free text.
NpsSurveysEnabled.title: NpsSurveysEnabled

OneWinNativeOutlookEnabled.description: The OneWinNativeOutlookEnabled parameter controls the availability of the new Outlook for Windows App.
OneWinNativeOutlookEnabled.title: OneWinNativeOutlookEnabled

OrganizationEnabled.description: When the OrganizationEnabled parameter is set to $false, the Automatic Reply option doesn't include external and internal options, the address book doesn't show the organization hierarchy, and the Resources tab in Calendar forms is disabled.
OrganizationEnabled.title: OrganizationEnabled

OnSendAddinsEnabled.description: The OnSendAddinsEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable on send add-ins in Outlook on the web (add-ins that support events when a user clicks Send).
OnSendAddinsEnabled.title: OnSendAddinsEnabled

OutboundCharset.description: The OutboundCharset parameter specifies the character set that's used for outgoing messages in Outlook on the web.
OutboundCharset.title: OutboundCharset

OutlookBetaToggleEnabled.description: The OutlookBetaToggleEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable the Outlook on the web Preview toggle. The Preview toggle allows users to try the new Outlook on the web experience.
OutlookBetaToggleEnabled.title: OutlookBetaToggleEnabled

OWALightEnabled.description: The OWALightEnabled parameter controls the availability of the light version of Outlook on the web.
OWALightEnabled.title: OWALightEnabled

PersonalAccountCalendarsEnabled.description: The PersonalAccountCalendarsEnabled parameter specifies whether to allow users to connect to their personal Outlook.com or Google Calendar in Outlook on the web.
PersonalAccountCalendarsEnabled.title: PersonalAccountCalendarsEnabled

PhoneticSupportEnabled.description: The PhoneticSupportEnabled parameter specifies phonetically spelled entries in the address book. This parameter is available for use in Japan.
PhoneticSupportEnabled.title: PhoneticSupportEnabled

PlacesEnabled.description: The PlacesEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable Places in Outlook on the web. Places lets users search, share, and map location details by using Bing.
PlacesEnabled.title: PlacesEnabled

PremiumClientEnabled.description: The PremiumClientEnabled parameter controls the availability of the full version of Outlook Web App.
PremiumClientEnabled.title: PremiumClientEnabled

PrintWithoutDownloadEnabled.description: The PrintWithoutDownloadEnabled specifies whether to allow printing of supported files without downloading the attachment in Outlook on the web.
PrintWithoutDownloadEnabled.title: PrintWithoutDownloadEnabled

ProjectMocaEnabled.description: The ProjectMocaEnabled parameter enables or disables access to Project Moca in Outlook on the web.
ProjectMocaEnabled.title: ProjectMocaEnabled

PublicFoldersEnabled.description: The PublicFoldersEnabled parameter specifies whether a user can browse or read items in public folders in Outlook Web App.
PublicFoldersEnabled.title: PublicFoldersEnabled

RecoverDeletedItemsEnabled.description: The RecoverDeletedItemsEnabled parameter specifies whether a user can use Outlook Web App to view, recover, or delete permanently items that have been deleted from the Deleted Items folder.
RecoverDeletedItemsEnabled.title: RecoverDeletedItemsEnabled

ReferenceAttachmentsEnabled.description: The ReferenceAttachmentsEnabled parameter specifies whether users can attach files from the cloud as linked attachments in Outlook on the web.
ReferenceAttachmentsEnabled.title: ReferenceAttachmentsEnabled

RemindersAndNotificationsEnabled.description: The RemindersAndNotificationsEnabled parameter specifies whether notifications and reminders are enabled in Outlook on the web.
RemindersAndNotificationsEnabled.title: RemindersAndNotificationsEnabled

ReportJunkEmailEnabled.description: The ReportJunkEmailEnabled parameter specifies whether users can report messages to Microsoft or unsubscribe from messages in Outlook on the web.
ReportJunkEmailEnabled.title: ReportJunkEmailEnabled

RulesEnabled.description: The RulesEnabled parameter specifies whether a user can view, create, or modify server-side rules in Outlook on the web.
RulesEnabled.title: RulesEnabled

SatisfactionEnabled.description: The SatisfactionEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable the satisfaction survey.
SatisfactionEnabled.title: SatisfactionEnabled

SaveAttachmentsToCloudEnabled.description: The SaveAttachmentsToCloudEnabled parameter specifies whether users can save regular email attachments to the cloud.
SaveAttachmentsToCloudEnabled.title: SaveAttachmentsToCloudEnabled

SearchFoldersEnabled.description: The SearchFoldersEnabled parameter specifies whether Search Folders are available in Outlook on the web.
SearchFoldersEnabled.title: SearchFoldersEnabled

SetPhotoEnabled.description: The SetPhotoEnabled parameter specifies whether users can add, change, and remove their sender photo in Outlook on the web.
SetPhotoEnabled.title: SetPhotoEnabled

SetPhotoURL.description: The SetPhotoURL parameter controls where users go to select their photo. Note that you can't specify a URL that contains one or more picture files, as there is no mechanism to copy a URL photo to the properties of the users' Exchange Online mailboxes.
SetPhotoURL.title: SetPhotoURL

SignaturesEnabled.description: The SignaturesEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable the use of signatures in Outlook on the web.
SignaturesEnabled.title: SignaturesEnabled

SkipCreateUnifiedGroupCustomSharepointCl.description: The SkipCreateUnifiedGroupCustomSharepointClassification parameter specifies whether to skip a custom SharePoint page during the creation of Office 365 Groups in Outlook web app.
SkipCreateUnifiedGroupCustomSharepointCl.title: SkipCreateUnifiedGroupCustomSharepointClassification

TeamSnapCalendarsEnabled.description: The TeamSnapCalendarsEnabled parameter specifies whether to allow users to connect to their personal TeamSnap calendars in Outlook on the web.
TeamSnapCalendarsEnabled.title: TeamSnapCalendarsEnabled

TextMessagingEnabled.description: The TextMessagingEnabled parameter specifies whether users can send and receive text messages in Outlook on the web.
TextMessagingEnabled.title: TextMessagingEnabled

ThemeSelectionEnabled.description: The ThemeSelectionEnabled parameter specifies whether users can change the theme in Outlook on the web.
ThemeSelectionEnabled.title: ThemeSelectionEnabled

UMIntegrationEnabled.description: The UMIntegrationEnabled parameter specifies whether Unified Messaging (UM) integration is enabled in Outlook on the web.
UMIntegrationEnabled.title: UMIntegrationEnabled

UseGB18030.description: The UseGB18030 parameter specifies whether to use the GB18030 character set instead of GB2312 in Outlook on the web.
UseGB18030.title: UseGB18030

UseISO885915.description: The UseISO885915 parameter specifies whether to use the character set ISO8859-15 instead of ISO8859-1 in Outlook on the web.
UseISO885915.title: UseISO885915

UserVoiceEnabled.description: The UserVoiceEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable Outlook UserVoice in Outlook on the web. Outlook UserVoice is a customer feedback area that's available in Office 365.
UserVoiceEnabled.title: UserVoiceEnabled

WacEditingEnabled.description: The WacEditingEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable editing documents in Outlook on the web by using Office Online Server (formerly known as Office Web Apps Server and Web Access Companion Server).
WacEditingEnabled.title: WacEditingEnabled

WacExternalServicesEnabled.description: The WacExternalServicesEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable external services when viewing documents in Outlook on the web (for example, machine translation) by using Office Online Server.
WacExternalServicesEnabled.title: WacExternalServicesEnabled

WacOMEXEnabled.description: The WacOMEXEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable apps for Outlook in Outlook on the web in Office Online Server.
WacOMEXEnabled.title: WacOMEXEnabled

WacViewingOnPrivateComputersEnabled.description: The WacViewingOnPrivateComputersEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable web viewing of supported Office documents private computer sessions in Office Online Server (formerly known as Office Web Apps Server and Web Access Companion Server). By default, all Outlook on the web sessions are considered to be on private computers.
WacViewingOnPrivateComputersEnabled.title: WacViewingOnPrivateComputersEnabled

WacViewingOnPublicComputersEnabled.description: The WacViewingOnPublicComputersEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable web viewing of supported Office documents in public computer sessions in Office Online Server.
WacViewingOnPublicComputersEnabled.title: WacViewingOnPublicComputersEnabled

WeatherEnabled.description: The WeatherEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable weather information in the calendar in Outlook on the web.
WeatherEnabled.title: WeatherEnabled

WebPartsFrameOptionsType.description: The WebPartsFrameOptionsType parameter specifies what sources can access web parts in IFRAME or FRAME elements in Outlook on the web.
WebPartsFrameOptionsType.title: WebPartsFrameOptionsType

Ensure.description: Specify if the OWA Mailbox Policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.partnerapplication.description: This resource configures Partner Applications in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.partnerapplication.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.partnerapplication

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies a new name for the partner application.
Name.title: Name

ApplicationIdentifier.description: The ApplicationIdentifier parameter specifies a unique application identifier for the partner application that uses an authorization server.
ApplicationIdentifier.title: ApplicationIdentifier

AcceptSecurityIdentifierInformation.description: The AcceptSecurityIdentifierInformation parameter specifies whether Exchange should accept security identifiers (SIDs) from another trusted Active Directory forest for the partner application.
AcceptSecurityIdentifierInformation.title: AcceptSecurityIdentifierInformation

AccountType.description: The AccountType parameter specifies the type of Microsoft account that's required for the partner application.
AccountType.title: AccountType

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter specifies whether the partner application is enabled.
Enabled.title: Enabled

LinkedAccount.description: The LinkedAccount parameter specifies a linked Active Directory user account for the application.
LinkedAccount.title: LinkedAccount

Ensure.description: Specify if the Partner Application should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.perimeterconfiguratio.description: Modify the perimeter Configuration policy in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.perimeterconfiguratio.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.perimeterconfiguration

GatewayIPAddresses.description: Use the GatewayIPAddresses parameter to create or modify a list of gateway server IP addresses to add to IP safelists.
GatewayIPAddresses.title: GatewayIPAddresses

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Outbound connector should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.place.description: This resource configures a place in Exchange Online (e.g., room).
microsoft.exchange.place.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.place

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the room mailbox that you want to modify. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the room.
Identity.title: Identity

DisplayName.description: The display name of the place.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

AudioDeviceName.description: The AudioDeviceName parameter specifies the name of the audio device in the room. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
AudioDeviceName.title: AudioDeviceName

Building.description: The Building parameter specifies the building name or building number that the room is in. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Building.title: Building

Capacity.description: The Capacity parameter specifies the capacity of the room. A valid value is an integer.
Capacity.title: Capacity

City.description: The City parameter specifies the room's city. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
City.title: City

CountryOrRegion.description: The CountryOrRegion parameter specifies the room's country or region. A valid value is a valid ISO 3166-1 two-letter country code (for example, AU for Australia) or the corresponding friendly name for the country (which might be different from the official ISO 3166 Maintenance Agency short name).
CountryOrRegion.title: CountryOrRegion

DisplayDeviceName.description: The DisplayDeviceName parameter specifies the name of the display device in the room. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
DisplayDeviceName.title: DisplayDeviceName

Floor.description: The Floor parameter specifies the floor number that the room is on.
Floor.title: Floor

FloorLabel.description: The FloorLabel parameter specifies a descriptive label for the floor that the room is on. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
FloorLabel.title: FloorLabel

GeoCoordinates.description: The GeoCoordinates parameter specifies the room's location in latitude, longitude and (optionally) altitude coordinates.
GeoCoordinates.title: GeoCoordinates

IsWheelChairAccessible.description: The IsWheelChairAccessible parameter specifies whether the room is wheelchair accessible.
IsWheelChairAccessible.title: IsWheelChairAccessible

Label.description: The Label parameter specifies a descriptive label for the room (for example, a number or name). If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Label.title: Label

MTREnabled.description: The MTREnabled parameter identifies the room as configured with a Microsoft Teams room system. You can add Teams room systems as audio sources in Teams meetings that involve the room.
MTREnabled.title: MTREnabled

ParentId.description: The ParentId parameter specifies the ID of a Place in the parent location hierarchy in Microsoft Places.
ParentId.title: ParentId

ParentType.description: The ParentType parameter specifies the parent type of the ParentId in Microsoft Places. Valid values are: Floor, Section
ParentType.title: ParentType

Phone.description: The Phone parameter specifies the room's telephone number.
Phone.title: Phone

PostalCode.description: The PostalCode parameter specifies the room's postal code.
PostalCode.title: PostalCode

State.description: The State parameter specifies the room's state or province.
State.title: State

Street.description: The Street parameter specifies the room's physical address.
Street.title: Street

Tags.description: The Tags parameter specifies additional features of the room (for example, details like the type of view or furniture type).
Tags.title: Tags

VideoDeviceName.description: The VideoDeviceName parameter specifies the name of the video device in the room. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
VideoDeviceName.title: VideoDeviceName

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Outbound connector should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.policytipconfig.description: This resource configures Policy Tips in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.policytipconfig.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.policytipconfig

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the custom Policy Tip you want to modify.
Name.title: Name

Value.description: The Value parameter specifies the text that's displayed by the Policy Tip.
Value.title: Value
