Ensure.description: Specify if the Policy Tip Config should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.quarantinepolicy.description: Create or modify a EXOQuarantinePolicy in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.quarantinepolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.quarantinepolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the QuarantinePolicy you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

EndUserQuarantinePermissionsValue.description: The EndUserQuarantinePermissionsValue parameter specifies the end-user permissions for the quarantine policy.
EndUserQuarantinePermissionsValue.title: EndUserQuarantinePermissionsValue

ESNEnabled.description: The ESNEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable quarantine notifications (formerly known as end-user spam notifications) for the policy.
ESNEnabled.title: ESNEnabled

MultiLanguageCustomDisclaimer.description: The MultiLanguageCustomDisclaimer parameter specifies the custom disclaimer text to use near the bottom of quarantine notifications.
MultiLanguageCustomDisclaimer.title: MultiLanguageCustomDisclaimer

MultiLanguageSenderName.description: The MultiLanguageSenderName parameter specifies the email sender's display name to use in quarantine notifications.
MultiLanguageSenderName.title: MultiLanguageSenderName

MultiLanguageSetting.description: The MultiLanguageSetting parameter specifies the language of quarantine notifications.
MultiLanguageSetting.title: MultiLanguageSetting

OrganizationBrandingEnabled.description: The OrganizationBrandingEnabled parameter enables or disables organization branding in the end-user quarantine notification messages.
OrganizationBrandingEnabled.title: OrganizationBrandingEnabled

Ensure.description: Specifies if this QuarantinePolicy should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

EndUserSpamNotificationFrequency.description: The EndUserSpamNotificationFrequency parameter species how often quarantine notifications are sent to users. Valid values are: 04:00:00 (4 hours),1.00:00:00 (1 day),7.00:00:00 (7 days)
EndUserSpamNotificationFrequency.title: EndUserSpamNotificationFrequency

QuarantinePolicyType.description: The QuarantinePolicyType parameter filters the results by the specified quarantine policy type. Valid values are: QuarantinePolicy, GlobalQuarantinePolicy
QuarantinePolicyType.title: QuarantinePolicyType

EndUserSpamNotificationFrequencyInDays.description: This parameter is reserved for internal Microsoft use.
EndUserSpamNotificationFrequencyInDays.title: EndUserSpamNotificationFrequencyInDays

CustomDisclaimer.description: This parameter is reserved for internal Microsoft use.
CustomDisclaimer.title: CustomDisclaimer

EndUserSpamNotificationCustomFromAddress.description: The EndUserSpamNotificationCustomFromAddress specifies the email address of an existing internal sender to use as the sender for quarantine notifications. To set this parameter back to the default email address quarantine@messaging.microsoft.com, use the value $null.
EndUserSpamNotificationCustomFromAddress.title: EndUserSpamNotificationCustomFromAddress

EsnCustomSubject.description: The EsnCustomSubject parameter specifies the text to use in the Subject field of quarantine notifications.This setting is available only in the built-in quarantine policy named DefaultGlobalTag that controls global quarantine policy settings.
EsnCustomSubject.title: EsnCustomSubject

microsoft.exchange.recipientpermission.description: This resource allows users to retrieve Office 365 Recipient Permissions.
microsoft.exchange.recipientpermission.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.recipientpermission

Identity.description: The mailbox the permission should be given on.
Identity.title: Identity

Trustee.description: The account to give the permission to.
Trustee.title: Trustee

AccessRights.description: The access rights granted to the account. Only 'SendAs' is supported.
AccessRights.title: AccessRights

Ensure.description: Present ensures the group exists, absent ensures it is removed
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.remotedomain.description: This resource configures the Remote Email Domains in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.remotedomain.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.remotedomain

Identity.description: Specify the Identity for the RemoteDomain.
Identity.title: Identity

DomainName.description: The DomainName parameter specifies the SMTP domain that you want to establish as a remote domain. A valid value is an SMTP domain (for example, contoso.com). The maximum length is 256 characters.
DomainName.title: DomainName

Ensure.description: Specify if the RemoteDomain should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

AllowedOOFType.description: The AllowedOOFType parameter specifies the type of automatic replies or out-of-office (also known as OOF) notifications than can be sent to recipients in the remote domain. Valid values are: External, ExternalLegacy, InternalLegacy or None
AllowedOOFType.title: AllowedOOFType

AutoForwardEnabled.description: The AutoForwardEnabled parameter specifies whether to allow messages that are auto-forwarded by client email programs in your organization.
AutoForwardEnabled.title: AutoForwardEnabled

AutoReplyEnabled.description: The AutoReplyEnabled parameter specifies whether to allow messages that are automatic replies from client email programs in your organization (for example, automatic reply messages that are generated by rules in Outlook).
AutoReplyEnabled.title: AutoReplyEnabled

ByteEncoderTypeFor7BitCharsets.description: The ByteEncoderTypeFor7BitCharsets parameter specifies the 7-bit transfer encoding method for MIME format for messages sent to this remote domain.
ByteEncoderTypeFor7BitCharsets.title: ByteEncoderTypeFor7BitCharsets

CharacterSet.description: The CharacterSet parameter specifies a character set for MIME messages without defined character sets that are sent from your organization to recipients in the remote domain.
CharacterSet.title: CharacterSet

ContentType.description: The ContentType parameter specifies the outbound message content type and formatting.
ContentType.title: ContentType

DeliveryReportEnabled.description: The DeliveryReportEnabled parameter specifies whether to allow delivery reports from client software in your organization to recipients in the remote domain.
DeliveryReportEnabled.title: DeliveryReportEnabled

DisplaySenderName.description: The DisplaySenderName parameter specifies whether to show the sender's Display Name in the From email address for messages sent to recipients in the remote domain.
DisplaySenderName.title: DisplaySenderName

IsInternal.description: The IsInternal parameter specifies whether the recipients in the remote domain are considered to be internal recipients.
IsInternal.title: IsInternal

LineWrapSize.description: The LineWrapSize parameter specifies the line-wrap size for messages to recipients in the remote domain. Valid values are an integer from 0 through 132 or the value to unlimited. The default value is unlimited.
LineWrapSize.title: LineWrapSize

MeetingForwardNotificationEnabled.description: The MeetingForwardNotificationEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable meeting forward notifications for recipients in the remote domain.
MeetingForwardNotificationEnabled.title: MeetingForwardNotificationEnabled

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies a unique name for the remote domain object. The maximum length is 64 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Name.title: Name

NDREnabled.description: The NDREnabled parameter specifies whether to allow non-delivery reports (also known NDRs or bounce messages) from your organization to recipients in the remote domain.
NDREnabled.title: NDREnabled

NonMimeCharacterSet.description: The NonMimeCharacterSet parameter specifies a character set for plain text messages without defined character sets that are sent from your organization to recipients in the remote domain.
NonMimeCharacterSet.title: NonMimeCharacterSet

PreferredInternetCodePageForShiftJis.description: The PreferredInternetCodePageForShiftJis parameter specifies the specific code page to use for Shift JIS character encoding in messages that are sent to recipients in the remote domain.
PreferredInternetCodePageForShiftJis.title: PreferredInternetCodePageForShiftJis

RequiredCharsetCoverage.description: The RequiredCharsetCoverage parameter specifies a percentage threshold for characters in a message that must match to apply your organization's preferred character set before switching to automatic character set detection.
RequiredCharsetCoverage.title: RequiredCharsetCoverage

TargetDeliveryDomain.description: The TargetDeliveryDomain parameter specifies whether the remote domain is used in cross-forest deployments to generate target email addresses for new mail users that represent users in the other organization (for example, all mailboxes hosted on Exchange Online are represented as mail users in your on-premises organization).
TargetDeliveryDomain.title: TargetDeliveryDomain

TNEFEnabled.description: The TNEFEnabled parameter specifies whether Transport Neutral Encapsulation Format (TNEF) message encoding is used on messages sent to the remote domain.
TNEFEnabled.title: TNEFEnabled

TrustedMailInboundEnabled.description: The TrustedMailInboundEnabled parameter specifies whether messages from senders in the remote domain are treated as trusted messages.
TrustedMailInboundEnabled.title: TrustedMailInboundEnabled

TrustedMailOutboundEnabled.description: The TrustedMailOutboundEnabled parameter specifies whether messages sent to recipients in the remote domain are treated as trusted messages.
TrustedMailOutboundEnabled.title: TrustedMailOutboundEnabled

UseSimpleDisplayName.description: The UseSimpleDisplayName parameter specifies whether the sender's simple display name is used for the From email address in messages sent to recipients in the remote domain.
UseSimpleDisplayName.title: UseSimpleDisplayName

microsoft.exchange.reportsubmissionpolic.description: Create or modify an EXOReportSubmissionPolicy in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.reportsubmissionpolic.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.reportsubmissionpolicy

IsSingleInstance.description: Specifies the resource is a single instance, the value must be 'Yes'.
IsSingleInstance.title: IsSingleInstance

DisableQuarantineReportingOption.description: The DisableQuarantineReportingOption parameter allows or prevents users from reporting messages in quarantine.
DisableQuarantineReportingOption.title: DisableQuarantineReportingOption

EnableCustomNotificationSender.description: The EnableCustomNotificationSender parameter specifies whether a custom sender email address is used for result messages after an admin reviews and marks the reported messages as junk, not junk, or phishing.
EnableCustomNotificationSender.title: EnableCustomNotificationSender

EnableOrganizationBranding.description: The EnableOrganizationBranding parameter specifies whether to show the company logo in the footer of result messages that users receive after an admin reviews and marks the reported messages as junk, not junk, or phishing.
EnableOrganizationBranding.title: EnableOrganizationBranding

EnableReportToMicrosoft.description: The EnableReportToMicrosoft parameter specifies whether Microsoft integrated reporting experience is enabled or disabled.
EnableReportToMicrosoft.title: EnableReportToMicrosoft

EnableThirdPartyAddress.description: The EnableThirdPartyAddress parameter specifies whether you're using third-party reporting tools in Outlook instead of Microsoft tools to send messages to the reporting mailbox in Exchange Online.
EnableThirdPartyAddress.title: EnableThirdPartyAddress

EnableUserEmailNotification.description: The EnableUserEmailNotification parameter species whether users receive result messages after an admin reviews and marks the reported messages as junk, not junk, or phishing.
EnableUserEmailNotification.title: EnableUserEmailNotification

JunkReviewResultMessage.description: The JunkReviewResultMessage parameter specifies the custom text to use in result messages after an admin reviews and marks the reported messages as junk.
JunkReviewResultMessage.title: JunkReviewResultMessage

NotJunkReviewResultMessage.description: The NotJunkReviewResultMessage parameter specifies the custom text to use in result messages after an admin reviews and marks the reported messages as not junk.
NotJunkReviewResultMessage.title: NotJunkReviewResultMessage

NotificationFooterMessage.description: The NotificationFooterMessage parameter specifies the custom footer text to use in email notifications after an admin reviews and marks the reported messages as junk, not junk, or phishing.
NotificationFooterMessage.title: NotificationFooterMessage

NotificationSenderAddress.description: The NotificationSenderAddress parameter specifies the sender email address to use in result messages after an admin reviews and marks the reported messages as junk, not junk, or phishing.
NotificationSenderAddress.title: NotificationSenderAddress

PhishingReviewResultMessage.description: The PhishingReviewResultMessage parameter specifies the custom text to use in result messages after an admin reviews and marks the reported messages as phishing.
PhishingReviewResultMessage.title: PhishingReviewResultMessage

PostSubmitMessage.description: The PostSubmitMessage parameter specifies the custom pop-up message text to use in Outlook notifications after users report messages.
PostSubmitMessage.title: PostSubmitMessage

PostSubmitMessageEnabled.description: The PostSubmitMessageEnabled parameter enables or disables the pop-up Outlook notifications that users see after they report messages using Microsoft reporting tools.
PostSubmitMessageEnabled.title: PostSubmitMessageEnabled

PostSubmitMessageTitle.description: The PostSubmitMessage parameter parameter specifies the custom pop-up message title to use in Outlook notifications after users report messages.
PostSubmitMessageTitle.title: PostSubmitMessageTitle

PreSubmitMessage.description: The PreSubmitMessage parameter specifies the custom pop-up message text to use in Outlook notifications before users report messages.
PreSubmitMessage.title: PreSubmitMessage

PreSubmitMessageEnabled.description: The PreSubmitMessageEnabled parameter enables or disables the pop-up Outlook notifications that users see before they report messages using Microsoft reporting tools.
PreSubmitMessageEnabled.title: PreSubmitMessageEnabled

PreSubmitMessageTitle.description: The PreSubmitMessage parameter parameter specifies the custom pop-up message title to use in Outlook notifications before users report messages.
PreSubmitMessageTitle.title: PreSubmitMessageTitle

ReportJunkAddresses.description: The ReportJunkAddresses parameter specifies the email address of the reporting mailbox in Exchange Online to receive user reported messages in reporting in Outlook using Microsoft or third-party reporting tools in Outlook.
ReportJunkAddresses.title: ReportJunkAddresses

ReportJunkToCustomizedAddress.description: The ReportJunkToCustomizedAddress parameter specifies whether to send user reported messages from Outlook (using Microsoft or third-party reporting tools) to the reporting mailbox as part of reporting in Outlook.
ReportJunkToCustomizedAddress.title: ReportJunkToCustomizedAddress

ReportNotJunkAddresses.description: The ReportNotJunkAddresses parameter specifies the email address of the reporting mailbox in Exchange Online to receive user reported messages in reporting in Outlook using Microsoft or third-party reporting tools in Outlook.
ReportNotJunkAddresses.title: ReportNotJunkAddresses

ReportNotJunkToCustomizedAddress.description: The ReportNotJunkToCustomizedAddress parameter specifies whether to send user reported messages from Outlook (using Microsoft or third-party reporting tools) to the reporting mailbox as part of reporting in Outlook.
ReportNotJunkToCustomizedAddress.title: ReportNotJunkToCustomizedAddress

ReportPhishAddresses.description: The ReportPhishAddresses parameter specifies the email address of the reporting mailbox in Exchange Online to receive user reported messages in reporting in Outlook using Microsoft or third-party reporting tools in Outlook.
ReportPhishAddresses.title: ReportPhishAddresses

ReportPhishToCustomizedAddress.description: The ReportPhishToCustomizedAddress parameter specifies whether to send user reported messages from Outlook (using Microsoft or third-party reporting tools) to the reporting mailbox as part of reporting in Outlook.
ReportPhishToCustomizedAddress.title: ReportPhishToCustomizedAddress

ThirdPartyReportAddresses.description: Use the ThirdPartyReportAddresses parameter to specify the email address of the reporting mailbox when you're using a third-party product for user submissions instead of reporting in Outlook.
ThirdPartyReportAddresses.title: ThirdPartyReportAddresses

Ensure.description: Specifies if this report submission policy should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.reportsubmissionrule.description: Create or modify an EXOReportSubmissionRule in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.reportsubmissionrule.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.reportsubmissionrule

IsSingleInstance.description: Specifies the resource is a single instance, the value must be 'Yes'.
IsSingleInstance.title: IsSingleInstance

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the report submission rule that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Comments.description: The Comments parameter specifies informative comments for the rule, such as what the rule is used for or how it has changed over time.
Comments.title: Comments

SentTo.description: The SentTo parameter specifies the email address of the reporting mailbox in Exchange Online where user reported messages are sent.
SentTo.title: SentTo

Ensure.description: Specifies if this report submission rule should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.resourceconfiguration.description: Modify the resource Configuration policy in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.resourceconfiguration.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.resourceconfiguration

ResourcePropertySchema.description: The ResourcePropertySchema parameter specifies the custom resource property that you want to make available to room or equipment mailboxes. This parameter uses the syntax Room/<Text> or Equipment/<Text> where the <Text> value doesn't contain spaces. For example, Room/Whiteboard or Equipment/Van.
ResourcePropertySchema.title: ResourcePropertySchema

Ensure.description: Specifies if this Outbound connector should exist.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.roleassignmentpolicy.description: This resource configures Role Assignment Policies in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.roleassignmentpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.roleassignmentpolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the new name of the assignment policy. The maximum length is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

Description.description: The Description parameter specifies the description that's displayed when the role assignment policy is viewed using the Get-RoleAssignmentPolicy cmdlet.
Description.title: Description

IsDefault.description: The IsDefault switch makes the assignment policy the default assignment policy.
IsDefault.title: IsDefault

Roles.description: The Roles parameter specifies the management roles to assign to the role assignment policy when it's created.
Roles.title: Roles

Ensure.description: Specify if the Role Assignment Policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.rolegroup.description: This resource configures Role Groups in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.rolegroup.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.rolegroup

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the name of the role. The maximum length of the name is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

Description.description: The Description parameter specifies the description that's displayed when the role group is viewed using the Get-RoleGroup cmdlet. Enclose the description in quotation marks
Description.title: Description

Members.description: The Members parameter specifies the mailboxes or mail-enabled USGs to add as a member of the role group. You can identify the user or group by the name, DN, or primary SMTP address value. You can specify multiple members separated by commas (Value1,Value2,...ValueN). If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks
Members.title: Members

Roles.description: The Roles parameter specifies the management roles to assign to the role group when it's created. If a role name contains spaces, enclose the name in quotation marks. If you want to assign more that one role, separate the role names with commas.
Roles.title: Roles

Ensure.description: Specify if the Role Group should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.safeattachmentpolicy.description:
This resource configures the settings of the Safe Attachments policies
in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.safeattachmentpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.safeattachmentpolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the name of the SafeAttachmentpolicy that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Action.description: The Action parameter specifies the action for the Safe Attachments policy.
Action.title: Action

ActionOnError.description: The ActionOnError parameter specifies the error handling option for Safe Attachments scanning (what to do if scanning times out or an error occurs). Valid values are: $true: The action specified by the Action parameter is applied to messages even when the attachments aren't successfully scanned. $false: The action specified by the Action parameter isn't applied to messages when the attachments aren't successfully scanned. This is the default value.
ActionOnError.title: ActionOnError

AdminDisplayName.description: The AdminDisplayName parameter specifies a description for the policy.
AdminDisplayName.title: AdminDisplayName

Enable.description: Specify if this policy should be enabled. Default is $true.
Enable.title: Enable

QuarantineTag.description: The QuarantineTag specifies the quarantine policy that's used on messages that are quarantined as malware by Safe Attachments.
QuarantineTag.title: QuarantineTag

Redirect.description: The Redirect parameter specifies whether to send detected malware attachments to another email address. Valid values are: $true: Malware attachments are sent to the email address specified by the RedirectAddress parameter. $false: Malware attachments aren't sent to another email address. This is the default value.
Redirect.title: Redirect

RedirectAddress.description: The RedirectAddress parameter specifies the email address where detected malware attachments are sent when the Redirect parameter is set to the value $true.
RedirectAddress.title: RedirectAddress

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.safeattachmentrule.description: This resource configures an Safe Attachment Rule in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.safeattachmentrule.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.safeattachmentrule

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the name of the SafeAttachment rule that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

SafeAttachmentPolicy.description: The SafeAttachmentPolicy parameter specifies the name of the SafeAttachment policy that's associated with the SafeAttachment rule.
SafeAttachmentPolicy.title: SafeAttachmentPolicy

Enabled.description: Specify if this rule should be enabled. Default is $true.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies a priority value for the rule that determines the order of rule processing. A lower integer value indicates a higher priority, the value 0 is the highest priority, and rules can't have the same priority value.
Priority.title: Priority

Comments.description: The Comments parameter specifies informative comments for the rule, such as what the rule is used for or how it has changed over time. The length of the comment can't exceed 1024 characters.
Comments.title: Comments

ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.title: ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs

ExceptIfSentTo.description: The ExceptIfSentTo parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
ExceptIfSentTo.title: ExceptIfSentTo

ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.description: The ExceptIfSentToMemberOf parameter specifies an exception that looks for messages sent to members of groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.title: ExceptIfSentToMemberOf

RecipientDomainIs.description: The RecipientDomainIs parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
RecipientDomainIs.title: RecipientDomainIs

SentTo.description: The SentTo parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
SentTo.title: SentTo

SentToMemberOf.description: The SentToMemberOf parameter looks for messages sent to members of groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
SentToMemberOf.title: SentToMemberOf

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.safelinkspolicy.description:
This resource configures the settings of the SafeLinks policies
in your cloud-based organization.
microsoft.exchange.safelinkspolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.safelinkspolicy

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the SafeLinks policy that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

AdminDisplayName.description: The AdminDisplayName parameter specifies a description for the policy.
AdminDisplayName.title: AdminDisplayName

AllowClickThrough.description: The AllowClickThrough parameter specifies whether to allow users to click through to the original URL on warning pages.
AllowClickThrough.title: AllowClickThrough

CustomNotificationText.description: The custom notification text specifies the customized notification text to show to users.
CustomNotificationText.title: CustomNotificationText

DeliverMessageAfterScan.description: The DeliverMessageAfterScan parameter specifies whether to deliver email messages only after Safe Links scanning is complete. Valid values are: $true: Wait until Safe Links scanning is complete before delivering the message. $false: If Safe Links scanning can't complete, deliver the message anyway. This is the default value.
DeliverMessageAfterScan.title: DeliverMessageAfterScan

DoNotRewriteUrls.description: The DoNotRewriteUrls parameter specifies a URL that's skipped by Safe Links scanning. You can specify multiple values separated by commas.
DoNotRewriteUrls.title: DoNotRewriteUrls

EnableForInternalSenders.description: The EnableForInternalSenders parameter specifies whether the Safe Links policy is applied to messages sent between internal senders and internal recipients within the same Exchange Online organization.
EnableForInternalSenders.title: EnableForInternalSenders

EnableOrganizationBranding.description: The EnableOrganizationBranding parameter specifies whether your organization's logo is displayed on Safe Links warning and notification pages.
EnableOrganizationBranding.title: EnableOrganizationBranding

EnableSafeLinksForOffice.description: The EnableSafeLinksForOffice parameter specifies whether to enable Safe Links protection for supported Office desktop, mobile, or web apps.
EnableSafeLinksForOffice.title: EnableSafeLinksForOffice

EnableSafeLinksForTeams.description: The EnableSafeLinksForTeams parameter specifies whether Safe Links is enabled for Microsoft Teams. Valid values are: $true: Safe Links is enabled for Teams. If a protected user clicks a malicious link in a Teams conversation, group chat, or from channels, a warning page will appear in the default web browser. $false: Safe Links isn't enabled for Teams. This is the default value.
EnableSafeLinksForTeams.title: EnableSafeLinksForTeams

EnableSafeLinksForEmail.description: The EnableSafeLinksForEmail parameter specifies whether to enable Safe Links protection for email messages. Valid values are: $true: Safe Links is enabled for email. When a user clicks a link in an email, the link is checked by Safe Links. If the link is found to be malicious, a warning page appears in the default web browser. $false: Safe Links isn't enabled for email. This is the default value.
EnableSafeLinksForEmail.title: EnableSafeLinksForEmail

DisableUrlRewrite.description: The DisableUrlRewrite parameter specifies whether to rewrite (wrap) URLs in email messages. Valid values are: $true: URLs in messages are not rewritten, but messages are still scanned by Safe Links prior to delivery. Time of click checks on links are done using the Safe Links API in supported Outlook clients (currently, Outlook for Windows and Outlook for Mac). Typically, we don't recommend using this value. $false: URLs in messages are rewritten. API checks still occur on unwrapped URLs in supported clients if the user is in a valid Safe Links policy. This is the default value.
DisableUrlRewrite.title: DisableUrlRewrite

ScanUrls.description: The ScanUrls parameter specifies whether to enable or disable the scanning of links in email messages. Valid values are: $true: Scanning links in email messages is enabled. $false: Scanning links in email messages is disabled. This is the default value.
ScanUrls.title: ScanUrls

TrackClicks.description: The TrackClicks parameter specifies whether to track user clicks related to Safe Links protection of links.
TrackClicks.title: TrackClicks

UseTranslatedNotificationText.description: The UseTranslatedNotificationText specifies whether to use Microsoft Translator to automatically localize the custom notification text that you specified with the CustomNotificationText parameter.
UseTranslatedNotificationText.title: UseTranslatedNotificationText

microsoft.exchange.safelinksrule.description: This resource configures an SafeLinks Rule in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.safelinksrule.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.safelinksrule

Identity.description: The Identity parameter specifies the name of the SafeLink rule that you want to modify.
Identity.title: Identity

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

SafeLinksPolicy.description: The SafeLinksPolicy parameter specifies the name of the SafeLink policy that's associated with the SafeLinksing rule.
SafeLinksPolicy.title: SafeLinksPolicy

Enabled.description: Specify if this rule should be enabled. Default is $true.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies a priority value for the rule that determines the order of rule processing. A lower integer value indicates a higher priority, the value 0 is the highest priority, and rules can't have the same priority value.
Priority.title: Priority

Comments.description: The Comments parameter specifies informative comments for the rule, such as what the rule is used for or how it has changed over time. The length of the comment can't exceed 1024 characters.
Comments.title: Comments

ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.title: ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs

ExceptIfSentTo.description: The ExceptIfSentTo parameter specifies an exception that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
ExceptIfSentTo.title: ExceptIfSentTo

ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.description: The ExceptIfSentToMemberOf parameter specifies an exception that looks for messages sent to members of groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.title: ExceptIfSentToMemberOf

RecipientDomainIs.description: The RecipientDomainIs parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
RecipientDomainIs.title: RecipientDomainIs

SentTo.description: The SentTo parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
SentTo.title: SentTo

SentToMemberOf.description: The SentToMemberOf parameter looks for messages sent to members of groups. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the group.
SentToMemberOf.title: SentToMemberOf

microsoft.exchange.sharedmailbox.description: This resource allows users to create Office 365 Shared Mailboxes.
microsoft.exchange.sharedmailbox.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.sharedmailbox

DisplayName.description: The display name of the Shared Mailbox
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

Identity.description: The unique identifier of the Shared Mailbox
Identity.title: Identity

PrimarySMTPAddress.description: The primary email address of the Shared Mailbox
PrimarySMTPAddress.title: PrimarySMTPAddress

Alias.description: The alias of the Shared Mailbox
Alias.title: Alias

EmailAddresses.description: The EmailAddresses parameter specifies all the email addresses (proxy addresses) for the Shared Mailbox
EmailAddresses.title: EmailAddresses

Ensure.description: Present ensures the group exists, absent ensures it is removed
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.sharingpolicy.description: This resource configures Sharing Policies in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.sharingpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.sharingpolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the sharing policy. The maximum length is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

Default.description: The Default switch specifies that the sharing policy is the default sharing policy for all mailboxes.
Default.title: Default

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter specifies whether to enable the sharing policy. Valid values for this parameter are $true or $false.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Domains.description: The Domains parameter specifies domains to which this policy applies and the sharing policy action.
Domains.title: Domains

Ensure.description: Specify if the Sharing Policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.sweeprule.description: Use this resource to create Sweep rules in mailboxes. Sweep rules run at regular intervals to help keep your Inbox clean.
microsoft.exchange.sweeprule.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.sweeprule

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the name of the Sweep rule. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Name.title: Name

Provider.description: The Provider parameter specifies the provider for the Sweep rule. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks. For Sweep rules that you create in Outlook on the web, the default value is Exchange16.
Provider.title: Provider

DestinationFolder.description: The DestinationFolder parameter specifies an action for the Sweep rule that moves messages to the specified folder.
DestinationFolder.title: DestinationFolder

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter specifies whether the Sweep rule is enabled or disabled.
Enabled.title: Enabled

KeepForDays.description: The KeepForDays parameter specifies an action for the Sweep rule that specifies the number of days to keep messages that match the conditions of the rule. After the number of days have passed, the messages are moved to the location that's specified by the DestinationFolder parameter (by default, the Deleted Items folder). You can't use this parameter with the KeepLatest parameter and the Sweep rule must contain a KeepForDays or KeepLatest parameter value.
KeepForDays.title: KeepForDays

KeepLatest.description: The KeepLatest parameter specifies an action for the Sweep rule that specifies the number of messages to keep that match the conditions of the rule. After the number of messages is exceeded, the oldest messages are moved to the location that's specified by the DestinationFolder parameter (by default, the Deleted Items folder). You can't use this parameter with the KeepForDays parameter and the Sweep rule must contain a KeepForDays or KeepLatest parameter value.
KeepLatest.title: KeepLatest

Mailbox.description: The Mailbox parameter specifies the mailbox where you want to create the Sweep rule. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the mailbox.
Mailbox.title: Mailbox

SenderName.description: The SenderName parameter specifies a condition for the Sweep rule that looks for the specified sender in messages. For internal senders, you can use any value that uniquely identifies the sender.
SenderName.title: SenderName

SourceFolder.description: The SourceFolder parameter specifies a condition for the Sweep rule that looks for messages in the specified folder.
SourceFolder.title: SourceFolder

SystemCategory.description: The SystemCategory parameter specifies a condition for the sweep rule that looks for messages with the specified system category. System categories are available to all mailboxes in the organization.
SystemCategory.title: SystemCategory

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.exchange.transportconfig.description:
This resource configures the Exchange Online transport
settings.
microsoft.exchange.transportconfig.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.transportconfig

IsSingleInstance.description: Specifies the resource is a single instance, the value must be 'Yes'.
IsSingleInstance.title: IsSingleInstance

AddressBookPolicyRoutingEnabled.description: The AddressBookPolicyRoutingEnabled parameter controls how recipients are resolved in an organization that uses address book policies to create separate virtual organizations within the same Exchange organization.
AddressBookPolicyRoutingEnabled.title: AddressBookPolicyRoutingEnabled

ClearCategories.description: The ClearCategories parameter keeps or removes Microsoft Outlook message categories during content conversion.
ClearCategories.title: ClearCategories

ConvertDisclaimerWrapperToEml.description: The ConvertDisclaimerWrapperToEml parameter specifies whether the original message will be added as a TNEF attachment or a regular EML attachment to a disclaimer.
ConvertDisclaimerWrapperToEml.title: ConvertDisclaimerWrapperToEml

DSNConversionMode.description: The DSNConversionMode parameter controls how Exchange handles delivery status notifications that are generated by earlier versions of Exchange or other messaging systems.
DSNConversionMode.title: DSNConversionMode

ExternalDelayDsnEnabled.description: The ExternalDelayDsnEnabled parameter specifies whether a delay delivery status notification (DSN) message should be created for external messages that couldn't be immediately delivered.
ExternalDelayDsnEnabled.title: ExternalDelayDsnEnabled

ExternalDsnDefaultLanguage.description: The ExternalDsnDefaultLanguage parameter specifies which Exchange server language should be used by default when you create external DSN messages.
ExternalDsnDefaultLanguage.title: ExternalDsnDefaultLanguage

ExternalDsnLanguageDetectionEnabled.description: The ExternalDsnLanguageDetectionEnabled parameter specifies whether the server should try to send an external DSN message in the same language as the original message that generated the notification.
ExternalDsnLanguageDetectionEnabled.title: ExternalDsnLanguageDetectionEnabled

ExternalDsnReportingAuthority.description: The ExternalDsnReportingAuthority parameter specifies the domain in the machine-readable part of external DSN messages.
ExternalDsnReportingAuthority.title: ExternalDsnReportingAuthority

ExternalDsnSendHtml.description: The ExternalDsnSendHtml parameter specifies whether external DSN messages should be HTML or plain text.
ExternalDsnSendHtml.title: ExternalDsnSendHtml

ExternalPostmasterAddress.description: The ExternalPostmasterAddress parameter specifies the email address in the From header field of an external DSN message.
ExternalPostmasterAddress.title: ExternalPostmasterAddress

HeaderPromotionModeSetting.description: The HeaderPromotionModeSetting parameter specifies whether named properties are created for custom X-headers on messages received.
HeaderPromotionModeSetting.title: HeaderPromotionModeSetting

InternalDelayDsnEnabled.description: The InternalDelayDsnEnabled parameter specifies whether a delay DSN message should be created for messages sent to or from recipients or senders in the same Exchange organization that couldn't be immediately delivered.
InternalDelayDsnEnabled.title: InternalDelayDsnEnabled

InternalDsnDefaultLanguage.description: The InternalDsnDefaultLanguage parameter specifies which Exchange server language should be used by default when you create internal DSN messages.
InternalDsnDefaultLanguage.title: InternalDsnDefaultLanguage

InternalDsnLanguageDetectionEnabled.description: The InternalDsnLanguageDetectionEnabled parameter specifies whether the server should try to send an internal DSN message in the same language as the original message that generated the notification.
InternalDsnLanguageDetectionEnabled.title: InternalDsnLanguageDetectionEnabled

InternalDsnReportingAuthority.description: The InternalDsnReportingAuthority parameter specifies the domain in the machine-readable part of internal DSN messages.
InternalDsnReportingAuthority.title: InternalDsnReportingAuthority

InternalDsnSendHtml.description: The InternalDsnSendHtml parameter specifies whether internal DSN messages should be HTML or plain text.
InternalDsnSendHtml.title: InternalDsnSendHtml

JournalMessageExpirationDays.description: The JournalMessageExpirationDays parameter extends the number of days that undeliverable journal reports are queued before they expire.
JournalMessageExpirationDays.title: JournalMessageExpirationDays

JournalingReportNdrTo.description: The JournalingReportNdrTo parameter specifies the email address to which journal reports are sent if the journaling mailbox is unavailable.
JournalingReportNdrTo.title: JournalingReportNdrTo

MaxRecipientEnvelopeLimit.description: The MaxRecipientEnvelopeLimit parameter specifies the maximum number of recipients in a message.
MaxRecipientEnvelopeLimit.title: MaxRecipientEnvelopeLimit

ReplyAllStormBlockDurationHours.description: Reply all storm block duration hours.
ReplyAllStormBlockDurationHours.title: ReplyAllStormBlockDurationHours

ReplyAllStormDetectionMinimumRecipients.description: Reply all storm detection minimum recipients.
ReplyAllStormDetectionMinimumRecipients.title: ReplyAllStormDetectionMinimumRecipients

ReplyAllStormDetectionMinimumReplies.description: Reply all storm detection minimum replies.
ReplyAllStormDetectionMinimumReplies.title: ReplyAllStormDetectionMinimumReplies

Rfc2231EncodingEnabled.description: The Rfc2231EncodingEnabled parameter specifies whether the RFC 2231 encoding of MIME parameters for outbound messages is enabled in your organization.
Rfc2231EncodingEnabled.title: Rfc2231EncodingEnabled

SmtpClientAuthenticationDisabled.description: The SmtpClientAuthenticationDisabled parameter specifies whether to disable authenticated SMTP (SMTP AUTH) for the whole organization.
SmtpClientAuthenticationDisabled.title: SmtpClientAuthenticationDisabled

microsoft.exchange.transportrule.description: This resource configures Transport Rules in Exchange Online.
microsoft.exchange.transportrule.title: Schema for microsoft.exchange.transportrule

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the display name of the transport rule to be created. The maximum length is 64 characters.
Name.title: Name

ADComparisonAttribute.description: This parameter specifies a condition or part of a condition for the rule. The name of the corresponding exception parameter starts with ExceptIf.
ADComparisonAttribute.title: ADComparisonAttribute

ADComparisonOperator.description: This parameter specifies a condition or part of a condition for the rule. The name of the corresponding exception parameter starts with ExceptIf.
ADComparisonOperator.title: ADComparisonOperator

ActivationDate.description: The ActivationDate parameter specifies when the rule starts processing messages. The rule won't take any action on messages until the specified date/time.
ActivationDate.title: ActivationDate

AddManagerAsRecipientType.description: The AddManagerAsRecipientType parameter specifies an action that delivers or redirects messages to the user that's defined in the sender's Manager attribute.
AddManagerAsRecipientType.title: AddManagerAsRecipientType

AddToRecipients.description: The AddToRecipients parameter specifies an action that adds recipients to the To field of messages.
AddToRecipients.title: AddToRecipients

AnyOfCcHeader.description: The AnyOfCcHeader parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients in the Cc field of messages.
AnyOfCcHeader.title: AnyOfCcHeader

AnyOfCcHeaderMemberOf.description: The AnyOfCcHeaderMemberOf parameter specifies a condition that looks for group members in the Cc field of messages.
AnyOfCcHeaderMemberOf.title: AnyOfCcHeaderMemberOf

AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords.description: The AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords parameter specifies a condition that looks for words in recipient email addresses.
AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords.title: AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords

AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns.description: The AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns parameter specifies a condition that looks for text patterns in recipient email addresses by using regular expressions.
AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns.title: AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns

AnyOfToCcHeader.description: The AnyOfToCcHeader parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients in the To or Cc fields of messages.
AnyOfToCcHeader.title: AnyOfToCcHeader

AnyOfToCcHeaderMemberOf.description: The AnyOfToCcHeaderMemberOf parameter specifies a condition that looks for group members in the To and Cc fields of messages.
AnyOfToCcHeaderMemberOf.title: AnyOfToCcHeaderMemberOf

AnyOfToHeader.description: The AnyOfToHeader parameter specifies a condition that looks for recipients in the To field of messages.
AnyOfToHeader.title: AnyOfToHeader

AnyOfToHeaderMemberOf.description: The AnyOfToHeaderMemberOf parameter specifies a condition that looks for group members in the To field of messages.
AnyOfToHeaderMemberOf.title: AnyOfToHeaderMemberOf

ApplyClassification.description: The ApplyClassification parameter specifies an action that applies a message classification to messages.
ApplyClassification.title: ApplyClassification

ApplyHtmlDisclaimerFallbackAction.description: The ApplyHtmlDisclaimerFallbackAction parameter specifies what to do if the HTML disclaimer can't be added to a message.
ApplyHtmlDisclaimerFallbackAction.title: ApplyHtmlDisclaimerFallbackAction

ApplyHtmlDisclaimerLocation.description: The ApplyHtmlDisclaimerLocation parameter specifies where to insert the HTML disclaimer text in the body of messages.
ApplyHtmlDisclaimerLocation.title: ApplyHtmlDisclaimerLocation

ApplyHtmlDisclaimerText.description: The ApplyHtmlDisclaimerText parameter specifies an action that adds the disclaimer text to messages.
ApplyHtmlDisclaimerText.title: ApplyHtmlDisclaimerText

ApplyOME.description: The ApplyOME parameter specifies an action that encrypts messages and their attachments by using Office 365 Message Encryption.
ApplyOME.title: ApplyOME

ApplyRightsProtectionCustomizationTempla.description: The ApplyRightsProtectionCustomizationTemplate parameter specifies an action that applies a custom branding template for OME encrypted messages.
ApplyRightsProtectionCustomizationTempla.title: ApplyRightsProtectionCustomizationTemplate

ApplyRightsProtectionTemplate.description: The ApplyRightsProtectionTemplate parameter specifies an action that applies rights management service (RMS) templates to messages.
ApplyRightsProtectionTemplate.title: ApplyRightsProtectionTemplate

AttachmentContainsWords.description: The AttachmentContainsWords parameter specifies a condition that looks for words in message attachments.
AttachmentContainsWords.title: AttachmentContainsWords

AttachmentExtensionMatchesWords.description: The AttachmentExtensionMatchesWords parameter specifies a condition that looks for words in the file name extensions of message attachments.
AttachmentExtensionMatchesWords.title: AttachmentExtensionMatchesWords

AttachmentHasExecutableContent.description: The AttachmentHasExecutableContent parameter specifies a condition that looks for executable content in message attachments.
AttachmentHasExecutableContent.title: AttachmentHasExecutableContent

AttachmentIsPasswordProtected.description: The AttachmentIsPasswordProtected parameter specifies a condition that looks for password protected files in messages (because the contents of the file can't be inspected).
AttachmentIsPasswordProtected.title: AttachmentIsPasswordProtected

AttachmentIsUnsupported.description: The AttachmentIsUnsupported parameter specifies a condition that looks for unsupported file types in messages.

The default value is false, which means the fallback application type is confidential client such as web app. There are certain scenarios where Microsoft Entra ID cannot determine the client application type (for example, ROPC flow where it is configured without specifying a redirect URI). In those cases, Microsoft Entra ID will interpret the application type based on the value of this property.

microsoft.entra.authenticationcontextcla.description: Represents a Microsoft Entra authentication context class reference. Authentication context class references are custom values that define a Conditional Access authentication requirement
microsoft.entra.authenticationcontextcla.title: Schema for microsoft.entra.authenticationcontextclassreference

Id.description: Identifier used to reference the authentication context class. The id is used to trigger step-up authentication for the referenced authentication requirements and is the value that will be issued in the acrs claim of an access token. This value in the claim is used to verify that the required authentication context has been satisfied. The allowed values are c1 through c25.

DisplayName.description: A friendly name that identifies the authenticationContextClassReference object when building user-facing admin experiences. For example, a selection UX
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

Description.description: A short explanation of the policies that are enforced by authenticationContextClassReference. This value should be used to provide secondary text to describe the authentication context class reference when building user-facing admin experiences. For example, a selection UX.
Description.title: Description

IsAvailable.description: Indicates whether the authenticationContextClassReference has been published by the security admin and is ready for use by apps. When it's set to false, it shouldn't be shown in admin UX experiences because the value isn't currently available for selection.
IsAvailable.title: IsAvailable

Do not use.

microsoft.entra.authorizationpolicy.description:
This resource configures the Azure Active Directory Authorization Policy.

The policy is managed using the BETA API, some properties may have been added in the API but not in the resource

## Azure AD Permissions

To authenticate via Microsoft Graph, this resource required the following Application permissions:

* **Automate**
  * Policy.Read.All
  * Policy.ReadWrite.Authorization

* **Export**
  * Policy.Read.All

NOTE: All permissions listed above require admin consent.
microsoft.entra.authorizationpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.entra.authorizationpolicy

DisplayName.description: Display name for this policy.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

Description.description: Description of this policy.
Description.title: Description

AllowedToSignUpEmailBasedSubscriptions.description: Boolean Indicates whether users can sign up for email based subscriptions.
AllowedToSignUpEmailBasedSubscriptions.title: AllowedToSignUpEmailBasedSubscriptions

AllowedToUseSSPR.description: Boolean Indicates whether the Self-Serve Password Reset feature can be used by users on the tenant.
AllowedToUseSSPR.title: AllowedToUseSSPR

AllowEmailVerifiedUsersToJoinOrganizatio.description: Boolean Indicates whether a user can join the tenant by email validation.
AllowEmailVerifiedUsersToJoinOrganizatio.title: AllowEmailVerifiedUsersToJoinOrganization

AllowInvitesFrom.description: Indicates who can invite external users to the organization. Possible values are: None, AdminsAndGuestInviters, AdminsGuestInvitersAndAllMembers, Everyone. Everyone is the default setting for all cloud environments except US Government.
AllowInvitesFrom.title: AllowInvitesFrom

BlockMsolPowershell.description: Boolean To disable the use of MSOL PowerShell, set this property to true. This will also disable user-based access to the legacy service endpoint used by MSOL PowerShell. This does not affect Azure AD Connect or Microsoft Graph.
BlockMsolPowershell.title: BlockMsolPowershell

DefaultUserRoleAllowedToCreateApps.description: Boolean Indicates whether the default user role can create applications.
DefaultUserRoleAllowedToCreateApps.title: DefaultUserRoleAllowedToCreateApps

DefaultUserRoleAllowedToCreateSecurityGr.description: Boolean Indicates whether the default user role can create security groups.
DefaultUserRoleAllowedToCreateSecurityGr.title: DefaultUserRoleAllowedToCreateSecurityGroups

DefaultUserRoleAllowedToReadBitlockerKey.description: Indicates whether the registered owners of a device can read their own BitLocker recovery keys with default user role.
DefaultUserRoleAllowedToReadBitlockerKey.title: DefaultUserRoleAllowedToReadBitlockerKeysForOwnedDevice

DefaultUserRoleAllowedToCreateTenants.description: Indicates whether the default user role can create tenants. This setting corresponds to the Restrict non-admin users from creating tenants setting in the User settings menu in the Azure portal. When this setting is false, users assigned the Tenant Creator role can still create tenants.
DefaultUserRoleAllowedToCreateTenants.title: DefaultUserRoleAllowedToCreateTenants

DefaultUserRoleAllowedToReadOtherUsers.description: Boolean Indicates whether the default user role can read other users.
DefaultUserRoleAllowedToReadOtherUsers.title: DefaultUserRoleAllowedToReadOtherUsers

GuestUserRole.description: The role that should be granted to guest users. Refer to List unifiedRoleDefinitions to find the list of available role templates. Only supported roles today are User, Guest User, and Restricted Guest User (2af84b1e-32c8-42b7-82bc-daa82404023b).
GuestUserRole.title: GuestUserRole

PermissionGrantPolicyIdsAssignedToDefaul.description: String collection Indicates if user consent to apps is allowed, and if it is, which permission to grant consent and which app consent policy (permissionGrantPolicy) govern the permission for users to grant consent. Value should be in the format managePermissionGrantsForSelf.{id}, where {id} is the id of a built-in or custom app consent policy. An empty list indicates user consent to apps is disabled.
PermissionGrantPolicyIdsAssignedToDefaul.title: PermissionGrantPolicyIdsAssignedToDefaultUserRole

AuthenticationStrength.description: Name of the associated authentication strength policy.

TransferMethods.description: Names of the associated authentication flow transfer methods. Possible values are '', 'deviceCodeFlow', 'authenticationTransfer', or 'deviceCodeFlow,authenticationTransfer'.

If set to false, self-service controls are disabled, and the admin of the guest tenant must manually remove the external user from the guest tenant. When the external user leaves the tenant, their data in the guest tenant is first soft-deleted then permanently deleted in 30 days.
allowExternalIdentitiesToLeave.title: allowExternalIdentitiesToLeave

microsoft.entra.group.description:
This resource configures an Azure Active Directory group. IMPORTANT: It does not support mail enabled security groups or mail enabled groups that are not unified or dynamic groups.

If using with AADUser, be aware that if AADUser->MemberOf is being specified and the referenced group is configured with AADGroup->Member then a conflict may arise if the two don't match. It is usually best to choose only one of them. See AADUser
microsoft.entra.group.title: Schema for microsoft.entra.group

DisplayName.title: DisplayName

MailNickname.title: MailNickname

Description.title: Description

Id.title: Id

Owners.description: User Service Principal values for the group's owners.
Owners.title: Owners

Members.title: Members

GroupAsMembers.title: GroupAsMembers

MemberOf.title: MemberOf

GroupTypes.description: Specifies that the group is a dynamic group. To create a dynamic group, specify a value of DynamicMembership.
GroupTypes.title: GroupTypes

MembershipRule.description: Specifies the membership rule for a dynamic group.
MembershipRule.title: MembershipRule

MembershipRuleProcessingState.title: MembershipRuleProcessingState

SecurityEnabled.description: Specifies whether the group is security enabled. For security groups, this value must be $True.
SecurityEnabled.title: SecurityEnabled

MailEnabled.title: MailEnabled

IsAssignableToRole.description: Specifies whether this group can be assigned a role. Only available when creating a group and can't be modified after group is created.
IsAssignableToRole.title: IsAssignableToRole

AssignedToRole.description: DisplayName values for the roles that the group is assigned to.
AssignedToRole.title: AssignedToRole

Visibility.description: This parameter determines the visibility of the group's content and members list.
Visibility.title: Visibility

This resource configures an Azure Active Directory role definition.
To configure custom roles you require an Azure AD Premium P1 license.
The account used to configure role definitions based on this resource needs either to be a
"Global Administrator" or a "Privileged role administrator".

ResourceScopes.title: ResourceScopes

IsEnabled.title: IsEnabled

microsoft.entra.roleeligibilityscheduler.description: Represents a request for a role eligibility for a principal through PIM. The role eligibility can be permanently eligible without an expiry date or temporarily eligible with an expiry date. Inherits from request.
microsoft.entra.roleeligibilityscheduler.title: Schema for microsoft.entra.roleeligibilityschedulerequest

Principal.description: User Principal Name of the eligibility request.
Principal.title: Principal

RoleDefinition.description: Role associated with the eligibility request.
RoleDefinition.title: RoleDefinition

PrincipalType.description: Represented the type of principal to assign the request to. Accepted values are: Group and User.
PrincipalType.title: PrincipalType

DirectoryScopeId.description: Identifier of the directory object representing the scope of the role eligibility. The scope of an role eligibility determines the set of resources for which the principal has been granted access. Directory scopes are shared scopes stored in the directory that are understood by multiple applications. Use / for tenant-wide scope. Use appScopeId to limit the scope to an application only. Either directoryScopeId or appScopeId is required.
DirectoryScopeId.title: DirectoryScopeId

Id.description: Identifier for the Role Eligibility Schedule Request.
Id.title: Id

AppScopeId.description: Identifier of the app-specific scope when the role eligibility is scoped to an app. The scope of a role eligibility determines the set of resources for which the principal is eligible to access. App scopes are scopes that are defined and understood by this application only. Use / for tenant-wide app scopes. Use directoryScopeId to limit the scope to particular directory objects, for example, administrative units. Either directoryScopeId or appScopeId is required.
AppScopeId.title: AppScopeId

Action.description: Represents the type of operation on the role eligibility request.The possible values are: adminAssign, adminUpdate, adminRemove, selfActivate, selfDeactivate, adminExtend, adminRenew, selfExtend, selfRenew, unknownFutureValue.
Action.title: Action

IsValidationOnly.description: Determines whether the call is a validation or an actual call. Only set this property if you want to check whether an activation is subject to additional rules like MFA before actually submitting the request.
IsValidationOnly.title: IsValidationOnly

Justification.description: A message provided by users and administrators when create they create the unifiedRoleEligibilityScheduleRequest object. Optional when action is adminRemove. Whether this property is required or optional is also dependent on the settings for the Azure AD role.
Justification.title: Justification

ScheduleInfo.description: The period of the role eligibility. Optional when action is adminRemove. The period of eligibility is dependent on the settings of the Azure AD role.
ScheduleInfo.title: ScheduleInfo

expiration.description: When the eligible or active assignment expires.
expiration.title: expiration

duration.description: The requestor's desired duration of access represented in ISO 8601 format for durations. For example, PT3H refers to three hours. If specified in a request, endDateTime should not be present and the type property should be set to afterDuration.
duration.title: duration

endDateTime.description: Timestamp of date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z.
endDateTime.title: endDateTime

type.description: The requestor's desired expiration pattern type. The possible values are: notSpecified, noExpiration, afterDateTime, afterDuration.
type.title: type

recurrence.description: The frequency of the eligible or active assignment. This property is currently unsupported in PIM.
recurrence.title: recurrence

dayOfMonth.description: The day of the month on which the event occurs.
dayOfMonth.title: dayOfMonth

daysOfWeek.description: A collection of the days of the week on which the event occurs. The possible values are: sunday, monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday
daysOfWeek.title: daysOfWeek

firstDayOfWeek.description: The first day of the week.
firstDayOfWeek.title: firstDayOfWeek

index.description: Specifies on which instance of the allowed days specified in daysOfWeek the event occurs, counted from the first instance in the month. The possible values are: first, second, third, fourth, last.
index.title: index

interval.description: The number of units between occurrences, where units can be in days, weeks, months, or years, depending on the type.
interval.title: interval

month.description: The month in which the event occurs. This is a number from 1 to 12.
month.title: month

type.description: The recurrence pattern type: daily, weekly, absoluteMonthly, relativeMonthly, absoluteYearly, relativeYearly.
type.title: type

endDate.description: The date to stop applying the recurrence pattern. Depending on the recurrence pattern of the event, the last occurrence of the meeting may not be this date.
endDate.title: endDate

numberOfOccurrences.description: The number of times to repeat the event. Required and must be positive if type is numbered.
numberOfOccurrences.title: numberOfOccurrences

recurrenceTimeZone.description: Time zone for the startDate and endDate properties.
recurrenceTimeZone.title: recurrenceTimeZone

startDate.description: The date to start applying the recurrence pattern. The first occurrence of the meeting may be this date or later, depending on the recurrence pattern of the event. Must be the same value as the start property of the recurring event.
startDate.title: startDate

type.description: The recurrence range. The possible values are: endDate, noEnd, numbered.
type.title: type

startDateTime.description: When the eligible or active assignment becomes active.
startDateTime.title: startDateTime

TicketInfo.description: Ticket details linked to the role eligibility request including details of the ticket number and ticket system.
TicketInfo.title: TicketInfo

ticketSystem.description: The description of the ticket system.
ticketSystem.title: ticketSystem

Ensure.description: Present ensures the instance exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.appsetuppolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.appsetuppolicy

Identity.description: Unique identifier to be assigned to the new Teams app setup policy. Use the 'Global' Identity if you wish to assign this policy to the entire tenant.
Identity.title: Identity

Description.description: Enables administrators to provide explanatory text to accompany a Teams app setup policy.
Description.title: Description

AppPresetList.description: Choose which apps and messaging extensions you want to be installed in your users' personal Teams environment and in meetings they create. Users can install other available apps from the Teams app store.
AppPresetList.title: AppPresetList

AppPresetMeetingList.description: Choose which apps and meeting extensions you want to be installed in your users' personal Teams environment and in meetings they create. Users can install other available apps from the Teams app store.
AppPresetMeetingList.title: AppPresetMeetingList

PinnedAppBarApps.description: Pinning an app displays the app in the app bar in Teams client. Admins can pin apps and they can allow users to pin apps. Pinning is used to highlight apps that are needed the most by users and promote ease of access.
PinnedAppBarApps.title: PinnedAppBarApps

PinnedMessageBarApps.description: Apps are pinned in messaging extensions and into the ellipsis menu.
PinnedMessageBarApps.title: PinnedMessageBarApps

AllowUserPinning.description: If you turn this on, the user's existing app pins will be added to the list of pinned apps set in this policy. Users can rearrange, add, and remove pins as they choose. If you turn this off, the user's existing app pins will be removed and replaced with the apps defined in this policy.
AllowUserPinning.title: AllowUserPinning

AllowSideLoading.description: This is also known as side loading. This setting determines if a user can upload a custom app package in the Teams app. Turning it on lets you create or develop a custom app to be used personally or across your organization without having to submit it to the Teams app store. Uploading a custom app also lets you test an app before you distribute it more widely by only assigning it to a single user or group of users.
AllowSideLoading.title: AllowSideLoading

microsoft.teams.callingpolicy.description:
This resource configures a Teams Calling Policy.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-calling-policy
microsoft.teams.callingpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.callingpolicy

Identity.description: Identity of the Teams Calling Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

Description.description: Description of the Teams Calling Policy.
Description.title: Description

AllowPrivateCalling.description: Controls all calling capabilities in Teams. Turning this off will turn off all calling functionality in Teams. If you use Skype for Business for calling, this policy will not affect calling functionality in Skype for Business.
AllowPrivateCalling.title: AllowPrivateCalling

AllowVoicemail.description: Enables inbound calls to be routed to voice mail. Valid options are: AlwaysEnabled, AlwaysDisabled, UserOverride.
AllowVoicemail.title: AllowVoicemail

AllowCallGroups.description: Enables inbound calls to be routed to call groups.
AllowCallGroups.title: AllowCallGroups

AllowDelegation.description: Enables inbound calls to be routed to delegates; allows delegates to make outbound calls on behalf of the users for whom they have delegated permissions.
AllowDelegation.title: AllowDelegation

AllowCallForwardingToUser.description: Enables call forwarding or simultaneous ringing of inbound calls to other users in your tenant.
AllowCallForwardingToUser.title: AllowCallForwardingToUser

AllowCallForwardingToPhone.description: Enables call forwarding or simultaneous ringing of inbound calls to any phone number.
AllowCallForwardingToPhone.title: AllowCallForwardingToPhone

AllowCallRedirect.description: Setting this parameter provides the ability to configure call redirection capabilities on Teams phones.
AllowCallRedirect.title: AllowCallRedirect

AllowSIPDevicesCalling.description: Determines whether the user is allowed to use SIP devices for calling on behalf of a Teams client.
AllowSIPDevicesCalling.title: AllowSIPDevicesCalling

AllowWebPSTNCalling.description: Allows PSTN calling from the Team web client
AllowWebPSTNCalling.title: AllowWebPSTNCalling

PreventTollBypass.description: Setting this parameter to True will send calls through PSTN and incur charges rather than going through the network and bypassing the tolls.
PreventTollBypass.title: PreventTollBypass

BusyOnBusyEnabledType.description: Setting this parameter lets you configure how incoming calls are handled when a user is already in a call or conference or has a call placed on hold. New or incoming calls will be rejected with a busy signal. Valid options are: Enabled, Disabled and Unanswered.
BusyOnBusyEnabledType.title: BusyOnBusyEnabledType

CallRecordingExpirationDays.description: Sets the expiration of the recorded 1:1 calls.
CallRecordingExpirationDays.title: CallRecordingExpirationDays

MusicOnHoldEnabledType.description: Setting this parameter allows you to turn on or turn off music on hold when a PSTN caller is placed on hold. It is turned on by default. Valid options are: Enabled, Disabled, UserOverride. For now setting the value to UserOverride is the same as Enabled. This setting does not apply to call park and SLA boss delegate features. Valid options are: Enabled, Disabled, UserOverride.
MusicOnHoldEnabledType.title: MusicOnHoldEnabledType

SafeTransferEnabled.description: This parameter is not available for use. Valid options are: Enabled, Disabled, UserOverride.
SafeTransferEnabled.title: SafeTransferEnabled

AllowCloudRecordingForCalls.description: Setting this parameter to True will allows 1:1 Calls to be recorded.
AllowCloudRecordingForCalls.title: AllowCloudRecordingForCalls

AllowTranscriptionforCalling.description: Determines whether post-meeting captions and transcriptions are allowed in a user's meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowTranscriptionforCalling.title: AllowTranscriptionforCalling

LiveCaptionsEnabledTypeForCalling.description: Determines whether real-time captions are available for the user in Teams meetings. Set this to DisabledUserOverride to allow user to turn on live captions. Set this to Disabled to prohibit.
LiveCaptionsEnabledTypeForCalling.title: LiveCaptionsEnabledTypeForCalling

AutoAnswerEnabledType.description: This setting allows the tenant admin to enable or disable the Auto-Answer setting. Valid options are: Enabled, Disabled.
AutoAnswerEnabledType.title: AutoAnswerEnabledType

SpamFilteringEnabledType.description: Setting this parameter determines whether calls identified as Spam will be rejected or not (probably). Valid options are: Enabled, Disabled.
SpamFilteringEnabledType.title: SpamFilteringEnabledType

Ensure.description: Present ensures the policyexists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.callparkpolicy.description: The TeamsCallParkPolicy controls whether or not users are able to leverage the call park feature in Microsoft Teams. Call park allows enterprise voice customers to place a call on hold and then perform a number of actions on that call: transfer to another department, retrieve via the same phone, or retrieve via a different Teams phone. The New-CsTeamsCallParkPolicy resource lets you create a new custom policy that can then be assigned to one or more specific users.
microsoft.teams.callparkpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.callparkpolicy

Identity.description: A unique identifier for the policy - this will be used to retrieve the policy later on to assign it to specific users.
Identity.title: Identity

AllowCallPark.description: If set to true, customers will be able to leverage the call park feature to place calls on hold and then decide how the call should be handled - transferred to another department, retrieved using the same phone, or retrieved using a different phone.
AllowCallPark.title: AllowCallPark

Description.description: Description of the Teams Call Park Policy.
Description.title: Description

ParkTimeoutSeconds.description: Specify the number of seconds to wait before ringing the parker when the parked call hasn't been picked up. Value can be from 120 to 1800 (seconds).
ParkTimeoutSeconds.title: ParkTimeoutSeconds

PickupRangeEnd.description: Specify the maximum value that a rendered pickup code can take. Value can be from 10 to 9999. Note: PickupRangeStart must be smaller than PickupRangeEnd.
PickupRangeEnd.title: PickupRangeEnd

PickupRangeStart.description: Specify the minimum value that a rendered pickup code can take. Value can be from 10 to 9999.
PickupRangeStart.title: PickupRangeStart

Ensure.description: Present ensures the instance exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.callqueue.description: This resource is used to manage Call Queue in your Skype for Business Online organization.
microsoft.teams.callqueue.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.callqueue

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies a unique name for the Call Queue.
Name.title: Name

AgentAlertTime.description: The Name parameter specifies a unique name for the Call Queue.
AgentAlertTime.title: AgentAlertTime

AllowOptOut.description: The AllowOptOut parameter indicates whether or not agents can opt in or opt out from taking calls from a Call Queue.
AllowOptOut.title: AllowOptOut

DistributionLists.description: The DistributionLists parameter lets you add all the members of the distribution lists to the Call Queue. This is a list of distribution list GUIDs. A service wide configurable maximum number of DLs per Call Queue are allowed. Only the first N (service wide configurable) agents from all distribution lists combined are considered for accepting the call. Nested DLs are supported. O365 Groups can also be used to add members to the Call Queue.
DistributionLists.title: DistributionLists

UseDefaultMusicOnHold.description: The UseDefaultMusicOnHold parameter indicates that this Call Queue uses the default music on hold. This parameter cannot be specified together with MusicOnHoldAudioFileId.
UseDefaultMusicOnHold.title: UseDefaultMusicOnHold

WelcomeMusicAudioFileId.description: The WelcomeMusicAudioFileId parameter represents the audio file to play when callers are connected with the Call Queue. This is the unique identifier of the audio file.
WelcomeMusicAudioFileId.title: WelcomeMusicAudioFileId

MusicOnHoldAudioFileId.description: The MusicOnHoldFileContent parameter represents music to play when callers are placed on hold. This is the unique identifier of the audio file. This parameter is required if the UseDefaultMusicOnHold parameter is not specified.
MusicOnHoldAudioFileId.title: MusicOnHoldAudioFileId

OverflowAction.description: The OverflowAction parameter designates the action to take if the overflow threshold is reached. The OverflowAction property must be set to one of the following values: DisconnectWithBusy, Forward, Voicemail, and SharedVoicemail. The default value is DisconnectWithBusy.
OverflowAction.title: OverflowAction

OverflowActionTarget.description: The OverflowActionTarget parameter represents the target of the overflow action. If the OverFlowAction is set to Forward, this parameter must be set to a Guid or a telephone number with a mandatory 'tel:' prefix. If the OverflowAction is set to SharedVoicemail, this parameter must be set to a group ID (Microsoft 365, Distribution list, or Mail-enabled security). Otherwise, this parameter is optional.
OverflowActionTarget.title: OverflowActionTarget

OverflowThreshold.description: The OverflowThreshold parameter defines the number of calls that can be in the queue at any one time before the overflow action is triggered. The OverflowThreshold can be any integer value between 0 and 200, inclusive. A value of 0 causes calls not to reach agents and the overflow action to be taken immediately.
OverflowThreshold.title: OverflowThreshold

TimeoutAction.description: The TimeoutAction parameter defines the action to take if the timeout threshold is reached. The TimeoutAction property must be set to one of the following values: Disconnect, Forward, Voicemail, and SharedVoicemail. The default value is Disconnect.
TimeoutAction.title: TimeoutAction

TimeoutActionTarget.description: The TimeoutActionTarget represents the target of the timeout action. If the TimeoutAction is set to Forward, this parameter must be set to a Guid or a telephone number with a mandatory 'tel:' prefix. If the TimeoutAction is set to SharedVoicemail, this parameter must be set to an Office 365 Group ID. Otherwise, this field is optional.
TimeoutActionTarget.title: TimeoutActionTarget

TimeoutThreshold.description: The TimeoutThreshold parameter defines the time (in seconds) that a call can be in the queue before that call times out. At that point, the system will take the action specified by the TimeoutAction parameter. The TimeoutThreshold can be any integer value between 0 and 2700 seconds (inclusive), and is rounded to the nearest 15th interval. For example, if set to 47 seconds, then it is rounded down to 45. If set to 0, welcome music is played, and then the timeout action will be taken.
TimeoutThreshold.title: TimeoutThreshold

RoutingMethod.description: The RoutingMethod defines how agents will be called in a Call Queue. If the routing method is set to Serial, then agents will be called one at a time. If the routing method is set to Attendant, then agents will be called in parallel. If routing method is set to RoundRobin, the agents will be called using Round Robin strategy so that all agents share the call-load equally. If routing method is set to LongestIdle, the agents will be called based on their idle time, i.e., the agent that has been idle for the longest period will be called.
RoutingMethod.title: RoutingMethod

PresenceBasedRouting.description: The PresenceBasedRouting parameter indicates whether or not presence based routing will be applied while call being routed to Call Queue agents. When set to False, calls will be routed to agents who have opted in to receive calls, regardless of their presence state. When set to True, opted-in agents will receive calls only when their presence state is Available.
PresenceBasedRouting.title: PresenceBasedRouting
