ConferenceMode.description: The ConferenceMode parameter indicates whether or not Conference mode will be applied on calls for this Call queue. Conference mode significantly reduces the amount of time it takes for a caller to be connected to an agent, after the agent accepts the call.
ConferenceMode.title: ConferenceMode

Users.description: The Users parameter lets you add agents to the Call Queue. This parameter expects a list of user unique identifiers (GUID).
Users.title: Users

LanguageId.description: The LanguageId parameter indicates the language that is used to play shared voicemail prompts. This parameter becomes a required parameter If either OverflowAction or TimeoutAction is set to SharedVoicemail. You can query the supported languages using the Get-CsAutoAttendantSupportedLanguage cmdlet.
LanguageId.title: LanguageId

OboResourceAccountIds.description: The OboResourceAccountIds parameter lets you add resource account with phone number to the Call Queue. The agents in the Call Queue will be able to make outbound calls using the phone number on the resource accounts. This is a list of resource account GUIDs. Only Call Queue managed by a Teams Channel will be able to use this feature.
OboResourceAccountIds.title: OboResourceAccountIds

OverflowDisconnectTextToSpeechPrompt.description: The OverflowDisconnectTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being disconnected due to overflow.
OverflowDisconnectTextToSpeechPrompt.title: OverflowDisconnectTextToSpeechPrompt

OverflowDisconnectAudioFilePrompt.description: The OverflowDisconnectAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is played to the caller when being disconnected due to overflow.
OverflowDisconnectAudioFilePrompt.title: OverflowDisconnectAudioFilePrompt

OverflowRedirectPersonTextToSpeechPrompt.description: The OverflowRedirectPersonTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a person in the organization due to overflow.
OverflowRedirectPersonTextToSpeechPrompt.title: OverflowRedirectPersonTextToSpeechPrompt

OverflowRedirectPersonAudioFilePrompt.description: The OverflowRedirectPersonAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a person in the organization due to overflow.
OverflowRedirectPersonAudioFilePrompt.title: OverflowRedirectPersonAudioFilePrompt

OverflowRedirectVoiceAppTextToSpeechProm.description: The OverflowRedirectVoiceAppsTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a voice application due to overflow.
OverflowRedirectVoiceAppTextToSpeechProm.title: OverflowRedirectVoiceAppTextToSpeechPrompt

OverflowRedirectVoiceAppAudioFilePrompt.description: The OverflowRedirectVoiceAppAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a voice application due to overflow.
OverflowRedirectVoiceAppAudioFilePrompt.title: OverflowRedirectVoiceAppAudioFilePrompt

OverflowRedirectPhoneNumberTextToSpeechP.description: The OverflowRedirectPhoneNumberTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to an external PSTN phone number due to overflow.
OverflowRedirectPhoneNumberTextToSpeechP.title: OverflowRedirectPhoneNumberTextToSpeechPrompt

OverflowRedirectPhoneNumberAudioFileProm.description: The OverflowRedirectPhoneNumberAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to an external PSTN phone number due to overflow.
OverflowRedirectPhoneNumberAudioFileProm.title: OverflowRedirectPhoneNumberAudioFilePrompt

OverflowRedirectVoicemailTextToSpeechPro.description: The OverflowRedirectVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a person's voicemail due to overflow.
OverflowRedirectVoicemailTextToSpeechPro.title: OverflowRedirectVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt

OverflowRedirectVoicemailAudioFilePrompt.description: The OverflowRedirectVoiceMailAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a person's voicemail due to overflow.
OverflowRedirectVoicemailAudioFilePrompt.title: OverflowRedirectVoicemailAudioFilePrompt

OverflowSharedVoicemailTextToSpeechPromp.description: The OverflowRedirectVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a person's voicemail due to overflow.
OverflowSharedVoicemailTextToSpeechPromp.title: OverflowSharedVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt

OverflowSharedVoicemailAudioFilePrompt.description: The OverflowSharedVoicemailAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is to be played as a greeting to the caller when transferred to shared voicemail on overflow. This parameter becomes a required parameter when OverflowAction is SharedVoicemail and OverflowSharedVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt is null.
OverflowSharedVoicemailAudioFilePrompt.title: OverflowSharedVoicemailAudioFilePrompt

EnableOverflowSharedVoicemailTranscripti.description: The EnableOverflowSharedVoicemailTranscription parameter is used to turn on transcription for voicemails left by a caller on overflow. This parameter is only applicable when OverflowAction is set to SharedVoicemail.
EnableOverflowSharedVoicemailTranscripti.title: EnableOverflowSharedVoicemailTranscription

TimeoutDisconnectTextToSpeechPrompt.description: The TimeoutDisconnectTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being disconnected due to timeout.
TimeoutDisconnectTextToSpeechPrompt.title: TimeoutDisconnectTextToSpeechPrompt

TimeoutDisconnectAudioFilePrompt.description: The TimeoutDisconnectAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is played to the caller when being disconnected due to timeout.
TimeoutDisconnectAudioFilePrompt.title: TimeoutDisconnectAudioFilePrompt

TimeoutRedirectPersonTextToSpeechPrompt.description: The TimeoutRedirectPersonTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a person in the organization due to timeout.
TimeoutRedirectPersonTextToSpeechPrompt.title: TimeoutRedirectPersonTextToSpeechPrompt

TimeoutRedirectPersonAudioFilePrompt.description: The TimeoutRedirectPersonAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a person in the organization due to timeout.
TimeoutRedirectPersonAudioFilePrompt.title: TimeoutRedirectPersonAudioFilePrompt

TimeoutRedirectVoiceAppTextToSpeechPromp.description: The TimeoutRedirectVoiceAppsTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a voice application due to timeout.
TimeoutRedirectVoiceAppTextToSpeechPromp.title: TimeoutRedirectVoiceAppTextToSpeechPrompt

TimeoutRedirectVoiceAppAudioFilePrompt.description: The TimeoutRedirectVoiceAppAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a voice application due to timeout.
TimeoutRedirectVoiceAppAudioFilePrompt.title: TimeoutRedirectVoiceAppAudioFilePrompt

TimeoutRedirectPhoneNumberTextToSpeechPr.description: The TimeoutRedirectPhoneNumberTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to an external PSTN phone number due to timeout.
TimeoutRedirectPhoneNumberTextToSpeechPr.title: TimeoutRedirectPhoneNumberTextToSpeechPrompt

TimeoutRedirectPhoneNumberAudioFilePromp.description: The TimeoutRedirectPhoneNumberAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to an external PSTN phone number due to timeout.
TimeoutRedirectPhoneNumberAudioFilePromp.title: TimeoutRedirectPhoneNumberAudioFilePrompt

TimeoutRedirectVoicemailTextToSpeechProm.description: The TimeoutRedirectVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a person's voicemail due to timeout.
TimeoutRedirectVoicemailTextToSpeechProm.title: TimeoutRedirectVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt

TimeoutRedirectVoicemailAudioFilePrompt.description: The TimeoutRedirectVoiceMailAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is played to the caller when being redirected to a person's voicemail due to timeout.
TimeoutRedirectVoicemailAudioFilePrompt.title: TimeoutRedirectVoicemailAudioFilePrompt

TimeoutSharedVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt.description: The TimeoutSharedVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt parameter indicates the Text-to-Speech (TTS) prompt which is to be played as a greeting to the caller when transferred to shared voicemail on timeout. This parameter becomes a required parameter when TimeoutAction is SharedVoicemail and TimeoutSharedVoicemailAudioFilePrompt is null.
TimeoutSharedVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt.title: TimeoutSharedVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt

TimeoutSharedVoicemailAudioFilePrompt.description: The TimeoutSharedVoicemailAudioFilePrompt parameter indicates the unique identifier for the Audio file prompt which is to be played as a greeting to the caller when transferred to shared voicemail on timeout. This parameter becomes a required parameter when TimeoutAction is SharedVoicemail and TimeoutSharedVoicemailTextToSpeechPrompt is null.
TimeoutSharedVoicemailAudioFilePrompt.title: TimeoutSharedVoicemailAudioFilePrompt

EnableTimeoutSharedVoicemailTranscriptio.description: The EnableTimeoutSharedVoicemailTranscription parameter is used to turn on transcription for voicemails left by a caller on timeout. This parameter is only applicable when TimeoutAction is set to SharedVoicemail.
EnableTimeoutSharedVoicemailTranscriptio.title: EnableTimeoutSharedVoicemailTranscription

ChannelId.description: Id of the channel to connect a call queue to.
ChannelId.title: ChannelId

ChannelUserObjectId.description: Guid should contain 32 digits with 4 dashes (xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx). This is the GUID of one of the owners of the team the channels belongs to.
ChannelUserObjectId.title: ChannelUserObjectId

AuthorizedUsers.description: This is a list of GUIDs for users who are authorized to make changes to this call queue. The users must also have a TeamsVoiceApplications policy assigned. The GUID should contain 32 digits with 4 dashes (xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx).
AuthorizedUsers.title: AuthorizedUsers

Ensure.description: Present ensures the Team Message Policy exists, absent ensures it is removed
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.channelspolicy.description:
This resource configures a Teams Channel Policy.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-policies
microsoft.teams.channelspolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.channelspolicy

Identity.description: Identity of the Teams Channel Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

Description.description: Description of the Teams Channel Policy.
Description.title: Description

AllowChannelSharingToExternalUser.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to share a shared channel with an external user. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowChannelSharingToExternalUser.title: AllowChannelSharingToExternalUser

AllowOrgWideTeamCreation.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to create an org-wide team. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowOrgWideTeamCreation.title: AllowOrgWideTeamCreation

EnablePrivateTeamDiscovery.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to discover private teams in suggestions and search results. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
EnablePrivateTeamDiscovery.title: EnablePrivateTeamDiscovery

AllowPrivateChannelCreation.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to create a private channel. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowPrivateChannelCreation.title: AllowPrivateChannelCreation

AllowSharedChannelCreation.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to create a shared channel. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowSharedChannelCreation.title: AllowSharedChannelCreation

AllowUserToParticipateInExternalSharedCh.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to participate in a shared channel that has been shared by an external user. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowUserToParticipateInExternalSharedCh.title: AllowUserToParticipateInExternalSharedChannel

Ensure.description: Present ensures the policy exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.channel.description: This resource is used to add and update channels in existing Teams.
microsoft.teams.channel.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.channel

DisplayName.description: Current channel name
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

TeamName.description: Name of the team the Channel belongs to
TeamName.title: TeamName

GroupID.description: Team group ID, only used to target a Team when duplicated display names occurs.
GroupID.title: GroupID

NewDisplayName.description: Used to update current channel name
NewDisplayName.title: NewDisplayName

Description.description: Channel description
Description.title: Description

Ensure.description: Present ensures the Team channel exists, absent ensures it is removed
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.channeltab.description: This resource configures a new Custom tab in a Channel.
microsoft.teams.channeltab.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.channeltab

DisplayName.description: Display Name of the Channel Tab.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

TeamId.description: Unique Id of the Team of the instance on the source tenant.
TeamId.title: TeamId

TeamsApp.description: Id of the Teams App associated with the custom tab.
TeamsApp.title: TeamsApp

SortOrderIndex.description: Index of the sort order for the custom tab.
SortOrderIndex.title: SortOrderIndex

WebSiteUrl.description: Url of the website linked to the Channel Tab.
WebSiteUrl.title: WebSiteUrl

ContentUrl.description: Url of the content linked to the Channel Tab.
ContentUrl.title: ContentUrl

RemoveUrl.description: Url of the location used to remove the app.
RemoveUrl.title: RemoveUrl

EntityId.description: Id of the Entity linked to the Channel Tab.
EntityId.title: EntityId

Ensure.description: Present ensures the Tab exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.clientconfiguration.description:
This resource is used to configure the Teams client settings.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/enable-features-office-365#teams-settings-and-teams-upgrade-settings-in-the-microsoft-teams-admin-center
microsoft.teams.clientconfiguration.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.clientconfiguration

Identity.description: The only valid input is Global - the tenant wide configuration
Identity.title: Identity

AllowBox.description: Designates whether users are able to leverage Box as a third party storage solution in Microsoft Teams. If $true, users will be able to add Box in the client and interact with the files stored there.
AllowBox.title: AllowBox

AllowDropBox.description: Designates whether users are able to leverage DropBox as a third party storage solution in Microsoft Teams. If $true, users will be able to add DropBox in the client and interact with the files stored there.
AllowDropBox.title: AllowDropBox

AllowEmailIntoChannel.description: When set to $true, mail hooks are enabled, and users can post messages to a channel by sending an email to the email address of Teams channel.
AllowEmailIntoChannel.title: AllowEmailIntoChannel

AllowGoogleDrive.description: Designates whether users are able to leverage GoogleDrive as a third party storage solution in Microsoft Teams. If $true, users will be able to add Google Drive in the client and interact with the files stored there.
AllowGoogleDrive.title: AllowGoogleDrive

AllowGuestUser.description: Designates whether or not guest users in your organization will have access to the Teams client. If $true, guests in your tenant will be able to access the Teams client. Note that this setting has a core dependency on Guest Access being enabled in your Office 365 tenant.
AllowGuestUser.title: AllowGuestUser

AllowOrganizationTab.description: When set to $true, users will be able to see the organizational chart icon other users' contact cards, and when clicked, this icon will display the detailed organizational chart.
AllowOrganizationTab.title: AllowOrganizationTab

AllowResourceAccountSendMessage.description: Surface Hub uses a device account to provide email and collaboration services (IM, video, voice). This device account is used as the originating identity (the from party) when sending email, IM, and placing calls. As this account is not coming from an individual, identifiable user, it is deemed anonymous because it originated from the Surface Hub's device account. If set to $true, these device accounts will be able to send chat messages in Skype for Business Online (does not apply to Microsoft Teams).
AllowResourceAccountSendMessage.title: AllowResourceAccountSendMessage

AllowScopedPeopleSearchandAccess.description: If set to $true, the Exchange address book policy (ABP) will be used to provide customized view of the global address book for each user. This is only a virtual separation and not a legal separation.
AllowScopedPeopleSearchandAccess.title: AllowScopedPeopleSearchandAccess

AllowShareFile.description: Designates whether users are able to leverage ShareFile as a third party storage solution in Microsoft Teams. If $true, users will be able to add ShareFile in the client and interact with the files stored there.
AllowShareFile.title: AllowShareFile

AllowSkypeBusinessInterop.description: When set to $true, Teams conversations automatically show up in Skype for Business for users that aren't enabled for Teams.
AllowSkypeBusinessInterop.title: AllowSkypeBusinessInterop

AllowEgnyte.description: Designates whether users are able to leverage Egnyte as a third party storage solution in Microsoft Teams. If $true, users will be able to add Egnyte in the client and interact with the files stored there.
AllowEgnyte.title: AllowEgnyte

ContentPin.description: This setting applies only to Skype for Business Online (not Microsoft Teams) and defines whether the user must provide a secondary form of authentication to access the meeting content from a resource device account. Meeting content is defined as files that are shared to the Content Bin - files that have been attached to the meeting.
ContentPin.title: ContentPin

ResourceAccountContentAccess.description: Require a secondary form of authentication to access meeting content.
ResourceAccountContentAccess.title: ResourceAccountContentAccess

RestrictedSenderList.description: Senders domains can be further restricted to ensure that only allowed SMTP domains can send emails to the Teams channels. This is a comma-separated string of the domains you'd like to allow to send emails to Teams channels.
RestrictedSenderList.title: RestrictedSenderList

microsoft.teams.compliancerecordingpolic.description: Creates a new Teams recording policy for governing automatic policy-based recording in your tenant. Automatic policy-based recording is only applicable to Microsoft Teams users.
microsoft.teams.compliancerecordingpolic.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.compliancerecordingpolicy

Identity.description: Unique identifier of the application instance of a policy-based recording application to be retrieved.
Identity.title: Identity

ComplianceRecordingApplications.description: A list of application instances of policy-based recording applications to assign to this policy. The Id of each of these application instances must be the ObjectId of the application instance as obtained by the Get-CsOnlineApplicationInstance cmdlet.
ComplianceRecordingApplications.title: ComplianceRecordingApplications

Description.description: Enables administrators to provide explanatory text to accompany a Teams recording policy. For example, the Description might include information about the users the policy should be assigned to.
Description.title: Description

DisableComplianceRecordingAudioNotificat.description: Setting this attribute to true disables recording audio notifications for 1:1 calls that are under compliance recording.
DisableComplianceRecordingAudioNotificat.title: DisableComplianceRecordingAudioNotificationForCalls

Enabled.description: Controls whether this Teams recording policy is active or not.
Enabled.title: Enabled

WarnUserOnRemoval.description: This parameter is reserved for future use.
WarnUserOnRemoval.title: WarnUserOnRemoval

Ensure.description: Present ensures the instance exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.cortanapolicy.description: The CsTeamsCortanaPolicy resources enable administrators to control settings for Cortana voice assistant in Microsoft Teams.
microsoft.teams.cortanapolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.cortanapolicy

Identity.description: Unique identifier for Teams cortana policy you're creating.
Identity.title: Identity

CortanaVoiceInvocationMode.description: The value of this field indicates if Cortana is enabled and mode of invocation.
CortanaVoiceInvocationMode.title: CortanaVoiceInvocationMode

Description.description: Provide a description of your policy to identify purpose of creating it.
Description.title: Description

Ensure.description: Present ensures the instance exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.dialinconferencingtenant.description:
This resource configures a Teams User's Calling Settings.

More information: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/user-call-settings
microsoft.teams.dialinconferencingtenant.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.dialinconferencingtenantsettings

AllowPSTNOnlyMeetingsByDefault.description: Specifies the default value that gets assigned to the 'AllowPSTNOnlyMeetings' setting of users when they are enabled for dial-in conferencing, or when a user's dial-in conferencing provider is set to Microsoft. If set to $true, the 'AllowPSTNOnlyMeetings' setting of the user will also be set to true. If $false, the user setting will be false. The default value for AllowPSTNOnlyMeetingsByDefault is $false.
AllowPSTNOnlyMeetingsByDefault.title: AllowPSTNOnlyMeetingsByDefault

AutomaticallySendEmailsToUsers.description: Specifies whether advisory emails will be sent to users when the events listed below occur. Setting the parameter to $true enables the emails to be sent, $false disables the emails. The default is $true.
AutomaticallySendEmailsToUsers.title: AutomaticallySendEmailsToUsers

EnableEntryExitNotifications.description: Specifies if, by default, announcements are made as users enter and exit a conference call. Set to $true to enable notifications, $false to disable notifications. The default is $true.
EnableEntryExitNotifications.title: EnableEntryExitNotifications

EntryExitAnnouncementsType.description: Supported entry and exit announcement type.
EntryExitAnnouncementsType.title: EntryExitAnnouncementsType

MaskPstnNumbersType.description: This parameter allows tenant administrators to configure masking of PSTN participant phone numbers in the roster view for Microsoft Teams meetings enabled for Audio Conferencing, scheduled within the organization. Possible values are MaskedForExternalUsers, MaskedForAllUsers or NoMasking
MaskPstnNumbersType.title: MaskPstnNumbersType

PinLength.description: Specifies the number of digits in the automatically generated PINs. Organizers can enter their PIN to start a meeting they scheduled if they join via phone and are the first person to join. The minimum value is 4, the maximum is 12, and the default is 5.
PinLength.title: PinLength

microsoft.teams.emergencycallingpolicy.description:
This resource configures the Teams Emergency Calling Policies.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-emergency-calling-policies
microsoft.teams.emergencycallingpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.emergencycallingpolicy

Identity.description: Identity of the Teams Emergency Calling Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

Description.description: Description of the Teams Emergency Calling Policy.
Description.title: Description

EnhancedEmergencyServiceDisclaimer.description: Allows the tenant administrator to configure a text string, which is shown at the top of the Calls app.
EnhancedEmergencyServiceDisclaimer.title: EnhancedEmergencyServiceDisclaimer

ExternalLocationLookupMode.description: Enables ExternalLocationLookupMode. This mode allows users to set Emergency addresses for remote locations.
ExternalLocationLookupMode.title: ExternalLocationLookupMode

NotificationDialOutNumber.description: This parameter represents PSTN number which can be dialed out if NotificationMode is set to either of the two Conference values.
NotificationDialOutNumber.title: NotificationDialOutNumber

NotificationGroup.description: NotificationGroup is a email list of users and groups to be notified of an emergency call.
NotificationGroup.title: NotificationGroup

NotificationMode.description: The type of conference experience for security desk notification.
NotificationMode.title: NotificationMode

Ensure.description: Present ensures the policy exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.emergencycallroutingpoli.description:
This resource configures the Teams Emergency Call Routing Policies.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-emergency-call-routing-policies
microsoft.teams.emergencycallroutingpoli.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.emergencycallroutingpolicy

Identity.description: Identity of the Teams Emergency Call Routing Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

Description.description: Description of the Teams Emergency Call Routing Policy.
Description.title: Description

items.description:
This resource configures the Teams Emergency Call Routing Policies.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-emergency-call-routing-policies
items.title: Schema for MSFT_TeamsEmergencyNumber

EmergencyDialMask.description: For each Teams emergency number, you can specify zero or more emergency dial masks. A dial mask is a number that you want to translate into the value of the emergency dial number value when it is dialed.
EmergencyDialMask.title: EmergencyDialMask

OnlinePSTNUsage.description: Specify the online public switched telephone network (PSTN) usage
OnlinePSTNUsage.title: OnlinePSTNUsage

EmergencyNumbers.description: Emergency number(s) associated with the policy.
EmergencyNumbers.title: EmergencyNumbers

AllowEnhancedEmergencyServices.description: Flag to enable Enhanced Emergency Services
AllowEnhancedEmergencyServices.title: AllowEnhancedEmergencyServices

Ensure.description: Present ensures the policy exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.enhancedencryptionpolicy.description: Use this resource to create a new Teams enhanced encryption policy.
microsoft.teams.enhancedencryptionpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.enhancedencryptionpolicy

Identity.description: Unique identifier assigned to the Teams enhanced encryption policy.
Identity.title: Identity

CallingEndtoEndEncryptionEnabledType.description: Determines whether End-to-end encrypted calling is available for the user in Teams. Set this to DisabledUserOverride to allow user to turn on End-to-end encrypted calls. Set this to Disabled to prohibit.
CallingEndtoEndEncryptionEnabledType.title: CallingEndtoEndEncryptionEnabledType

Description.description: Enables administrators to provide explanatory text to accompany a Teams enhanced encryption policy.
Description.title: Description

Ensure.description: Present ensures the instance exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.eventspolicy.description: This resource configures the Teams Events Policies.
microsoft.teams.eventspolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.eventspolicy

Identity.description: Identity of the Teams Events Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

Description.description: Description of the Teams Events Policy.
Description.title: Description

AllowEmailEditing.description: This setting governs if a user is allowed to edit the communication emails in Teams Town Hall or Teams Webinar events.
AllowEmailEditing.title: AllowEmailEditing

AllowEventIntegrations.description: This setting governs access to the integrations tab in the event creation workflow.
AllowEventIntegrations.title: AllowEventIntegrations

AllowWebinars.description: Determines if webinars are allowed by the policy or not.
AllowWebinars.title: AllowWebinars

AllowTownhalls.description: This setting governs if a user can create town halls using Teams Events.
AllowTownhalls.title: AllowTownhalls

AllowedQuestionTypesInRegistrationForm.description: This setting governs which users in a tenant can add which registration form questions to an event registration page for attendees to answer when registering for the event.
AllowedQuestionTypesInRegistrationForm.title: AllowedQuestionTypesInRegistrationForm

AllowedTownhallTypesForRecordingPublish.description: This setting describes how IT admins can control which types of Town Hall attendees can have their recordings published.
AllowedTownhallTypesForRecordingPublish.title: AllowedTownhallTypesForRecordingPublish

AllowedWebinarTypesForRecordingPublish.description: This setting describes how IT admins can control which types of webinar attendees can have their recordings published.
AllowedWebinarTypesForRecordingPublish.title: AllowedWebinarTypesForRecordingPublish

EventAccessType.description: Defines who is allowed to join the event.
EventAccessType.title: EventAccessType

Ensure.description: Present ensures the policy exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

TownhallChatExperience.description: This setting governs whether the user can enable the Comment Stream chat experience for Town Halls.
TownhallChatExperience.title: TownhallChatExperience

UseMicrosoftECDN.description: This setting governs whether the global admin disables this property and prevents the organizers from creating town halls that use Microsoft eCDN even though they have been assigned a Teams Premium license.
UseMicrosoftECDN.title: UseMicrosoftECDN

microsoft.teams.federationconfiguration.description:
This resource is used to configure the Teams Federation Configuration (CsTenantFederationConfiguration).
In the Teams admin center this is available in 'External access' in the Users section.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-external-access
microsoft.teams.federationconfiguration.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.federationconfiguration

Identity.description: The only valid input is Global - the tenant wide configuration
Identity.title: Identity

AllowFederatedUsers.description: When set to True users will be potentially allowed to communicate with users from other domains.
AllowFederatedUsers.title: AllowFederatedUsers

AllowedDomains.description: List of federated domains to allow.
AllowedDomains.title: AllowedDomains

BlockedDomains.description: List of federated domains to block.
BlockedDomains.title: BlockedDomains

AllowPublicUsers.description: When set to True users will be potentially allowed to communicate with users who have accounts on public IM and presence providers.
AllowPublicUsers.title: AllowPublicUsers

AllowTeamsConsumer.description: Allows federation with people using Teams with an account that's not managed by an organization.
AllowTeamsConsumer.title: AllowTeamsConsumer

AllowTeamsConsumerInbound.description: Allows people using Teams with an account that's not managed by an organization, to discover and start communication with users in your organization.
AllowTeamsConsumerInbound.title: AllowTeamsConsumerInbound

ExternalAccessWithTrialTenants.description: When set to Blocked, all external access with users from Teams subscriptions that contain only trial licenses will be blocked. This means users from these trial-only tenants will not be able to reach to your users via chats, Teams calls, and meetings (using the users authenticated identity) and your users will not be able to reach users in these trial-only tenants. If this setting is set to Blocked, users from the trial-only tenant will also be removed from existing chats.
ExternalAccessWithTrialTenants.title: ExternalAccessWithTrialTenants

TreatDiscoveredPartnersAsUnverified.description: When set to True, messages sent from discovered partners are considered unverified. That means that those messages will be delivered only if they were sent from a person who is on the recipient's Contacts list.
TreatDiscoveredPartnersAsUnverified.title: TreatDiscoveredPartnersAsUnverified

SharedSipAddressSpace.description: When set to True, indicates that the users homed on Skype for Business Online use the same SIP domain as users homed on the on-premises version of Skype for Business Server.
SharedSipAddressSpace.title: SharedSipAddressSpace

RestrictTeamsConsumerToExternalUserProfi.description: When set to True, Teamsconsumer have access only to external user profiles
RestrictTeamsConsumerToExternalUserProfi.title: RestrictTeamsConsumerToExternalUserProfiles

Identity.description: Specify the name of the Teams Feedback Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

UserInitiatedMode.description: Specifies if users are allowed to give feedback.
UserInitiatedMode.title: UserInitiatedMode

ReceiveSurveysMode.description: Specifies if users are allowed to receive the survey.
ReceiveSurveysMode.title: ReceiveSurveysMode

AllowScreenshotCollection.description: Specifies if Screenshot Collection is enabled or not.
AllowScreenshotCollection.title: AllowScreenshotCollection

AllowEmailCollection.description: Specifies if Email Collection is enabled or not.
AllowEmailCollection.title: AllowEmailCollection

AllowLogCollection.description: Specifies if Log Collection is enabled or not.
AllowLogCollection.title: AllowLogCollection

EnableFeatureSuggestions.description: Specifies if users are allowed to provide feature suggestions
EnableFeatureSuggestions.title: EnableFeatureSuggestions

Ensure.description: Present ensures the instance exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Identity.description: Specifies the policy instance name
Identity.title: Identity

NativeFileEntryPoints.description: Specifies whether users see the options to upload files from OneDrive for Business, other cloud storage services configured for the user account, and SharePoint Online
NativeFileEntryPoints.title: NativeFileEntryPoints

SPChannelFilesTab.description: Specifies whether users see the Teams Files channel tab in any channel or in Teams chat.
SPChannelFilesTab.title: SPChannelFilesTab

Ensure.description: Present ensures the instance exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.grouppolicyassignment.description: This resource is used to assign Teams policy to a specified group
microsoft.teams.grouppolicyassignment.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.grouppolicyassignment

GroupDisplayName.description: Group Displayname of the group the policies are assigned to
GroupDisplayName.title: GroupDisplayName

PolicyType.description: Teams PolicyType. The type of the policy to be assigned. Possible values:
PolicyType.title: PolicyType

PolicyName.description: Teams PolicyName. The name of the policy to be assigned.
PolicyName.title: PolicyName

Priority.description: Teams Priority. The rank of the policy assignment, relative to other group policy assignments for the same policy type
Priority.title: Priority

Ensure.description: Present ensures the group policy assignment exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.guestcallingconfiguratio.description:
This resource is used to configure the Teams guest calling configuration.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-guests
microsoft.teams.guestcallingconfiguratio.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.guestcallingconfiguration

Identity.description: The only valid input is Global - the tenant wide configuration
Identity.title: Identity

AllowPrivateCalling.description: Designates whether guests who have been enabled for Teams can use calling functionality. If $false, guests cannot call.
AllowPrivateCalling.title: AllowPrivateCalling

microsoft.teams.guestmeetingconfiguratio.description:
This resource is used to configure the Teams Guest Meetings Configuration.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-guests
microsoft.teams.guestmeetingconfiguratio.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.guestmeetingconfiguration

Identity.description: The only valid input is Global - the tenant wide configuration
Identity.title: Identity

AllowIPVideo.description: Determines whether video is enabled in a user's meetings or calls. Set this to TRUE to allow guests to share their video. Set this to FALSE to prohibit guests from sharing their video.
AllowIPVideo.title: AllowIPVideo

LiveCaptionsEnabledType.description: Determines whether real-time captions are available for guests in Teams meetings.
LiveCaptionsEnabledType.title: LiveCaptionsEnabledType

ScreenSharingMode.description: Determines the mode in which guests can share a screen in calls or meetings. Set this to SingleApplication to allow the user to share an application at a given point in time. Set this to EntireScreen to allow the user to share anything on their screens. Set this to Disabled to prohibit the user from sharing their screens.
ScreenSharingMode.title: ScreenSharingMode

AllowMeetNow.description: Determines whether guests can start ad-hoc meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow guests to start ad-hoc meetings. Set this to FALSE to prohibit guests from starting ad-hoc meetings.
AllowMeetNow.title: AllowMeetNow

AllowTranscription.description: Determines whether guests can enable post-meeting captions and transcriptions in meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowTranscription.title: AllowTranscription

microsoft.teams.guestmessagingconfigurat.description:
This resource is used to configure the Teams Guest Messaging Configuration.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-guests
microsoft.teams.guestmessagingconfigurat.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.guestmessagingconfiguration

Identity.description: The only valid input is Global - the tenant wide configuration
Identity.title: Identity

AllowUserEditMessage.description: Determines if a user is allowed to edit their own messages.
AllowUserEditMessage.title: AllowUserEditMessage

AllowUserDeleteMessage.description: Determines if a user is allowed to delete their own messages.
AllowUserDeleteMessage.title: AllowUserDeleteMessage

AllowUserChat.description: Determines if a user is allowed to chat.
AllowUserChat.title: AllowUserChat

AllowUserDeleteChat.description: Turn this setting on to allow users to permanently delete their one-on-one chat, group chat, and meeting chat as participants (this deletes the chat only for them, not other users in the chat).
AllowUserDeleteChat.title: AllowUserDeleteChat

GiphyRatingType.description: Determines Giphy content restrictions. Default value is Moderate, other options are Strict and NoRestriction.
GiphyRatingType.title: GiphyRatingType

AllowMemes.description: Determines if memes are available for use.
AllowMemes.title: AllowMemes

AllowStickers.description: Determines if stickers are available for use.
AllowStickers.title: AllowStickers

AllowGiphy.description: Determines if Giphy are available for use.
AllowGiphy.title: AllowGiphy

AllowImmersiveReader.description: Determines if Immersive Reader is enabled.
AllowImmersiveReader.title: AllowImmersiveReader

microsoft.teams.ipphonepolicy.description: New-CsTeamsIPPhonePolicy allows you to create a policy to manage features related to Teams phone experiences. Teams phone policies determine the features that are available to users.
microsoft.teams.ipphonepolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.ipphonepolicy

Identity.description: Specifies the policy instance name
Identity.title: Identity

AllowBetterTogether.description: Determines whether Better Together mode is enabled, phones can lock and unlock in an integrated fashion when connected to their Windows PC running a 64-bit Teams desktop client.
AllowBetterTogether.title: AllowBetterTogether

AllowHomeScreen.description: Determines whether the Home Screen feature of the Teams IP Phones is enabled.
AllowHomeScreen.title: AllowHomeScreen

AllowHotDesking.description: Determines whether hot desking mode is enabled.
AllowHotDesking.title: AllowHotDesking

Description.description: Specifies the description of the policy
Description.title: Description

HotDeskingIdleTimeoutInMinutes.description: Determines the idle timeout value in minutes for the signed in user account. When the timeout is reached, the account is logged out.
HotDeskingIdleTimeoutInMinutes.title: HotDeskingIdleTimeoutInMinutes

SearchOnCommonAreaPhoneMode.description: Determines whether a user can search the Global Address List in Common Area Phone Mode.
SearchOnCommonAreaPhoneMode.title: SearchOnCommonAreaPhoneMode

SignInMode.description: Determines the sign in mode for the device when signing in to Teams.
SignInMode.title: SignInMode

Ensure.description: Present ensures the instance exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.meetingbroadcastconfigur.description:
This resource is used to configure the Teams Meeting Broadcast Settings.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-live-events/configure-teams-live-events
microsoft.teams.meetingbroadcastconfigur.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.meetingbroadcastconfiguration

Identity.description: The only valid input is Global - the tenant wide configuration
Identity.title: Identity

SupportURL.description: Specifies a URL where broadcast event attendees can find support information or FAQs specific to that event. The URL will be displayed to the attendees during the broadcast.
SupportURL.title: SupportURL

AllowSdnProviderForBroadcastMeeting.description: If set to $true, Teams meeting broadcast streams are enabled to take advantage of the network and bandwidth management capabilities of your Software Defined Network (SDN) provider.
AllowSdnProviderForBroadcastMeeting.title: AllowSdnProviderForBroadcastMeeting

SdnProviderName.description: Specifies the Software Defined Network (SDN) provider's name. This parameter is only required if AllowSdnProviderForBroadcastMeeting is set to $true.
SdnProviderName.title: SdnProviderName

SdnLicenseId.description: Specifies the Software Defined Network (SDN) license identifier. This is required and provided by some SDN providers. This parameter is only required if AllowSdnProviderForBroadcastMeeting is set to $true.
SdnLicenseId.title: SdnLicenseId

SdnApiTemplateUrl.description: Specifies the Software Defined Network (SDN) provider's HTTP API endpoint. This information is provided to you by the SDN provider. This parameter is only required if AllowSdnProviderForBroadcastMeeting is set to $true.
SdnApiTemplateUrl.title: SdnApiTemplateUrl

SdnApiToken.description: Specifies the Software Defined Network (SDN) provider's authentication token which is required to use their SDN license. This is required by some SDN providers who will give you the required token. This parameter is only required if AllowSdnProviderForBroadcastMeeting is set to $true.
SdnApiToken.title: SdnApiToken

microsoft.teams.meetingbroadcastpolicy.description:
This resource is used to configure the Teams Meeting Broadcast Policies.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-live-events/set-up-for-teams-live-events
microsoft.teams.meetingbroadcastpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.meetingbroadcastpolicy

Identity.description: The identifier of the Teams Meeting Broadcast Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

AllowBroadcastScheduling.description: Specifies whether this user can create broadcast events in Teams. This setting impacts broadcasts that use both self-service and external encoder production methods.
AllowBroadcastScheduling.title: AllowBroadcastScheduling

AllowBroadcastTranscription.description: Specifies whether real-time transcription and translation can be enabled in the broadcast event. Note: this setting is applicable to broadcast events that use Teams Meeting production only and does not apply when external encoder is used as production method.
AllowBroadcastTranscription.title: AllowBroadcastTranscription

BroadcastAttendeeVisibilityMode.description: Specifies the attendee visibility mode of the broadcast events created by this user.  This setting controls who can watch the broadcast event - e.g. anyone can watch this event including anonymous users or only authenticated users in my company can watch the event.  Note: this setting is applicable to broadcast events that use Teams Meeting production only and does not apply when external encoder is used as production method.
BroadcastAttendeeVisibilityMode.title: BroadcastAttendeeVisibilityMode

BroadcastRecordingMode.description: Specifies whether broadcast events created by this user are always recorded, never recorded or user can choose whether to record or not. Note: this setting is applicable to broadcast events that use Teams Meeting production only and does not apply when external encoder is used as production method.
BroadcastRecordingMode.title: BroadcastRecordingMode

Ensure.description: Present ensures the Policy exists, absent ensures it is removed
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.meetingconfiguration.description:
This resource is used to configure the Teams Meeting Configuration.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/meeting-settings-in-teams
microsoft.teams.meetingconfiguration.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.meetingconfiguration

Identity.description: The only valid input is Global - the tenant wide configuration
Identity.title: Identity

LogoURL.description: URL to a logo image. This would be included in the meeting invite. Please ensure this URL is publicly accessible for invites that go beyond your federation boundaries.
LogoURL.title: LogoURL

LegalURL.description: URL to a website containing legal information and meeting disclaimers. This would be included in the meeting invite. Please ensure this URL is publicly accessible for invites that go beyond your federation boundaries.
LegalURL.title: LegalURL

HelpURL.description: URL to a website where users can obtain assistance on joining the meeting.This would be included in the meeting invite. Please ensure this URL is publicly accessible for invites that go beyond your federation boundaries.
HelpURL.title: HelpURL

CustomFooterText.description: Text to be used on custom meeting invitations.
CustomFooterText.title: CustomFooterText

DisableAnonymousJoin.description: Determines whether anonymous users are blocked from joining meetings in the tenant. Set this to TRUE to block anonymous users from joining. Set this to FALSE to allow anonymous users to join meetings.
DisableAnonymousJoin.title: DisableAnonymousJoin

EnableQoS.description: Determines whether Quality of Service Marking for real-time media (audio, video, screen/app sharing) is enabled in the tenant. Set this to TRUE to enable and FALSE to disable.
EnableQoS.title: EnableQoS

ClientAudioPort.description: Determines the starting port number for client audio. Minimum allowed value: 1024 Maximum allowed value: 65535 Default value: 50000.
ClientAudioPort.title: ClientAudioPort

ClientAudioPortRange.description: Determines the total number of ports available for client audio. Default value is 20.
ClientAudioPortRange.title: ClientAudioPortRange

ClientVideoPort.description: Determines the starting port number for client video. Minimum allowed value: 1024 Maximum allowed value: 65535 Default value: 50020.
ClientVideoPort.title: ClientVideoPort

ClientVideoPortRange.description: Determines the total number of ports available for client video. Default value is 20.
ClientVideoPortRange.title: ClientVideoPortRange

ClientAppSharingPort.description: Determines the starting port number for client screen sharing or application sharing. Minimum allowed value: 1024 Maximum allowed value: 65535 Default value: 50040.
ClientAppSharingPort.title: ClientAppSharingPort

ClientMediaPortRangeEnabled.description: Determines whether custom media port and range selections need to be enforced. When set to True, clients will use the specified port range for media traffic. When set to False (the default value) for any available port (from port 1024 through port 65535) will be used to accommodate media traffic.
ClientMediaPortRangeEnabled.title: ClientMediaPortRangeEnabled

ClientAppSharingPortRange.description: Determines the total number of ports available for client sharing or application sharing. Default value is 20.
ClientAppSharingPortRange.title: ClientAppSharingPortRange

microsoft.teams.meetingpolicy.description:
This resource configures the Teams Meeting Policies.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/meeting-policies-overview
microsoft.teams.meetingpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.meetingpolicy

Identity.description: Identity of the Teams Meeting Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

Description.description: Description of the Teams Meeting Policy.
Description.title: Description

AllowChannelMeetingScheduling.description: Determines whether a user can schedule channel meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow a user to schedule channel meetings. Set this to FALSE to prohibit the user from scheduling channel meetings. Note this only restricts from scheduling and not from joining a meeting scheduled by another user.
AllowChannelMeetingScheduling.title: AllowChannelMeetingScheduling

AllowMeetNow.description: Determines whether a user can start ad-hoc meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow a user to start ad-hoc meetings. Set this to FALSE to prohibit the user from starting ad-hoc meetings.
AllowMeetNow.title: AllowMeetNow

AllowPrivateMeetNow.description: Determines whether a user can start private ad-hoc meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow a user to start private ad-hoc meetings. Set this to FALSE to prohibit the user from starting private ad-hoc meetings.
AllowPrivateMeetNow.title: AllowPrivateMeetNow

MeetingChatEnabledType.description: Determines whether or not Chat will be enabled, enabled except anonymous or disabled for meetings.
MeetingChatEnabledType.title: MeetingChatEnabledType

LiveCaptionsEnabledType.description: Determines whether a user should have the option to view live captions or not in a meeting.
LiveCaptionsEnabledType.title: LiveCaptionsEnabledType

AllowIPAudio.description: Determines whether audio is enabled in a user's meetings or calls. Set this to TRUE to allow the user to share their audioo. Set this to FALSE to prohibit the user from sharing their audio.
AllowIPAudio.title: AllowIPAudio

AllowIPVideo.description: Determines whether video is enabled in a user's meetings or calls. Set this to TRUE to allow the user to share their video. Set this to FALSE to prohibit the user from sharing their video.
AllowIPVideo.title: AllowIPVideo

AllowEngagementReport.description: Determines whether or not a meeting Organizer can track join and leave times for all users within their meetings as well as download a roster.
AllowEngagementReport.title: AllowEngagementReport

IPAudioMode.description: Determines whether or not a user can use audio in a meeting that supports it.
IPAudioMode.title: IPAudioMode

IPVideoMode.description: Determines whether or not a user can use video in a meeting that supports it.  Can only be enabled if IPAudioMode is enabled
IPVideoMode.title: IPVideoMode

AllowAnonymousUsersToDialOut.description: CURRENTLY DISABLED: Determines whether anonymous users can use the Call Me At feature for meeting audio.
AllowAnonymousUsersToDialOut.title: AllowAnonymousUsersToDialOut

AllowAnonymousUsersToStartMeeting.description: Determines whether anonymous users can initiate a meeting. Set this to TRUE to allow anonymous users to initiate a meeting. Set this to FALSE to prohibit them from initiating a meeting.
AllowAnonymousUsersToStartMeeting.title: AllowAnonymousUsersToStartMeeting

AllowPrivateMeetingScheduling.description: Determines whether a user can schedule private meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow a user to schedule private meetings. Set this to FALSE to prohibit the user from scheduling private meetings. Note this only restricts from scheduling and not from joining a meeting scheduled by another user.
AllowPrivateMeetingScheduling.title: AllowPrivateMeetingScheduling

AutoAdmittedUsers.description: Determines what types of participants will automatically be added to meetings organized by this user. Set this to EveryoneInCompany if you would like meetings to place every external user in the lobby but allow all users in the company to join the meeting immediately. Set this to Everyone if you'd like to admit anonymous users by default. Set this to EveryoneInSameAndFederatedCompany if you would like meetings to allow federated users to join like your company's users, but place all other external users in a lobby. Set this to InvitedUsers if you would like meetings to allow only the invited users.
AutoAdmittedUsers.title: AutoAdmittedUsers

AllowPSTNUsersToBypassLobby.description: Determines whether PSTN users should be automatically admitted to the meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow the PSTN user to be able bypass the meetinglobby. Set this to FALSE to prohibit the PSTN user from bypassing the meetinglobby.
AllowPSTNUsersToBypassLobby.title: AllowPSTNUsersToBypassLobby

AllowCloudRecording.description: Determines whether cloud recording is allowed in a user's meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow the user to be able to record meetings. Set this to FALSE to prohibit the user from recording meetings.
AllowCloudRecording.title: AllowCloudRecording

AllowRecordingStorageOutsideRegion.description: Determines whether cloud recording can be stored out of region for go-local tenants where recording is not yet enabled.
AllowRecordingStorageOutsideRegion.title: AllowRecordingStorageOutsideRegion

DesignatedPresenterRoleMode.description: Determines if users can change the default value of the Who can present? setting in Meeting options in the Teams client. This policy setting affects all meetings, including Meet Now meetings.
DesignatedPresenterRoleMode.title: DesignatedPresenterRoleMode

AllowOutlookAddIn.description: Determines whether a user can schedule Teams Meetings in Outlook desktop client. Set this to TRUE to allow the user to be able to schedule Teams meetings in Outlook client. Set this to FALSE to prohibit a user from scheduling Teams meeting in Outlook client.
AllowOutlookAddIn.title: AllowOutlookAddIn

AllowPowerPointSharing.description: Determines whether Powerpoint sharing is allowed in a user's meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowPowerPointSharing.title: AllowPowerPointSharing

AllowParticipantGiveRequestControl.description: Determines whether participants can request or give control of screen sharing during meetings scheduled by this user. Set this to TRUE to allow the user to be able to give or request control. Set this to FALSE to prohibit the user from giving, requesting control in a meeting.
AllowParticipantGiveRequestControl.title: AllowParticipantGiveRequestControl

AllowExternalParticipantGiveRequestContr.description: Determines whether external participants can request or give control of screen sharing during meetings scheduled by this user. Set this to TRUE to allow the user to be able to give or request control. Set this to FALSE to prohibit an external user from giving or requesting control in a meeting.
AllowExternalParticipantGiveRequestContr.title: AllowExternalParticipantGiveRequestControl

AllowSharedNotes.description: Determines whether users are allowed to take shared notes. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowSharedNotes.title: AllowSharedNotes

AllowWhiteboard.description: Determines whether whiteboard is allowed in a user's meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowWhiteboard.title: AllowWhiteboard

AllowTranscription.description: Determines whether real-time and/or post-meeting captions and transcriptions are allowed in a user's meetings. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowTranscription.title: AllowTranscription

MediaBitRateKb.description: Determines the media bit rate for audio/video/app sharing transmissions in meetings.
MediaBitRateKb.title: MediaBitRateKb

ScreenSharingMode.description: Determines the mode in which a user can share a screen in calls or meetings. Set this to SingleApplication to allow the user to share an application at a given point in time. Set this to EntireScreen to allow the user to share anything on their screens. Set this to Disabled to prohibit the user from sharing their screens.
ScreenSharingMode.title: ScreenSharingMode

VideoFiltersMode.description: Determines which background filters are available to meeting attendees.
VideoFiltersMode.title: VideoFiltersMode

AllowOrganizersToOverrideLobbySettings.description: Determines whether organizers can override lobby settings for both VOIP and PSTN. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowOrganizersToOverrideLobbySettings.title: AllowOrganizersToOverrideLobbySettings

PreferredMeetingProviderForIslandsMode.description: Determines which Outlook Add-in the user will get as preferred Meeting provider(TeamsAndSfb or Teams).
PreferredMeetingProviderForIslandsMode.title: PreferredMeetingProviderForIslandsMode

AllowNDIStreaming.description: Determines whether a user is able to use NDI (Network Device Interface) in meetings - both for output and input streams.
AllowNDIStreaming.title: AllowNDIStreaming

AllowUserToJoinExternalMeeting.description: Determines what types of external meetings users can join. Enabled is able join all external meetings.
AllowUserToJoinExternalMeeting.title: AllowUserToJoinExternalMeeting

EnrollUserOverride.description: Determines whether or not users will be able to enroll/capture their Biometric data: Face & Voice.
EnrollUserOverride.title: EnrollUserOverride

RoomAttributeUserOverride.description: Determines whether or not biometric data will be used to distinguish and or attribute in the transcript.
RoomAttributeUserOverride.title: RoomAttributeUserOverride

StreamingAttendeeMode.description: Determines whether or not meetings created by users with this policy are able to utilize the meeting overflow capability.
StreamingAttendeeMode.title: StreamingAttendeeMode

TeamsCameraFarEndPTZMode.description: Determines whether or not meetings created by users with this policy are able to utilize the Camera Far-End PTZ Mode.
TeamsCameraFarEndPTZMode.title: TeamsCameraFarEndPTZMode

AllowMeetingReactions.description: Determines whether or not meetings created by users with this policy are able to utilize the Meeting Reactions feature.
AllowMeetingReactions.title: AllowMeetingReactions

WhoCanRegister.description: Specifies who can attend and register for webinars.
WhoCanRegister.title: WhoCanRegister

AllowAnonymousUsersToJoinMeeting.description: Determines whether anonymous users can join the meetings that impacted users organize. Set this to TRUE to allow anonymous users to join a meeting. Set this to FALSE to prohibit them from joining a meeting.
AllowAnonymousUsersToJoinMeeting.title: AllowAnonymousUsersToJoinMeeting

AllowMeetingRegistration.description: Controls if a user can create a webinar meeting. The default value is True.
AllowMeetingRegistration.title: AllowMeetingRegistration

AllowNetworkConfigurationSettingsLookup.description: Determines whether network configuration setting lookups can be made by users who are not Enterprise Voice enabled. It is used to enable Network Roaming policies.
AllowNetworkConfigurationSettingsLookup.title: AllowNetworkConfigurationSettingsLookup

NewMeetingRecordingExpirationDays.description: Specifies the number of days before meeting recordings will expire and move to the recycle bin. Value can be from 1 to 99,999 days. NOTE: You may opt to set Meeting Recordings to never expire by entering the value -1.
NewMeetingRecordingExpirationDays.title: NewMeetingRecordingExpirationDays

AllowCartCaptionsScheduling.description: Determines whether a user can add a URL for captions from a Communications Access Real-Time Translation (CART) captioner for providing real-time captions in meetings.
AllowCartCaptionsScheduling.title: AllowCartCaptionsScheduling

BlockedAnonymousJoinClientTypes.description: A user can join a Teams meeting anonymously using a Teams client or using a custom application built using Azure Communication Services. When anonymous meeting join is enabled, both types of clients may be used by default. This optional parameter can be used to block one of the client types that can be used. The allowed values are ACS (to block the use of Azure Communication Services clients) or Teams (to block the use of Teams clients). Both can also be specified, separated by a comma, but this is equivalent to disabling anonymous join completely.
BlockedAnonymousJoinClientTypes.title: BlockedAnonymousJoinClientTypes

ChannelRecordingDownload.description: Determines how channel meeting recordings are saved, permissioned, and who can download them.
ChannelRecordingDownload.title: ChannelRecordingDownload

LiveInterpretationEnabledType.description: Determines how meeting organizers can configure a meeting for language interpretation, select attendees of the meeting to become interpreters that other attendees can select and listen to the real-time translation they provide.
LiveInterpretationEnabledType.title: LiveInterpretationEnabledType

LiveStreamingMode.description: Determines whether you provide support for your users to stream their Teams meetings to large audiences through Real-Time Messaging Protocol (RTMP).
LiveStreamingMode.title: LiveStreamingMode

MeetingInviteLanguages.description: Controls how the join information in meeting invitations is displayed by enforcing a common language or enabling up to two languages to be displayed. Note: All Teams supported languages can be specified using language codes.
MeetingInviteLanguages.title: MeetingInviteLanguages

Ensure.description: Present ensures the policy exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.messagingpolicy.description:
This resource is used to configure the Teams messaging policy.

More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/messaging-policies-in-teams
microsoft.teams.messagingpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.messagingpolicy

Identity.description: Identity for the teams messaging policy you're modifying. To modify the global policy, use this syntax: -Identity global. To modify a per-user policy, use syntax similar to this: -Identity TeamsMessagingPolicy.
Identity.title: Identity

AllowFluidCollaborate.description: Determines is Fluid Collaboration should be enabled or not.
AllowFluidCollaborate.title: AllowFluidCollaborate

AllowGiphy.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to access and post Giphys. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowGiphy.title: AllowGiphy

AllowMemes.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to access and post memes. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowMemes.title: AllowMemes

AllowOwnerDeleteMessage.description: Determines whether owners are allowed to delete all the messages in their team. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowOwnerDeleteMessage.title: AllowOwnerDeleteMessage

AllowUserEditMessage.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to edit their own messages. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowUserEditMessage.title: AllowUserEditMessage

AllowSmartCompose.description: Turn on this setting to let a user get text predictions for chat messages.
AllowSmartCompose.title: AllowSmartCompose

AllowSmartReply.description: Turn this setting on to enable suggested replies for chat messages. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowSmartReply.title: AllowSmartReply

AllowStickers.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to access and post stickers. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowStickers.title: AllowStickers

AllowUrlPreviews.description: Use this setting to turn automatic URL previewing on or off in messages. Set this to TRUE to turn on. Set this to FALSE to turn off.
AllowUrlPreviews.title: AllowUrlPreviews

AllowUserChat.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to chat. Set this to TRUE to allow a user to chat across private chat, group chat and in meetings. Set this to FALSE to prohibit all chat.
AllowUserChat.title: AllowUserChat

AllowUserDeleteMessage.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to delete their own messages. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowUserDeleteMessage.title: AllowUserDeleteMessage

AllowUserTranslation.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to translate messages to their client languages. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this to FALSE to prohibit.
AllowUserTranslation.title: AllowUserTranslation

AllowImmersiveReader.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to use Immersive Reader for reading conversation messages. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowImmersiveReader.title: AllowImmersiveReader

AllowRemoveUser.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to remove a user from a conversation. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowRemoveUser.title: AllowRemoveUser

AllowPriorityMessages.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to send priorities messages. Set this to TRUE to allow. Set this FALSE to prohibit.
AllowPriorityMessages.title: AllowPriorityMessages

AllowUserDeleteChat.description: Turn this setting on to allow users to permanently delete their 1:1, group chat, and meeting chat as participants (this deletes the chat only for them, not other users in the chat).
AllowUserDeleteChat.title: AllowUserDeleteChat

AllowVideoMessages.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to send video messages in Chat. Set this to TRUE to allow a user to send video messages. Set this to FALSE to prohibit sending video messages.
AllowVideoMessages.title: AllowVideoMessages

Description.description: Provide a description of your policy to identify purpose of creating it.
Description.title: Description

GiphyRatingType.description: Determines the Giphy content restrictions applicable to a user. Set this to STRICT, MODERATE or NORESTRICTION.
GiphyRatingType.title: GiphyRatingType

ReadReceiptsEnabledType.description: Use this setting to specify whether read receipts are user controlled, enabled for everyone, or disabled. Set this to UserPreference, Everyone or None.
ReadReceiptsEnabledType.title: ReadReceiptsEnabledType

AudioMessageEnabledType.description: Determines whether a user is allowed to send audio messages. Possible values are: ChatsAndChannels,ChatsOnly,Disabled.
AudioMessageEnabledType.title: AudioMessageEnabledType

Tenant.description: Globally unique identifier (GUID) of the tenant account whose external user communication policy are being created.
Tenant.title: Tenant

Ensure.description: Present ensures the Team Message Policy exists, absent ensures it is removed
Ensure.title: Ensure

Identity.description: Specify the name of the Teams Mobility Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

Description.description: Enables administrators to provide explanatory text about the policy. For example, the Description might indicate the users the policy should be assigned to.
Description.title: Description

IPAudioMobileMode.description: When set to WifiOnly, prohibits the user from making and receiving calls or joining meetings using VoIP calls on the mobile device while on a cellular data connection. Possible values are: WifiOnly, AllNetworks.
IPAudioMobileMode.title: IPAudioMobileMode

IPVideoMobileMode.description: When set to WifiOnly, prohibits the user from making and receiving video calls or enabling video in meetings using VoIP calls on the mobile device while on a cellular data connection. Possible values are: WifiOnly, AllNetworks.
IPVideoMobileMode.title: IPVideoMobileMode

MobileDialerPreference.description: Determines the mobile dialer preference, possible values are: Teams, Native, UserOverride.
MobileDialerPreference.title: MobileDialerPreference

Identity.description: Specify the name of the Teams Network Roaming Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

AllowIPVideo.description: Determines whether video is enabled in a user's meetings or calls. Set this to TRUE to allow the user to share their video. Set this to FALSE to prohibit the user from sharing their video.
AllowIPVideo.title: AllowIPVideo

Description.description: Description of the new policy to be created.
Description.title: Description

MediaBitRateKb.description: Determines the media bit rate for audio/video/app sharing transmissions in meetings.
MediaBitRateKb.title: MediaBitRateKb

microsoft.teams.onlinevoicemailpolicy.description:
This resource configures the Teams Online Voicemail Policies.

More information: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-voicemail-policies
microsoft.teams.onlinevoicemailpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.onlinevoicemailpolicy

Identity.description: Identity of the Teams Online Voicemail Policy.
Identity.title: Identity

EnableEditingCallAnswerRulesSetting.description: Controls if editing call answer rule settings are enabled or disabled for a user. Possible values are $true or $false.
EnableEditingCallAnswerRulesSetting.title: EnableEditingCallAnswerRulesSetting

EnableTranscription.description: Allows you to disable or enable voicemail transcription. Possible values are $true or $false.
EnableTranscription.title: EnableTranscription

EnableTranscriptionProfanityMasking.description: Allows you to disable or enable profanity masking for the voicemail transcriptions. Possible values are $true or $false.
EnableTranscriptionProfanityMasking.title: EnableTranscriptionProfanityMasking

EnableTranscriptionTranslation.description: Allows you to disable or enable translation for the voicemail transcriptions. Possible values are $true or $false.
EnableTranscriptionTranslation.title: EnableTranscriptionTranslation

MaximumRecordingLength.description: A duration of voicemail maximum recording length. The length should be between 30 seconds to 600 seconds.
MaximumRecordingLength.title: MaximumRecordingLength

PrimarySystemPromptLanguage.description: The primary (or first) language that voicemail system prompts will be presented in. Must also set SecondarySystemPromptLanguage. When set, this overrides the user language choice.
PrimarySystemPromptLanguage.title: PrimarySystemPromptLanguage

SecondarySystemPromptLanguage.description: The secondary language that voicemail system prompts will be presented in. Must also set PrimarySystemPromptLanguage and may not be the same value as PrimarySystemPromptanguage. When set, this overrides the user language choice.
SecondarySystemPromptLanguage.title: SecondarySystemPromptLanguage

ShareData.description: Specifies whether voicemail and transcription data are shared with the service for training and improving accuracy. Possible values are Defer and Deny.
ShareData.title: ShareData

Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.onlinevoicemailusersetti.description: This resource configures a Teams User's Online Voicemail Settings.
microsoft.teams.onlinevoicemailusersetti.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.onlinevoicemailusersettings

Identity.description: The Identity parameter represents the ID of the specific user in your organization; this can be either a SIP URI or an Object ID.
Identity.title: Identity

CallAnswerRule.description: The CallAnswerRule parameter represents the value of the call answer rule, which can be any of the following: DeclineCall, PromptOnly, PromptOnlyWithTransfer, RegularVoicemail, VoicemailWithTransferOption.
CallAnswerRule.title: CallAnswerRule

DefaultGreetingPromptOverwrite.description: The DefaultGreetingPromptOverwrite parameter represents the contents that overwrite the default normal greeting prompt. If the user's normal custom greeting is not set and DefaultGreetingPromptOverwrite is not empty, the voicemail service will play this overwrite greeting instead of the default normal greeting in the voicemail deposit scenario.
DefaultGreetingPromptOverwrite.title: DefaultGreetingPromptOverwrite

DefaultOofGreetingPromptOverwrite.description: The DefaultOofGreetingPromptOverwrite parameter represents the contents that overwrite the default out-of-office greeting prompt. If the user's out-of-office custom greeting is not set and DefaultOofGreetingPromptOverwrite is not empty, the voicemail service will play this overwrite greeting instead of the default out-of-office greeting in the voicemail deposit scenario.
DefaultOofGreetingPromptOverwrite.title: DefaultOofGreetingPromptOverwrite

OofGreetingEnabled.description: The OofGreetingEnabled parameter represents whether to play out-of-office greeting in voicemail deposit scenario.
OofGreetingEnabled.title: OofGreetingEnabled

OofGreetingFollowAutomaticRepliesEnabled.description: The OofGreetingFollowAutomaticRepliesEnabled parameter represents whether to play out-of-office greeting in voicemail deposit scenario when user set automatic replies in Outlook.
OofGreetingFollowAutomaticRepliesEnabled.title: OofGreetingFollowAutomaticRepliesEnabled

OofGreetingFollowCalendarEnabled.description: The OofGreetingFollowCalendarEnabled parameter represents whether to play out-of-office greeting in voicemail deposit scenario when user set out-of-office in calendar.
OofGreetingFollowCalendarEnabled.title: OofGreetingFollowCalendarEnabled

PromptLanguage.description: The PromptLanguage parameter represents the language that is used to play voicemail prompts.
PromptLanguage.title: PromptLanguage

ShareData.description: Specifies whether voicemail and transcription data is shared with the service for training and improving accuracy.
ShareData.title: ShareData

TransferTarget.description: The TransferTarget parameter represents the target to transfer the call when call answer rule set to PromptOnlyWithTransfer or VoicemailWithTransferOption. Value of this parameter should be a SIP URI of another user in your organization. For user with Enterprise Voice enabled, a valid telephone number could also be accepted as TransferTarget.
TransferTarget.title: TransferTarget

VoicemailEnabled.description: The VoicemailEnabled parameter represents whether to enable voicemail service. If set to $false, the user has no voicemail service.
VoicemailEnabled.title: VoicemailEnabled

Ensure.description: Present ensures the policy exists, absent ensures it is removed.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.teams.onlinevoiceuser.title: Schema for microsoft.teams.onlinevoiceuser

TelephoneNumber.description: Specifies the telephone number to be assigned to the user. The value must be in E.164 format: +14255043920. Setting the value to $Null clears the user's telephone number.
TelephoneNumber.title: TelephoneNumber

IsSideloadedAppsInteractionEnabled.title: IsSideloadedAppsInteractionEnabled

Identity.title: Identity

AccessGracePeriodMinutes.title: AccessGracePeriodMinutes

AccessType.description: Determines the Teams access type granted to the user. Today, only unrestricted access to Teams app is supported.
AccessType.title: AccessType

EnableScheduleOwnerPermissions.description: Determines whether a user can manage a Shifts schedule as a team member.
EnableScheduleOwnerPermissions.title: EnableScheduleOwnerPermissions

EnableShiftPresence.description: Determines whether a user is given shift-based presence (On shift, Off shift, or Busy). This must be set in order to have any off shift warning message-specific settings.
EnableShiftPresence.title: EnableShiftPresence

ShiftNoticeFrequency.description: Determines the frequency of warning dialog displayed when user opens Teams.
ShiftNoticeFrequency.title: ShiftNoticeFrequency

ShiftNoticeMessageCustom.description: Specifies a custom message. Must set ShiftNoticeMessageType to 'CustomMessage' to enforce this
ShiftNoticeMessageCustom.title: ShiftNoticeMessageCustom
