microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationendp.title: Schema for microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationendpointprotectionpolicywindows10

ApplicationGuardAllowCameraMicrophoneRed.description: Gets or sets whether applications inside Microsoft Defender Application Guard can access the devices camera and microphone.
ApplicationGuardAllowCameraMicrophoneRed.title: ApplicationGuardAllowCameraMicrophoneRedirection

ApplicationGuardAllowFileSaveOnHost.description: Allow users to download files from Edge in the application guard container and save them on the host file system
ApplicationGuardAllowFileSaveOnHost.title: ApplicationGuardAllowFileSaveOnHost

ApplicationGuardAllowPersistence.description: Allow persisting user generated data inside the App Guard Container (favorites, cookies, web passwords, etc.)
ApplicationGuardAllowPersistence.title: ApplicationGuardAllowPersistence

ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToLocalPrinter.description: Allow printing to Local Printers from Container
ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToLocalPrinter.title: ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToLocalPrinters

ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToNetworkPrint.description: Allow printing to Network Printers from Container
ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToNetworkPrint.title: ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToNetworkPrinters

ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToPDF.description: Allow printing to PDF from Container
ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToPDF.title: ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToPDF

ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToXPS.description: Allow printing to XPS from Container
ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToXPS.title: ApplicationGuardAllowPrintToXPS

ApplicationGuardAllowVirtualGPU.description: Allow application guard to use virtual GPU
ApplicationGuardAllowVirtualGPU.title: ApplicationGuardAllowVirtualGPU

ApplicationGuardBlockClipboardSharing.description: Block clipboard to share data from Host to Container, or from Container to Host, or both ways, or neither ways. Possible values are: notConfigured, blockBoth, blockHostToContainer, blockContainerToHost, blockNone.
ApplicationGuardBlockClipboardSharing.title: ApplicationGuardBlockClipboardSharing

ApplicationGuardBlockFileTransfer.description: Block clipboard to transfer image file, text file or neither of them. Possible values are: notConfigured, blockImageAndTextFile, blockImageFile, blockNone, blockTextFile.
ApplicationGuardBlockFileTransfer.title: ApplicationGuardBlockFileTransfer

ApplicationGuardBlockNonEnterpriseConten.description: Block enterprise sites to load non-enterprise content, such as third party plug-ins
ApplicationGuardBlockNonEnterpriseConten.title: ApplicationGuardBlockNonEnterpriseContent

ApplicationGuardCertificateThumbprints.description: Allows certain device level Root Certificates to be shared with the Microsoft Defender Application Guard container.
ApplicationGuardCertificateThumbprints.title: ApplicationGuardCertificateThumbprints

ApplicationGuardEnabledOptions.description: Enable Windows Defender Application Guard for newer Windows builds. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabledForEdge, enabledForOffice, enabledForEdgeAndOffice.
ApplicationGuardEnabledOptions.title: ApplicationGuardEnabledOptions

ApplicationGuardForceAuditing.description: Force auditing will persist Windows logs and events to meet security/compliance criteria (sample events are user login-logoff, use of privilege rights, software installation, system changes, etc.)
ApplicationGuardForceAuditing.title: ApplicationGuardForceAuditing

AppLockerApplicationControl.description: Enables the Admin to choose what types of app to allow on devices. Possible values are: notConfigured, enforceComponentsAndStoreApps, auditComponentsAndStoreApps, enforceComponentsStoreAppsAndSmartlocker, auditComponentsStoreAppsAndSmartlocker.
AppLockerApplicationControl.title: AppLockerApplicationControl

BitLockerAllowStandardUserEncryption.description: Allows the admin to allow standard users to enable encryption during Azure AD Join.
BitLockerAllowStandardUserEncryption.title: BitLockerAllowStandardUserEncryption

BitLockerDisableWarningForOtherDiskEncry.description: Allows the Admin to disable the warning prompt for other disk encryption on the user machines.
BitLockerDisableWarningForOtherDiskEncry.title: BitLockerDisableWarningForOtherDiskEncryption

BitLockerEnableStorageCardEncryptionOnMo.description: Allows the admin to require encryption to be turned on using BitLocker. This policy is valid only for a mobile SKU.
BitLockerEnableStorageCardEncryptionOnMo.title: BitLockerEnableStorageCardEncryptionOnMobile

BitLockerEncryptDevice.description: Allows the admin to require encryption to be turned on using BitLocker.
BitLockerEncryptDevice.title: BitLockerEncryptDevice

EncryptionMethod.description: Select the encryption method for fixed drives. Possible values are: aesCbc128, aesCbc256, xtsAes128, xtsAes256.
EncryptionMethod.title: EncryptionMethod

RecoveryOptions.description: This policy setting allows you to control how BitLocker-protected fixed data drives are recovered in the absence of the required credentials. This policy setting is applied when you turn on BitLocker.
RecoveryOptions.title: RecoveryOptions

BlockDataRecoveryAgent.description: Indicates whether to block certificate-based data recovery agent.
BlockDataRecoveryAgent.title: BlockDataRecoveryAgent

EnableBitLockerAfterRecoveryInformationT.description: Indicates whether or not to enable BitLocker until recovery information is stored in AD DS.
EnableBitLockerAfterRecoveryInformationT.title: EnableBitLockerAfterRecoveryInformationToStore

EnableRecoveryInformationSaveToStore.description: Indicates whether or not to allow BitLocker recovery information to store in AD DS.
EnableRecoveryInformationSaveToStore.title: EnableRecoveryInformationSaveToStore

HideRecoveryOptions.description: Indicates whether or not to allow showing recovery options in BitLocker Setup Wizard for fixed or system disk.
HideRecoveryOptions.title: HideRecoveryOptions

RecoveryInformationToStore.description: Configure what pieces of BitLocker recovery information are stored to AD DS. Possible values are: passwordAndKey, passwordOnly.
RecoveryInformationToStore.title: RecoveryInformationToStore

RecoveryKeyUsage.description: Indicates whether users are allowed or required to generate a 256-bit recovery key for fixed or system disk. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
RecoveryKeyUsage.title: RecoveryKeyUsage

RecoveryPasswordUsage.description: Indicates whether users are allowed or required to generate a 48-digit recovery password for fixed or system disk. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
RecoveryPasswordUsage.title: RecoveryPasswordUsage

RequireEncryptionForWriteAccess.description: This policy setting determines whether BitLocker protection is required for fixed data drives to be writable on a computer.
RequireEncryptionForWriteAccess.title: RequireEncryptionForWriteAccess

BitLockerRecoveryPasswordRotation.description: This setting initiates a client-driven recovery password rotation after an OS drive recovery (either by using bootmgr or WinRE). Possible values are: notConfigured, disabled, enabledForAzureAd, enabledForAzureAdAndHybrid.
BitLockerRecoveryPasswordRotation.title: BitLockerRecoveryPasswordRotation

BlockCrossOrganizationWriteAccess.description: This policy setting determines whether BitLocker protection is required for removable data drives to be writable on a computer.
BlockCrossOrganizationWriteAccess.title: BlockCrossOrganizationWriteAccess

EncryptionMethod.description: Select the encryption method for removable  drives. Possible values are: aesCbc128, aesCbc256, xtsAes128, xtsAes256.
EncryptionMethod.title: EncryptionMethod

RequireEncryptionForWriteAccess.description: Indicates whether to block write access to devices configured in another organization.  If requireEncryptionForWriteAccess is false, this value does not affect.
RequireEncryptionForWriteAccess.title: RequireEncryptionForWriteAccess

EncryptionMethod.description: Select the encryption method for operating system drives. Possible values are: aesCbc128, aesCbc256, xtsAes128, xtsAes256.
EncryptionMethod.title: EncryptionMethod

MinimumPinLength.description: Indicates the minimum length of startup pin. Valid values 4 to 20
MinimumPinLength.title: MinimumPinLength

PrebootRecoveryEnableMessageAndUrl.description: Enable pre-boot recovery message and Url. If requireStartupAuthentication is false, this value does not affect.
PrebootRecoveryEnableMessageAndUrl.title: PrebootRecoveryEnableMessageAndUrl

RecoveryOptions.description: Allows to recover BitLocker encrypted operating system drives in the absence of the required startup key information. This policy setting is applied when you turn on BitLocker.
RecoveryOptions.title: RecoveryOptions

BlockDataRecoveryAgent.description: Indicates whether to block certificate-based data recovery agent.
BlockDataRecoveryAgent.title: BlockDataRecoveryAgent

EnableBitLockerAfterRecoveryInformationT.description: Indicates whether or not to enable BitLocker until recovery information is stored in AD DS.
EnableBitLockerAfterRecoveryInformationT.title: EnableBitLockerAfterRecoveryInformationToStore

EnableRecoveryInformationSaveToStore.description: Indicates whether or not to allow BitLocker recovery information to store in AD DS.
EnableRecoveryInformationSaveToStore.title: EnableRecoveryInformationSaveToStore

HideRecoveryOptions.description: Indicates whether or not to allow showing recovery options in BitLocker Setup Wizard for fixed or system disk.
HideRecoveryOptions.title: HideRecoveryOptions

RecoveryInformationToStore.description: Configure what pieces of BitLocker recovery information are stored to AD DS. Possible values are: passwordAndKey, passwordOnly.
RecoveryInformationToStore.title: RecoveryInformationToStore

RecoveryKeyUsage.description: Indicates whether users are allowed or required to generate a 256-bit recovery key for fixed or system disk. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
RecoveryKeyUsage.title: RecoveryKeyUsage

RecoveryPasswordUsage.description: Indicates whether users are allowed or required to generate a 48-digit recovery password for fixed or system disk. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
RecoveryPasswordUsage.title: RecoveryPasswordUsage

StartupAuthenticationBlockWithoutTpmChip.description: Indicates whether to allow BitLocker without a compatible TPM (requires a password or a startup key on a USB flash drive).
StartupAuthenticationBlockWithoutTpmChip.title: StartupAuthenticationBlockWithoutTpmChip

StartupAuthenticationTpmKeyUsage.description: Indicates if TPM startup key is allowed/required/disallowed. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
StartupAuthenticationTpmKeyUsage.title: StartupAuthenticationTpmKeyUsage

StartupAuthenticationTpmPinAndKeyUsage.description: Indicates if TPM startup pin key and key are allowed/required/disallowed. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
StartupAuthenticationTpmPinAndKeyUsage.title: StartupAuthenticationTpmPinAndKeyUsage

StartupAuthenticationTpmPinUsage.description: Indicates if TPM startup pin is allowed/required/disallowed. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
StartupAuthenticationTpmPinUsage.title: StartupAuthenticationTpmPinUsage

StartupAuthenticationTpmUsage.description: Indicates if TPM startup is allowed/required/disallowed. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
StartupAuthenticationTpmUsage.title: StartupAuthenticationTpmUsage

DefenderAdditionalGuardedFolders.description: List of folder paths to be added to the list of protected folders
DefenderAdditionalGuardedFolders.title: DefenderAdditionalGuardedFolders

DefenderAdobeReaderLaunchChildProcess.description: Value indicating the behavior of Adobe Reader from creating child processes. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderAdobeReaderLaunchChildProcess.title: DefenderAdobeReaderLaunchChildProcess

DefenderAdvancedRansomewareProtectionTyp.description: Value indicating use of advanced protection against ransomeware. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderAdvancedRansomewareProtectionTyp.title: DefenderAdvancedRansomewareProtectionType

DefenderAllowBehaviorMonitoring.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender Behavior Monitoring functionality.
DefenderAllowBehaviorMonitoring.title: DefenderAllowBehaviorMonitoring

DefenderAllowCloudProtection.description: To best protect your PC, Windows Defender will send information to Microsoft about any problems it finds. Microsoft will analyze that information, learn more about problems affecting you and other customers, and offer improved solutions.
DefenderAllowCloudProtection.title: DefenderAllowCloudProtection

DefenderAllowEndUserAccess.description: Allows or disallows user access to the Windows Defender UI. If disallowed, all Windows Defender notifications will also be suppressed.
DefenderAllowEndUserAccess.title: DefenderAllowEndUserAccess

DefenderAllowIntrusionPreventionSystem.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender Intrusion Prevention functionality.
DefenderAllowIntrusionPreventionSystem.title: DefenderAllowIntrusionPreventionSystem

DefenderAllowOnAccessProtection.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender On Access Protection functionality.
DefenderAllowOnAccessProtection.title: DefenderAllowOnAccessProtection

DefenderAllowRealTimeMonitoring.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender Realtime Monitoring functionality.
DefenderAllowRealTimeMonitoring.title: DefenderAllowRealTimeMonitoring

DefenderAllowScanArchiveFiles.description: Allows or disallows scanning of archives.
DefenderAllowScanArchiveFiles.title: DefenderAllowScanArchiveFiles

DefenderAllowScanDownloads.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender IOAVP Protection functionality.
DefenderAllowScanDownloads.title: DefenderAllowScanDownloads

DefenderAllowScanNetworkFiles.description: Allows or disallows a scanning of network files.
DefenderAllowScanNetworkFiles.title: DefenderAllowScanNetworkFiles

DefenderAllowScanRemovableDrivesDuringFu.description: Allows or disallows a full scan of removable drives. During a quick scan, removable drives may still be scanned.
DefenderAllowScanRemovableDrivesDuringFu.title: DefenderAllowScanRemovableDrivesDuringFullScan

DefenderAllowScanScriptsLoadedInInternet.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender Script Scanning functionality.
DefenderAllowScanScriptsLoadedInInternet.title: DefenderAllowScanScriptsLoadedInInternetExplorer

DefenderAttackSurfaceReductionExcludedPa.description: List of exe files and folders to be excluded from attack surface reduction rules
DefenderAttackSurfaceReductionExcludedPa.title: DefenderAttackSurfaceReductionExcludedPaths

DefenderBlockEndUserAccess.description: Allows or disallows user access to the Windows Defender UI. If disallowed, all Windows Defender notifications will also be suppressed.
DefenderBlockEndUserAccess.title: DefenderBlockEndUserAccess

DefenderBlockPersistenceThroughWmiType.description: Value indicating the behavior ofBlock persistence through WMI event subscription. Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderBlockPersistenceThroughWmiType.title: DefenderBlockPersistenceThroughWmiType

DefenderCheckForSignaturesBeforeRunningS.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether a check for new virus and spyware definitions will occur before running a scan.
DefenderCheckForSignaturesBeforeRunningS.title: DefenderCheckForSignaturesBeforeRunningScan

DefenderCloudBlockLevel.description: Added in Windows 10, version 1709. This policy setting determines how aggressive Windows Defender Antivirus will be in blocking and scanning suspicious files. Value type is integer. This feature requires the 'Join Microsoft MAPS' setting enabled in order to function. Possible values are: notConfigured, high, highPlus, zeroTolerance.
DefenderCloudBlockLevel.title: DefenderCloudBlockLevel

DefenderCloudExtendedTimeoutInSeconds.description: Added in Windows 10, version 1709. This feature allows Windows Defender Antivirus to block a suspicious file for up to 60 seconds, and scan it in the cloud to make sure it's safe. Value type is integer, range is 0 - 50. This feature depends on three other MAPS settings the must all be enabled- 'Configure the 'Block at First Sight' feature 'Join Microsoft MAPS' 'Send file samples when further analysis is required'. Valid values 0 to 50
DefenderCloudExtendedTimeoutInSeconds.title: DefenderCloudExtendedTimeoutInSeconds

DefenderDaysBeforeDeletingQuarantinedMal.description: Time period (in days) that quarantine items will be stored on the system. Valid values 0 to 90
DefenderDaysBeforeDeletingQuarantinedMal.title: DefenderDaysBeforeDeletingQuarantinedMalware

DefenderDetectedMalwareActions.description: Allows an administrator to specify any valid threat severity levels and the corresponding default action ID to take.
DefenderDetectedMalwareActions.title: DefenderDetectedMalwareActions

HighSeverity.description: Indicates a Defender action to take for high severity Malware threat detected. Possible values are: deviceDefault, clean, quarantine, remove, allow, userDefined, block.
HighSeverity.title: HighSeverity

LowSeverity.description: Indicates a Defender action to take for low severity Malware threat detected. Possible values are: deviceDefault, clean, quarantine, remove, allow, userDefined, block.
LowSeverity.title: LowSeverity

ModerateSeverity.description: Indicates a Defender action to take for moderate severity Malware threat detected. Possible values are: deviceDefault, clean, quarantine, remove, allow, userDefined, block.
ModerateSeverity.title: ModerateSeverity

SevereSeverity.description: Indicates a Defender action to take for severe severity Malware threat detected. Possible values are: deviceDefault, clean, quarantine, remove, allow, userDefined, block.
SevereSeverity.title: SevereSeverity

DefenderDisableBehaviorMonitoring.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender Behavior Monitoring functionality.
DefenderDisableBehaviorMonitoring.title: DefenderDisableBehaviorMonitoring

DefenderDisableCatchupFullScan.description: This policy setting allows you to configure catch-up scans for scheduled full scans. A catch-up scan is a scan that is initiated because a regularly scheduled scan was missed. Usually these scheduled scans are missed because the computer was turned off at the scheduled time.
DefenderDisableCatchupFullScan.title: DefenderDisableCatchupFullScan

DefenderDisableCatchupQuickScan.description: This policy setting allows you to configure catch-up scans for scheduled quick scans. A catch-up scan is a scan that is initiated because a regularly scheduled scan was missed. Usually these scheduled scans are missed because the computer was turned off at the scheduled time.
DefenderDisableCatchupQuickScan.title: DefenderDisableCatchupQuickScan

DefenderDisableCloudProtection.description: To best protect your PC, Windows Defender will send information to Microsoft about any problems it finds. Microsoft will analyze that information, learn more about problems affecting you and other customers, and offer improved solutions.
DefenderDisableCloudProtection.title: DefenderDisableCloudProtection

DefenderDisableIntrusionPreventionSystem.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender Intrusion Prevention functionality.
DefenderDisableIntrusionPreventionSystem.title: DefenderDisableIntrusionPreventionSystem

DefenderDisableOnAccessProtection.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender On Access Protection functionality.
DefenderDisableOnAccessProtection.title: DefenderDisableOnAccessProtection

DefenderDisableRealTimeMonitoring.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender Realtime Monitoring functionality.
DefenderDisableRealTimeMonitoring.title: DefenderDisableRealTimeMonitoring

DefenderDisableScanArchiveFiles.description: Allows or disallows scanning of archives.
DefenderDisableScanArchiveFiles.title: DefenderDisableScanArchiveFiles

DefenderDisableScanDownloads.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender IOAVP Protection functionality.
DefenderDisableScanDownloads.title: DefenderDisableScanDownloads

DefenderDisableScanNetworkFiles.description: Allows or disallows a scanning of network files.
DefenderDisableScanNetworkFiles.title: DefenderDisableScanNetworkFiles

DefenderDisableScanRemovableDrivesDuring.description: Allows or disallows a full scan of removable drives. During a quick scan, removable drives may still be scanned.
DefenderDisableScanRemovableDrivesDuring.title: DefenderDisableScanRemovableDrivesDuringFullScan

DefenderDisableScanScriptsLoadedInIntern.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender Script Scanning functionality.
DefenderDisableScanScriptsLoadedInIntern.title: DefenderDisableScanScriptsLoadedInInternetExplorer

DefenderEmailContentExecution.description: Value indicating if execution of executable content (exe, dll, ps, js, vbs, etc) should be dropped from email (webmail/mail-client). Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderEmailContentExecution.title: DefenderEmailContentExecution

DefenderEmailContentExecutionType.description: Value indicating if execution of executable content (exe, dll, ps, js, vbs, etc) should be dropped from email (webmail/mail-client). Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderEmailContentExecutionType.title: DefenderEmailContentExecutionType

DefenderEnableLowCpuPriority.description: This policy setting allows you to enable or disable low CPU priority for scheduled scans.
DefenderEnableLowCpuPriority.title: DefenderEnableLowCpuPriority

DefenderEnableScanIncomingMail.description: Allows or disallows scanning of email.
DefenderEnableScanIncomingMail.title: DefenderEnableScanIncomingMail

DefenderEnableScanMappedNetworkDrivesDur.description: Allows or disallows a full scan of mapped network drives.
DefenderEnableScanMappedNetworkDrivesDur.title: DefenderEnableScanMappedNetworkDrivesDuringFullScan

DefenderExploitProtectionXml.description: Xml content containing information regarding exploit protection details.
DefenderExploitProtectionXml.title: DefenderExploitProtectionXml

DefenderExploitProtectionXmlFileName.description: Name of the file from which DefenderExploitProtectionXml was obtained.
DefenderExploitProtectionXmlFileName.title: DefenderExploitProtectionXmlFileName

DefenderFileExtensionsToExclude.description: File extensions to exclude from scans and real time protection.
DefenderFileExtensionsToExclude.title: DefenderFileExtensionsToExclude

DefenderFilesAndFoldersToExclude.description: Files and folder to exclude from scans and real time protection.
DefenderFilesAndFoldersToExclude.title: DefenderFilesAndFoldersToExclude

DefenderGuardedFoldersAllowedAppPaths.description: List of paths to exe that are allowed to access protected folders
DefenderGuardedFoldersAllowedAppPaths.title: DefenderGuardedFoldersAllowedAppPaths

DefenderGuardMyFoldersType.description: Value indicating the behavior of protected folders. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, blockDiskModification, auditDiskModification.
DefenderGuardMyFoldersType.title: DefenderGuardMyFoldersType

DefenderNetworkProtectionType.description: Value indicating the behavior of NetworkProtection. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderNetworkProtectionType.title: DefenderNetworkProtectionType

DefenderOfficeAppsExecutableContentCreat.description: Value indicating the behavior of Office applications/macros creating or launching executable content. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderOfficeAppsExecutableContentCreat.title: DefenderOfficeAppsExecutableContentCreationOrLaunch

DefenderOfficeAppsExecutableContentCreat.description: Value indicating the behavior of Office applications/macros creating or launching executable content. Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderOfficeAppsExecutableContentCreat.title: DefenderOfficeAppsExecutableContentCreationOrLaunchType

DefenderOfficeAppsLaunchChildProcess.description: Value indicating the behavior of Office application launching child processes. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderOfficeAppsLaunchChildProcess.title: DefenderOfficeAppsLaunchChildProcess

DefenderOfficeAppsLaunchChildProcessType.description: Value indicating the behavior of Office application launching child processes. Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderOfficeAppsLaunchChildProcessType.title: DefenderOfficeAppsLaunchChildProcessType

DefenderOfficeAppsOtherProcessInjection.description: Value indicating the behavior of Office applications injecting into other processes. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderOfficeAppsOtherProcessInjection.title: DefenderOfficeAppsOtherProcessInjection

DefenderOfficeAppsOtherProcessInjectionT.description: Value indicating the behavior ofOffice applications injecting into other processes. Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderOfficeAppsOtherProcessInjectionT.title: DefenderOfficeAppsOtherProcessInjectionType

DefenderOfficeCommunicationAppsLaunchChi.description: Value indicating the behavior of Office communication applications, including Microsoft Outlook, from creating child processes. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderOfficeCommunicationAppsLaunchChi.title: DefenderOfficeCommunicationAppsLaunchChildProcess

DefenderOfficeMacroCodeAllowWin32Imports.description: Value indicating the behavior of Win32 imports from Macro code in Office. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderOfficeMacroCodeAllowWin32Imports.title: DefenderOfficeMacroCodeAllowWin32Imports

DefenderOfficeMacroCodeAllowWin32Imports.description: Value indicating the behavior of Win32 imports from Macro code in Office. Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderOfficeMacroCodeAllowWin32Imports.title: DefenderOfficeMacroCodeAllowWin32ImportsType

DefenderPotentiallyUnwantedAppAction.description: Added in Windows 10, version 1607. Specifies the level of detection for potentially unwanted applications (PUAs). Windows Defender alerts you when potentially unwanted software is being downloaded or attempts to install itself on your computer. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderPotentiallyUnwantedAppAction.title: DefenderPotentiallyUnwantedAppAction

DefenderPreventCredentialStealingType.description: Value indicating if credential stealing from the Windows local security authority subsystem is permitted. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderPreventCredentialStealingType.title: DefenderPreventCredentialStealingType

DefenderProcessCreation.description: Value indicating response to process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderProcessCreation.title: DefenderProcessCreation

DefenderProcessCreationType.description: Value indicating response to process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands. Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderProcessCreationType.title: DefenderProcessCreationType

DefenderProcessesToExclude.description: Processes to exclude from scans and real time protection.
DefenderProcessesToExclude.title: DefenderProcessesToExclude

DefenderScanDirection.description: Controls which sets of files should be monitored. Possible values are: monitorAllFiles, monitorIncomingFilesOnly, monitorOutgoingFilesOnly.
DefenderScanDirection.title: DefenderScanDirection

DefenderScanMaxCpuPercentage.description: Represents the average CPU load factor for the Windows Defender scan (in percent). The default value is 50. Valid values 0 to 100
DefenderScanMaxCpuPercentage.title: DefenderScanMaxCpuPercentage

DefenderScanType.description: Selects whether to perform a quick scan or full scan. Possible values are: userDefined, disabled, quick, full.
DefenderScanType.title: DefenderScanType

DefenderScheduledQuickScanTime.description: Selects the time of day that the Windows Defender quick scan should run. For example, a value of 0=12:00AM, a value of 60=1:00AM, a value of 120=2:00, and so on, up to a value of 1380=11:00PM. The default value is 120
DefenderScheduledQuickScanTime.title: DefenderScheduledQuickScanTime

DefenderScheduledScanDay.description: Selects the day that the Windows Defender scan should run. Possible values are: userDefined, everyday, sunday, monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday, noScheduledScan.
DefenderScheduledScanDay.title: DefenderScheduledScanDay

DefenderScheduledScanTime.description: Selects the time of day that the Windows Defender scan should run.
DefenderScheduledScanTime.title: DefenderScheduledScanTime

DefenderScriptDownloadedPayloadExecution.description: Value indicating the behavior of js/vbs executing payload downloaded from Internet. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderScriptDownloadedPayloadExecution.title: DefenderScriptDownloadedPayloadExecution

DefenderScriptDownloadedPayloadExecution.description: Value indicating the behavior of js/vbs executing payload downloaded from Internet. Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderScriptDownloadedPayloadExecution.title: DefenderScriptDownloadedPayloadExecutionType

DefenderScriptObfuscatedMacroCode.description: Value indicating the behavior of obfuscated js/vbs/ps/macro code. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderScriptObfuscatedMacroCode.title: DefenderScriptObfuscatedMacroCode

DefenderScriptObfuscatedMacroCodeType.description: Value indicating the behavior of obfuscated js/vbs/ps/macro code. Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderScriptObfuscatedMacroCodeType.title: DefenderScriptObfuscatedMacroCodeType

DefenderSecurityCenterBlockExploitProtec.description: Indicates whether or not to block user from overriding Exploit Protection settings.
DefenderSecurityCenterBlockExploitProtec.title: DefenderSecurityCenterBlockExploitProtectionOverride

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableAccountUI.description: Used to disable the display of the account protection area.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableAccountUI.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableAccountUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableAppBrowserU.description: Used to disable the display of the app and browser protection area.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableAppBrowserU.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableAppBrowserUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableClearTpmUI.description: Used to disable the display of the Clear TPM button.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableClearTpmUI.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableClearTpmUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableFamilyUI.description: Used to disable the display of the family options area.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableFamilyUI.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableFamilyUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableHardwareUI.description: Used to disable the display of the hardware protection area.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableHardwareUI.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableHardwareUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableHealthUI.description: Used to disable the display of the device performance and health area.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableHealthUI.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableHealthUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableNetworkUI.description: Used to disable the display of the firewall and network protection area.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableNetworkUI.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableNetworkUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableNotificatio.description: Used to disable the display of the notification area control. The user needs to either sign out and sign in or reboot the computer for this setting to take effect.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableNotificatio.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableNotificationAreaUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableRansomwareU.description: Used to disable the display of the ransomware protection area.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableRansomwareU.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableRansomwareUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableSecureBootU.description: Used to disable the display of the secure boot area under Device security.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableSecureBootU.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableSecureBootUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableTroubleshoo.description: Used to disable the display of the security process troubleshooting under Device security.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableTroubleshoo.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableTroubleshootingUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableVirusUI.description: Used to disable the display of the virus and threat protection area.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableVirusUI.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableVirusUI

DefenderSecurityCenterDisableVulnerableT.description: Used to disable the display of update TPM Firmware when a vulnerable firmware is detected.
DefenderSecurityCenterDisableVulnerableT.title: DefenderSecurityCenterDisableVulnerableTpmFirmwareUpdateUI

DefenderSecurityCenterHelpEmail.description: The email address that is displayed to users.
DefenderSecurityCenterHelpEmail.title: DefenderSecurityCenterHelpEmail

DefenderSecurityCenterHelpPhone.description: The phone number or Skype ID that is displayed to users.
DefenderSecurityCenterHelpPhone.title: DefenderSecurityCenterHelpPhone

DefenderSecurityCenterHelpURL.description: The help portal URL this is displayed to users.
DefenderSecurityCenterHelpURL.title: DefenderSecurityCenterHelpURL

DefenderSecurityCenterITContactDisplay.description: Configure where to display IT contact information to end users. Possible values are: notConfigured, displayInAppAndInNotifications, displayOnlyInApp, displayOnlyInNotifications.
DefenderSecurityCenterITContactDisplay.title: DefenderSecurityCenterITContactDisplay

DefenderSecurityCenterNotificationsFromA.description: Notifications to show from the displayed areas of app. Possible values are: notConfigured, blockNoncriticalNotifications, blockAllNotifications.
DefenderSecurityCenterNotificationsFromA.title: DefenderSecurityCenterNotificationsFromApp

DefenderSecurityCenterOrganizationDispla.description: The company name that is displayed to the users.
DefenderSecurityCenterOrganizationDispla.title: DefenderSecurityCenterOrganizationDisplayName

DefenderSignatureUpdateIntervalInHours.description: Specifies the interval (in hours) that will be used to check for signatures, so instead of using the ScheduleDay and ScheduleTime the check for new signatures will be set according to the interval. Valid values 0 to 24
DefenderSignatureUpdateIntervalInHours.title: DefenderSignatureUpdateIntervalInHours

DefenderSubmitSamplesConsentType.description: Checks for the user consent level in Windows Defender to send data. Possible values are: sendSafeSamplesAutomatically, alwaysPrompt, neverSend, sendAllSamplesAutomatically.
DefenderSubmitSamplesConsentType.title: DefenderSubmitSamplesConsentType

DefenderUntrustedExecutable.description: Value indicating response to executables that don't meet a prevalence, age, or trusted list criteria. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderUntrustedExecutable.title: DefenderUntrustedExecutable

DefenderUntrustedExecutableType.description: Value indicating response to executables that don't meet a prevalence, age, or trusted list criteria. Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderUntrustedExecutableType.title: DefenderUntrustedExecutableType

DefenderUntrustedUSBProcess.description: Value indicating response to untrusted and unsigned processes that run from USB. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderUntrustedUSBProcess.title: DefenderUntrustedUSBProcess

DefenderUntrustedUSBProcessType.description: Value indicating response to untrusted and unsigned processes that run from USB. Possible values are: userDefined, block, auditMode, warn, disable.
DefenderUntrustedUSBProcessType.title: DefenderUntrustedUSBProcessType

DeviceGuardEnableSecureBootWithDMA.description: This property will be deprecated in May 2019 and will be replaced with property DeviceGuardSecureBootWithDMA. Specifies whether Platform Security Level is enabled at next reboot.
DeviceGuardEnableSecureBootWithDMA.title: DeviceGuardEnableSecureBootWithDMA

DeviceGuardLaunchSystemGuard.description: Allows the IT admin to configure the launch of System Guard. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
DeviceGuardLaunchSystemGuard.title: DeviceGuardLaunchSystemGuard

DeviceGuardLocalSystemAuthorityCredentia.description: Turn on Credential Guard when Platform Security Level with Secure Boot and Virtualization Based Security are both enabled. Possible values are: notConfigured, enableWithUEFILock, enableWithoutUEFILock, disable.
DeviceGuardLocalSystemAuthorityCredentia.title: DeviceGuardLocalSystemAuthorityCredentialGuardSettings

DeviceGuardSecureBootWithDMA.description: Specifies whether Platform Security Level is enabled at next reboot. Possible values are: notConfigured, withoutDMA, withDMA.
DeviceGuardSecureBootWithDMA.title: DeviceGuardSecureBootWithDMA

DmaGuardDeviceEnumerationPolicy.description: This policy is intended to provide additional security against external DMA capable devices. It allows for more control over the enumeration of external DMA capable devices incompatible with DMA Remapping/device memory isolation and sandboxing. This policy only takes effect when Kernel DMA Protection is supported and enabled by the system firmware. Kernel DMA Protection is a platform feature that cannot be controlled via policy or by end user. It has to be supported by the system at the time of manufacturing. To check if the system supports Kernel DMA Protection, please check the Kernel DMA Protection field in the Summary page of MSINFO32.exe. Possible values are: deviceDefault, blockAll, allowAll.
DmaGuardDeviceEnumerationPolicy.title: DmaGuardDeviceEnumerationPolicy

FirewallBlockStatefulFTP.description: Blocks stateful FTP connections to the device
FirewallBlockStatefulFTP.title: FirewallBlockStatefulFTP

FirewallCertificateRevocationListCheckMe.description: Specify how the certificate revocation list is to be enforced. Possible values are: deviceDefault, none, attempt, require.
FirewallCertificateRevocationListCheckMe.title: FirewallCertificateRevocationListCheckMethod

FirewallIdleTimeoutForSecurityAssociatio.description: Configures the idle timeout for security associations, in seconds, from 300 to 3600 inclusive. This is the period after which security associations will expire and be deleted. Valid values 300 to 3600
FirewallIdleTimeoutForSecurityAssociatio.title: FirewallIdleTimeoutForSecurityAssociationInSeconds

FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowDHCP.description: Configures IPSec exemptions to allow both IPv4 and IPv6 DHCP traffic
FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowDHCP.title: FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowDHCP

FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowICMP.description: Configures IPSec exemptions to allow ICMP
FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowICMP.title: FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowICMP

FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowNeighborDisc.description: Configures IPSec exemptions to allow neighbor discovery IPv6 ICMP type-codes
FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowNeighborDisc.title: FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowNeighborDiscovery

FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowRouterDiscov.description: Configures IPSec exemptions to allow router discovery IPv6 ICMP type-codes
FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowRouterDiscov.title: FirewallIPSecExemptionsAllowRouterDiscovery

FirewallIPSecExemptionsNone.description: Configures IPSec exemptions to no exemptions
FirewallIPSecExemptionsNone.title: FirewallIPSecExemptionsNone

FirewallMergeKeyingModuleSettings.description: If an authentication set is not fully supported by a keying module, direct the module to ignore only unsupported authentication suites rather than the entire set
FirewallMergeKeyingModuleSettings.title: FirewallMergeKeyingModuleSettings

FirewallPacketQueueingMethod.description: Configures how packet queueing should be applied in the tunnel gateway scenario. Possible values are: deviceDefault, disabled, queueInbound, queueOutbound, queueBoth.
FirewallPacketQueueingMethod.title: FirewallPacketQueueingMethod

FirewallPreSharedKeyEncodingMethod.description: Select the preshared key encoding to be used. Possible values are: deviceDefault, none, utF8.
FirewallPreSharedKeyEncodingMethod.title: FirewallPreSharedKeyEncodingMethod

FirewallProfileDomain.description: Configures the firewall profile settings for domain networks
FirewallProfileDomain.title: FirewallProfileDomain

AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.description: Configures the firewall to merge authorized application rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.title: AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging authorized application rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.title: AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMe.description: Configures the firewall to merge connection security rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMe.title: ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNo.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging connection security rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNo.title: ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

FirewallEnabled.description: Configures the host device to allow or block the firewall and advanced security enforcement for the network profile. Possible values are: notConfigured, blocked, allowed.
FirewallEnabled.title: FirewallEnabled

GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged.description: Configures the firewall to merge global port rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged.title: GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging global port rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged.title: GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

InboundConnectionsBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block all incoming connections by default. When InboundConnectionsRequired and InboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, InboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority.
InboundConnectionsBlocked.title: InboundConnectionsBlocked

InboundConnectionsRequired.description: Configures the firewall to allow all incoming connections by default. When InboundConnectionsRequired and InboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, InboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority.
InboundConnectionsRequired.title: InboundConnectionsRequired

InboundNotificationsBlocked.description: Prevents the firewall from displaying notifications when an application is blocked from listening on a port. When InboundNotificationsRequired and InboundNotificationsBlocked are both true, InboundNotificationsBlocked takes priority.
InboundNotificationsBlocked.title: InboundNotificationsBlocked

InboundNotificationsRequired.description: Allows the firewall to display notifications when an application is blocked from listening on a port. When InboundNotificationsRequired and InboundNotificationsBlocked are both true, InboundNotificationsBlocked takes priority.
InboundNotificationsRequired.title: InboundNotificationsRequired

IncomingTrafficBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block all incoming traffic regardless of other policy settings. When IncomingTrafficRequired and IncomingTrafficBlocked are both true, IncomingTrafficBlocked takes priority.
IncomingTrafficBlocked.title: IncomingTrafficBlocked

IncomingTrafficRequired.description: Configures the firewall to allow incoming traffic pursuant to other policy settings. When IncomingTrafficRequired and IncomingTrafficBlocked are both true, IncomingTrafficBlocked takes priority.
IncomingTrafficRequired.title: IncomingTrafficRequired

OutboundConnectionsBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block all outgoing connections by default. When OutboundConnectionsRequired and OutboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, OutboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority. This setting will get applied to Windows releases version 1809 and above.
OutboundConnectionsBlocked.title: OutboundConnectionsBlocked

OutboundConnectionsRequired.description: Configures the firewall to allow all outgoing connections by default. When OutboundConnectionsRequired and OutboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, OutboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority. This setting will get applied to Windows releases version 1809 and above.
OutboundConnectionsRequired.title: OutboundConnectionsRequired

PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged.description: Configures the firewall to merge Firewall Rule policies from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged.title: PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging Firewall Rule policies from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged.title: PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed.description: Configures the firewall to allow the host computer to respond to unsolicited network traffic of that traffic is secured by IPSec even when stealthModeBlocked is set to true. When SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked and SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed are both true, SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed takes priority.
SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed.title: SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed

SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block the host computer to respond to unsolicited network traffic of that traffic is secured by IPSec even when stealthModeBlocked is set to true. When SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked and SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed are both true, SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed takes priority.
SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked.title: SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked

StealthModeBlocked.description: Prevent the server from operating in stealth mode. When StealthModeRequired and StealthModeBlocked are both true, StealthModeBlocked takes priority.
StealthModeBlocked.title: StealthModeBlocked

StealthModeRequired.description: Allow the server to operate in stealth mode. When StealthModeRequired and StealthModeBlocked are both true, StealthModeBlocked takes priority.
StealthModeRequired.title: StealthModeRequired

UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlo.description: Configures the firewall to block unicast responses to multicast broadcast traffic. When UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsRequired and UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked are both true, UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked takes priority.
UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlo.title: UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked

UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsReq.description: Configures the firewall to allow unicast responses to multicast broadcast traffic. When UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsRequired and UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked are both true, UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked takes priority.
UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsReq.title: UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsRequired

FirewallProfilePrivate.description: Configures the firewall profile settings for private networks
FirewallProfilePrivate.title: FirewallProfilePrivate

AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.description: Configures the firewall to merge authorized application rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.title: AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging authorized application rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.title: AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMe.description: Configures the firewall to merge connection security rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMe.title: ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNo.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging connection security rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNo.title: ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

FirewallEnabled.description: Configures the host device to allow or block the firewall and advanced security enforcement for the network profile. Possible values are: notConfigured, blocked, allowed.
FirewallEnabled.title: FirewallEnabled

GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged.description: Configures the firewall to merge global port rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged.title: GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging global port rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged.title: GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

InboundConnectionsBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block all incoming connections by default. When InboundConnectionsRequired and InboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, InboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority.
InboundConnectionsBlocked.title: InboundConnectionsBlocked

InboundConnectionsRequired.description: Configures the firewall to allow all incoming connections by default. When InboundConnectionsRequired and InboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, InboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority.
InboundConnectionsRequired.title: InboundConnectionsRequired

InboundNotificationsBlocked.description: Prevents the firewall from displaying notifications when an application is blocked from listening on a port. When InboundNotificationsRequired and InboundNotificationsBlocked are both true, InboundNotificationsBlocked takes priority.
InboundNotificationsBlocked.title: InboundNotificationsBlocked

InboundNotificationsRequired.description: Allows the firewall to display notifications when an application is blocked from listening on a port. When InboundNotificationsRequired and InboundNotificationsBlocked are both true, InboundNotificationsBlocked takes priority.
InboundNotificationsRequired.title: InboundNotificationsRequired

IncomingTrafficBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block all incoming traffic regardless of other policy settings. When IncomingTrafficRequired and IncomingTrafficBlocked are both true, IncomingTrafficBlocked takes priority.
IncomingTrafficBlocked.title: IncomingTrafficBlocked

IncomingTrafficRequired.description: Configures the firewall to allow incoming traffic pursuant to other policy settings. When IncomingTrafficRequired and IncomingTrafficBlocked are both true, IncomingTrafficBlocked takes priority.
IncomingTrafficRequired.title: IncomingTrafficRequired

OutboundConnectionsBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block all outgoing connections by default. When OutboundConnectionsRequired and OutboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, OutboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority. This setting will get applied to Windows releases version 1809 and above.
OutboundConnectionsBlocked.title: OutboundConnectionsBlocked

OutboundConnectionsRequired.description: Configures the firewall to allow all outgoing connections by default. When OutboundConnectionsRequired and OutboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, OutboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority. This setting will get applied to Windows releases version 1809 and above.
OutboundConnectionsRequired.title: OutboundConnectionsRequired

PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged.description: Configures the firewall to merge Firewall Rule policies from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged.title: PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging Firewall Rule policies from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged.title: PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed.description: Configures the firewall to allow the host computer to respond to unsolicited network traffic of that traffic is secured by IPSec even when stealthModeBlocked is set to true. When SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked and SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed are both true, SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed takes priority.
SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed.title: SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed

SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block the host computer to respond to unsolicited network traffic of that traffic is secured by IPSec even when stealthModeBlocked is set to true. When SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked and SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed are both true, SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed takes priority.
SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked.title: SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked

StealthModeBlocked.description: Prevent the server from operating in stealth mode. When StealthModeRequired and StealthModeBlocked are both true, StealthModeBlocked takes priority.
StealthModeBlocked.title: StealthModeBlocked

StealthModeRequired.description: Allow the server to operate in stealth mode. When StealthModeRequired and StealthModeBlocked are both true, StealthModeBlocked takes priority.
StealthModeRequired.title: StealthModeRequired

UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlo.description: Configures the firewall to block unicast responses to multicast broadcast traffic. When UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsRequired and UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked are both true, UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked takes priority.
UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlo.title: UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked

UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsReq.description: Configures the firewall to allow unicast responses to multicast broadcast traffic. When UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsRequired and UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked are both true, UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked takes priority.
UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsReq.title: UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsRequired

FirewallProfilePublic.description: Configures the firewall profile settings for public networks
FirewallProfilePublic.title: FirewallProfilePublic

AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.description: Configures the firewall to merge authorized application rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.title: AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging authorized application rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolic.title: AuthorizedApplicationRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMe.description: Configures the firewall to merge connection security rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMe.title: ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNo.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging connection security rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNo.title: ConnectionSecurityRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

FirewallEnabled.description: Configures the host device to allow or block the firewall and advanced security enforcement for the network profile. Possible values are: notConfigured, blocked, allowed.
FirewallEnabled.title: FirewallEnabled

GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged.description: Configures the firewall to merge global port rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged.title: GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged

GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged.description: Configures the firewall to prevent merging global port rules from group policy with those from local store instead of ignoring the local store rules. When GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.
GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged.title: GlobalPortRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged

InboundConnectionsBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block all incoming connections by default. When InboundConnectionsRequired and InboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, InboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority.
InboundConnectionsBlocked.title: InboundConnectionsBlocked

InboundConnectionsRequired.description: Configures the firewall to allow all incoming connections by default. When InboundConnectionsRequired and InboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, InboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority.
InboundConnectionsRequired.title: InboundConnectionsRequired

InboundNotificationsBlocked.description: Prevents the firewall from displaying notifications when an application is blocked from listening on a port. When InboundNotificationsRequired and InboundNotificationsBlocked are both true, InboundNotificationsBlocked takes priority.
InboundNotificationsBlocked.title: InboundNotificationsBlocked

InboundNotificationsRequired.description: Allows the firewall to display notifications when an application is blocked from listening on a port. When InboundNotificationsRequired and InboundNotificationsBlocked are both true, InboundNotificationsBlocked takes priority.
InboundNotificationsRequired.title: InboundNotificationsRequired

IncomingTrafficBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block all incoming traffic regardless of other policy settings. When IncomingTrafficRequired and IncomingTrafficBlocked are both true, IncomingTrafficBlocked takes priority.
IncomingTrafficBlocked.title: IncomingTrafficBlocked

IncomingTrafficRequired.description: Configures the firewall to allow incoming traffic pursuant to other policy settings. When IncomingTrafficRequired and IncomingTrafficBlocked are both true, IncomingTrafficBlocked takes priority.
IncomingTrafficRequired.title: IncomingTrafficRequired

OutboundConnectionsBlocked.description: Configures the firewall to block all outgoing connections by default. When OutboundConnectionsRequired and OutboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, OutboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority. This setting will get applied to Windows releases version 1809 and above.
OutboundConnectionsBlocked.title: OutboundConnectionsBlocked

OutboundConnectionsRequired.description: Configures the firewall to allow all outgoing connections by default. When OutboundConnectionsRequired and OutboundConnectionsBlocked are both true, OutboundConnectionsBlocked takes priority. This setting will get applied to Windows releases version 1809 and above.
OutboundConnectionsRequired.title: OutboundConnectionsRequired

When PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.

When PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyNotMerged and PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged are both true, PolicyRulesFromGroupPolicyMerged takes priority.

When SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked and SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed are both true, SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed takes priority.

When SecuredPacketExemptionBlocked and SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed are both true, SecuredPacketExemptionAllowed takes priority.

UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlo.description: Configures the firewall to block unicast responses to multicast broadcast traffic. When UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsRequired and UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked are both true, UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked takes priority.

When UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsRequired and UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked are both true, UnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcastsBlocked takes priority.
