items.description: Intune Device Configuration Endpoint Protection Policy for Windows10
items.title: Schema for MSFT_MicrosoftGraphWindowsFirewallRule

Action.description: The action the rule enforces. If not specified, the default is Allowed. Possible values are: notConfigured, blocked, allowed.
Action.title: Action

Description.description: The description of the rule.
Description.title: Description

DisplayName.description: The display name of the rule. Does not need to be unique.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

EdgeTraversal.description: Indicates whether edge traversal is enabled or disabled for this rule. The EdgeTraversal setting indicates that specific inbound traffic is allowed to tunnel through NATs and other edge devices using the Teredo tunneling technology. In order for this setting to work correctly, the application or service with the inbound firewall rule needs to support IPv6. The primary application of this setting allows listeners on the host to be globally addressable through a Teredo IPv6 address. New rules have the EdgeTraversal property disabled by default. Possible values are: notConfigured, blocked, allowed.
EdgeTraversal.title: EdgeTraversal

FilePath.description: The full file path of an app that's affected by the firewall rule.
FilePath.title: FilePath

InterfaceTypes.description: The interface types of the rule. Possible values are: notConfigured, remoteAccess, wireless, lan.
InterfaceTypes.title: InterfaceTypes

LocalAddressRanges.description: List of local addresses covered by the rule. Default is any address. Valid tokens include:'' indicates any local address. If present, this must be the only token included.A subnet can be specified using either the subnet mask or network prefix notation. If neither a subnet mask nor a network prefix is specified, the subnet mask defaults to 255.255.255.255.A valid IPv6 address.An IPv4 address range in the format of 'start address - end address' with no spaces included.An IPv6 address range in the format of 'start address - end address' with no spaces included.
LocalAddressRanges.title: LocalAddressRanges

LocalPortRanges.description: List of local port ranges. For example, '100-120', '200', '300-320'. If not specified, the default is All.
LocalPortRanges.title: LocalPortRanges

LocalUserAuthorizations.description: Specifies the list of authorized local users for the app container. This is a string in Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) format.
LocalUserAuthorizations.title: LocalUserAuthorizations

PackageFamilyName.description: The package family name of a Microsoft Store application that's affected by the firewall rule.
PackageFamilyName.title: PackageFamilyName

ProfileTypes.description: Specifies the profiles to which the rule belongs. If not specified, the default is All. Possible values are: notConfigured, domain, private, public.
ProfileTypes.title: ProfileTypes

Protocol.description: 0-255 number representing the IP protocol (TCP = 6, UDP = 17). If not specified, the default is All. Valid values 0 to 255
Protocol.title: Protocol

RemoteAddressRanges.description: List of tokens specifying the remote addresses covered by the rule. Tokens are case insensitive. Default is any address. Valid tokens include:'' indicates any remote address. If present, this must be the only token included.'Defaultgateway''DHCP''DNS''WINS''Intranet' (supported on Windows versions 1809+)'RmtIntranet' (supported on Windows versions 1809+)'Internet' (supported on Windows versions 1809+)'Ply2Renders' (supported on Windows versions 1809+)'LocalSubnet' indicates any local address on the local subnet.A subnet can be specified using either the subnet mask or network prefix notation. If neither a subnet mask nor a network prefix is specified, the subnet mask defaults to 255.255.255.255.A valid IPv6 address.An IPv4 address range in the format of 'start address - end address' with no spaces included.An IPv6 address range in the format of 'start address - end address' with no spaces included.
RemoteAddressRanges.title: RemoteAddressRanges

RemotePortRanges.description: List of remote port ranges. For example, '100-120', '200', '300-320'. If not specified, the default is All.
RemotePortRanges.title: RemotePortRanges

ServiceName.description: The name used in cases when a service, not an application, is sending or receiving traffic.
ServiceName.title: ServiceName

TrafficDirection.description: The traffic direction that the rule is enabled for. If not specified, the default is Out. Possible values are: notConfigured, out, in.
TrafficDirection.title: TrafficDirection

FirewallRules.description: Configures the firewall rule settings. This collection can contain a maximum of 150 elements.
FirewallRules.title: FirewallRules

LanManagerAuthenticationLevel.description: This security setting determines which challenge/response authentication protocol is used for network logons. Possible values are: lmAndNltm, lmNtlmAndNtlmV2, lmAndNtlmOnly, lmAndNtlmV2, lmNtlmV2AndNotLm, lmNtlmV2AndNotLmOrNtm.
LanManagerAuthenticationLevel.title: LanManagerAuthenticationLevel

LanManagerWorkstationDisableInsecureGues.description: If enabled,the SMB client will allow insecure guest logons. If not configured, the SMB client will reject insecure guest logons.
LanManagerWorkstationDisableInsecureGues.title: LanManagerWorkstationDisableInsecureGuestLogons

LocalSecurityOptionsAdministratorAccount.description: Define a different account name to be associated with the security identifier (SID) for the account 'Administrator'.
LocalSecurityOptionsAdministratorAccount.title: LocalSecurityOptionsAdministratorAccountName

LocalSecurityOptionsAdministratorElevati.description: Define the behavior of the elevation prompt for admins in Admin Approval Mode. Possible values are: notConfigured, elevateWithoutPrompting, promptForCredentialsOnTheSecureDesktop, promptForConsentOnTheSecureDesktop, promptForCredentials, promptForConsent, promptForConsentForNonWindowsBinaries.
LocalSecurityOptionsAdministratorElevati.title: LocalSecurityOptionsAdministratorElevationPromptBehavior

LocalSecurityOptionsAllowAnonymousEnumer.description: This security setting determines whether to allows anonymous users to perform certain activities, such as enumerating the names of domain accounts and network shares.
LocalSecurityOptionsAllowAnonymousEnumer.title: LocalSecurityOptionsAllowAnonymousEnumerationOfSAMAccountsAndShares

LocalSecurityOptionsAllowPKU2UAuthentica.description: Block PKU2U authentication requests to this device to use online identities.
LocalSecurityOptionsAllowPKU2UAuthentica.title: LocalSecurityOptionsAllowPKU2UAuthenticationRequests

LocalSecurityOptionsAllowRemoteCallsToSe.description: Edit the default Security Descriptor Definition Language string to allow or deny users and groups to make remote calls to the SAM.
LocalSecurityOptionsAllowRemoteCallsToSe.title: LocalSecurityOptionsAllowRemoteCallsToSecurityAccountsManager

LocalSecurityOptionsAllowSystemToBeShutD.description: This security setting determines whether a computer can be shut down without having to log on to Windows.
LocalSecurityOptionsAllowSystemToBeShutD.title: LocalSecurityOptionsAllowSystemToBeShutDownWithoutHavingToLogOn

LocalSecurityOptionsAllowUIAccessApplica.description: Allow UIAccess apps to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop.
LocalSecurityOptionsAllowUIAccessApplica.title: LocalSecurityOptionsAllowUIAccessApplicationElevation

LocalSecurityOptionsAllowUIAccessApplica.description: Allow UIAccess apps to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop.Default is enabled
LocalSecurityOptionsAllowUIAccessApplica.title: LocalSecurityOptionsAllowUIAccessApplicationsForSecureLocations

LocalSecurityOptionsAllowUndockWithoutHa.description: Prevent a portable computer from being undocked without having to log in.
LocalSecurityOptionsAllowUndockWithoutHa.title: LocalSecurityOptionsAllowUndockWithoutHavingToLogon

LocalSecurityOptionsBlockMicrosoftAccoun.description: Prevent users from adding new Microsoft accounts to this computer.
LocalSecurityOptionsBlockMicrosoftAccoun.title: LocalSecurityOptionsBlockMicrosoftAccounts

LocalSecurityOptionsBlockRemoteLogonWith.description: Enable Local accounts that are not password protected to log on from locations other than the physical device.Default is enabled
LocalSecurityOptionsBlockRemoteLogonWith.title: LocalSecurityOptionsBlockRemoteLogonWithBlankPassword

LocalSecurityOptionsBlockRemoteOpticalDr.description: Enabling this settings allows only interactively logged on user to access CD-ROM media.
LocalSecurityOptionsBlockRemoteOpticalDr.title: LocalSecurityOptionsBlockRemoteOpticalDriveAccess

LocalSecurityOptionsBlockUsersInstalling.description: Restrict installing printer drivers as part of connecting to a shared printer to admins only.
LocalSecurityOptionsBlockUsersInstalling.title: LocalSecurityOptionsBlockUsersInstallingPrinterDrivers

LocalSecurityOptionsClearVirtualMemoryPa.description: This security setting determines whether the virtual memory pagefile is cleared when the system is shut down.
LocalSecurityOptionsClearVirtualMemoryPa.title: LocalSecurityOptionsClearVirtualMemoryPageFile

LocalSecurityOptionsClientDigitallySignC.description: This security setting determines whether packet signing is required by the SMB client component.
LocalSecurityOptionsClientDigitallySignC.title: LocalSecurityOptionsClientDigitallySignCommunicationsAlways

LocalSecurityOptionsClientSendUnencrypte.description: If this security setting is enabled, the Server Message Block (SMB) redirector is allowed to send plaintext passwords to non-Microsoft SMB servers that do not support password encryption during authentication.
LocalSecurityOptionsClientSendUnencrypte.title: LocalSecurityOptionsClientSendUnencryptedPasswordToThirdPartySMBServers

LocalSecurityOptionsDetectApplicationIns.description: App installations requiring elevated privileges will prompt for admin credentials.Default is enabled
LocalSecurityOptionsDetectApplicationIns.title: LocalSecurityOptionsDetectApplicationInstallationsAndPromptForElevation

LocalSecurityOptionsDisableAdministrator.description: Determines whether the Local Administrator account is enabled or disabled.
LocalSecurityOptionsDisableAdministrator.title: LocalSecurityOptionsDisableAdministratorAccount

LocalSecurityOptionsDisableClientDigital.description: This security setting determines whether the SMB client attempts to negotiate SMB packet signing.
LocalSecurityOptionsDisableClientDigital.title: LocalSecurityOptionsDisableClientDigitallySignCommunicationsIfServerAgrees

LocalSecurityOptionsDisableGuestAccount.description: Determines if the Guest account is enabled or disabled.
LocalSecurityOptionsDisableGuestAccount.title: LocalSecurityOptionsDisableGuestAccount

LocalSecurityOptionsDisableServerDigital.description: This security setting determines whether packet signing is required by the SMB server component.
LocalSecurityOptionsDisableServerDigital.title: LocalSecurityOptionsDisableServerDigitallySignCommunicationsAlways

LocalSecurityOptionsDisableServerDigital.description: This security setting determines whether the SMB server will negotiate SMB packet signing with clients that request it.
LocalSecurityOptionsDisableServerDigital.title: LocalSecurityOptionsDisableServerDigitallySignCommunicationsIfClientAgrees

LocalSecurityOptionsDoNotAllowAnonymousE.description: This security setting determines what additional permissions will be granted for anonymous connections to the computer.
LocalSecurityOptionsDoNotAllowAnonymousE.title: LocalSecurityOptionsDoNotAllowAnonymousEnumerationOfSAMAccounts

LocalSecurityOptionsDoNotRequireCtrlAltD.description: Require CTRL+ALT+DEL to be pressed before a user can log on.
LocalSecurityOptionsDoNotRequireCtrlAltD.title: LocalSecurityOptionsDoNotRequireCtrlAltDel

LocalSecurityOptionsDoNotStoreLANManager.description: This security setting determines if, at the next password change, the LAN Manager (LM) hash value for the new password is stored. Its not stored by default.
LocalSecurityOptionsDoNotStoreLANManager.title: LocalSecurityOptionsDoNotStoreLANManagerHashValueOnNextPasswordChange

LocalSecurityOptionsFormatAndEjectOfRemo.description: Define who is allowed to format and eject removable NTFS media. Possible values are: notConfigured, administrators, administratorsAndPowerUsers, administratorsAndInteractiveUsers.
LocalSecurityOptionsFormatAndEjectOfRemo.title: LocalSecurityOptionsFormatAndEjectOfRemovableMediaAllowedUser

LocalSecurityOptionsGuestAccountName.description: Define a different account name to be associated with the security identifier (SID) for the account 'Guest'.
LocalSecurityOptionsGuestAccountName.title: LocalSecurityOptionsGuestAccountName

LocalSecurityOptionsHideLastSignedInUser.description: Do not display the username of the last person who signed in on this device.
LocalSecurityOptionsHideLastSignedInUser.title: LocalSecurityOptionsHideLastSignedInUser

LocalSecurityOptionsHideUsernameAtSignIn.description: Do not display the username of the person signing in to this device after credentials are entered and before the devices desktop is shown.
LocalSecurityOptionsHideUsernameAtSignIn.title: LocalSecurityOptionsHideUsernameAtSignIn

LocalSecurityOptionsInformationDisplayed.description: Configure the user information that is displayed when the session is locked. If not configured, user display name, domain and username are shown. Possible values are: notConfigured, administrators, administratorsAndPowerUsers, administratorsAndInteractiveUsers.
LocalSecurityOptionsInformationDisplayed.title: LocalSecurityOptionsInformationDisplayedOnLockScreen

LocalSecurityOptionsInformationShownOnLo.description: Configure the user information that is displayed when the session is locked. If not configured, user display name, domain and username are shown. Possible values are: notConfigured, userDisplayNameDomainUser, userDisplayNameOnly, doNotDisplayUser.
LocalSecurityOptionsInformationShownOnLo.title: LocalSecurityOptionsInformationShownOnLockScreen

LocalSecurityOptionsLogOnMessageText.description: Set message text for users attempting to log in.
LocalSecurityOptionsLogOnMessageText.title: LocalSecurityOptionsLogOnMessageText

LocalSecurityOptionsLogOnMessageTitle.description: Set message title for users attempting to log in.
LocalSecurityOptionsLogOnMessageTitle.title: LocalSecurityOptionsLogOnMessageTitle

LocalSecurityOptionsMachineInactivityLim.description: Define maximum minutes of inactivity on the interactive desktops login screen until the screen saver runs. Valid values 0 to 9999
LocalSecurityOptionsMachineInactivityLim.title: LocalSecurityOptionsMachineInactivityLimit

LocalSecurityOptionsMachineInactivityLim.description: Define maximum minutes of inactivity on the interactive desktops login screen until the screen saver runs. Valid values 0 to 9999
LocalSecurityOptionsMachineInactivityLim.title: LocalSecurityOptionsMachineInactivityLimitInMinutes

LocalSecurityOptionsMinimumSessionSecuri.description: This security setting allows a client to require the negotiation of 128-bit encryption and/or NTLMv2 session security. Possible values are: none, requireNtmlV2SessionSecurity, require128BitEncryption, ntlmV2And128BitEncryption.
LocalSecurityOptionsMinimumSessionSecuri.title: LocalSecurityOptionsMinimumSessionSecurityForNtlmSspBasedClients

LocalSecurityOptionsMinimumSessionSecuri.description: This security setting allows a server to require the negotiation of 128-bit encryption and/or NTLMv2 session security. Possible values are: none, requireNtmlV2SessionSecurity, require128BitEncryption, ntlmV2And128BitEncryption.
LocalSecurityOptionsMinimumSessionSecuri.title: LocalSecurityOptionsMinimumSessionSecurityForNtlmSspBasedServers

LocalSecurityOptionsOnlyElevateSignedExe.description: Enforce PKI certification path validation for a given executable file before it is permitted to run.
LocalSecurityOptionsOnlyElevateSignedExe.title: LocalSecurityOptionsOnlyElevateSignedExecutables

LocalSecurityOptionsRestrictAnonymousAcc.description: By default, this security setting restricts anonymous access to shares and pipes to the settings for named pipes that can be accessed anonymously and Shares that can be accessed anonymously
LocalSecurityOptionsRestrictAnonymousAcc.title: LocalSecurityOptionsRestrictAnonymousAccessToNamedPipesAndShares

LocalSecurityOptionsSmartCardRemovalBeha.description: This security setting determines what happens when the smart card for a logged-on user is removed from the smart card reader. Possible values are: noAction, lockWorkstation, forceLogoff, disconnectRemoteDesktopSession.
LocalSecurityOptionsSmartCardRemovalBeha.title: LocalSecurityOptionsSmartCardRemovalBehavior

LocalSecurityOptionsStandardUserElevatio.description: Define the behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users. Possible values are: notConfigured, automaticallyDenyElevationRequests, promptForCredentialsOnTheSecureDesktop, promptForCredentials.
LocalSecurityOptionsStandardUserElevatio.title: LocalSecurityOptionsStandardUserElevationPromptBehavior

LocalSecurityOptionsSwitchToSecureDeskto.description: Enable all elevation requests to go to the interactive user's desktop rather than the secure desktop. Prompt behavior policy settings for admins and standard users are used.
LocalSecurityOptionsSwitchToSecureDeskto.title: LocalSecurityOptionsSwitchToSecureDesktopWhenPromptingForElevation

LocalSecurityOptionsUseAdminApprovalMode.description: Defines whether the built-in admin account uses Admin Approval Mode or runs all apps with full admin privileges.Default is enabled
LocalSecurityOptionsUseAdminApprovalMode.title: LocalSecurityOptionsUseAdminApprovalMode

LocalSecurityOptionsUseAdminApprovalMode.description: Define whether Admin Approval Mode and all UAC policy settings are enabled, default is enabled
LocalSecurityOptionsUseAdminApprovalMode.title: LocalSecurityOptionsUseAdminApprovalModeForAdministrators

LocalSecurityOptionsVirtualizeFileAndReg.description: Virtualize file and registry write failures to per user locations
LocalSecurityOptionsVirtualizeFileAndReg.title: LocalSecurityOptionsVirtualizeFileAndRegistryWriteFailuresToPerUserLocations

SmartScreenBlockOverrideForFiles.description: Allows IT Admins to control whether users can can ignore SmartScreen warnings and run malicious files.
SmartScreenBlockOverrideForFiles.title: SmartScreenBlockOverrideForFiles

SmartScreenEnableInShell.description: Allows IT Admins to configure SmartScreen for Windows.
SmartScreenEnableInShell.title: SmartScreenEnableInShell

UserRightsAccessCredentialManagerAsTrust.description: This user right is used by Credential Manager during Backup/Restore. Users' saved credentials might be compromised if this privilege is given to other entities. Only states NotConfigured and Allowed are supported
UserRightsAccessCredentialManagerAsTrust.title: UserRightsAccessCredentialManagerAsTrustedCaller

items.description: Intune Device Configuration Endpoint Protection Policy for Windows10
items.title: Schema for MSFT_MicrosoftGraphDeviceManagementUserRightsLocalUserOrGroup

Description.description: Admins description of this local user or group.
Description.title: Description

Name.description: The name of this local user or group.
Name.title: Name

SecurityIdentifier.description: The security identifier of this local user or group (e.g. S-1-5-32-544).
SecurityIdentifier.title: SecurityIdentifier

LocalUsersOrGroups.description: Representing a collection of local users or groups which will be set on device if the state of this setting is Allowed. This collection can contain a maximum of 500 elements.
LocalUsersOrGroups.title: LocalUsersOrGroups

State.description: Representing the current state of this user rights setting. Possible values are: notConfigured, blocked, allowed.
State.title: State

UserRightsActAsPartOfTheOperatingSystem.description: This user right allows a process to impersonate any user without authentication. The process can therefore gain access to the same local resources as that user. Only states NotConfigured and Allowed are supported
UserRightsActAsPartOfTheOperatingSystem.title: UserRightsActAsPartOfTheOperatingSystem

items.description: Intune Device Configuration Endpoint Protection Policy for Windows10
items.title: Schema for MSFT_MicrosoftGraphDeviceManagementUserRightsLocalUserOrGroup

Description.description: Admins description of this local user or group.
Description.title: Description

EnhancedAntiSpoofingForFacialFeaturesEna.title: EnhancedAntiSpoofingForFacialFeaturesEnabled

PinExpirationInDays.description: Integer value specifies the period (in days) that a PIN can be used before the system requires the user to change it. Valid values are 0 to 730 inclusive. Valid values 0 to 730
PinExpirationInDays.title: PinExpirationInDays

PinLowercaseCharactersUsage.description: This value configures the use of lowercase characters in the Windows Hello for Business PIN. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
PinLowercaseCharactersUsage.title: PinLowercaseCharactersUsage

PinMaximumLength.description: Integer value that sets the maximum number of characters allowed for the work PIN. Valid values are 4 to 127 inclusive and greater than or equal to the value set for the minimum PIN. Valid values 4 to 127
PinMaximumLength.title: PinMaximumLength

PinMinimumLength.description: Integer value that sets the minimum number of characters required for the Windows Hello for Business PIN. Valid values are 4 to 127 inclusive and less than or equal to the value set for the maximum PIN. Valid values 4 to 127
PinMinimumLength.title: PinMinimumLength

PinPreviousBlockCount.description: Controls the ability to prevent users from using past PINs. This must be set between 0 and 50, inclusive, and the current PIN of the user is included in that count. If set to 0, previous PINs are not stored. PIN history is not preserved through a PIN reset. Valid values 0 to 50
PinPreviousBlockCount.title: PinPreviousBlockCount

PinRecoveryEnabled.description: Boolean value that enables a user to change their PIN by using the Windows Hello for Business PIN recovery service.
PinRecoveryEnabled.title: PinRecoveryEnabled

PinSpecialCharactersUsage.description: Controls the ability to use special characters in the Windows Hello for Business PIN. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
PinSpecialCharactersUsage.title: PinSpecialCharactersUsage

PinUppercaseCharactersUsage.description: This value configures the use of uppercase characters in the Windows Hello for Business PIN. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
PinUppercaseCharactersUsage.title: PinUppercaseCharactersUsage

SecurityDeviceRequired.description: Controls whether to require a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) for provisioning Windows Hello for Business. A TPM provides an additional security benefit in that data stored on it cannot be used on other devices. If set to False, all devices can provision Windows Hello for Business even if there is not a usable TPM.
SecurityDeviceRequired.title: SecurityDeviceRequired

UnlockWithBiometricsEnabled.description: Controls the use of biometric gestures, such as face and fingerprint, as an alternative to the Windows Hello for Business PIN.  If set to False, biometric gestures are not allowed. Users must still configure a PIN as a backup in case of failures.
UnlockWithBiometricsEnabled.title: UnlockWithBiometricsEnabled

UseCertificatesForOnPremisesAuthEnabled.description: Boolean value that enables Windows Hello for Business to use certificates to authenticate on-premise resources.
UseCertificatesForOnPremisesAuthEnabled.title: UseCertificatesForOnPremisesAuthEnabled

UseSecurityKeyForSignin.description: Boolean value used to enable the Windows Hello security key as a logon credential.
UseSecurityKeyForSignin.title: UseSecurityKeyForSignin

WindowsHelloForBusinessBlocked.description: Boolean value that blocks Windows Hello for Business as a method for signing into Windows.
WindowsHelloForBusinessBlocked.title: WindowsHelloForBusinessBlocked

EnterpriseCloudResources.description: Contains a list of enterprise resource domains hosted in the cloud that need to be protected. Connections to these resources are considered enterprise data. If a proxy is paired with a cloud resource, traffic to the cloud resource will be routed through the enterprise network via the denoted proxy server (on Port 80). A proxy server used for this purpose must also be configured using the EnterpriseInternalProxyServers policy. This collection can contain a maximum of 500 elements.
EnterpriseCloudResources.title: EnterpriseCloudResources

EnterpriseInternalProxyServers.description: This is the comma-separated list of internal proxy servers. For example, '157.54.14.28, 157.54.11.118, 10.202.14.167, 157.53.14.163, 157.69.210.59'. These proxies have been configured by the admin to connect to specific resources on the Internet. They are considered to be enterprise network locations. The proxies are only leveraged in configuring the EnterpriseCloudResources policy to force traffic to the matched cloud resources through these proxies.
EnterpriseInternalProxyServers.title: EnterpriseInternalProxyServers

CidrAddress.title: CidrAddress

EnterpriseIPRanges.description: Sets the enterprise IP ranges that define the computers in the enterprise network. Data that comes from those computers will be considered part of the enterprise and protected. These locations will be considered a safe destination for enterprise data to be shared to. This collection can contain a maximum of 500 elements.
EnterpriseIPRanges.title: EnterpriseIPRanges

EnterpriseIPRangesAreAuthoritative.description: Boolean value that tells the client to accept the configured list and not to use heuristics to attempt to find other subnets. Default is false.
EnterpriseIPRangesAreAuthoritative.title: EnterpriseIPRangesAreAuthoritative

EnterpriseNetworkDomainNames.description: This is the list of domains that comprise the boundaries of the enterprise. Data from one of these domains that is sent to a device will be considered enterprise data and protected. These locations will be considered a safe destination for enterprise data to be shared to.
EnterpriseNetworkDomainNames.title: EnterpriseNetworkDomainNames

EnterpriseProxyServers.description: This is a list of proxy servers. Any server not on this list is considered non-enterprise.
EnterpriseProxyServers.title: EnterpriseProxyServers

EnterpriseProxyServersAreAuthoritative.description: Boolean value that tells the client to accept the configured list of proxies and not try to detect other work proxies. Default is false
EnterpriseProxyServersAreAuthoritative.title: EnterpriseProxyServersAreAuthoritative

NeutralDomainResources.description: List of domain names that can used for work or personal resource.
NeutralDomainResources.title: NeutralDomainResources

NetworkEscapeHatchAllowed.description: Whether the network escape hatch is enabled. If a network connection can't be made at boot time, the escape hatch prompts the user to temporarily connect to a network in order to refresh the device policy. After applying policy, the temporary network will be forgotten and the device will continue booting. This prevents being unable to connect to a network if there is no suitable network in the last policy and the device boots into an app in lock task mode, or the user is otherwise unable to reach device settings.

AirDropBlocked.title: AirDropBlocked

AirDropForceUnmanagedDropTarget.description: Force AirDrop to be considered an unmanaged drop target.
AirDropForceUnmanagedDropTarget.title: AirDropForceUnmanagedDropTarget

AirPlayForcePairingPasswordForOutgoingRe.description: Force requiring a pairing password for outgoing AirPlay requests.
AirPlayForcePairingPasswordForOutgoingRe.title: AirPlayForcePairingPasswordForOutgoingRequests

AirPrintBlockCredentialsStorage.description: Blocks keychain storage of username and password for outgoing AirPrint request.
AirPrintBlockCredentialsStorage.title: AirPrintBlockCredentialsStorage

AirPrintBlockiBeaconDiscovery.description: Blocking prevents malicious AirPrint Bluetooth beacons phishing for network traffic.
AirPrintBlockiBeaconDiscovery.title: AirPrintBlockiBeaconDiscovery

AirPrintForceTrustedTLS.description: Forces trusted certificates for TLS printing communication
AirPrintForceTrustedTLS.title: AirPrintForceTrustedTLS

AppleWatchBlockPairing.description: Indicates whether or not to allow Apple Watch pairing when the device is in supervised mode (iOS 9.0 and later).
AppleWatchBlockPairing.title: AppleWatchBlockPairing

AppleWatchForceWristDetection.description: Force paired Apple watch to use wrist detection.
AppleWatchForceWristDetection.title: AppleWatchForceWristDetection

name.description: Define the name of the app.
name.title: name

publisher.description: Define the publisher of the app.
publisher.title: publisher

AppsSingleAppModeList.description: Apps you add to this list and assign to a device can lock the device to run only that app once launched, or lock the device while a certain action is running (for example, taking a test). Once the action is complete, or you remove the restriction, the device returns to its normal state.
AppsSingleAppModeList.title: AppsSingleAppModeList

AppStoreBlockAutomaticDownloads.description: Blocks automatic downloading of apps purchased on other devices. Does not affect updates to existing apps.
AppStoreBlockAutomaticDownloads.title: AppStoreBlockAutomaticDownloads

AppStoreBlocked.description: For supervised devices as of iOS 13.0.
AppStoreBlocked.title: AppStoreBlocked

AppStoreBlockUIAppInstallation.description: Block App Store from Home Screen. Users may continue to use iTunes or Apple Configurator to install or update apps.
AppStoreBlockUIAppInstallation.title: AppStoreBlockUIAppInstallation

AppStoreRequirePassword.description: Users must enter Apple ID password for each in-app and iTunes purchase.
AppStoreRequirePassword.title: AppStoreRequirePassword

items.description: This resource configures the settings of Android Device Administrator device restriction policy in your cloud-based organization.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_MicrosoftGraphapplistitem

name.description: Define the name of the app.
name.title: name

publisher.description: Define the publisher of the app.
publisher.title: publisher

AppsVisibilityList.description: Enter the iTunes App Store URL of the app you want. For example, to specify the Microsoft Work Folders app for iOS, enter https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/work-folders/id950878067?mt=8. To find the URL of an app, use a search engine to locate the store page. For example, to find the Work Folders app, you could search Microsoft Work Folders ITunes.
AppsVisibilityList.title: AppsVisibilityList

AppsVisibilityListType.description: Set whether the list is a list of apps to hide or a list of apps to make visible.
AppsVisibilityListType.title: AppsVisibilityListType

AutoFillForceAuthentication.description: Require Touch ID or Face ID before passwords or credit card information can be auto filled in Safari and Apps. Available with iOS 12.0 and later.
AutoFillForceAuthentication.title: AutoFillForceAuthentication

BlockSystemAppRemoval.description: Blocking disables the ability to remove system apps from the device.
BlockSystemAppRemoval.title: BlockSystemAppRemoval

BluetoothBlockModification.description: Block modification of Bluetooth settings. To use this setting, the device must be in supervised mode (iOS 10.0+).
BluetoothBlockModification.title: BluetoothBlockModification

CameraBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from accessing the camera of the device. Requires a supervised device for iOS 13 and later.
CameraBlocked.title: CameraBlocked

CellularBlockDataRoaming.description: Block data roaming over the cellular network. This won't show in the device's management profile, but a block will be enforced for data roaming every time the device checks in (typically every 8 hours).
CellularBlockDataRoaming.title: CellularBlockDataRoaming

CellularBlockGlobalBackgroundFetchWhileR.description: Block global background fetch while roaming over the cellular network.
CellularBlockGlobalBackgroundFetchWhileR.title: CellularBlockGlobalBackgroundFetchWhileRoaming

CellularBlockPerAppDataModification.description: Block changes to app cellular data usage settings.
CellularBlockPerAppDataModification.title: CellularBlockPerAppDataModification

CellularBlockPersonalHotspot.description: This value is available only with certain carriers. This won't show in the device's management profile, but a block will be enforced for personal hotspot every time the device checks in (typically every 8 hours). Block modification of personal hotspot in addition to this setting to ensure personal hotspot will always be blocked.
CellularBlockPersonalHotspot.title: CellularBlockPersonalHotspot

CellularBlockPersonalHotspotModification.description: For devices running iOS 12.2 and later. Users can't turn Personal Hotspot on or off. If you block this setting and block Personal Hotspot, Personal Hotspot will be turned off.
CellularBlockPersonalHotspotModification.title: CellularBlockPersonalHotspotModification

CellularBlockPlanModification.description: Indicates whether or not to allow users to change the settings of the cellular plan on a supervised device.
CellularBlockPlanModification.title: CellularBlockPlanModification

CellularBlockVoiceRoaming.description: Block voice roaming over the cellular network.
CellularBlockVoiceRoaming.title: CellularBlockVoiceRoaming

CertificatesBlockUntrustedTlsCertificate.description: Block untrusted Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificates.
CertificatesBlockUntrustedTlsCertificate.title: CertificatesBlockUntrustedTlsCertificates

ClassroomAppBlockRemoteScreenObservation.description: Block remote screen observation by Classroom app. To use this setting, the device must be in supervised mode (iOS 9.3+).
ClassroomAppBlockRemoteScreenObservation.title: ClassroomAppBlockRemoteScreenObservation

ClassroomAppForceUnpromptedScreenObserva.description: Student devices enrolled in a class via the Classroom app will automatically give permission to that course's teacher to silently observe the student's screen.
ClassroomAppForceUnpromptedScreenObserva.title: ClassroomAppForceUnpromptedScreenObservation

ClassroomForceAutomaticallyJoinClasses.description: Students can join a class without prompting the teacher.
ClassroomForceAutomaticallyJoinClasses.title: ClassroomForceAutomaticallyJoinClasses

ClassroomForceRequestPermissionToLeaveCl.description: Requires a student enrolled in an unmanaged course via Classroom to request permission from the teacher when attempting to leave the course. Only available in iOS 11.3+
ClassroomForceRequestPermissionToLeaveCl.title: ClassroomForceRequestPermissionToLeaveClasses

ClassroomForceUnpromptedAppAndDeviceLock.description: Teachers can lock an app open or lock the device without first prompting the user.
ClassroomForceUnpromptedAppAndDeviceLock.title: ClassroomForceUnpromptedAppAndDeviceLock

CompliantAppListType.description: Device compliance can be viewed in the Restricted Apps Compliance report.
CompliantAppListType.title: CompliantAppListType

items.description: This resource configures the settings of Android Device Administrator device restriction policy in your cloud-based organization.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_MicrosoftGraphapplistitem

name.description: Define the name of the app.
name.title: name

publisher.description: Define the publisher of the app.
publisher.title: publisher

CompliantAppsList.description: Enter the iTunes App Store URL of the app you want. For example, to specify the Microsoft Work Folders app for iOS, enter https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/work-folders/id950878067?mt=8. To find the URL of an app, use a search engine to locate the store page. For example, to find the Work Folders app, you could search Microsoft Work Folders ITunes.
CompliantAppsList.title: CompliantAppsList

ConfigurationProfileBlockChanges.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from installing configuration profiles and certificates interactively when the device is in supervised mode.
ConfigurationProfileBlockChanges.title: ConfigurationProfileBlockChanges

ContactsAllowManagedToUnmanagedWrite.description: Users can sync and add their managed contacts (including business and corporate ones) to an unmanaged app, such as the device's built-in contacts app.
ContactsAllowManagedToUnmanagedWrite.title: ContactsAllowManagedToUnmanagedWrite

ContactsAllowUnmanagedToManagedRead.description: An unmanaged app, such as the device's built-in contacts app, can access contact info in a managed app, such as Outlook.
ContactsAllowUnmanagedToManagedRead.title: ContactsAllowUnmanagedToManagedRead

ContinuousPathKeyboardBlocked.description: QuickPath enables continuous input on the device keyboard. Available for iOS/iPadOS 13.0 and later.
ContinuousPathKeyboardBlocked.title: ContinuousPathKeyboardBlocked

DateAndTimeForceSetAutomatically.description: Forces device to Set Date & Time Automatically. The device's time zone will only be updated when the device has cellular connections or wifi with location services enabled.
DateAndTimeForceSetAutomatically.title: DateAndTimeForceSetAutomatically

DefinitionLookupBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block definition lookup when the device is in supervised mode (iOS 8.1.3 and later ).
DefinitionLookupBlocked.title: DefinitionLookupBlocked

DeviceBlockEnableRestrictions.description: On iOS 12.0 and later, this blocks users from setting their own Screen Time settings, which includes device restrictions. On iOS 11.4.1 and earlier, this blocks the user from enabling restrictions in the device settings. The blocking effect is the same on any supervised iOS device.
DeviceBlockEnableRestrictions.title: DeviceBlockEnableRestrictions

DeviceBlockEraseContentAndSettings.description: Block the use of the erase all content and settings option on the device.
DeviceBlockEraseContentAndSettings.title: DeviceBlockEraseContentAndSettings

DeviceBlockNameModification.description: Indicates whether or not to allow device name modification when the device is in supervised mode (iOS 9.0 and later).
DeviceBlockNameModification.title: DeviceBlockNameModification

DiagnosticDataBlockSubmission.description: Block the device from sending diagnostic and usage telemetry data.
DiagnosticDataBlockSubmission.title: DiagnosticDataBlockSubmission

DiagnosticDataBlockSubmissionModificatio.description: Block the modification of the diagnostic submission and app analytics settings in the Diagnostics and Usage pane in Settings. To use this setting, the device must be in supervised mode (iOS 9.3.2+).
DiagnosticDataBlockSubmissionModificatio.title: DiagnosticDataBlockSubmissionModification

DocumentsBlockManagedDocumentsInUnmanage.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from viewing managed documents in unmanaged apps.
DocumentsBlockManagedDocumentsInUnmanage.title: DocumentsBlockManagedDocumentsInUnmanagedApps

DocumentsBlockUnmanagedDocumentsInManage.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from viewing unmanaged documents in managed apps.
DocumentsBlockUnmanagedDocumentsInManage.title: DocumentsBlockUnmanagedDocumentsInManagedApps

EmailInDomainSuffixes.description: Emails that the user sends or receives which don't match the domains you specify here will be marked as untrusted.
EmailInDomainSuffixes.title: EmailInDomainSuffixes

EnterpriseAppBlockTrust.description: Removes the Trust Enterprise Developer button in Settings->General->Profiles & Device Management.
EnterpriseAppBlockTrust.title: EnterpriseAppBlockTrust

EnterpriseAppBlockTrustModification.description: Block the changing of enterprise app trust settings.
EnterpriseAppBlockTrustModification.title: EnterpriseAppBlockTrustModification

EnterpriseBookBlockBackup.description: Indicates whether or not to backup enterprise book.
EnterpriseBookBlockBackup.title: EnterpriseBookBlockBackup

EnterpriseBookBlockMetadataSync.description: Indicates whether or not to sync enterprise book metadata.
EnterpriseBookBlockMetadataSync.title: EnterpriseBookBlockMetadataSync

EsimBlockModification.description: Indicates whether or not to allow the addition or removal of cellular plans on the eSIM of a supervised device.
EsimBlockModification.title: EsimBlockModification

FaceTimeBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using FaceTime. Requires a supervised device for iOS 13 and later.
FaceTimeBlocked.title: FaceTimeBlocked

FilesNetworkDriveAccessBlocked.description: Using the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol, devices can access files or other resources on a network server. Available for devices running iOS and iPadOS, versions 13.0 and later.
FilesNetworkDriveAccessBlocked.title: FilesNetworkDriveAccessBlocked

FilesUsbDriveAccessBlocked.description: Devices with access can connect to and open files on a USB drive. Available for devices running iOS and iPadOS, versions 13.0 and later.
FilesUsbDriveAccessBlocked.title: FilesUsbDriveAccessBlocked

FindMyDeviceInFindMyAppBlocked.description: A Find My app feature. Available for iOS/iPadOS 13.0 and later.
FindMyDeviceInFindMyAppBlocked.title: FindMyDeviceInFindMyAppBlocked

FindMyFriendsBlocked.description: Block changes to the Find My Friends app settings.
FindMyFriendsBlocked.title: FindMyFriendsBlocked

FindMyFriendsInFindMyAppBlocked.description: A Find My app feature. Used to locate family and friends from an Apple device or iCloud.com. Available for iOS/iPadOS 13.0 and later.
FindMyFriendsInFindMyAppBlocked.title: FindMyFriendsInFindMyAppBlocked

GameCenterBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using Game Center when the device is in supervised mode.
GameCenterBlocked.title: GameCenterBlocked

GamingBlockGameCenterFriends.description: Block adding Game Center friends. For supervised devices as of iOS 13.0.
GamingBlockGameCenterFriends.title: GamingBlockGameCenterFriends

GamingBlockMultiplayer.description: For supervised devices as of iOS 13.0.
GamingBlockMultiplayer.title: GamingBlockMultiplayer

HostPairingBlocked.description: Host pairing allows you to control which devices the device can pair with.
HostPairingBlocked.title: HostPairingBlocked

IBooksStoreBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using the iBooks Store when the device is in supervised mode.
IBooksStoreBlocked.title: IBooksStoreBlocked

IBooksStoreBlockErotica.description: User will not be able to download media from the iBook store that has been tagged as erotica.
IBooksStoreBlockErotica.title: IBooksStoreBlockErotica

ICloudBlockActivityContinuation.description: Handoff lets users start work on one iOS device, and continue it on another MacOS or iOS device.
ICloudBlockActivityContinuation.title: ICloudBlockActivityContinuation

ICloudBlockBackup.description: Block backing up device to iCloud.
ICloudBlockBackup.title: ICloudBlockBackup

ICloudBlockDocumentSync.description: Blocks iCloud from syncing documents and data.
ICloudBlockDocumentSync.title: ICloudBlockDocumentSync

ICloudBlockManagedAppsSync.description: Block managed apps from syncing to cloud.
ICloudBlockManagedAppsSync.title: ICloudBlockManagedAppsSync

ICloudBlockPhotoLibrary.description: Any photos not fully downloaded from iCloud Photo Library to device will be removed from local storage.
ICloudBlockPhotoLibrary.title: ICloudBlockPhotoLibrary

ICloudBlockPhotoStreamSync.description: Block photo stream syncing to iCloud.
ICloudBlockPhotoStreamSync.title: ICloudBlockPhotoStreamSync

ICloudBlockSharedPhotoStream.description: Block shared photo streaming. Blocking can cause data loss.
ICloudBlockSharedPhotoStream.title: ICloudBlockSharedPhotoStream

ITunesBlockExplicitContent.title: ITunesBlockExplicitContent

ITunesBlockMusicService.description: Block Music service. If true, Music app reverts to classic mode and Music service is disabled.
ITunesBlockMusicService.title: ITunesBlockMusicService

ITunesBlockRadio.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using iTunes Radio when the device is in supervised mode (iOS 9.3 and later).
ITunesBlockRadio.title: ITunesBlockRadio

KeyboardBlockAutoCorrect.description: Indicates whether or not to block keyboard auto-correction when the device is in supervised mode (iOS 8.1.3 and later).
KeyboardBlockAutoCorrect.title: KeyboardBlockAutoCorrect

KeyboardBlockDictation.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using dictation input when the device is in supervised mode.
KeyboardBlockDictation.title: KeyboardBlockDictation

KeyboardBlockPredictive.description: Indicates whether or not to block predictive keyboards when device is in supervised mode (iOS 8.1.3 and later).
KeyboardBlockPredictive.title: KeyboardBlockPredictive

KeyboardBlockShortcuts.description: Indicates whether or not to block keyboard shortcuts when the device is in supervised mode (iOS 9.0 and later).
KeyboardBlockShortcuts.title: KeyboardBlockShortcuts

KeyboardBlockSpellCheck.description: Indicates whether or not to block keyboard spell-checking when the device is in supervised mode (iOS 8.1.3 and later).
KeyboardBlockSpellCheck.title: KeyboardBlockSpellCheck

KeychainBlockCloudSync.description: Disables syncing credentials stored in the Keychain to iCloud.
KeychainBlockCloudSync.title: KeychainBlockCloudSync

KioskModeAllowAssistiveSpeak.title: KioskModeAllowAssistiveSpeak

KioskModeAllowAssistiveTouchSettings.description: Users can turn AssistiveTouch on or off.
KioskModeAllowAssistiveTouchSettings.title: KioskModeAllowAssistiveTouchSettings

KioskModeAllowColorInversionSettings.description: Users can turn invert colors on or off.
KioskModeAllowColorInversionSettings.title: KioskModeAllowColorInversionSettings

KioskModeAllowVoiceControlModification.description: Indicates whether or not to allow the user to toggle voice control in kiosk mode.
KioskModeAllowVoiceControlModification.title: KioskModeAllowVoiceControlModification

KioskModeAllowVoiceOverSettings.description: Users can turn VoiceOver on or off.
KioskModeAllowVoiceOverSettings.title: KioskModeAllowVoiceOverSettings

KioskModeAllowZoomSettings.description: Users can turn zoom on or off.
KioskModeAllowZoomSettings.title: KioskModeAllowZoomSettings

KioskModeAppStoreUrl.title: KioskModeAppStoreUrl

KioskModeAppType.description: Indicates type of app in kiosk mode.
KioskModeAppType.title: KioskModeAppType

KioskModeBlockAutoLock.description: Indicates whether or not to block the auto-lock while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeBlockAutoLock.title: KioskModeBlockAutoLock

KioskModeBlockRingerSwitch.description: Indicates whether or not to block the ringer switch while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeBlockRingerSwitch.title: KioskModeBlockRingerSwitch

KioskModeBlockScreenRotation.description: Indicates whether or not to block the screen rotation while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeBlockScreenRotation.title: KioskModeBlockScreenRotation

KioskModeBlockSleepButton.description: Indicates whether or not to block the sleep button while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeBlockSleepButton.title: KioskModeBlockSleepButton

KioskModeBlockTouchscreen.description: Indicates whether or not to block the touchscreen while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeBlockTouchscreen.title: KioskModeBlockTouchscreen

KioskModeBlockVolumeButtons.description: Indicates whether or not to block the volume buttons while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeBlockVolumeButtons.title: KioskModeBlockVolumeButtons

KioskModeBuiltInAppId.description: To see a list of bundle IDs for common built-in iOS apps, see the Intune documentation.
KioskModeBuiltInAppId.title: KioskModeBuiltInAppId

KioskModeEnableVoiceControl.description: Indicates whether or not to enable the voice control while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeEnableVoiceControl.title: KioskModeEnableVoiceControl

KioskModeManagedAppId.description: Add managed Intune apps from the Software Node.
KioskModeManagedAppId.title: KioskModeManagedAppId

KioskModeRequireAssistiveTouch.description: Indicates whether or not to enforce assistive touch while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeRequireAssistiveTouch.title: KioskModeRequireAssistiveTouch

KioskModeRequireColorInversion.description: Indicates whether or not to enforce color inversion while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeRequireColorInversion.title: KioskModeRequireColorInversion

KioskModeRequireMonoAudio.description: Indicates whether or not to enforce mono audio while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeRequireMonoAudio.title: KioskModeRequireMonoAudio

KioskModeRequireVoiceOver.description: Indicates whether or not to enforce voice control while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeRequireVoiceOver.title: KioskModeRequireVoiceOver

KioskModeRequireZoom.description: Indicates whether or not to enforce zoom while in Kiosk Mode.
KioskModeRequireZoom.title: KioskModeRequireZoom

LockScreenBlockControlCenter.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using control center on the lock screen.
LockScreenBlockControlCenter.title: LockScreenBlockControlCenter

LockScreenBlockNotificationView.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using the notification view on the lock screen.
LockScreenBlockNotificationView.title: LockScreenBlockNotificationView

LockScreenBlockPassbook.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using passbook when the device is locked.
LockScreenBlockPassbook.title: LockScreenBlockPassbook

LockScreenBlockTodayView.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using the Today View on the lock screen.
LockScreenBlockTodayView.title: LockScreenBlockTodayView

ManagedPasteboardRequired.description: Indicates whether or not to enforce managed pasteboard.
ManagedPasteboardRequired.title: ManagedPasteboardRequired

MediaContentRatingApps.description: Media content rating settings for apps.
MediaContentRatingApps.title: MediaContentRatingApps

MediaContentRatingAustralia.description: Media content rating settings for Australia
MediaContentRatingAustralia.title: MediaContentRatingAustralia

movieRating.description: Movies rating selected for New Zealand

tvRating.description: TV rating selected for New Zealand

MediaContentRatingUnitedStates.title: MediaContentRatingUnitedStates

items.description: This resource configures an Intune Device Configuration Policy for iOS.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_MicrosoftGraphiosnetworkusagerule

cellularDataBlocked.description: If set to true, corresponding managed apps will not be allowed to use cellular data at any time.
cellularDataBlocked.title: cellularDataBlocked

cellularDataBlockWhenRoaming.description: If set to true, corresponding managed apps will not be allowed to use cellular data when roaming.
cellularDataBlockWhenRoaming.title: cellularDataBlockWhenRoaming

items.description: This resource configures the settings of Android Device Administrator device restriction policy in your cloud-based organization.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_MicrosoftGraphapplistitem

name.description: Define the name of the app.
name.title: name

publisher.description: Define the publisher of the app.
publisher.title: publisher

managedApps.description: Information about the managed apps that this rule is going to apply to.
managedApps.title: managedApps

NetworkUsageRules.description: If you don't add any managed apps, the configured settings will apply to all managed apps by default. If you add specific managed apps, the configured settings will apply to only those apps.
NetworkUsageRules.title: NetworkUsageRules

NfcBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using nfc on the supervised device.
NfcBlocked.title: NfcBlocked

NotificationsBlockSettingsModification.description: Indicates whether or not to allow notifications settings modification (iOS 9.3 and later).
NotificationsBlockSettingsModification.title: NotificationsBlockSettingsModification

OnDeviceOnlyDictationForced.description: Indicates whether or not to enforce on device only dictation.
OnDeviceOnlyDictationForced.title: OnDeviceOnlyDictationForced

OnDeviceOnlyTranslationForced.description: Indicates whether or not to enforce on device only translation.
OnDeviceOnlyTranslationForced.title: OnDeviceOnlyTranslationForced

PasscodeBlockFingerprintModification.description: Block users from adding, changing, or removing fingerprints and faces. Face ID is available in iOS 11.0 and later.
PasscodeBlockFingerprintModification.title: PasscodeBlockFingerprintModification

PasscodeBlockFingerprintUnlock.description: Face ID is available on iOS 11.0 and later.
PasscodeBlockFingerprintUnlock.title: PasscodeBlockFingerprintUnlock

PasscodeBlockModification.description: Block passcode from being added, changed or removed. Changes to passcode restrictions will be ignored on supervised devices after blocking passcode modification.
PasscodeBlockModification.title: PasscodeBlockModification

PasscodeBlockSimple.description: Block simple password sequences, such as 1234 or 1111.
PasscodeBlockSimple.title: PasscodeBlockSimple

PasscodeExpirationDays.description: Number of days until device password must be changed. (1-65535)
PasscodeExpirationDays.title: PasscodeExpirationDays

PasscodeMinimumCharacterSetCount.description: Minimum number (0-4) of non-alphanumeric characters, such as #, %, !, etc., required in the password. The default value is 0.
PasscodeMinimumCharacterSetCount.title: PasscodeMinimumCharacterSetCount

PasscodeMinimumLength.description: Minimum number of digits or characters in password. (4-14)
PasscodeMinimumLength.title: PasscodeMinimumLength

PasscodeMinutesOfInactivityBeforeLock.description: Set to 0 to require a password immediately. There is no maximum number of minutes, and this number overrides the number currently set on the device. (This compliance check is supported for devices with OS versions iOS 8.0 and above)
PasscodeMinutesOfInactivityBeforeLock.title: PasscodeMinutesOfInactivityBeforeLock

PasscodeMinutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenT.description: Set to 0 to use the device's minimum possible value. This number (0-60) overrides the number currently set on the device. If set to Immediately, devices will use the minimum possible value per device.
PasscodeMinutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenT.title: PasscodeMinutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenTimeout

PasscodePreviousPasscodeBlockCount.description: Number of new passwords that must be used until an old one can be reused. (1-24)
PasscodePreviousPasscodeBlockCount.title: PasscodePreviousPasscodeBlockCount

PasscodeRequired.description: In addition to requiring a password on all devices, this setting enforces a non-simple, 6-digit password requirement (regardless of other password settings you configure) on devices that are enrolled with Apple user enrollment.
PasscodeRequired.title: PasscodeRequired

PasscodeRequiredType.description: Type of passcode that is required.
PasscodeRequiredType.title: PasscodeRequiredType

PasscodeSignInFailureCountBeforeWipe.description: Number of consecutive times an incorrect password can be entered before device is wiped of all data. (2-11)
PasscodeSignInFailureCountBeforeWipe.title: PasscodeSignInFailureCountBeforeWipe

PasswordBlockAirDropSharing.description: Indicates whether or not to block AirDrop password sharing
PasswordBlockAirDropSharing.title: PasswordBlockAirDropSharing

PasswordBlockAutoFill.description: Indicates whether or not to block password autofill.
PasswordBlockAutoFill.title: PasswordBlockAutoFill

PasswordBlockProximityRequests.description: Indicates whether or not to block password proximity requests.
PasswordBlockProximityRequests.title: PasswordBlockProximityRequests

PkiBlockOTAUpdates.description: Allows your users to receive software updates without connecting their devices to a computer
PkiBlockOTAUpdates.title: PkiBlockOTAUpdates

PodcastsBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block podcasts.
PodcastsBlocked.title: PodcastsBlocked

ProximityBlockSetupToNewDevice.description: Block user's from using their Apple devices to set up and configure other Apple devices.
ProximityBlockSetupToNewDevice.title: ProximityBlockSetupToNewDevice

SafariBlockAutofill.description: Indicates whether or not to block Safari autofill.
SafariBlockAutofill.title: SafariBlockAutofill

SafariBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block Safari. For supervised devices as of iOS 13.0.
SafariBlocked.title: SafariBlocked

SafariBlockJavaScript.description: Indicates whether or not to block javascript in Safari.
SafariBlockJavaScript.title: SafariBlockJavaScript

SafariBlockPopups.description: Indicates whether or not to block popups on Safari.
SafariBlockPopups.title: SafariBlockPopups

SafariManagedDomains.description: Documents downloaded from the URLs you specify here will be considered managed (Safari only).
SafariManagedDomains.title: SafariManagedDomains

SafariPasswordAutoFillDomains.description: Users can save passwords in Safari only from URLs matching the patterns you specify here. To use this setting, the device must be in supervised mode and not configured for multiple users. (iOS 9.3+)
SafariPasswordAutoFillDomains.title: SafariPasswordAutoFillDomains

SafariRequireFraudWarning.description: Indicates whether or not to require fraud warning in Safari.
SafariRequireFraudWarning.title: SafariRequireFraudWarning

ScreenCaptureBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from taking Screenshots
ScreenCaptureBlocked.title: ScreenCaptureBlocked

SharedDeviceBlockTemporarySessions.description: Indicates whether or not to block temporary sessions on shared devices.
SharedDeviceBlockTemporarySessions.title: SharedDeviceBlockTemporarySessions

SiriBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block Siri.
SiriBlocked.title: SiriBlocked

SiriBlockedWhenLocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block Siri when locked.
SiriBlockedWhenLocked.title: SiriBlockedWhenLocked

SiriBlockUserGeneratedContent.description: Block Siri from querying user-generated content from the internet.
SiriBlockUserGeneratedContent.title: SiriBlockUserGeneratedContent

SiriRequireProfanityFilter.description: Prevents Siri from dictating, or speaking profane language.
SiriRequireProfanityFilter.title: SiriRequireProfanityFilter

SoftwareUpdatesEnforcedDelayInDays.description: Delay the user's software update for this many days. The maximum is 90 days. (1-90)
SoftwareUpdatesEnforcedDelayInDays.title: SoftwareUpdatesEnforcedDelayInDays

SoftwareUpdatesForceDelayed.description: Delay user visibility of Software Updates. This does not impact any scheduled updates. It represents days before software updates are visible to end users after release.
SoftwareUpdatesForceDelayed.title: SoftwareUpdatesForceDelayed

SpotlightBlockInternetResults.description: Blocks Spotlight from returning any results from an Internet search.
SpotlightBlockInternetResults.title: SpotlightBlockInternetResults

UnpairedExternalBootToRecoveryAllowed.description: Allow users to boot devices into recovery mode with unpaired devices. Available for devices running iOS and iPadOS versions 14.5 and later.
UnpairedExternalBootToRecoveryAllowed.title: UnpairedExternalBootToRecoveryAllowed

UsbRestrictedModeBlocked.description: Blocks USB Restricted mode. USB Restricted mode blocks USB accessories from exchanging data with a device that has been locked over an hour.
UsbRestrictedModeBlocked.title: UsbRestrictedModeBlocked

VoiceDialingBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block voice dialing.
VoiceDialingBlocked.title: VoiceDialingBlocked

VpnBlockCreation.description: Blocks the creation of VPN configurations
VpnBlockCreation.title: VpnBlockCreation

WiFiConnectOnlyToConfiguredNetworks.description: Force the device to use only Wi-Fi networks set up through configuration profiles.
WiFiConnectOnlyToConfiguredNetworks.title: WiFiConnectOnlyToConfiguredNetworks

WiFiConnectToAllowedNetworksOnlyForced.description: Require devices to use Wi-Fi networks set up via configuration profiles. Available for devices running iOS and iPadOS versions 14.5 and later.
WiFiConnectToAllowedNetworksOnlyForced.title: WiFiConnectToAllowedNetworksOnlyForced

WifiPowerOnForced.description: Wi-Fi can't be turned off in the Settings app or in the Control Center, even when the device is in airplane mode. Available for iOS/iPadOS 13.0 and later.
WifiPowerOnForced.title: WifiPowerOnForced

Id.description: Id of the Intune policy.
Id.title: Id

DisplayName.description: Display name of the Intune policy.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

Description.title: Description

AddingGameCenterFriendsBlocked.description: Configures users from adding friends to Game Center. Available for devices running macOS versions 10.13 and later.
AddingGameCenterFriendsBlocked.title: AddingGameCenterFriendsBlocked

AirDropBlocked.description: Configures whether or not to allow AirDrop.
AirDropBlocked.title: AirDropBlocked

AppleWatchBlockAutoUnlock.description: Blocks users from unlocking their Mac with Apple Watch.
AppleWatchBlockAutoUnlock.title: AppleWatchBlockAutoUnlock

CameraBlocked.description: Blocks users from taking photographs and videos.
CameraBlocked.title: CameraBlocked

ClassroomAppBlockRemoteScreenObservation.description: Blocks AirPlay, screen sharing to other devices, and a Classroom app feature used by teachers to view their students' screens. This setting isn't available if you've blocked screenshots.
ClassroomAppBlockRemoteScreenObservation.title: ClassroomAppBlockRemoteScreenObservation

ClassroomAppForceUnpromptedScreenObserva.description: Unprompted observation means that teachers can view screens without warning students first. This setting isn't available if you've blocked screenshots.
ClassroomAppForceUnpromptedScreenObserva.title: ClassroomAppForceUnpromptedScreenObservation

ClassroomForceAutomaticallyJoinClasses.description: Students can join a class without prompting the teacher.
ClassroomForceAutomaticallyJoinClasses.title: ClassroomForceAutomaticallyJoinClasses

ClassroomForceRequestPermissionToLeaveCl.description: Students enrolled in an unmanaged Classroom course must get teacher consent to leave the course.
ClassroomForceRequestPermissionToLeaveCl.title: ClassroomForceRequestPermissionToLeaveClasses

ClassroomForceUnpromptedAppAndDeviceLock.description: Teachers can lock a student's device or app without the student's approval.
ClassroomForceUnpromptedAppAndDeviceLock.title: ClassroomForceUnpromptedAppAndDeviceLock

CompliantAppListType.description: Device compliance can be viewed in the Restricted Apps Compliance report.
CompliantAppListType.title: CompliantAppListType

items.description: This resource configures an Intune device configuration profile for an MacOS Device.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_MicrosoftGraphapplistitemMacOS

appId.description: The application or bundle identifier of the application
appId.title: appId

appStoreUrl.description: The Store URL of the application
appStoreUrl.title: appStoreUrl

name.description: The application name
name.title: name

CompliantAppsList.description: List of apps in the compliance (either allow list or block list, controlled by CompliantAppListType).
CompliantAppsList.title: CompliantAppsList

ContentCachingBlocked.description: Configures whether or not to allow content caching.
ContentCachingBlocked.title: ContentCachingBlocked

DefinitionLookupBlocked.description: Block look up, a feature that looks up the definition of a highlighted word.
DefinitionLookupBlocked.title: DefinitionLookupBlocked

EmailInDomainSuffixes.description: Emails that the user sends or receives which don't match the domains you specify here will be marked as untrusted.
EmailInDomainSuffixes.title: EmailInDomainSuffixes

EraseContentAndSettingsBlocked.description: Configures the reset option on supervised devices. Available for devices running macOS versions 12.0 and later.
EraseContentAndSettingsBlocked.title: EraseContentAndSettingsBlocked

GameCenterBlocked.description: Configured if the Game Center icon is removed from the Home screen. Available for devices running macOS versions 10.13 and later.
GameCenterBlocked.title: GameCenterBlocked

ICloudBlockActivityContinuation.description: Handoff lets users start work on one MacOS device, and continue it on another MacOS or iOS device. Available for macOS 10.15 and later.
ICloudBlockActivityContinuation.title: ICloudBlockActivityContinuation

ICloudBlockDocumentSync.description: Blocks iCloud from syncing documents and data.
ICloudBlockDocumentSync.title: ICloudBlockDocumentSync

ICloudBlockPhotoLibrary.description: Any photos not fully downloaded from iCloud Photo Library to device will be removed from local storage.
ICloudBlockPhotoLibrary.title: ICloudBlockPhotoLibrary

ICloudDesktopAndDocumentsBlocked.description: Configures if the synchronization of cloud desktop and documents is blocked. Available for devices running macOS 10.12.4 and later.
ICloudDesktopAndDocumentsBlocked.title: ICloudDesktopAndDocumentsBlocked

ICloudPrivateRelayBlocked.description: Configures if iCloud private relay is blocked or not. Available for devices running macOS 12 and later.
ICloudPrivateRelayBlocked.title: ICloudPrivateRelayBlocked

ITunesBlockFileSharing.description: Blocks files from being transferred using iTunes.
ITunesBlockFileSharing.title: ITunesBlockFileSharing

ITunesBlockMusicService.description: Configures  whether or not to block files from being transferred using iTunes.
ITunesBlockMusicService.title: ITunesBlockMusicService

KeyboardBlockDictation.description: Block dictation, which is a feature that converts the user's voice to text.
KeyboardBlockDictation.title: KeyboardBlockDictation

KeychainBlockCloudSync.description: Disables syncing credentials stored in the Keychain to iCloud
KeychainBlockCloudSync.title: KeychainBlockCloudSync

MultiplayerGamingBlocked.description: Configures whether multiplayer gaming when using Game Center is blocked. Available for devices running macOS versions 10.13 and later.
MultiplayerGamingBlocked.title: MultiplayerGamingBlocked

PasswordBlockAirDropSharing.description: Configures whether or not to block sharing passwords with the AirDrop passwords feature.
PasswordBlockAirDropSharing.title: PasswordBlockAirDropSharing

PasswordBlockAutoFill.description: Configures whether or not to block the AutoFill Passwords feature.
PasswordBlockAutoFill.title: PasswordBlockAutoFill

PasswordBlockFingerprintUnlock.description: Requires user to set a non-biometric passcode or password to unlock the device.
PasswordBlockFingerprintUnlock.title: PasswordBlockFingerprintUnlock

PasswordBlockModification.description: Blocks user from changing the set passcode.
PasswordBlockModification.title: PasswordBlockModification

PasswordBlockProximityRequests.description: Configures whether or not to block requesting passwords from nearby devices.
PasswordBlockProximityRequests.title: PasswordBlockProximityRequests

PasswordBlockSimple.description: Block simple password sequences, such as 1234 or 1111.
PasswordBlockSimple.title: PasswordBlockSimple

PasswordExpirationDays.description: Number of days until device password must be changed. (1-65535)
PasswordExpirationDays.title: PasswordExpirationDays

PasswordMaximumAttemptCount.description: Configures the number of allowed failed attempts to enter the passcode at the device's lock screen. Valid values 2 to 11
PasswordMaximumAttemptCount.title: PasswordMaximumAttemptCount

PasswordMinimumCharacterSetCount.description: Minimum number (0-4) of non-alphanumeric characters, such as #, %, !, etc., required in the password. The default value is 0.
PasswordMinimumCharacterSetCount.title: PasswordMinimumCharacterSetCount

PasswordMinimumLength.description: Minimum number of digits or characters in password (4-16).
PasswordMinimumLength.title: PasswordMinimumLength

PasswordMinutesOfInactivityBeforeLock.description: Set to 0 to require a password immediately. There is no maximum number of minutes, and this number overrides the number currently set on the device.
PasswordMinutesOfInactivityBeforeLock.title: PasswordMinutesOfInactivityBeforeLock

PasswordMinutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenT.description: Set to 0 to use the device's minimum possible value. This number (0-60 minutes) overrides the number currently set on the device.
PasswordMinutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenT.title: PasswordMinutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenTimeout

PasswordMinutesUntilFailedLoginReset.description: Configures the number of minutes before the login is reset after the maximum number of unsuccessful login attempts is reached.
PasswordMinutesUntilFailedLoginReset.title: PasswordMinutesUntilFailedLoginReset

PasswordPreviousPasswordBlockCount.description: Number of new passwords that must be used until an old one can be reused. (1-24)
PasswordPreviousPasswordBlockCount.title: PasswordPreviousPasswordBlockCount

PasswordRequired.description: Specify the type of password required.
PasswordRequired.title: PasswordRequired

PasswordRequiredType.description: Specify the type of password required.
PasswordRequiredType.title: PasswordRequiredType

addressBook.description: Allow or block access to contact information managed by Contacts.

allowed.description: Allow or block this app from receiving Apple events.
allowed.title: allowed

codeRequirement.description: Code requirement for the app or binary that receives the Apple Event.

identifier.description: Bundle ID of the app or file path of the process or executable that receives the Apple Event.

identifierType.title: identifierType

appleEventsAllowedReceivers.title: appleEventsAllowedReceivers

blockListenEvent.description: Block the app or process from listening to events from input devices such as mouse, keyboard, and trackpad.Requires macOS 10.15 or later.
blockListenEvent.title: blockListenEvent

blockScreenCapture.description: Block app from capturing contents of system display. Requires macOS 10.15 or later.
blockScreenCapture.title: blockScreenCapture

codeRequirement.description: Enter the code requirement, which can be obtained with the command 'codesign -display -r -' in the Terminal app. Include everything after '=>'.

fileProviderPresence.description: Allow the app or process to access files managed by another app's file provider extension. Requires macOS 10.15 or later.
fileProviderPresence.title: fileProviderPresence

identifierType.title: identifierType

mediaLibrary.description: Allow or block access to music and the media library.

photos.description: Allow or block access to images managed by Photos.

postEvent.description: Control access to CoreGraphics APIs, which are used to send CGEvents to the system event stream.
postEvent.title: postEvent

reminders.description: Allow or block access to information managed by Reminders.
reminders.title: reminders

speechRecognition.description: Allow or block access to system speech recognition facility.
speechRecognition.title: speechRecognition

staticCodeValidation.description: Statically validates the code requirement. Use this setting if the process invalidates its dynamic code signature.
staticCodeValidation.title: staticCodeValidation

systemPolicyAllFiles.description: Control access to all protected files on a device. Files might be in locations such as emails, messages, apps, and administrative settings. Apply this setting with caution.
systemPolicyAllFiles.title: systemPolicyAllFiles

systemPolicyDesktopFolder.description: Allow or block access to Desktop folder.
systemPolicyDesktopFolder.title: systemPolicyDesktopFolder

systemPolicyDocumentsFolder.description: Allow or block access to Documents folder.
systemPolicyDocumentsFolder.title: systemPolicyDocumentsFolder

systemPolicyDownloadsFolder.description: Allow or block access to Downloads folder.
systemPolicyDownloadsFolder.title: systemPolicyDownloadsFolder

systemPolicyNetworkVolumes.description: Allow or block access to network volumes. Requires macOS 10.15 or later.
systemPolicyNetworkVolumes.title: systemPolicyNetworkVolumes

systemPolicyRemovableVolumes.description: Control access to removable volumes on the device, such as an external hard drive. Requires macOS 10.15 or later.
systemPolicyRemovableVolumes.title: systemPolicyRemovableVolumes

systemPolicySystemAdminFiles.description: Allow app or process to access files used in system administration.
systemPolicySystemAdminFiles.title: systemPolicySystemAdminFiles

PrivacyAccessControls.description: Configure an app's access to specific data, folders, and apps on a device. These settings apply to devices running macOS Mojave 10.14 and later.
PrivacyAccessControls.title: PrivacyAccessControls

SafariBlockAutofill.description: Blocks Safari from remembering what users enter in web forms.
SafariBlockAutofill.title: SafariBlockAutofill

ScreenCaptureBlocked.description: Configures whether or not to block the user from taking Screenshots.
ScreenCaptureBlocked.title: ScreenCaptureBlocked

SoftwareUpdateMajorOSDeferredInstallDela.description: Specify the number of days (1-90) to delay visibility of major OS software updates. Available for devices running macOS versions 11.3 and later. Valid values 0 to 90
SoftwareUpdateMajorOSDeferredInstallDela.title: SoftwareUpdateMajorOSDeferredInstallDelayInDays

SoftwareUpdateMinorOSDeferredInstallDela.description: Specify the number of days (1-90) to delay visibility of minor OS software updates. Available for devices running macOS versions 11.3 and later. Valid values 0 to 90
SoftwareUpdateMinorOSDeferredInstallDela.title: SoftwareUpdateMinorOSDeferredInstallDelayInDays

SoftwareUpdateNonOSDeferredInstallDelayI.description: Specify the number of days (1-90) to delay visibility of non-OS software updates. Available for devices running macOS versions 11.3 and later. Valid values 0 to 90
SoftwareUpdateNonOSDeferredInstallDelayI.title: SoftwareUpdateNonOSDeferredInstallDelayInDays

SoftwareUpdatesEnforcedDelayInDays.description: Delay the user's software update for this many days. The maximum is 90 days. (1-90)
SoftwareUpdatesEnforcedDelayInDays.title: SoftwareUpdatesEnforcedDelayInDays

SpotlightBlockInternetResults.description: Blocks Spotlight from returning any results from an Internet search
SpotlightBlockInternetResults.title: SpotlightBlockInternetResults

TouchIdTimeoutInHours.description: Configures the maximum hours after which the user must enter their password to unlock the device instead of using Touch ID. Available for devices running macOS 12 and later. Valid values 0 to 2147483647
TouchIdTimeoutInHours.title: TouchIdTimeoutInHours

UpdateDelayPolicy.description: Configures whether to delay OS and/or app updates for macOS.
UpdateDelayPolicy.title: UpdateDelayPolicy

WallpaperModificationBlocked.description: Configures whether the wallpaper can be changed. Available for devices running macOS versions 10.13 and later.
WallpaperModificationBlocked.title: WallpaperModificationBlocked

deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterId.title: deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterId
