microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationpoli.description: Intune Device Configuration Policy for Windows10
microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationpoli.title: Schema for microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationpolicywindows10

AccountsBlockAddingNonMicrosoftAccountEm.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from adding email accounts to the device that are not associated with a Microsoft account.
AccountsBlockAddingNonMicrosoftAccountEm.title: AccountsBlockAddingNonMicrosoftAccountEmail

ActivateAppsWithVoice.description: Specifies if Windows apps can be activated by voice. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
ActivateAppsWithVoice.title: ActivateAppsWithVoice

AntiTheftModeBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from selecting an AntiTheft mode preference (Windows 10 Mobile only).
AntiTheftModeBlocked.title: AntiTheftModeBlocked

AppManagementMSIAllowUserControlOverInst.description: This policy setting permits users to change installation options that typically are available only to system administrators.
AppManagementMSIAllowUserControlOverInst.title: AppManagementMSIAllowUserControlOverInstall

AppManagementMSIAlwaysInstallWithElevate.description: This policy setting directs Windows Installer to use elevated permissions when it installs any program on the system.
AppManagementMSIAlwaysInstallWithElevate.title: AppManagementMSIAlwaysInstallWithElevatedPrivileges

AppManagementPackageFamilyNamesToLaunchA.description: List of semi-colon delimited Package Family Names of Windows apps. Listed Windows apps are to be launched after logon.
AppManagementPackageFamilyNamesToLaunchA.title: AppManagementPackageFamilyNamesToLaunchAfterLogOn

AppsAllowTrustedAppsSideloading.description: Indicates whether apps from AppX packages signed with a trusted certificate can be side loaded. Possible values are: notConfigured, blocked, allowed.
AppsAllowTrustedAppsSideloading.title: AppsAllowTrustedAppsSideloading

AppsBlockWindowsStoreOriginatedApps.description: Indicates whether or not to disable the launch of all apps from Windows Store that came pre-installed or were downloaded.
AppsBlockWindowsStoreOriginatedApps.title: AppsBlockWindowsStoreOriginatedApps

AuthenticationAllowSecondaryDevice.description: Allows secondary authentication devices to work with Windows.
AuthenticationAllowSecondaryDevice.title: AuthenticationAllowSecondaryDevice

AuthenticationPreferredAzureADTenantDoma.description: Specifies the preferred domain among available domains in the Azure AD tenant.
AuthenticationPreferredAzureADTenantDoma.title: AuthenticationPreferredAzureADTenantDomainName

AuthenticationWebSignIn.description: Indicates whether or not Web Credential Provider will be enabled. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
AuthenticationWebSignIn.title: AuthenticationWebSignIn

BluetoothAllowedServices.description: Specify a list of allowed Bluetooth services and profiles in hex formatted strings.
BluetoothAllowedServices.title: BluetoothAllowedServices

BluetoothBlockAdvertising.description: Whether or not to Block the user from using bluetooth advertising.
BluetoothBlockAdvertising.title: BluetoothBlockAdvertising

BluetoothBlockDiscoverableMode.description: Whether or not to Block the user from using bluetooth discoverable mode.
BluetoothBlockDiscoverableMode.title: BluetoothBlockDiscoverableMode

BluetoothBlocked.description: Whether or not to Block the user from using bluetooth.
BluetoothBlocked.title: BluetoothBlocked

BluetoothBlockPrePairing.description: Whether or not to block specific bundled Bluetooth peripherals to automatically pair with the host device.
BluetoothBlockPrePairing.title: BluetoothBlockPrePairing

BluetoothBlockPromptedProximalConnection.description: Whether or not to block the users from using Swift Pair and other proximity based scenarios.
BluetoothBlockPromptedProximalConnection.title: BluetoothBlockPromptedProximalConnections

CameraBlocked.description: Whether or not to Block the user from accessing the camera of the device.
CameraBlocked.title: CameraBlocked

CellularBlockDataWhenRoaming.description: Whether or not to Block the user from using data over cellular while roaming.
CellularBlockDataWhenRoaming.title: CellularBlockDataWhenRoaming

CellularBlockVpn.description: Whether or not to Block the user from using VPN over cellular.
CellularBlockVpn.title: CellularBlockVpn

CellularBlockVpnWhenRoaming.description: Whether or not to Block the user from using VPN when roaming over cellular.
CellularBlockVpnWhenRoaming.title: CellularBlockVpnWhenRoaming

CellularData.description: Whether or not to allow the cellular data channel on the device. If not configured, the cellular data channel is allowed and the user can turn it off. Possible values are: blocked, required, allowed, notConfigured.
CellularData.title: CellularData

CertificatesBlockManualRootCertificateIn.description: Whether or not to Block the user from doing manual root certificate installation.
CertificatesBlockManualRootCertificateIn.title: CertificatesBlockManualRootCertificateInstallation

ConfigureTimeZone.description: Specifies the time zone to be applied to the device. This is the standard Windows name for the target time zone.
ConfigureTimeZone.title: ConfigureTimeZone

ConnectedDevicesServiceBlocked.description: Whether or not to block Connected Devices Service which enables discovery and connection to other devices, remote messaging, remote app sessions and other cross-device experiences.
ConnectedDevicesServiceBlocked.title: ConnectedDevicesServiceBlocked

CopyPasteBlocked.description: Whether or not to Block the user from using copy paste.
CopyPasteBlocked.title: CopyPasteBlocked

CortanaBlocked.description: Whether or not to Block the user from using Cortana.
CortanaBlocked.title: CortanaBlocked

CryptographyAllowFipsAlgorithmPolicy.description: Specify whether to allow or disallow the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) policy.
CryptographyAllowFipsAlgorithmPolicy.title: CryptographyAllowFipsAlgorithmPolicy

DataProtectionBlockDirectMemoryAccess.description: This policy setting allows you to block direct memory access (DMA) for all hot pluggable PCI downstream ports until a user logs into Windows.
DataProtectionBlockDirectMemoryAccess.title: DataProtectionBlockDirectMemoryAccess

DefenderBlockEndUserAccess.description: Whether or not to block end user access to Defender.
DefenderBlockEndUserAccess.title: DefenderBlockEndUserAccess

DefenderBlockOnAccessProtection.description: Allows or disallows Windows Defender On Access Protection functionality.
DefenderBlockOnAccessProtection.title: DefenderBlockOnAccessProtection

DefenderCloudBlockLevel.description: Specifies the level of cloud-delivered protection. Possible values are: notConfigured, high, highPlus, zeroTolerance.
DefenderCloudBlockLevel.title: DefenderCloudBlockLevel

DefenderCloudExtendedTimeout.description: Timeout extension for file scanning by the cloud. Valid values 0 to 50
DefenderCloudExtendedTimeout.title: DefenderCloudExtendedTimeout

DefenderCloudExtendedTimeoutInSeconds.description: Timeout extension for file scanning by the cloud. Valid values 0 to 50
DefenderCloudExtendedTimeoutInSeconds.title: DefenderCloudExtendedTimeoutInSeconds

DefenderDaysBeforeDeletingQuarantinedMal.description: Number of days before deleting quarantined malware. Valid values 0 to 90
DefenderDaysBeforeDeletingQuarantinedMal.title: DefenderDaysBeforeDeletingQuarantinedMalware

DefenderDetectedMalwareActions.description: Gets or sets Defenders actions to take on detected Malware per threat level.
DefenderDetectedMalwareActions.title: DefenderDetectedMalwareActions

HighSeverity.description: Indicates a Defender action to take for high severity Malware threat detected. Possible values are: deviceDefault, clean, quarantine, remove, allow, userDefined, block.
HighSeverity.title: HighSeverity

LowSeverity.description: Indicates a Defender action to take for low severity Malware threat detected. Possible values are: deviceDefault, clean, quarantine, remove, allow, userDefined, block.
LowSeverity.title: LowSeverity

ModerateSeverity.description: Indicates a Defender action to take for moderate severity Malware threat detected. Possible values are: deviceDefault, clean, quarantine, remove, allow, userDefined, block.
ModerateSeverity.title: ModerateSeverity

SevereSeverity.description: Indicates a Defender action to take for severe severity Malware threat detected. Possible values are: deviceDefault, clean, quarantine, remove, allow, userDefined, block.
SevereSeverity.title: SevereSeverity

DefenderDisableCatchupFullScan.description: When blocked, catch-up scans for scheduled full scans will be turned off.
DefenderDisableCatchupFullScan.title: DefenderDisableCatchupFullScan

DefenderDisableCatchupQuickScan.description: When blocked, catch-up scans for scheduled quick scans will be turned off.
DefenderDisableCatchupQuickScan.title: DefenderDisableCatchupQuickScan

DefenderFileExtensionsToExclude.description: File extensions to exclude from scans and real time protection.
DefenderFileExtensionsToExclude.title: DefenderFileExtensionsToExclude

DefenderFilesAndFoldersToExclude.description: Files and folder to exclude from scans and real time protection.
DefenderFilesAndFoldersToExclude.title: DefenderFilesAndFoldersToExclude

DefenderMonitorFileActivity.description: Value for monitoring file activity. Possible values are: userDefined, disable, monitorAllFiles, monitorIncomingFilesOnly, monitorOutgoingFilesOnly.
DefenderMonitorFileActivity.title: DefenderMonitorFileActivity

DefenderPotentiallyUnwantedAppAction.description: Gets or sets Defenders action to take on Potentially Unwanted Application (PUA), which includes software with behaviors of ad-injection, software bundling, persistent solicitation for payment or subscription, etc. Defender alerts user when PUA is being downloaded or attempts to install itself. Added in Windows 10 for desktop. Possible values are: deviceDefault, block, audit.
DefenderPotentiallyUnwantedAppAction.title: DefenderPotentiallyUnwantedAppAction

DefenderPotentiallyUnwantedAppActionSett.description: Gets or sets Defenders action to take on Potentially Unwanted Application (PUA), which includes software with behaviors of ad-injection, software bundling, persistent solicitation for payment or subscription, etc. Defender alerts user when PUA is being downloaded or attempts to install itself. Added in Windows 10 for desktop. Possible values are: userDefined, enable, auditMode, warn, notConfigured.
DefenderPotentiallyUnwantedAppActionSett.title: DefenderPotentiallyUnwantedAppActionSetting

DefenderProcessesToExclude.description: Processes to exclude from scans and real time protection.
DefenderProcessesToExclude.title: DefenderProcessesToExclude

DefenderPromptForSampleSubmission.description: The configuration for how to prompt user for sample submission. Possible values are: userDefined, alwaysPrompt, promptBeforeSendingPersonalData, neverSendData, sendAllDataWithoutPrompting.
DefenderPromptForSampleSubmission.title: DefenderPromptForSampleSubmission

DefenderRequireBehaviorMonitoring.description: Indicates whether or not to require behavior monitoring.
DefenderRequireBehaviorMonitoring.title: DefenderRequireBehaviorMonitoring

DefenderRequireCloudProtection.description: Indicates whether or not to require cloud protection.
DefenderRequireCloudProtection.title: DefenderRequireCloudProtection

DefenderRequireNetworkInspectionSystem.description: Indicates whether or not to require network inspection system.
DefenderRequireNetworkInspectionSystem.title: DefenderRequireNetworkInspectionSystem

DefenderRequireRealTimeMonitoring.description: Indicates whether or not to require real time monitoring.
DefenderRequireRealTimeMonitoring.title: DefenderRequireRealTimeMonitoring

DefenderScanArchiveFiles.description: Indicates whether or not to scan archive files.
DefenderScanArchiveFiles.title: DefenderScanArchiveFiles

DefenderScanDownloads.description: Indicates whether or not to scan downloads.
DefenderScanDownloads.title: DefenderScanDownloads

DefenderScanIncomingMail.description: Indicates whether or not to scan incoming mail messages.
DefenderScanIncomingMail.title: DefenderScanIncomingMail

DefenderScanMappedNetworkDrivesDuringFul.description: Indicates whether or not to scan mapped network drives during full scan.
DefenderScanMappedNetworkDrivesDuringFul.title: DefenderScanMappedNetworkDrivesDuringFullScan

DefenderScanMaxCpu.description: Max CPU usage percentage during scan. Valid values 0 to 100
DefenderScanMaxCpu.title: DefenderScanMaxCpu

DefenderScanNetworkFiles.description: Indicates whether or not to scan files opened from a network folder.
DefenderScanNetworkFiles.title: DefenderScanNetworkFiles

DefenderScanRemovableDrivesDuringFullSca.description: Indicates whether or not to scan removable drives during full scan.
DefenderScanRemovableDrivesDuringFullSca.title: DefenderScanRemovableDrivesDuringFullScan

DefenderScanScriptsLoadedInInternetExplo.description: Indicates whether or not to scan scripts loaded in Internet Explorer browser.
DefenderScanScriptsLoadedInInternetExplo.title: DefenderScanScriptsLoadedInInternetExplorer

DefenderScanType.description: The defender system scan type. Possible values are: userDefined, disabled, quick, full.
DefenderScanType.title: DefenderScanType

DefenderScheduledQuickScanTime.description: The time to perform a daily quick scan.
DefenderScheduledQuickScanTime.title: DefenderScheduledQuickScanTime

DefenderScheduledScanTime.description: The defender time for the system scan.
DefenderScheduledScanTime.title: DefenderScheduledScanTime

DefenderScheduleScanEnableLowCpuPriority.description: When enabled, low CPU priority will be used during scheduled scans.
DefenderScheduleScanEnableLowCpuPriority.title: DefenderScheduleScanEnableLowCpuPriority

DefenderSignatureUpdateIntervalInHours.description: The signature update interval in hours. Specify 0 not to check. Valid values 0 to 24
DefenderSignatureUpdateIntervalInHours.title: DefenderSignatureUpdateIntervalInHours

DefenderSubmitSamplesConsentType.description: Checks for the user consent level in Windows Defender to send data. Possible values are: sendSafeSamplesAutomatically, alwaysPrompt, neverSend, sendAllSamplesAutomatically.
DefenderSubmitSamplesConsentType.title: DefenderSubmitSamplesConsentType

DefenderSystemScanSchedule.description: Defender day of the week for the system scan. Possible values are: userDefined, everyday, sunday, monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday, noScheduledScan.
DefenderSystemScanSchedule.title: DefenderSystemScanSchedule

DeveloperUnlockSetting.description: Indicates whether or not to allow developer unlock. Possible values are: notConfigured, blocked, allowed.
DeveloperUnlockSetting.title: DeveloperUnlockSetting

DeviceManagementBlockFactoryResetOnMobil.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from resetting their phone.
DeviceManagementBlockFactoryResetOnMobil.title: DeviceManagementBlockFactoryResetOnMobile

DeviceManagementBlockManualUnenroll.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from doing manual un-enrollment from device management.
DeviceManagementBlockManualUnenroll.title: DeviceManagementBlockManualUnenroll

DiagnosticsDataSubmissionMode.description: Gets or sets a value allowing the device to send diagnostic and usage telemetry data, such as Watson. Possible values are: userDefined, none, basic, enhanced, full.
DiagnosticsDataSubmissionMode.title: DiagnosticsDataSubmissionMode

DisplayAppListWithGdiDPIScalingTurnedOff.description: List of legacy applications that have GDI DPI Scaling turned off.
DisplayAppListWithGdiDPIScalingTurnedOff.title: DisplayAppListWithGdiDPIScalingTurnedOff

DisplayAppListWithGdiDPIScalingTurnedOn.description: List of legacy applications that have GDI DPI Scaling turned on.
DisplayAppListWithGdiDPIScalingTurnedOn.title: DisplayAppListWithGdiDPIScalingTurnedOn

EdgeAllowStartPagesModification.description: Allow users to change Start pages on Edge. Use the EdgeHomepageUrls to specify the Start pages that the user would see by default when they open Edge.
EdgeAllowStartPagesModification.title: EdgeAllowStartPagesModification

EdgeBlockAccessToAboutFlags.description: Indicates whether or not to prevent access to about flags on Edge browser.
EdgeBlockAccessToAboutFlags.title: EdgeBlockAccessToAboutFlags

EdgeBlockAddressBarDropdown.description: Block the address bar dropdown functionality in Microsoft Edge. Disable this settings to minimize network connections from Microsoft Edge to Microsoft services.
EdgeBlockAddressBarDropdown.title: EdgeBlockAddressBarDropdown

EdgeBlockAutofill.description: Indicates whether or not to block auto fill.
EdgeBlockAutofill.title: EdgeBlockAutofill

EdgeBlockCompatibilityList.description: Block Microsoft compatibility list in Microsoft Edge. This list from Microsoft helps Edge properly display sites with known compatibility issues.
EdgeBlockCompatibilityList.title: EdgeBlockCompatibilityList

EdgeBlockDeveloperTools.description: Indicates whether or not to block developer tools in the Edge browser.
EdgeBlockDeveloperTools.title: EdgeBlockDeveloperTools

EdgeBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from using the Edge browser.
EdgeBlocked.title: EdgeBlocked

EdgeBlockEditFavorites.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from making changes to Favorites.
EdgeBlockEditFavorites.title: EdgeBlockEditFavorites

EdgeBlockExtensions.description: Indicates whether or not to block extensions in the Edge browser.
EdgeBlockExtensions.title: EdgeBlockExtensions

EdgeBlockFullScreenMode.description: Allow or prevent Edge from entering the full screen mode.
EdgeBlockFullScreenMode.title: EdgeBlockFullScreenMode

EdgeBlockInPrivateBrowsing.description: Indicates whether or not to block InPrivate browsing on corporate networks, in the Edge browser.
EdgeBlockInPrivateBrowsing.title: EdgeBlockInPrivateBrowsing

EdgeBlockJavaScript.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from using JavaScript.
EdgeBlockJavaScript.title: EdgeBlockJavaScript

EdgeBlockLiveTileDataCollection.description: Block the collection of information by Microsoft for live tile creation when users pin a site to Start from Microsoft Edge.
EdgeBlockLiveTileDataCollection.title: EdgeBlockLiveTileDataCollection

EdgeBlockPasswordManager.description: Indicates whether or not to Block password manager.
EdgeBlockPasswordManager.title: EdgeBlockPasswordManager

EdgeBlockPopups.description: Indicates whether or not to block popups.
EdgeBlockPopups.title: EdgeBlockPopups

EdgeBlockPrelaunch.description: Decide whether Microsoft Edge is prelaunched at Windows startup.
EdgeBlockPrelaunch.title: EdgeBlockPrelaunch

EdgeBlockPrinting.description: Configure Edge to allow or block printing.
EdgeBlockPrinting.title: EdgeBlockPrinting

EdgeBlockSavingHistory.description: Configure Edge to allow browsing history to be saved or to never save browsing history.
EdgeBlockSavingHistory.title: EdgeBlockSavingHistory

EdgeBlockSearchEngineCustomization.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from adding new search engine or changing the default search engine.
EdgeBlockSearchEngineCustomization.title: EdgeBlockSearchEngineCustomization

EdgeBlockSearchSuggestions.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from using the search suggestions in the address bar.
EdgeBlockSearchSuggestions.title: EdgeBlockSearchSuggestions

EdgeBlockSendingDoNotTrackHeader.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from sending the do not track header.
EdgeBlockSendingDoNotTrackHeader.title: EdgeBlockSendingDoNotTrackHeader

EdgeBlockSendingIntranetTrafficToInterne.description: Indicates whether or not to switch the intranet traffic from Edge to Internet Explorer. Note: the name of this property is misleading the property is obsolete, use EdgeSendIntranetTrafficToInternetExplorer instead.
EdgeBlockSendingIntranetTrafficToInterne.title: EdgeBlockSendingIntranetTrafficToInternetExplorer

EdgeBlockSideloadingExtensions.description: Indicates whether the user can sideload extensions.
EdgeBlockSideloadingExtensions.title: EdgeBlockSideloadingExtensions

EdgeBlockTabPreloading.description: Configure whether Edge preloads the new tab page at Windows startup.
EdgeBlockTabPreloading.title: EdgeBlockTabPreloading

EdgeBlockWebContentOnNewTabPage.description: Configure to load a blank page in Edge instead of the default New tab page and prevent users from changing it.
EdgeBlockWebContentOnNewTabPage.title: EdgeBlockWebContentOnNewTabPage

EdgeClearBrowsingDataOnExit.description: Clear browsing data on exiting Microsoft Edge.
EdgeClearBrowsingDataOnExit.title: EdgeClearBrowsingDataOnExit

EdgeCookiePolicy.description: Indicates which cookies to block in the Edge browser. Possible values are: userDefined, allow, blockThirdParty, blockAll.
EdgeCookiePolicy.title: EdgeCookiePolicy

EdgeDisableFirstRunPage.description: Block the Microsoft web page that opens on the first use of Microsoft Edge. This policy allows enterprises, like those enrolled in zero emissions configurations, to block this page.
EdgeDisableFirstRunPage.title: EdgeDisableFirstRunPage

EdgeEnterpriseModeSiteListLocation.description: Indicates the enterprise mode site list location. Could be a local file, local network or http location.
EdgeEnterpriseModeSiteListLocation.title: EdgeEnterpriseModeSiteListLocation

EdgeFavoritesBarVisibility.description: Get or set a value that specifies whether to set the favorites bar to always be visible or hidden on any page. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
EdgeFavoritesBarVisibility.title: EdgeFavoritesBarVisibility

EdgeFavoritesListLocation.description: The location of the favorites list to provision. Could be a local file, local network or http location.
EdgeFavoritesListLocation.title: EdgeFavoritesListLocation

EdgeFirstRunUrl.description: The first run URL for when Edge browser is opened for the first time.
EdgeFirstRunUrl.title: EdgeFirstRunUrl

EdgeHomeButtonConfiguration.description: Causes the Home button to either hide, load the default Start page, load a New tab page, or a custom URL
EdgeHomeButtonConfiguration.title: EdgeHomeButtonConfiguration

EdgeHomepageUrls.description: The list of URLs for homepages shodwn on MDM-enrolled devices on Edge browser.
EdgeHomepageUrls.title: EdgeHomepageUrls

EdgeKioskModeRestriction.description: Controls how the Microsoft Edge settings are restricted based on the configure kiosk mode. Possible values are: notConfigured, digitalSignage, normalMode, publicBrowsingSingleApp, publicBrowsingMultiApp.
EdgeKioskModeRestriction.title: EdgeKioskModeRestriction

EdgeKioskResetAfterIdleTimeInMinutes.description: Specifies the time in minutes from the last user activity before Microsoft Edge kiosk resets.  Valid values are 0-1440. The default is 5. 0 indicates no reset. Valid values 0 to 1440
EdgeKioskResetAfterIdleTimeInMinutes.title: EdgeKioskResetAfterIdleTimeInMinutes

EdgeNewTabPageURL.description: Specify the page opened when new tabs are created.
EdgeNewTabPageURL.title: EdgeNewTabPageURL

EdgeOpensWith.description: Specify what kind of pages are open at start. Possible values are: notConfigured, startPage, newTabPage, previousPages, specificPages.
EdgeOpensWith.title: EdgeOpensWith

EdgePreventCertificateErrorOverride.description: Allow or prevent users from overriding certificate errors.
EdgePreventCertificateErrorOverride.title: EdgePreventCertificateErrorOverride

EdgeRequiredExtensionPackageFamilyNames.description: Specify the list of package family names of browser extensions that are required and cannot be turned off by the user.
EdgeRequiredExtensionPackageFamilyNames.title: EdgeRequiredExtensionPackageFamilyNames

EdgeRequireSmartScreen.description: Indicates whether or not to Require the user to use the smart screen filter.
EdgeRequireSmartScreen.title: EdgeRequireSmartScreen

EdgeSearchEngine.description: Allows IT admins to set a default search engine for MDM-Controlled devices. Users can override this and change their default search engine provided the AllowSearchEngineCustomization policy is not set.
EdgeSearchEngine.title: EdgeSearchEngine

EdgeSearchEngineType.description: Allows IT admins to set a predefined default search engine for MDM-Controlled devices. Possible values are: default, bing.
EdgeSearchEngineType.title: EdgeSearchEngineType

EdgeSearchEngineOpenSearchXmlUrl.description: Points to a https link containing the OpenSearch xml file that contains, at minimum, the short name and the URL to the search Engine.
EdgeSearchEngineOpenSearchXmlUrl.title: EdgeSearchEngineOpenSearchXmlUrl

EdgeSendIntranetTrafficToInternetExplore.description: Indicates whether or not to switch the intranet traffic from Edge to Internet Explorer.
EdgeSendIntranetTrafficToInternetExplore.title: EdgeSendIntranetTrafficToInternetExplorer

EdgeShowMessageWhenOpeningInternetExplor.description: Controls the message displayed by Edge before switching to Internet Explorer. Possible values are: notConfigured, disabled, enabled, keepGoing.
EdgeShowMessageWhenOpeningInternetExplor.title: EdgeShowMessageWhenOpeningInternetExplorerSites

EdgeSyncFavoritesWithInternetExplorer.description: Enable favorites sync between Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge. Additions, deletions, modifications and order changes to favorites are shared between browsers.
EdgeSyncFavoritesWithInternetExplorer.title: EdgeSyncFavoritesWithInternetExplorer

EdgeTelemetryForMicrosoft365Analytics.description: Specifies what type of telemetry data (none, intranet, internet, both) is sent to Microsoft 365 Analytics. Possible values are: notConfigured, intranet, internet, intranetAndInternet.
EdgeTelemetryForMicrosoft365Analytics.title: EdgeTelemetryForMicrosoft365Analytics

EnableAutomaticRedeployment.description: Allow users with administrative rights to delete all user data and settings using CTRL + Win + R at the device lock screen so that the device can be automatically re-configured and re-enrolled into management.
EnableAutomaticRedeployment.title: EnableAutomaticRedeployment

EnergySaverOnBatteryThresholdPercentage.description: This setting allows you to specify battery charge level at which Energy Saver is turned on. While on battery, Energy Saver is automatically turned on at (and below) the specified battery charge level. Valid input range (0-100). Valid values 0 to 100
EnergySaverOnBatteryThresholdPercentage.title: EnergySaverOnBatteryThresholdPercentage

EnergySaverPluggedInThresholdPercentage.description: This setting allows you to specify battery charge level at which Energy Saver is turned on. While plugged in, Energy Saver is automatically turned on at (and below) the specified battery charge level. Valid input range (0-100). Valid values 0 to 100
EnergySaverPluggedInThresholdPercentage.title: EnergySaverPluggedInThresholdPercentage

EnterpriseCloudPrintDiscoveryMaxLimit.description: Maximum number of printers that should be queried from a discovery endpoint. This is a mobile only setting. Valid values 1 to 65535
EnterpriseCloudPrintDiscoveryMaxLimit.title: EnterpriseCloudPrintDiscoveryMaxLimit

EnterpriseCloudPrintMopriaDiscoveryResou.description: OAuth resource URI for printer discovery service as configured in Azure portal.
EnterpriseCloudPrintMopriaDiscoveryResou.title: EnterpriseCloudPrintMopriaDiscoveryResourceIdentifier

EnterpriseCloudPrintOAuthAuthority.description: Authentication endpoint for acquiring OAuth tokens.
EnterpriseCloudPrintOAuthAuthority.title: EnterpriseCloudPrintOAuthAuthority

EnterpriseCloudPrintOAuthClientIdentifie.description: GUID of a client application authorized to retrieve OAuth tokens from the OAuth Authority.
EnterpriseCloudPrintOAuthClientIdentifie.title: EnterpriseCloudPrintOAuthClientIdentifier

EnterpriseCloudPrintResourceIdentifier.description: OAuth resource URI for print service as configured in the Azure portal.
EnterpriseCloudPrintResourceIdentifier.title: EnterpriseCloudPrintResourceIdentifier

ExperienceBlockDeviceDiscovery.description: Indicates whether or not to enable device discovery UX.
ExperienceBlockDeviceDiscovery.title: ExperienceBlockDeviceDiscovery

ExperienceBlockErrorDialogWhenNoSIM.description: Indicates whether or not to allow the error dialog from displaying if no SIM card is detected.
ExperienceBlockErrorDialogWhenNoSIM.title: ExperienceBlockErrorDialogWhenNoSIM

ExperienceBlockTaskSwitcher.description: Indicates whether or not to enable task switching on the device.
ExperienceBlockTaskSwitcher.title: ExperienceBlockTaskSwitcher

ExperienceDoNotSyncBrowserSettings.description: Allow or prevent the syncing of Microsoft Edge Browser settings. Option for IT admins to prevent syncing across devices, but allow user override. Possible values are: notConfigured, blockedWithUserOverride, blocked.
ExperienceDoNotSyncBrowserSettings.title: ExperienceDoNotSyncBrowserSettings

FindMyFiles.description: Controls if the user can configure search to Find My Files mode, which searches files in secondary hard drives and also outside of the user profile. Find My Files does not allow users to search files or locations to which they do not have access. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
FindMyFiles.title: FindMyFiles

GameDvrBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to block DVR and broadcasting.
GameDvrBlocked.title: GameDvrBlocked

InkWorkspaceAccess.description: Controls the user access to the ink workspace, from the desktop and from above the lock screen. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
InkWorkspaceAccess.title: InkWorkspaceAccess

InkWorkspaceAccessState.description: Controls the user access to the ink workspace, from the desktop and from above the lock screen. Possible values are: notConfigured, blocked, allowed.
InkWorkspaceAccessState.title: InkWorkspaceAccessState

InkWorkspaceBlockSuggestedApps.description: Specify whether to show recommended app suggestions in the ink workspace.
InkWorkspaceBlockSuggestedApps.title: InkWorkspaceBlockSuggestedApps

InternetSharingBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from using internet sharing.
InternetSharingBlocked.title: InternetSharingBlocked

LocationServicesBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from location services.
LocationServicesBlocked.title: LocationServicesBlocked

LockScreenActivateAppsWithVoice.description: This policy setting specifies whether Windows apps can be activated by voice while the system is locked. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
LockScreenActivateAppsWithVoice.title: LockScreenActivateAppsWithVoice

LockScreenAllowTimeoutConfiguration.description: Specify whether to show a user-configurable setting to control the screen timeout while on the lock screen of Windows 10 Mobile devices. If this policy is set to Allow, the value set by lockScreenTimeoutInSeconds is ignored.
LockScreenAllowTimeoutConfiguration.title: LockScreenAllowTimeoutConfiguration

LockScreenBlockActionCenterNotifications.description: Indicates whether or not to block action center notifications over lock screen.
LockScreenBlockActionCenterNotifications.title: LockScreenBlockActionCenterNotifications

LockScreenBlockCortana.description: Indicates whether or not the user can interact with Cortana using speech while the system is locked.
LockScreenBlockCortana.title: LockScreenBlockCortana

LockScreenBlockToastNotifications.description: Indicates whether to allow toast notifications above the device lock screen.
LockScreenBlockToastNotifications.title: LockScreenBlockToastNotifications

LockScreenTimeoutInSeconds.description: Set the duration (in seconds) from the screen locking to the screen turning off for Windows 10 Mobile devices. Supported values are 11-1800. Valid values 11 to 1800
LockScreenTimeoutInSeconds.title: LockScreenTimeoutInSeconds

LogonBlockFastUserSwitching.description: Disables the ability to quickly switch between users that are logged on simultaneously without logging off.
LogonBlockFastUserSwitching.title: LogonBlockFastUserSwitching

MessagingBlockMMS.description: Indicates whether or not to block the MMS send/receive functionality on the device.
MessagingBlockMMS.title: MessagingBlockMMS

MessagingBlockRichCommunicationServices.description: Indicates whether or not to block the RCS send/receive functionality on the device.
MessagingBlockRichCommunicationServices.title: MessagingBlockRichCommunicationServices

MessagingBlockSync.description: Indicates whether or not to block text message back up and restore and Messaging Everywhere.
MessagingBlockSync.title: MessagingBlockSync

MicrosoftAccountBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block a Microsoft account.
MicrosoftAccountBlocked.title: MicrosoftAccountBlocked

MicrosoftAccountBlockSettingsSync.description: Indicates whether or not to Block Microsoft account settings sync.
MicrosoftAccountBlockSettingsSync.title: MicrosoftAccountBlockSettingsSync

MicrosoftAccountSignInAssistantSettings.description: Controls the Microsoft Account Sign-In Assistant (wlidsvc) NT service. Possible values are: notConfigured, disabled.
MicrosoftAccountSignInAssistantSettings.title: MicrosoftAccountSignInAssistantSettings

NetworkProxyApplySettingsDeviceWide.description: If set, proxy settings will be applied to all processes and accounts in the device. Otherwise, it will be applied to the user account that's enrolled into MDM.
NetworkProxyApplySettingsDeviceWide.title: NetworkProxyApplySettingsDeviceWide

NetworkProxyAutomaticConfigurationUrl.description: Address to the proxy auto-config (PAC) script you want to use.
NetworkProxyAutomaticConfigurationUrl.title: NetworkProxyAutomaticConfigurationUrl

NetworkProxyDisableAutoDetect.description: Disable automatic detection of settings. If enabled, the system will try to find the path to a proxy auto-config (PAC) script.
NetworkProxyDisableAutoDetect.title: NetworkProxyDisableAutoDetect

Address.description: Address to the proxy server. Specify an address in the format ':'
Address.title: Address

Exceptions.description: Addresses that should not use the proxy server. The system will not use the proxy server for addresses beginning with what is specified in this node.
Exceptions.title: Exceptions

UseForLocalAddresses.description: Specifies whether the proxy server should be used for local (intranet) addresses.
UseForLocalAddresses.title: UseForLocalAddresses

NfcBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from using near field communication.
NfcBlocked.title: NfcBlocked

OneDriveDisableFileSync.description: Gets or sets a value allowing IT admins to prevent apps and features from working with files on OneDrive.
OneDriveDisableFileSync.title: OneDriveDisableFileSync

PasswordBlockSimple.description: Specify whether PINs or passwords such as '1111' or '1234' are allowed. For Windows 10 desktops, it also controls the use of picture passwords.
PasswordBlockSimple.title: PasswordBlockSimple

PasswordExpirationDays.description: The password expiration in days. Valid values 0 to 730
PasswordExpirationDays.title: PasswordExpirationDays

PasswordMinimumAgeInDays.description: This security setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password must be used before the user can change it. Valid values 0 to 998
PasswordMinimumAgeInDays.title: PasswordMinimumAgeInDays

PasswordMinimumCharacterSetCount.description: The number of character sets required in the password.
PasswordMinimumCharacterSetCount.title: PasswordMinimumCharacterSetCount

PasswordMinimumLength.description: The minimum password length. Valid values 4 to 16
PasswordMinimumLength.title: PasswordMinimumLength

PasswordMinutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenT.description: The minutes of inactivity before the screen times out.
PasswordMinutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenT.title: PasswordMinutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenTimeout

PasswordPreviousPasswordBlockCount.description: The number of previous passwords to prevent reuse of. Valid values 0 to 50
PasswordPreviousPasswordBlockCount.title: PasswordPreviousPasswordBlockCount

PasswordRequired.description: Indicates whether or not to require the user to have a password.
PasswordRequired.title: PasswordRequired

PasswordRequiredType.description: The required password type. Possible values are: deviceDefault, alphanumeric, numeric.
PasswordRequiredType.title: PasswordRequiredType

PasswordRequireWhenResumeFromIdleState.description: Indicates whether or not to require a password upon resuming from an idle state.
PasswordRequireWhenResumeFromIdleState.title: PasswordRequireWhenResumeFromIdleState

PasswordSignInFailureCountBeforeFactoryR.description: The number of sign in failures before factory reset. Valid values 0 to 999
PasswordSignInFailureCountBeforeFactoryR.title: PasswordSignInFailureCountBeforeFactoryReset

PersonalizationDesktopImageUrl.description: A http or https Url to a jpg, jpeg or png image that needs to be downloaded and used as the Desktop Image or a file Url to a local image on the file system that needs to used as the Desktop Image.
PersonalizationDesktopImageUrl.title: PersonalizationDesktopImageUrl

PersonalizationLockScreenImageUrl.description: A http or https Url to a jpg, jpeg or png image that needs to be downloaded and used as the Lock Screen Image or a file Url to a local image on the file system that needs to be used as the Lock Screen Image.
PersonalizationLockScreenImageUrl.title: PersonalizationLockScreenImageUrl

PowerButtonActionOnBattery.description: This setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user presses the Power button while on battery. Possible values are: notConfigured, noAction, sleep, hibernate, shutdown.
PowerButtonActionOnBattery.title: PowerButtonActionOnBattery

PowerButtonActionPluggedIn.description: This setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user presses the Power button while plugged in. Possible values are: notConfigured, noAction, sleep, hibernate, shutdown.
PowerButtonActionPluggedIn.title: PowerButtonActionPluggedIn

PowerHybridSleepOnBattery.description: This setting allows you to turn off hybrid sleep while on battery. If you set this setting to disable, a hiberfile is not generated when the system transitions to sleep (Stand By). If you set this setting to enable or do not configure this policy setting, users control this setting. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
PowerHybridSleepOnBattery.title: PowerHybridSleepOnBattery

PowerHybridSleepPluggedIn.description: This setting allows you to turn off hybrid sleep while plugged in. If you set this setting to disable, a hiberfile is not generated when the system transitions to sleep (Stand By). If you set this setting to enable or do not configure this policy setting, users control this setting. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
PowerHybridSleepPluggedIn.title: PowerHybridSleepPluggedIn

PowerLidCloseActionOnBattery.description: This setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user closes the lid on a mobile PC while on battery. Possible values are: notConfigured, noAction, sleep, hibernate, shutdown.
PowerLidCloseActionOnBattery.title: PowerLidCloseActionOnBattery

PowerLidCloseActionPluggedIn.description: This setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user closes the lid on a mobile PC while plugged in. Possible values are: notConfigured, noAction, sleep, hibernate, shutdown.
PowerLidCloseActionPluggedIn.title: PowerLidCloseActionPluggedIn

PowerSleepButtonActionOnBattery.description: This setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user presses the Sleep button while on battery. Possible values are: notConfigured, noAction, sleep, hibernate, shutdown.
PowerSleepButtonActionOnBattery.title: PowerSleepButtonActionOnBattery

PowerSleepButtonActionPluggedIn.description: This setting specifies the action that Windows takes when a user presses the Sleep button while plugged in. Possible values are: notConfigured, noAction, sleep, hibernate, shutdown.
PowerSleepButtonActionPluggedIn.title: PowerSleepButtonActionPluggedIn

PrinterBlockAddition.description: Prevent user installation of additional printers from printers settings.
PrinterBlockAddition.title: PrinterBlockAddition

PrinterDefaultName.description: Name (network host name) of an installed printer.
PrinterDefaultName.title: PrinterDefaultName

PrinterNames.description: Automatically provision printers based on their names (network host names).
PrinterNames.title: PrinterNames

PrivacyAdvertisingId.description: Enables or disables the use of advertising ID. Added in Windows 10, version 1607. Possible values are: notConfigured, blocked, allowed.
PrivacyAdvertisingId.title: PrivacyAdvertisingId

PrivacyAutoAcceptPairingAndConsentPrompt.description: Indicates whether or not to allow the automatic acceptance of the pairing and privacy user consent dialog when launching apps.
PrivacyAutoAcceptPairingAndConsentPrompt.title: PrivacyAutoAcceptPairingAndConsentPrompts

PrivacyBlockActivityFeed.description: Blocks the usage of cloud based speech services for Cortana, Dictation, or Store applications.
PrivacyBlockActivityFeed.title: PrivacyBlockActivityFeed

PrivacyBlockInputPersonalization.description: Indicates whether or not to block the usage of cloud based speech services for Cortana, Dictation, or Store applications.
PrivacyBlockInputPersonalization.title: PrivacyBlockInputPersonalization

PrivacyBlockPublishUserActivities.description: Blocks the shared experiences/discovery of recently used resources in task switcher etc.
PrivacyBlockPublishUserActivities.title: PrivacyBlockPublishUserActivities

PrivacyDisableLaunchExperience.description: This policy prevents the privacy experience from launching during user logon for new and upgraded users.
PrivacyDisableLaunchExperience.title: PrivacyDisableLaunchExperience

ResetProtectionModeBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from reset protection mode.
ResetProtectionModeBlocked.title: ResetProtectionModeBlocked

SafeSearchFilter.description: Specifies what filter level of safe search is required. Possible values are: userDefined, strict, moderate.
SafeSearchFilter.title: SafeSearchFilter

ScreenCaptureBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from taking Screenshots.
ScreenCaptureBlocked.title: ScreenCaptureBlocked

SearchBlockDiacritics.description: Specifies if search can use diacritics.
SearchBlockDiacritics.title: SearchBlockDiacritics

SearchBlockWebResults.description: Indicates whether or not to block the web search.
SearchBlockWebResults.title: SearchBlockWebResults

SearchDisableAutoLanguageDetection.description: Specifies whether to use automatic language detection when indexing content and properties.
SearchDisableAutoLanguageDetection.title: SearchDisableAutoLanguageDetection

SearchDisableIndexerBackoff.description: Indicates whether or not to disable the search indexer backoff feature.
SearchDisableIndexerBackoff.title: SearchDisableIndexerBackoff

SearchDisableIndexingEncryptedItems.description: Indicates whether or not to block indexing of WIP-protected items to prevent them from appearing in search results for Cortana or Explorer.
SearchDisableIndexingEncryptedItems.title: SearchDisableIndexingEncryptedItems

SearchDisableIndexingRemovableDrive.description: Indicates whether or not to allow users to add locations on removable drives to libraries and to be indexed.
SearchDisableIndexingRemovableDrive.title: SearchDisableIndexingRemovableDrive

SearchDisableLocation.description: Specifies if search can use location information.
SearchDisableLocation.title: SearchDisableLocation

SearchDisableUseLocation.description: Specifies if search can use location information.
SearchDisableUseLocation.title: SearchDisableUseLocation

SearchEnableAutomaticIndexSizeManangemen.description: Specifies minimum amount of hard drive space on the same drive as the index location before indexing stops.
SearchEnableAutomaticIndexSizeManangemen.title: SearchEnableAutomaticIndexSizeManangement

SearchEnableRemoteQueries.description: Indicates whether or not to block remote queries of this computers index.
SearchEnableRemoteQueries.title: SearchEnableRemoteQueries

SecurityBlockAzureADJoinedDevicesAutoEnc.description: Specify whether to allow automatic device encryption during OOBE when the device is Azure AD joined (desktop only).
SecurityBlockAzureADJoinedDevicesAutoEnc.title: SecurityBlockAzureADJoinedDevicesAutoEncryption

SettingsBlockAccountsPage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Accounts in Settings app.
SettingsBlockAccountsPage.title: SettingsBlockAccountsPage

SettingsBlockAddProvisioningPackage.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from installing provisioning packages.
SettingsBlockAddProvisioningPackage.title: SettingsBlockAddProvisioningPackage

SettingsBlockAppsPage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Apps in Settings app.
SettingsBlockAppsPage.title: SettingsBlockAppsPage

SettingsBlockChangeLanguage.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from changing the language settings.
SettingsBlockChangeLanguage.title: SettingsBlockChangeLanguage

SettingsBlockChangePowerSleep.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from changing power and sleep settings.
SettingsBlockChangePowerSleep.title: SettingsBlockChangePowerSleep

SettingsBlockChangeRegion.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from changing the region settings.
SettingsBlockChangeRegion.title: SettingsBlockChangeRegion

SettingsBlockChangeSystemTime.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from changing date and time settings.
SettingsBlockChangeSystemTime.title: SettingsBlockChangeSystemTime

SettingsBlockDevicesPage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Devices in Settings app.
SettingsBlockDevicesPage.title: SettingsBlockDevicesPage

SettingsBlockEaseOfAccessPage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Ease of Access in Settings app.
SettingsBlockEaseOfAccessPage.title: SettingsBlockEaseOfAccessPage

SettingsBlockEditDeviceName.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from editing the device name.
SettingsBlockEditDeviceName.title: SettingsBlockEditDeviceName

SettingsBlockGamingPage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Gaming in Settings app.
SettingsBlockGamingPage.title: SettingsBlockGamingPage

SettingsBlockNetworkInternetPage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Network & Internet in Settings app.
SettingsBlockNetworkInternetPage.title: SettingsBlockNetworkInternetPage

SettingsBlockPersonalizationPage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Personalization in Settings app.
SettingsBlockPersonalizationPage.title: SettingsBlockPersonalizationPage

SettingsBlockPrivacyPage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Privacy in Settings app.
SettingsBlockPrivacyPage.title: SettingsBlockPrivacyPage

SettingsBlockRemoveProvisioningPackage.description: Indicates whether or not to block the runtime configuration agent from removing provisioning packages.
SettingsBlockRemoveProvisioningPackage.title: SettingsBlockRemoveProvisioningPackage

SettingsBlockSettingsApp.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Settings app.
SettingsBlockSettingsApp.title: SettingsBlockSettingsApp

SettingsBlockSystemPage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to System in Settings app.
SettingsBlockSystemPage.title: SettingsBlockSystemPage

SettingsBlockTimeLanguagePage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Time & Language in Settings app.
SettingsBlockTimeLanguagePage.title: SettingsBlockTimeLanguagePage

SettingsBlockUpdateSecurityPage.description: Indicates whether or not to block access to Update & Security in Settings app.
SettingsBlockUpdateSecurityPage.title: SettingsBlockUpdateSecurityPage

SharedUserAppDataAllowed.description: Indicates whether or not to block multiple users of the same app to share data.
SharedUserAppDataAllowed.title: SharedUserAppDataAllowed

SmartScreenAppInstallControl.description: Added in Windows 10, version 1703. Allows IT Admins to control whether users are allowed to install apps from places other than the Store. Possible values are: notConfigured, anywhere, storeOnly, recommendations, preferStore.
SmartScreenAppInstallControl.title: SmartScreenAppInstallControl

SmartScreenBlockPromptOverride.description: Indicates whether or not users can override SmartScreen Filter warnings about potentially malicious websites.
SmartScreenBlockPromptOverride.title: SmartScreenBlockPromptOverride

SmartScreenBlockPromptOverrideForFiles.description: Indicates whether or not users can override the SmartScreen Filter warnings about downloading unverified files
SmartScreenBlockPromptOverrideForFiles.title: SmartScreenBlockPromptOverrideForFiles

SmartScreenEnableAppInstallControl.description: This property will be deprecated in July 2019 and will be replaced by property SmartScreenAppInstallControl. Allows IT Admins to control whether users are allowed to install apps from places other than the Store.
SmartScreenEnableAppInstallControl.title: SmartScreenEnableAppInstallControl

StartBlockUnpinningAppsFromTaskbar.description: Indicates whether or not to block the user from unpinning apps from taskbar.
StartBlockUnpinningAppsFromTaskbar.title: StartBlockUnpinningAppsFromTaskbar

StartMenuAppListVisibility.description: Setting the value of this collapses the app list, removes the app list entirely, or disables the corresponding toggle in the Settings app. Possible values are: userDefined, collapse, remove, disableSettingsApp.
StartMenuAppListVisibility.title: StartMenuAppListVisibility

StartMenuHideChangeAccountSettings.description: Enabling this policy hides the change account setting from appearing in the user tile in the start menu.
StartMenuHideChangeAccountSettings.title: StartMenuHideChangeAccountSettings

StartMenuHideFrequentlyUsedApps.description: Enabling this policy hides the most used apps from appearing on the start menu and disables the corresponding toggle in the Settings app.
StartMenuHideFrequentlyUsedApps.title: StartMenuHideFrequentlyUsedApps

StartMenuHideHibernate.description: Enabling this policy hides hibernate from appearing in the power button in the start menu.
StartMenuHideHibernate.title: StartMenuHideHibernate

StartMenuHideLock.description: Enabling this policy hides lock from appearing in the user tile in the start menu.
StartMenuHideLock.title: StartMenuHideLock

StartMenuHidePowerButton.description: Enabling this policy hides the power button from appearing in the start menu.
StartMenuHidePowerButton.title: StartMenuHidePowerButton

StartMenuHideRecentJumpLists.description: Enabling this policy hides recent jump lists from appearing on the start menu/taskbar and disables the corresponding toggle in the Settings app.
StartMenuHideRecentJumpLists.title: StartMenuHideRecentJumpLists

StartMenuHideRecentlyAddedApps.description: Enabling this policy hides recently added apps from appearing on the start menu and disables the corresponding toggle in the Settings app.
StartMenuHideRecentlyAddedApps.title: StartMenuHideRecentlyAddedApps

StartMenuHideRestartOptions.description: Enabling this policy hides 'Restart/Update and Restart' from appearing in the power button in the start menu.
StartMenuHideRestartOptions.title: StartMenuHideRestartOptions

StartMenuHideShutDown.description: Enabling this policy hides shut down/update and shut down from appearing in the power button in the start menu.
StartMenuHideShutDown.title: StartMenuHideShutDown

StartMenuHideSignOut.description: Enabling this policy hides sign out from appearing in the user tile in the start menu.
StartMenuHideSignOut.title: StartMenuHideSignOut

StartMenuHideSleep.description: Enabling this policy hides sleep from appearing in the power button in the start menu.
StartMenuHideSleep.title: StartMenuHideSleep

StartMenuHideSwitchAccount.description: Enabling this policy hides switch account from appearing in the user tile in the start menu.
StartMenuHideSwitchAccount.title: StartMenuHideSwitchAccount

StartMenuHideUserTile.description: Enabling this policy hides the user tile from appearing in the start menu.
StartMenuHideUserTile.title: StartMenuHideUserTile

StartMenuLayoutEdgeAssetsXml.description: This policy setting allows you to import Edge assets to be used with startMenuLayoutXml policy. Start layout can contain secondary tile from Edge app which looks for Edge local asset file. Edge local asset would not exist and cause Edge secondary tile to appear empty in this case. This policy only gets applied when startMenuLayoutXml policy is modified. The value should be a UTF-8 Base64 encoded byte array.
StartMenuLayoutEdgeAssetsXml.title: StartMenuLayoutEdgeAssetsXml

StartMenuLayoutXml.description: Allows admins to override the default Start menu layout and prevents the user from changing it. The layout is modified by specifying an XML file based on a layout modification schema. XML needs to be in a UTF8 encoded byte array format.
StartMenuLayoutXml.title: StartMenuLayoutXml

StartMenuMode.description: Allows admins to decide how the Start menu is displayed. Possible values are: userDefined, fullScreen, nonFullScreen.
StartMenuMode.title: StartMenuMode

StartMenuPinnedFolderDocuments.description: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Documents folder shortcut on the Start menu. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
StartMenuPinnedFolderDocuments.title: StartMenuPinnedFolderDocuments

StartMenuPinnedFolderDownloads.description: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Downloads folder shortcut on the Start menu. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
StartMenuPinnedFolderDownloads.title: StartMenuPinnedFolderDownloads

StartMenuPinnedFolderFileExplorer.description: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the FileExplorer shortcut on the Start menu. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
StartMenuPinnedFolderFileExplorer.title: StartMenuPinnedFolderFileExplorer

StartMenuPinnedFolderHomeGroup.description: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the HomeGroup folder shortcut on the Start menu. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
StartMenuPinnedFolderHomeGroup.title: StartMenuPinnedFolderHomeGroup

StartMenuPinnedFolderMusic.description: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Music folder shortcut on the Start menu. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
StartMenuPinnedFolderMusic.title: StartMenuPinnedFolderMusic

StartMenuPinnedFolderNetwork.description: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Network folder shortcut on the Start menu. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
StartMenuPinnedFolderNetwork.title: StartMenuPinnedFolderNetwork

StartMenuPinnedFolderPersonalFolder.description: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the PersonalFolder shortcut on the Start menu. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
StartMenuPinnedFolderPersonalFolder.title: StartMenuPinnedFolderPersonalFolder

StartMenuPinnedFolderPictures.description: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Pictures folder shortcut on the Start menu. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
StartMenuPinnedFolderPictures.title: StartMenuPinnedFolderPictures

StartMenuPinnedFolderSettings.description: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Settings folder shortcut on the Start menu. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
StartMenuPinnedFolderSettings.title: StartMenuPinnedFolderSettings

StartMenuPinnedFolderVideos.description: Enforces the visibility (Show/Hide) of the Videos folder shortcut on the Start menu. Possible values are: notConfigured, hide, show.
StartMenuPinnedFolderVideos.title: StartMenuPinnedFolderVideos

StorageBlockRemovableStorage.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from using removable storage.
StorageBlockRemovableStorage.title: StorageBlockRemovableStorage

StorageRequireMobileDeviceEncryption.description: Indicating whether or not to require encryption on a mobile device.
StorageRequireMobileDeviceEncryption.title: StorageRequireMobileDeviceEncryption

StorageRestrictAppDataToSystemVolume.description: Indicates whether application data is restricted to the system drive.
StorageRestrictAppDataToSystemVolume.title: StorageRestrictAppDataToSystemVolume

StorageRestrictAppInstallToSystemVolume.description: Indicates whether the installation of applications is restricted to the system drive.
StorageRestrictAppInstallToSystemVolume.title: StorageRestrictAppInstallToSystemVolume

SystemTelemetryProxyServer.description: Gets or sets the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) or IP address of a proxy server to forward Connected User Experiences and Telemetry requests.
SystemTelemetryProxyServer.title: SystemTelemetryProxyServer

TaskManagerBlockEndTask.description: Specify whether non-administrators can use Task Manager to end tasks.
TaskManagerBlockEndTask.title: TaskManagerBlockEndTask

TenantLockdownRequireNetworkDuringOutOfB.description: Whether the device is required to connect to the network.
TenantLockdownRequireNetworkDuringOutOfB.title: TenantLockdownRequireNetworkDuringOutOfBoxExperience

UninstallBuiltInApps.description: Indicates whether or not to uninstall a fixed list of built-in Windows apps.
UninstallBuiltInApps.title: UninstallBuiltInApps

UsbBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from USB connection.
UsbBlocked.title: UsbBlocked

VoiceRecordingBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from voice recording.
VoiceRecordingBlocked.title: VoiceRecordingBlocked

WebRtcBlockLocalhostIpAddress.description: Indicates whether or not user's localhost IP address is displayed while making phone calls using the WebRTC
WebRtcBlockLocalhostIpAddress.title: WebRtcBlockLocalhostIpAddress

WiFiBlockAutomaticConnectHotspots.description: Indicating whether or not to block automatically connecting to Wi-Fi hotspots. Has no impact if Wi-Fi is blocked.
WiFiBlockAutomaticConnectHotspots.title: WiFiBlockAutomaticConnectHotspots

WiFiBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from using Wi-Fi.
WiFiBlocked.title: WiFiBlocked

WiFiBlockManualConfiguration.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from using Wi-Fi manual configuration.
WiFiBlockManualConfiguration.title: WiFiBlockManualConfiguration

WiFiScanInterval.description: Specify how often devices scan for Wi-Fi networks. Supported values are 1-500, where 100 = default, and 500 = low frequency. Valid values 1 to 500
WiFiScanInterval.title: WiFiScanInterval

Windows10AppsForceUpdateSchedule.description: Windows 10 force update schedule for Apps.
Windows10AppsForceUpdateSchedule.title: Windows10AppsForceUpdateSchedule

Recurrence.description: Recurrence schedule. Possible values are: none, daily, weekly, monthly.
Recurrence.title: Recurrence

RunImmediatelyIfAfterStartDateTime.description: If true, runs the task immediately if StartDateTime is in the past, else, runs at the next recurrence.
RunImmediatelyIfAfterStartDateTime.title: RunImmediatelyIfAfterStartDateTime

StartDateTime.description: The start time for the force restart.
StartDateTime.title: StartDateTime

WindowsSpotlightBlockConsumerSpecificFea.description: Allows IT admins to block experiences that are typically for consumers only, such as Start suggestions, Membership notifications, Post-OOBE app install and redirect tiles.
WindowsSpotlightBlockConsumerSpecificFea.title: WindowsSpotlightBlockConsumerSpecificFeatures

WindowsSpotlightBlocked.description: Allows IT admins to turn off all Windows Spotlight features
WindowsSpotlightBlocked.title: WindowsSpotlightBlocked

WindowsSpotlightBlockOnActionCenter.description: Block suggestions from Microsoft that show after each OS clean install, upgrade or in an on-going basis to introduce users to what is new or changed
WindowsSpotlightBlockOnActionCenter.title: WindowsSpotlightBlockOnActionCenter

WindowsSpotlightBlockTailoredExperiences.description: Block personalized content in Windows spotlight based on users device usage.
WindowsSpotlightBlockTailoredExperiences.title: WindowsSpotlightBlockTailoredExperiences

WindowsSpotlightBlockThirdPartyNotificat.description: Block third party content delivered via Windows Spotlight
WindowsSpotlightBlockThirdPartyNotificat.title: WindowsSpotlightBlockThirdPartyNotifications

WindowsSpotlightBlockWelcomeExperience.description: Block Windows Spotlight Windows welcome experience
WindowsSpotlightBlockWelcomeExperience.title: WindowsSpotlightBlockWelcomeExperience

WindowsSpotlightBlockWindowsTips.description: Allows IT admins to turn off the popup of Windows Tips.
WindowsSpotlightBlockWindowsTips.title: WindowsSpotlightBlockWindowsTips

WindowsSpotlightConfigureOnLockScreen.description: Specifies the type of Spotlight. Possible values are: notConfigured, disabled, enabled.
WindowsSpotlightConfigureOnLockScreen.title: WindowsSpotlightConfigureOnLockScreen

WindowsStoreBlockAutoUpdate.description: Indicates whether or not to block automatic update of apps from Windows Store.
WindowsStoreBlockAutoUpdate.title: WindowsStoreBlockAutoUpdate

WindowsStoreBlocked.description: Indicates whether or not to Block the user from using the Windows store.
WindowsStoreBlocked.title: WindowsStoreBlocked

WindowsStoreEnablePrivateStoreOnly.description: Indicates whether or not to enable Private Store Only.
WindowsStoreEnablePrivateStoreOnly.title: WindowsStoreEnablePrivateStoreOnly

WirelessDisplayBlockProjectionToThisDevi.description: Indicates whether or not to allow other devices from discovering this PC for projection.
WirelessDisplayBlockProjectionToThisDevi.title: WirelessDisplayBlockProjectionToThisDevice

WirelessDisplayBlockUserInputFromReceive.description: Indicates whether or not to allow user input from wireless display receiver.
WirelessDisplayBlockUserInputFromReceive.title: WirelessDisplayBlockUserInputFromReceiver

WirelessDisplayRequirePinForPairing.description: Indicates whether or not to require a PIN for new devices to initiate pairing.
WirelessDisplayRequirePinForPairing.title: WirelessDisplayRequirePinForPairing

Description.description: Admin provided description of the Device Configuration.
Description.title: Description

DisplayName.description: Admin provided name of the device configuration.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

SupportsScopeTags.description: Indicates whether or not the underlying Device Configuration supports the assignment of scope tags. Assigning to the ScopeTags property is not allowed when this value is false and entities will not be visible to scoped users. This occurs for Legacy policies created in Silverlight and can be resolved by deleting and recreating the policy in the Azure Portal. This property is read-only.
SupportsScopeTags.title: SupportsScopeTags

Id.description: The unique identifier for an entity. Read-only.
Id.title: Id

dataType.description: The type of the target assignment.

deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterId.description: The Id of the filter for the target assignment.
deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterId.title: deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterId

groupId.title: groupId

groupDisplayName.description: The group Display Name that is the target of the assignment.

collectionId.description: The collection Id that is the target of the assignment.(ConfigMgr)

CertificateStore.description: Target store certificate. Possible values are: user, machine.
CertificateStore.title: CertificateStore

HashAlgorithm.description: SCEP Hash Algorithm. Possible values are: sha1, sha2.
HashAlgorithm.title: HashAlgorithm

KeySize.description: SCEP Key Size. Possible values are: size1024, size2048, size4096.
KeySize.title: KeySize

KeyUsage.description: SCEP Key Usage. Possible values are: keyEncipherment, digitalSignature.
KeyUsage.title: KeyUsage

SubjectAlternativeNameFormatString.description: Custom String that defines the AAD Attribute.
SubjectAlternativeNameFormatString.title: SubjectAlternativeNameFormatString

SubjectNameFormatString.description: Custom format to use with SubjectNameFormat = Custom. Example: CN={{UserName}},E={{EmailAddress}},OU=Enterprise Users,O=Contoso Corporation,L=Redmond,ST=WA,C=US
SubjectNameFormatString.title: SubjectNameFormatString

items.description: Intune Device Configuration Pkcs Certificate Policy for Windows10

Name.description: Custom SAN Name
Name.title: Name

SanType.description: Custom SAN Type. Possible values are: none, emailAddress, userPrincipalName, customAzureADAttribute, domainNameService, universalResourceIdentifier.
SanType.title: SanType

CustomSubjectAlternativeNames.description: Custom Subject Alternative Name Settings. This collection can contain a maximum of 500 elements.
CustomSubjectAlternativeNames.title: CustomSubjectAlternativeNames

ExtendedKeyUsages.description: Extended Key Usage (EKU) settings. This collection can contain a maximum of 500 elements.

CertificateValidityPeriodScale.description: Scale for the Certificate Validity Period. Possible values are: days, months, years.
CertificateValidityPeriodScale.title: CertificateValidityPeriodScale

CertificateValidityPeriodValue.description: Value for the Certificate Validity Period
CertificateValidityPeriodValue.title: CertificateValidityPeriodValue

KeyStorageProvider.description: Key Storage Provider (KSP). Possible values are: useTpmKspOtherwiseUseSoftwareKsp, useTpmKspOtherwiseFail, usePassportForWorkKspOtherwiseFail, useSoftwareKsp.
KeyStorageProvider.title: KeyStorageProvider

RenewalThresholdPercentage.description: Certificate renewal threshold percentage. Valid values 1 to 99
RenewalThresholdPercentage.title: RenewalThresholdPercentage

SubjectAlternativeNameType.description: Certificate Subject Alternative Name Type. Possible values are: none, emailAddress, userPrincipalName, customAzureADAttribute, domainNameService, universalResourceIdentifier.
SubjectAlternativeNameType.title: SubjectAlternativeNameType

SubjectNameFormat.description: Certificate Subject Name Format. Possible values are: commonName, commonNameIncludingEmail, commonNameAsEmail, custom, commonNameAsIMEI, commonNameAsSerialNumber, commonNameAsAadDeviceId, commonNameAsIntuneDeviceId, commonNameAsDurableDeviceId.
SubjectNameFormat.title: SubjectNameFormat

microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationsecu.description: Intune Device Configuration Secure Assessment Policy for Windows10
microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationsecu.title: Schema for microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationsecureassessmentpolicywindows10

AllowPrinting.description: Indicates whether or not to allow the app from printing during the test.
AllowPrinting.title: AllowPrinting

AllowScreenCapture.description: Indicates whether or not to allow screen capture capability during a test.
AllowScreenCapture.title: AllowScreenCapture

AllowTextSuggestion.description: Indicates whether or not to allow text suggestions during the test.
AllowTextSuggestion.title: AllowTextSuggestion

AssessmentAppUserModelId.description: Specifies the application user model ID of the assessment app launched when a user signs in to a secure assessment with a local guest account. Important notice: this property must be set with localGuestAccountName in order to make the local guest account sign-in experience work properly for secure assessments.
AssessmentAppUserModelId.title: AssessmentAppUserModelId

ConfigurationAccount.description: The account used to configure the Windows device for taking the test. The user can be a domain account (domain/user), an AAD account (usernametenant.com) or a local account (username).
ConfigurationAccount.title: ConfigurationAccount

ConfigurationAccountType.description: The account type used to by ConfigurationAccount. Possible values are: azureADAccount, domainAccount, localAccount, localGuestAccount.
ConfigurationAccountType.title: ConfigurationAccountType

LaunchUri.description: Url link to an assessment that's automatically loaded when the secure assessment browser is launched. It has to be a valid Url (https://msdn.microsoft.com/).
LaunchUri.title: LaunchUri

LocalGuestAccountName.description: Specifies the display text for the local guest account shown on the sign-in screen. Typically is the name of an assessment. When the user clicks the local guest account on the sign-in screen, an assessment app is launched with a specified assessment URL. Secure assessments can only be configured with local guest account sign-in on devices running Windows 10, version 1903 or later. Important notice: this property must be set with assessmentAppUserModelID in order to make the local guest account sign-in experience work properly for secure assessments.
LocalGuestAccountName.title: LocalGuestAccountName

DisplayName.title: DisplayName

microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationshar.description: Intune Device Configuration Shared Multi Device Policy for Windows10
microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationshar.title: Schema for microsoft.intune.deviceconfigurationsharedmultidevicepolicywindows10

AccountManagerPolicy.description: Specifies how accounts are managed on a shared PC. Only applies when disableAccountManager is false.
AccountManagerPolicy.title: AccountManagerPolicy

AccountDeletionPolicy.description: Configures when accounts are deleted. Possible values are: immediate, diskSpaceThreshold, diskSpaceThresholdOrInactiveThreshold.
AccountDeletionPolicy.title: AccountDeletionPolicy

CacheAccountsAboveDiskFreePercentage.description: Sets the percentage of available disk space a PC should have before it stops deleting cached shared PC accounts. Only applies when AccountDeletionPolicy is DiskSpaceThreshold or DiskSpaceThresholdOrInactiveThreshold. Valid values 0 to 100
CacheAccountsAboveDiskFreePercentage.title: CacheAccountsAboveDiskFreePercentage

InactiveThresholdDays.description: Specifies when the accounts will start being deleted when they have not been logged on during the specified period, given as number of days. Only applies when AccountDeletionPolicy is DiskSpaceThreshold or DiskSpaceThresholdOrInactiveThreshold.
InactiveThresholdDays.title: InactiveThresholdDays

RemoveAccountsBelowDiskFreePercentage.description: Sets the percentage of disk space remaining on a PC before cached accounts will be deleted to free disk space. Accounts that have been inactive the longest will be deleted first. Only applies when AccountDeletionPolicy is DiskSpaceThresholdOrInactiveThreshold. Valid values 0 to 100
RemoveAccountsBelowDiskFreePercentage.title: RemoveAccountsBelowDiskFreePercentage

AllowedAccounts.description: Indicates which type of accounts are allowed to use on a shared PC. Possible values are: notConfigured, guest, domain.
AllowedAccounts.title: AllowedAccounts

AllowLocalStorage.description: Specifies whether local storage is allowed on a shared PC.
AllowLocalStorage.title: AllowLocalStorage

DisableAccountManager.description: Disables the account manager for shared PC mode.
DisableAccountManager.title: DisableAccountManager

DisableEduPolicies.description: Specifies whether the default shared PC education environment policies should be disabled. For Windows 10 RS2 and later, this policy will be applied without setting Enabled to true.
DisableEduPolicies.title: DisableEduPolicies

DisablePowerPolicies.description: Specifies whether the default shared PC power policies should be disabled.
DisablePowerPolicies.title: DisablePowerPolicies

DisableSignInOnResume.description: Disables the requirement to sign in whenever the device wakes up from sleep mode.
DisableSignInOnResume.title: DisableSignInOnResume

Enabled.description: Enables shared PC mode and applies the shared pc policies.
Enabled.title: Enabled

FastFirstSignIn.description: Specifies whether to auto connect new non-admin Azure AD accounts to pre-configured candidate local accounts. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
FastFirstSignIn.title: FastFirstSignIn

IdleTimeBeforeSleepInSeconds.description: Specifies the time in seconds that a device must sit idle before the PC goes to sleep. Setting this value to 0 prevents the sleep timeout from occurring.
IdleTimeBeforeSleepInSeconds.title: IdleTimeBeforeSleepInSeconds

KioskAppDisplayName.description: Specifies the display text for the account shown on the sign-in screen which launches the app specified by SetKioskAppUserModelId. Only applies when KioskAppUserModelId is set.
KioskAppDisplayName.title: KioskAppDisplayName

KioskAppUserModelId.description: Specifies the application user model ID of the app to use with assigned access.
KioskAppUserModelId.title: KioskAppUserModelId

LocalStorage.description: Specifies whether local storage is allowed on a shared PC. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
LocalStorage.title: LocalStorage

MaintenanceStartTime.description: Specifies the daily start time of maintenance hour.
MaintenanceStartTime.title: MaintenanceStartTime

SetAccountManager.description: Disables the account manager for shared PC mode. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
SetAccountManager.title: SetAccountManager

SetEduPolicies.description: Specifies whether the default shared PC education environment policies should be enabled/disabled/not configured. For Windows 10 RS2 and later, this policy will be applied without setting Enabled to true. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
SetEduPolicies.title: SetEduPolicies

SetPowerPolicies.description: Specifies whether the default shared PC power policies should be enabled/disabled. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
SetPowerPolicies.title: SetPowerPolicies

SignInOnResume.description: Specifies the requirement to sign in whenever the device wakes up from sleep mode. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
SignInOnResume.title: SignInOnResume

Description.title: Description

DisplayName.description: Admin provided name of the device configuration.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

AuthenticationBlockPeriodInMinutes.description: Specify the duration for which automatic authentication attempts will be blocked from occurring after a failed authentication attempt.
AuthenticationBlockPeriodInMinutes.title: AuthenticationBlockPeriodInMinutes

AuthenticationMethod.description: Specify the authentication method. Possible values are: certificate, usernameAndPassword, derivedCredential. Possible values are: certificate, usernameAndPassword, derivedCredential, unknownFutureValue.
AuthenticationMethod.title: AuthenticationMethod

AuthenticationPeriodInSeconds.description: Specify the number of seconds for the client to wait after an authentication attempt before failing. Valid range 1-3600.
AuthenticationPeriodInSeconds.title: AuthenticationPeriodInSeconds

AuthenticationRetryDelayPeriodInSeconds.description: Specify the number of seconds between a failed authentication and the next authentication attempt. Valid range 1-3600.
AuthenticationRetryDelayPeriodInSeconds.title: AuthenticationRetryDelayPeriodInSeconds

AuthenticationType.description: Specify whether to authenticate the user, the device, either, or to use guest authentication (none). If you're using certificate authentication, make sure the certificate type matches the authentication type. Possible values are: none, user, machine, machineOrUser, guest. Possible values are: none, user, machine, machineOrUser, guest, unknownFutureValue.
AuthenticationType.title: AuthenticationType

CacheCredentials.description: When TRUE, caches user credentials on the device so that users don't need to keep entering them each time they connect. When FALSE, do not cache credentials. Default value is FALSE.
CacheCredentials.title: CacheCredentials

DisableUserPromptForServerValidation.description: When TRUE, prevents the user from being prompted to authorize new servers for trusted certification authorities when EAP type is selected as PEAP. When FALSE, does not prevent the user from being prompted. Default value is FALSE.
DisableUserPromptForServerValidation.title: DisableUserPromptForServerValidation

EapolStartPeriodInSeconds.description: Specify the number of seconds to wait before sending an EAPOL (Extensible Authentication Protocol over LAN) Start message. Valid range 1-3600.
EapolStartPeriodInSeconds.title: EapolStartPeriodInSeconds

EapType.description: Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP). Indicates the type of EAP protocol set on the Wi-Fi endpoint (router). Possible values are: eapTls, leap, eapSim, eapTtls, peap, eapFast, teap. Possible values are: eapTls, leap, eapSim, eapTtls, peap, eapFast, teap.
EapType.title: EapType

Enforce8021X.description: When TRUE, the automatic configuration service for wired networks requires the use of 802.1X for port authentication. When FALSE, 802.1X is not required. Default value is FALSE.
Enforce8021X.title: Enforce8021X

ForceFIPSCompliance.description: When TRUE, forces FIPS compliance. When FALSE, does not enable FIPS compliance. Default value is FALSE.
ForceFIPSCompliance.title: ForceFIPSCompliance

InnerAuthenticationProtocolForEAPTTLS.description: Specify inner authentication protocol for EAP TTLS. Possible values are: unencryptedPassword, challengeHandshakeAuthenticationProtocol, microsoftChap, microsoftChapVersionTwo. Possible values are: unencryptedPassword, challengeHandshakeAuthenticationProtocol, microsoftChap, microsoftChapVersionTwo.
InnerAuthenticationProtocolForEAPTTLS.title: InnerAuthenticationProtocolForEAPTTLS

MaximumAuthenticationFailures.description: Specify the maximum authentication failures allowed for a set of credentials. Valid range 1-100.
MaximumAuthenticationFailures.title: MaximumAuthenticationFailures

MaximumEAPOLStartMessages.description: Specify the maximum number of EAPOL (Extensible Authentication Protocol over LAN) Start messages to be sent before returning failure. Valid range 1-100.
MaximumEAPOLStartMessages.title: MaximumEAPOLStartMessages

OuterIdentityPrivacyTemporaryValue.description: Specify the string to replace usernames for privacy when using EAP TTLS or PEAP.
OuterIdentityPrivacyTemporaryValue.title: OuterIdentityPrivacyTemporaryValue

PerformServerValidation.description: When TRUE, enables verification of server's identity by validating the certificate when EAP type is selected as PEAP. When FALSE, the certificate is not validated. Default value is TRUE.
PerformServerValidation.title: PerformServerValidation

RequireCryptographicBinding.description: When TRUE, enables cryptographic binding when EAP type is selected as PEAP. When FALSE, does not enable cryptogrpahic binding. Default value is TRUE.
RequireCryptographicBinding.title: RequireCryptographicBinding

SecondaryAuthenticationMethod.description: Specify the secondary authentication method. Possible values are: certificate, usernameAndPassword, derivedCredential. Possible values are: certificate, usernameAndPassword, derivedCredential, unknownFutureValue.
SecondaryAuthenticationMethod.title: SecondaryAuthenticationMethod

IdentityCertificateForClientAuthenticati.title: IdentityCertificateForClientAuthenticationDisplayName
