microsoft.intune.exploitprotectionpolicy.description:
This resource configures an Intune Endpoint Protection Exploit Protection policy for a Windows 10 Device.
Enables the IT admin to push out a configuration representing the desired system and application mitigation options to all the devices in the organization. The configuration is represented by an XML.
For more information Exploit Protection, see
- Enable Exploit Protection on Devices and Import: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/defender-endpoint/enable-exploit-protection,
- Export, and deploy Exploit Protection configurations: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/threat-protection/windows-defender-exploit-guard/import-export-exploit-protection-emet-xml
microsoft.intune.exploitprotectionpolicy.title: Schema for microsoft.intune.exploitprotectionpolicywindows10settingcatalog

DisplayName.title: DisplayName

Description.description: Description of the endpoint protection.
Description.title: Description

ExploitProtectionSettings.title: ExploitProtectionSettings

DisallowExploitProtectionOverride.description: Prevent users from making changes to the exploit protection settings area in the Windows Defender Security Center.values 0:disable, 1:enable
DisallowExploitProtectionOverride.title: DisallowExploitProtectionOverride

This resource configures an Intune Endpoint Protection Antivirus policy for a Windows 10 Device.
This policy setting enables the management of Microsoft Defender Antivirus for Windows 10 using the settings catalog.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_DeviceManagementConfigurationPolicyAssignments

dataType.description: The type of the target assignment.
dataType.title: dataType

deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterTy.description: The type of filter of the target assignment i.e. Exclude or Include. Possible values are:none, include, exclude.

groupDisplayName.title: groupDisplayName

collectionId.title: collectionId

Assignments.description: Assignments of the endpoint protection.
Assignments.title: Assignments

AttackSurfaceReductionOnlyExclusions.description: Exclude files and paths from attack surface reduction rules
AttackSurfaceReductionOnlyExclusions.title: AttackSurfaceReductionOnlyExclusions

BlockAbuseOfExploitedVulnerableSignedDri.description: This rule prevents an application from writing a vulnerable signed driver to disk.
BlockAbuseOfExploitedVulnerableSignedDri.title: BlockAbuseOfExploitedVulnerableSignedDrivers

BlockAdobeReaderFromCreatingChildProcess.description: This rule prevents attacks by blocking Adobe Reader from creating processes.
BlockAdobeReaderFromCreatingChildProcess.title: BlockAdobeReaderFromCreatingChildProcesses

BlockAllOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingCh.description: This rule blocks Office apps from creating child processes. Office apps include Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, and Access.
BlockAllOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingCh.title: BlockAllOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingChildProcesses

BlockAllOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingCh.description: ASR Only Per Rule Exclusions (off: Off, block: Block, audit: Audit, warn: Warn)
BlockAllOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingCh.title: BlockAllOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingChildProcesses_ASROnlyPerRuleExclusions

BlockCredentialStealingFromWindowsLocalS.description: This rule helps prevent credential stealing by locking down Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS).
BlockCredentialStealingFromWindowsLocalS.title: BlockCredentialStealingFromWindowsLocalSecurityAuthoritySubsystem

BlockExecutableContentFromEmailClientAnd.description: This rule blocks the following file types from launching from email opened within the Microsoft Outlook application, or Outlook.com and other popular webmail providers.
BlockExecutableContentFromEmailClientAnd.title: BlockExecutableContentFromEmailClientAndWebmail

BlockExecutableFilesRunningUnlessTheyMee.description: This rule blocks executable files that don't meet a prevalence, age, or trusted list criteria, such as .exe, .dll, or .scr, from launching.
BlockExecutableFilesRunningUnlessTheyMee.title: BlockExecutableFilesRunningUnlessTheyMeetPrevalenceAgeTrustedListCriterion

BlockExecutionOfPotentiallyObfuscatedScr.description: This rule detects suspicious properties within an obfuscated script.
BlockExecutionOfPotentiallyObfuscatedScr.title: BlockExecutionOfPotentiallyObfuscatedScripts

BlockJavaScriptOrVBScriptFromLaunchingDo.description: This rule prevents scripts from launching potentially malicious downloaded content.
BlockJavaScriptOrVBScriptFromLaunchingDo.title: BlockJavaScriptOrVBScriptFromLaunchingDownloadedExecutableContent

BlockOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingExecu.description: This rule prevents Office apps, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, from creating potentially malicious executable content, by blocking malicious code from being written to disk.
BlockOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingExecu.title: BlockOfficeApplicationsFromCreatingExecutableContent

BlockOfficeApplicationsFromInjectingCode.description: This rule blocks code injection attempts from Office apps into other processes.
BlockOfficeApplicationsFromInjectingCode.title: BlockOfficeApplicationsFromInjectingCodeIntoOtherProcesses

BlockOfficeCommunicationAppFromCreatingC.description: This rule prevents Outlook from creating child processes, while still allowing legitimate Outlook functions.
BlockOfficeCommunicationAppFromCreatingC.title: BlockOfficeCommunicationAppFromCreatingChildProcesses

BlockPersistenceThroughWMIEventSubscript.description: This rule prevents malware from abusing WMI to attain persistence on a device.
BlockPersistenceThroughWMIEventSubscript.title: BlockPersistenceThroughWMIEventSubscription

BlockProcessCreationsFromPSExecAndWMICom.description: This rule blocks processes created through PsExec and WMI from running.
BlockProcessCreationsFromPSExecAndWMICom.title: BlockProcessCreationsFromPSExecAndWMICommands

BlockRebootingMachineInSafeMode.description: This rule prevents the execution of commands to restart machines in Safe Mode.
BlockRebootingMachineInSafeMode.title: BlockRebootingMachineInSafeMode

BlockUntrustedUnsignedProcessesThatRunFr.description: With this rule, admins can prevent unsigned or untrusted executable files from running from USB removable drives, including SD cards.
BlockUntrustedUnsignedProcessesThatRunFr.title: BlockUntrustedUnsignedProcessesThatRunFromUSB

BlockUseOfCopiedOrImpersonatedSystemTool.description: This rule blocks the use of executable files that are identified as copies of Windows system tools. These files are either duplicates or impostors of the original system tools.
BlockUseOfCopiedOrImpersonatedSystemTool.title: BlockUseOfCopiedOrImpersonatedSystemTools

BlockWebShellCreationForServers.description: This rule blocks webshell creation for servers.
BlockWebShellCreationForServers.title: BlockWebShellCreationForServers

BlockWin32APICallsFromOfficeMacros.description: This rule prevents VBA macros from calling Win32 APIs.
BlockWin32APICallsFromOfficeMacros.title: BlockWin32APICallsFromOfficeMacros

UseAdvancedProtectionAgainstRansomware.description: This rule provides an extra layer of protection against ransomware.
UseAdvancedProtectionAgainstRansomware.title: UseAdvancedProtectionAgainstRansomware

ControlledFolderAccessProtectedFolders.description: List of additional folders that need to be protected
ControlledFolderAccessProtectedFolders.title: ControlledFolderAccessProtectedFolders

ControlledFolderAccessAllowedApplication.description: List of apps that have access to protected folders.
ControlledFolderAccessAllowedApplication.title: ControlledFolderAccessAllowedApplications

EnableControlledFolderAccess.description: This rule enables Controlled folder access which protects your data by checking apps against a list of known, trusted apps.values 0:disable, 1:enable, 2:audit
EnableControlledFolderAccess.title: EnableControlledFolderAccess

Ensure.description: Present ensures the policy exists, absent ensures it is removed
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.intune.windowsupdateforbusines.description:
Intune Windows Update For Business Feature Update Profile for Windows10

## RolloutSettings

The RolloutSettings for this resource have the following constraints and notes: 

* When creating a policy:
    * If only a start date is specified, then the start date must be at least today. 
        * If the desired state date is before the current date, it will be adjusted to the current date.
    * If a start and end date is specified, the start date must be the current date + 2 days, and  
      the end date must be at least one day after the start date.
        * If the start date is before the current date + 2 days, it will be adjusted to this date.
* When updating a policy:
    * If only a start date is specified, then the start date must either be the date from the current   
      configuration or the current date (or later). 
        * If the desired state date is before the current date, it will be adjusted to the current date.
    * If a start and end date is specified, the start date must be the current date + 2 days, and  
      the end date must be at least one day after the start date.
        * If the start date is before the current date + 2 days, it will be adjusted to this date.
* When testing a policy:
    * If the policy is missing and the start and end date are before the current date, it will return true.
    * If the start date is different but before the current start date or time, it will return true.
microsoft.intune.windowsupdateforbusines.title: Schema for microsoft.intune.windowsupdateforbusinessfeatureupdateprofilewindows10

Id.description: The unique identifier for an entity. Read-only.
Id.title: Id

DisplayName.description: The display name of the profile.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

Description.description: The description of the profile which is specified by the user.
Description.title: Description

FeatureUpdateVersion.description: The feature update version that will be deployed to the devices targeted by this profile. The version could be any supported version for example 1709, 1803 or 1809 and so on.
FeatureUpdateVersion.title: FeatureUpdateVersion

InstallFeatureUpdatesOptional.description: If true, the Windows 11 update will become optional
InstallFeatureUpdatesOptional.title: InstallFeatureUpdatesOptional

InstallLatestWindows10OnWindows11Ineligi.description: If true, the latest Microsoft Windows 10 update will be installed on devices ineligible for Microsoft Windows 11. Cannot be changed after creation of the policy.
InstallLatestWindows10OnWindows11Ineligi.title: InstallLatestWindows10OnWindows11IneligibleDevice

RolloutSettings.description: The windows update rollout settings, including offer start date time, offer end date time, and days between each set of offers. For 'as soon as possible' installation, set this setting to $null or do not configure it.
RolloutSettings.title: RolloutSettings

OfferEndDateTimeInUTC.description: The feature update's ending  of release date and time to be set, update, and displayed for a feature Update profile for example: 2020-06-09T10:00:00Z.
OfferEndDateTimeInUTC.title: OfferEndDateTimeInUTC

OfferIntervalInDays.description: The number of day(s) between each set of offers to be set, updated, and displayed for a feature update profile, for example: if OfferStartDateTimeInUTC is 2020-06-09T10:00:00Z, and OfferIntervalInDays is 1, then the next two sets of offers will be made consecutively on 2020-06-10T10:00:00Z (next day at the same specified time) and 2020-06-11T10:00:00Z (next next day at the same specified time) with 1 day in between each set of offers.
OfferIntervalInDays.title: OfferIntervalInDays

OfferStartDateTimeInUTC.description: The feature update's starting date and time to be set, update, and displayed for a feature Update profile for example: 2020-06-09T10:00:00Z.
OfferStartDateTimeInUTC.title: OfferStartDateTimeInUTC

microsoft.intune.windowsupdateforbusines.description: Intune Windows Update For Business Ring Update Profile for Windows 10
microsoft.intune.windowsupdateforbusines.title: Schema for microsoft.intune.windowsupdateforbusinessringupdateprofilewindows10

Id.description: The unique identifier for an entity. Read-only.
Id.title: Id

DisplayName.description: Admin provided name of the device configuration.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

AllowWindows11Upgrade.description: When TRUE, allows eligible Windows 10 devices to upgrade to Windows 11. When FALSE, implies the device stays on the existing operating system. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
AllowWindows11Upgrade.title: AllowWindows11Upgrade

AutomaticUpdateMode.description: The Automatic Update Mode. Possible values are: UserDefined, NotifyDownload, AutoInstallAtMaintenanceTime, AutoInstallAndRebootAtMaintenanceTime, AutoInstallAndRebootAtScheduledTime, AutoInstallAndRebootWithoutEndUserControl, WindowsDefault. UserDefined is the default value, no intent. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. Possible values are: userDefined, notifyDownload, autoInstallAtMaintenanceTime, autoInstallAndRebootAtMaintenanceTime, autoInstallAndRebootAtScheduledTime, autoInstallAndRebootWithoutEndUserControl, windowsDefault.
AutomaticUpdateMode.title: AutomaticUpdateMode

AutoRestartNotificationDismissal.description: Specify the method by which the auto-restart required notification is dismissed. Possible values are: NotConfigured, Automatic, User. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. Possible values are: notConfigured, automatic, user, unknownFutureValue.
AutoRestartNotificationDismissal.title: AutoRestartNotificationDismissal

BusinessReadyUpdatesOnly.description: Determines which branch devices will receive their updates from. Possible values are: UserDefined, All, BusinessReadyOnly, WindowsInsiderBuildFast, WindowsInsiderBuildSlow, WindowsInsiderBuildRelease. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. Possible values are: userDefined, all, businessReadyOnly, windowsInsiderBuildFast, windowsInsiderBuildSlow, windowsInsiderBuildRelease.
BusinessReadyUpdatesOnly.title: BusinessReadyUpdatesOnly

DeadlineForFeatureUpdatesInDays.description: Number of days before feature updates are installed automatically with valid range from 0 to 30 days. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
DeadlineForFeatureUpdatesInDays.title: DeadlineForFeatureUpdatesInDays

DeadlineForQualityUpdatesInDays.description: Number of days before quality updates are installed automatically with valid range from 0 to 30 days. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
DeadlineForQualityUpdatesInDays.title: DeadlineForQualityUpdatesInDays

DeadlineGracePeriodInDays.description: Number of days after deadline until restarts occur automatically with valid range from 0 to 7 days. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
DeadlineGracePeriodInDays.title: DeadlineGracePeriodInDays

DeliveryOptimizationMode.description: The Delivery Optimization Mode. Possible values are: UserDefined, HttpOnly, HttpWithPeeringNat, HttpWithPeeringPrivateGroup, HttpWithInternetPeering, SimpleDownload, BypassMode. UserDefined allows the user to set. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. Possible values are: userDefined, httpOnly, httpWithPeeringNat, httpWithPeeringPrivateGroup, httpWithInternetPeering, simpleDownload, bypassMode.
DeliveryOptimizationMode.title: DeliveryOptimizationMode

DriversExcluded.description: When TRUE, excludes Windows update Drivers. When FALSE, does not exclude Windows update Drivers. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
DriversExcluded.title: DriversExcluded

EngagedRestartDeadlineInDays.description: Deadline in days before automatically scheduling and executing a pending restart outside of active hours, with valid range from 2 to 30 days. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
EngagedRestartDeadlineInDays.title: EngagedRestartDeadlineInDays

EngagedRestartSnoozeScheduleInDays.description: Number of days a user can snooze Engaged Restart reminder notifications with valid range from 1 to 3 days. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
EngagedRestartSnoozeScheduleInDays.title: EngagedRestartSnoozeScheduleInDays

EngagedRestartTransitionScheduleInDays.description: Number of days before transitioning from Auto Restarts scheduled outside of active hours to Engaged Restart, which requires the user to schedule, with valid range from 0 to 30 days. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
EngagedRestartTransitionScheduleInDays.title: EngagedRestartTransitionScheduleInDays

FeatureUpdatesDeferralPeriodInDays.description: Defer Feature Updates by these many days with valid range from 0 to 30 days. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
FeatureUpdatesDeferralPeriodInDays.title: FeatureUpdatesDeferralPeriodInDays

FeatureUpdatesPaused.description: When TRUE, assigned devices are paused from receiving feature updates for up to 35 days from the time you pause the ring. When FALSE, does not pause Feature Updates. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.s
FeatureUpdatesPaused.title: FeatureUpdatesPaused

FeatureUpdatesPauseExpiryDateTime.description: The Feature Updates Pause Expiry datetime. This value is 35 days from the time admin paused or extended the pause for the ring. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
FeatureUpdatesPauseExpiryDateTime.title: FeatureUpdatesPauseExpiryDateTime

FeatureUpdatesPauseStartDate.description: The Feature Updates Pause start date. This value is the time when the admin paused or extended the pause for the ring. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. This property is read-only.
FeatureUpdatesPauseStartDate.title: FeatureUpdatesPauseStartDate

FeatureUpdatesRollbackStartDateTime.description: The Feature Updates Rollback Start datetime.This value is the time when the admin rolled back the Feature update for the ring.Returned by default.Query parameters are not supported.
FeatureUpdatesRollbackStartDateTime.title: FeatureUpdatesRollbackStartDateTime

FeatureUpdatesRollbackWindowInDays.description: The number of days after a Feature Update for which a rollback is valid with valid range from 2 to 60 days. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
FeatureUpdatesRollbackWindowInDays.title: FeatureUpdatesRollbackWindowInDays

InstallationSchedule.description: The Installation Schedule. Possible values are: ActiveHoursStart, ActiveHoursEnd, ScheduledInstallDay, ScheduledInstallTime. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
InstallationSchedule.title: InstallationSchedule

ScheduledInstallDay.description: Scheduled Install Day in week. Possible values are: userDefined, everyday, sunday, monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday, noScheduledScan.
ScheduledInstallDay.title: ScheduledInstallDay

MicrosoftUpdateServiceAllowed.description: When TRUE, allows Microsoft Update Service. When FALSE, does not allow Microsoft Update Service. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
MicrosoftUpdateServiceAllowed.title: MicrosoftUpdateServiceAllowed

PostponeRebootUntilAfterDeadline.description: When TRUE the device should wait until deadline for rebooting outside of active hours. When FALSE the device should not wait until deadline for rebooting outside of active hours. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
PostponeRebootUntilAfterDeadline.title: PostponeRebootUntilAfterDeadline

PrereleaseFeatures.description: The Pre-Release Features. Possible values are: UserDefined, SettingsOnly, SettingsAndExperimentations, NotAllowed. UserDefined is the default value, no intent. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. Possible values are: userDefined, settingsOnly, settingsAndExperimentations, notAllowed.
PrereleaseFeatures.title: PrereleaseFeatures

QualityUpdatesDeferralPeriodInDays.description: Defer Quality Updates by these many days with valid range from 0 to 30 days. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
QualityUpdatesDeferralPeriodInDays.title: QualityUpdatesDeferralPeriodInDays

QualityUpdatesPaused.description: When TRUE, assigned devices are paused from receiving quality updates for up to 35 days from the time you pause the ring. When FALSE, does not pause Quality Updates. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
QualityUpdatesPaused.title: QualityUpdatesPaused

QualityUpdatesPauseExpiryDateTime.description: The Quality Updates Pause Expiry datetime. This value is 35 days from the time admin paused or extended the pause for the ring. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
QualityUpdatesPauseExpiryDateTime.title: QualityUpdatesPauseExpiryDateTime

QualityUpdatesPauseStartDate.description: The Quality Updates Pause start date. This value is the time when the admin paused or extended the pause for the ring. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. This property is read-only.
QualityUpdatesPauseStartDate.title: QualityUpdatesPauseStartDate

QualityUpdatesRollbackStartDateTime.description: The Quality Updates Rollback Start datetime. This value is the time when the admin rolled back the Quality update for the ring. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
QualityUpdatesRollbackStartDateTime.title: QualityUpdatesRollbackStartDateTime

ScheduleImminentRestartWarningInMinutes.description: Specify the period for auto-restart imminent warning notifications. Supported values: 15, 30 or 60 (minutes). Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
ScheduleImminentRestartWarningInMinutes.title: ScheduleImminentRestartWarningInMinutes

ScheduleRestartWarningInHours.description: Specify the period for auto-restart warning reminder notifications. Supported values: 2, 4, 8, 12 or 24 (hours). Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
ScheduleRestartWarningInHours.title: ScheduleRestartWarningInHours

SkipChecksBeforeRestart.description: When TRUE, skips all checks before restart: Battery level = 40%, User presence, Display Needed, Presentation mode, Full screen mode, phone call state, game mode etc. When FALSE, does not skip all checks before restart. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported.
SkipChecksBeforeRestart.title: SkipChecksBeforeRestart

UpdateNotificationLevel.description: Specifies what Windows Update notifications users see. Possible values are: NotConfigured, DefaultNotifications, RestartWarningsOnly, DisableAllNotifications. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. Possible values are: notConfigured, defaultNotifications, restartWarningsOnly, disableAllNotifications, unknownFutureValue.
UpdateNotificationLevel.title: UpdateNotificationLevel

UpdateWeeks.description: Schedule the update installation on the weeks of the month. Possible values are: UserDefined, FirstWeek, SecondWeek, ThirdWeek, FourthWeek, EveryWeek. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. Possible values are: userDefined, firstWeek, secondWeek, thirdWeek, fourthWeek, everyWeek, unknownFutureValue.
UpdateWeeks.title: UpdateWeeks

UserPauseAccess.description: Specifies whether to enable end user's access to pause software updates. Possible values are: NotConfigured, Enabled, Disabled. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
UserPauseAccess.title: UserPauseAccess

UserWindowsUpdateScanAccess.description: Specifies whether to disable user's access to scan Windows Update. Possible values are: NotConfigured, Enabled, Disabled. Returned by default. Query parameters are not supported. Possible values are: notConfigured, enabled, disabled.
UserWindowsUpdateScanAccess.title: UserWindowsUpdateScanAccess

Description.description: Admin provided description of the Device Configuration.
Description.title: Description

items.description:
This resource configures an Intune Endpoint Protection Antivirus policy for a Windows 10 Device.
This policy setting enables the management of Microsoft Defender Antivirus for Windows 10 using the settings catalog.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_DeviceManagementConfigurationPolicyAssignments

dataType.description: The type of the target assignment.
dataType.title: dataType

deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterTy.description: The type of filter of the target assignment i.e. Exclude or Include. Possible values are:none, include, exclude.
deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterTy.title: deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterType

deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterId.description: The Id of the filter for the target assignment.
deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterId.title: deviceAndAppManagementAssignmentFilterId

groupId.description: The group Id that is the target of the assignment.
groupId.title: groupId

groupDisplayName.description: The group Display Name that is the target of the assignment.
groupDisplayName.title: groupDisplayName

collectionId.description: The collection Id that is the target of the assignment.(ConfigMgr)
collectionId.title: collectionId

Assignments.description: Represents the assignment to the Intune policy.
Assignments.title: Assignments

microsoft.securityandcompliance.auditcon.description:
This resource configures an Audit ConfigurationPolicy
in Security and Compliance Center.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.auditcon.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.auditconfigurationpolicy

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.securityandcompliance.autosens.description: This resource configures a Auto Sensitivity label policy in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.autosens.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.autosensitivitylabelpolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name for the sensitivity label. The maximum length is 64 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Name.title: Name

Ensure.description: Specify if this label policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

ApplySensitivityLabel.description: The ApplySensitivityLabel parameter specifies the label to use for the auto label policy.
ApplySensitivityLabel.title: ApplySensitivityLabel

ExchangeSender.description: The ExchangeSender parameter specifies which senders to include in the policy.
ExchangeSender.title: ExchangeSender

ExchangeSenderException.description: The ExchangeSenderException parameter specifies which senders to exclude in the policy.
ExchangeSenderException.title: ExchangeSenderException

ExchangeSenderMemberOf.description: The ExchangeSenderMemberOf parameter specifies the distribution groups, mail-enabled security groups, or dynamic distribution groups to include in the auto-labeling policy.
ExchangeSenderMemberOf.title: ExchangeSenderMemberOf

ExchangeSenderMemberOfException.description: he ExchangeSenderMemberOf parameter specifies the distribution groups, mail-enabled security groups, or dynamic distribution groups to exclude from the auto-labeling policy.
ExchangeSenderMemberOfException.title: ExchangeSenderMemberOfException

ExchangeLocation.description: The ExchangeSender parameter specifies which senders to include in the policy.
ExchangeLocation.title: ExchangeLocation

AddExchangeLocation.description: This AddExchangeLocation parameter specifies new Exchange locations to be added to the policy without affecting the existing ones.
AddExchangeLocation.title: AddExchangeLocation

RemoveExchangeLocation.description: The RemoveExchangeLocation parameter removes locations on Exchange from the policy.
RemoveExchangeLocation.title: RemoveExchangeLocation

Mode.description: The Mode parameter specifies the action and notification level of the auto-labeling policy.
Mode.title: Mode

OneDriveLocation.description: The OneDriveLocation parameter specifies the OneDrive for Business sites to include. You identify the site by its URL value, or you can use the value.
OneDriveLocation.title: OneDriveLocation

AddOneDriveLocation.description: The AddOneDriveLocation parameter specifies the OneDrive for Business sites to add to the list of included sites when you aren't using the value All for the OneDriveLocation parameter.
AddOneDriveLocation.title: AddOneDriveLocation

RemoveOneDriveLocation.description: The RemoveOneDriveLocation parameter specifies the OneDrive for Business sites to remove from the list of included sites when you aren't using the value All for the OneDriveLocation parameter.
RemoveOneDriveLocation.title: RemoveOneDriveLocation

AddOneDriveLocationException.description: This parameter specifies the OneDrive for Business sites to exclude when you use the value All for the OneDriveLocation parameter.
AddOneDriveLocationException.title: AddOneDriveLocationException

RemoveOneDriveLocationException.description: This RemoveOneDriveLocationException parameter specifies the OneDrive for Business sites to remove from the list of excluded sites when you use the value All for the OneDriveLocation parameter.
RemoveOneDriveLocationException.title: RemoveOneDriveLocationException

OneDriveLocationException.description: The AddOneDriveLocationException parameter specifies the OneDrive for Business sites to add to the list of excluded sites when you use the value All for the OneDriveLocation parameter.
OneDriveLocationException.title: OneDriveLocationException

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies the priority of the policy. The highest priority policy will take action over lower priority policies if two policies are applicable for a file.
Priority.title: Priority

SharePointLocation.description: The SharePointLocation parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to include. You identify the site by its URL value, or you can use the value All to include all sites.
SharePointLocation.title: SharePointLocation

SharePointLocationException.description: This parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to exclude when you use the value All for the SharePointLocation parameter.
SharePointLocationException.title: SharePointLocationException

AddSharePointLocationException.description: The AddSharePointLocation parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to add to the list of included sites when you aren't using the value All for the SharePointLocation parameter.
AddSharePointLocationException.title: AddSharePointLocationException

RemoveSharePointLocationException.description: The RemoveSharePointLocationException parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to remove from the list of excluded sites when you use the value All for the SharePointLocation parameter.
RemoveSharePointLocationException.title: RemoveSharePointLocationException

AddSharePointLocation.description: The AddSharePointLocation parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to add to the list of included sites when you aren't using the value All for the SharePointLocation parameter.
AddSharePointLocation.title: AddSharePointLocation

RemoveSharePointLocation.description: The RemoveSharePointLocation parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to remove from the list of included sites when you aren't using the value All for the SharePointLocation parameter.
RemoveSharePointLocation.title: RemoveSharePointLocation

microsoft.securityandcompliance.autosens.description:
This resource configures a Auto Sensitivity Label
Rule in Security and Compliance Center.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.autosens.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.autosensitivitylabelrule

Name.description: Name of the Rule.
Name.title: Name

AccessScope.description: The AccessScope parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that's based on the access scope of the content. The rule is applied to content that matches the specified access scope. Valid values are: InOrganization, NotInOrganization, None
AccessScope.title: AccessScope

AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords.description: The AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for words or phrases in recipient email addresses. You can specify multiple words or phrases separated by commas.
AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords.title: AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords

AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns.description: The AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for text patterns in recipient email addresses by using regular expressions.
AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns.title: AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

ContentContainsSensitiveInformation.description: The ContentContainsSensitiveInformation parameter specifies a condition for the rule that's based on a sensitive information type match in content. The rule is applied to content that contains the specified sensitive information type.
ContentContainsSensitiveInformation.title: ContentContainsSensitiveInformation

items.description:

Rule in Security and Compliance Center.

name.description: Name of the Sensitive Label
name.title: name

type.description: Type of the Sensitive Information label
type.title: type

Name.description: Name of the group
Name.title: Name

ContentExtensionMatchesWords.description: The ContentExtensionMatchesWords parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for words in file name extensions. You can specify multiple words separated by commas.
ContentExtensionMatchesWords.title: ContentExtensionMatchesWords

Disabled.description: The Disabled parameter specifies whether the auto-labeling policy rule is enabled or disabled.
Disabled.title: Disabled

DocumentIsPasswordProtected.description: The DocumentIsPasswordProtected parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for password protected files (because the contents of the file can't be inspected). Password detection only works for Office documents and .zip files.
DocumentIsPasswordProtected.title: DocumentIsPasswordProtected

DocumentIsUnsupported.description: The DocumentIsUnsupported parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for files that can't be scanned.
DocumentIsUnsupported.title: DocumentIsUnsupported

ExceptIfAccessScope.description: The ExceptIfAccessScopeAccessScope parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that's based on the access scope of the content. The rule isn't applied to content that matches the specified access scope. Valid values are: InOrganization, NotInOrganization, None
ExceptIfAccessScope.title: ExceptIfAccessScope

ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWor.description: The ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for words or phrases in recipient email addresses. You can specify multiple words separated by commas.
ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWor.title: ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords

ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatt.description: The ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for text patterns in recipient email addresses by using regular expressions.
ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatt.title: ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns

ExceptIfContentContainsSensitiveInformat.description: The ExceptIfContentContainsSensitiveInformation parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that's based on a sensitive information type match in content. The rule isn't applied to content that contains the specified sensitive information type.
ExceptIfContentContainsSensitiveInformat.title: ExceptIfContentContainsSensitiveInformation

items.description:
This resource configures a Auto Sensitivity Label
Rule in Security and Compliance Center.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_SCDLPLabel

name.description: Name of the Sensitive Label
name.title: name

id.description: Id of the Sensitive Information label
id.title: id

type.description: Type of the Sensitive Information label
type.title: type

Name.description: Name of the group
Name.title: Name

ExceptIfContentExtensionMatchesWords.description: The ExceptIfContentExtensionMatchesWords parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for words in file name extensions. You can specify multiple words separated by commas.
ExceptIfContentExtensionMatchesWords.title: ExceptIfContentExtensionMatchesWords

ExceptIfDocumentIsPasswordProtected.description: The ExceptIfDocumentIsPasswordProtected parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for password protected files (because the contents of the file can't be inspected). Password detection only works for Office documents and .zip files.
ExceptIfDocumentIsPasswordProtected.title: ExceptIfDocumentIsPasswordProtected

ExceptIfDocumentIsUnsupported.description: The ExceptIfDocumentIsUnsupported parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for files that can't be scanned.
ExceptIfDocumentIsUnsupported.title: ExceptIfDocumentIsUnsupported

ExceptIfFrom.description: The ExceptIfFrom parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for messages from specific senders. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the sender.
ExceptIfFrom.title: ExceptIfFrom

ExceptIfFromAddressContainsWords.description: The ExceptIfFromAddressContainsWords parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for words or phrases in the sender's email address. You can specify multiple words or phrases separated by commas.
ExceptIfFromAddressContainsWords.title: ExceptIfFromAddressContainsWords

ExceptIfFromAddressMatchesPatterns.description: The ExceptIfFromAddressMatchesPatterns parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for text patterns in the sender's email address by using regular expressions.
ExceptIfFromAddressMatchesPatterns.title: ExceptIfFromAddressMatchesPatterns

ExceptIfFromMemberOf.description: The ExceptIfFromMemberOf parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for messages sent by group members. You identify the group members by their email addresses. You can enter multiple values separated by commas.
ExceptIfFromMemberOf.title: ExceptIfFromMemberOf

ExceptIfHeaderMatchesPatterns.description: The HeaderMatchesPatterns parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for text patterns in a header field by using regular expressions.
ExceptIfHeaderMatchesPatterns.title: ExceptIfHeaderMatchesPatterns

ExceptIfProcessingLimitExceeded.description: The ExceptIfProcessingLimitExceeded parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for files where scanning couldn't complete.
ExceptIfProcessingLimitExceeded.title: ExceptIfProcessingLimitExceeded

ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.title: ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs

ExceptIfSenderDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfSenderDomainIs parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for messages from senders with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple values separated by commas.
ExceptIfSenderDomainIs.title: ExceptIfSenderDomainIs

ExceptIfSenderIPRanges.description: The ExceptIfSenderIpRanges parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for senders whose IP addresses matches the specified value, or fall within the specified ranges.
ExceptIfSenderIPRanges.title: ExceptIfSenderIPRanges

ExceptIfSentTo.description: The ExceptIfSentTo parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
ExceptIfSentTo.title: ExceptIfSentTo

ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.description: The ExceptIfSentToMemberOf parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for messages sent to members of distribution groups, dynamic distribution groups, or mail-enabled security groups. You identify the groups by email address. You can specify multiple values separated by commas.
ExceptIfSentToMemberOf.title: ExceptIfSentToMemberOf

ExceptIfSubjectMatchesPatterns.description: The ExceptIfSubjectMatchesPatterns parameter specifies an exception for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for text patterns in the Subject field of messages by using regular expressions.
ExceptIfSubjectMatchesPatterns.title: ExceptIfSubjectMatchesPatterns

FromAddressContainsWords.description: The FromAddressContainsWords parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for words or phrases in the sender's email address. You can specify multiple words or phrases separated by commas.
FromAddressContainsWords.title: FromAddressContainsWords

FromAddressMatchesPatterns.description: The FromAddressMatchesPatterns parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for text patterns in the sender's email address by using regular expressions.
FromAddressMatchesPatterns.title: FromAddressMatchesPatterns

HeaderMatchesPatterns.description: The HeaderMatchesPatterns parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for text patterns in a header field by using regular expressions.
HeaderMatchesPatterns.title: HeaderMatchesPatterns

Name.description: Name of the header pattern
Name.title: Name

ProcessingLimitExceeded.description: The ProcessingLimitExceeded parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for files where scanning couldn't complete. You can use this condition to create rules that work together to identify and process messages where the content couldn't be fully scanned.
ProcessingLimitExceeded.title: ProcessingLimitExceeded

RecipientDomainIs.description: The RecipientDomainIs parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for recipients with email address in the specified domains. You can specify multiple domains separated by commas.
RecipientDomainIs.title: RecipientDomainIs

ReportSeverityLevel.description: The ReportSeverityLevel parameter specifies the severity level of the incident report for content detections based on the rule. Valid values are: None, Low, Medium, High
ReportSeverityLevel.title: ReportSeverityLevel

RuleErrorAction.description: The RuleErrorAction parameter specifies what to do if an error is encountered during the evaluation of the rule. Valid values are: Ignore, RetryThenBlock, *blank*
RuleErrorAction.title: RuleErrorAction

SenderDomainIs.description: The SenderDomainIs parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for messages from senders with email address in the specified domains.
SenderDomainIs.title: SenderDomainIs

SenderIPRanges.description: The SenderIpRanges parameter specifies a condition for the auto-sensitivity policy rule that looks for senders whose IP addresses matches the specified value, or fall within the specified ranges.
SenderIPRanges.title: SenderIPRanges

SentTo.description: The SentTo parameter specifies a condition for the auto-sensitivity policy rule that looks for recipients in messages. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the recipient.
SentTo.title: SentTo

SentToMemberOf.description: The SentToMemberOf parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for messages sent to members of distribution groups, dynamic distribution groups, or mail-enabled security groups. You identify the groups by email address.
SentToMemberOf.title: SentToMemberOf

SubjectMatchesPatterns.description: The SubjectMatchesPatterns parameter specifies a condition for the auto-labeling policy rule that looks for text patterns in the Subject field of messages by using regular expressions.
SubjectMatchesPatterns.title: SubjectMatchesPatterns

Workload.description: Workload the rule is associated with. Value can be: Exchange, SharePoint, OneDriveForBusiness
Workload.title: Workload

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.securityandcompliance.casehold.description:
This resource configures a eDiscovery Case Policy
in Security and Compliance Center.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.casehold.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.caseholdpolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the case hold policy.
Name.title: Name

Case.description: The Case parameter specifies the eDiscovery case that you want to associate with the case hold policy.
Case.title: Case

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter specifies whether the policy is enabled or disabled.
Enabled.title: Enabled

ExchangeLocation.description: The ExchangeLocation parameter specifies the mailboxes to include in the policy.
ExchangeLocation.title: ExchangeLocation

PublicFolderLocation.description: The PublicFolderLocation parameter specifies that you want to include all public folders in the case hold policy. You use the value All for this parameter.
PublicFolderLocation.title: PublicFolderLocation

SharePointLocation.description: The SharePointLocation parameter specifies the SharePoint Online and OneDrive for Business sites to include. You identify a site by its URL value.
SharePointLocation.title: SharePointLocation

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.securityandcompliance.casehold.description:
This resource configures an eDiscovery Case Hold Rule
in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.casehold.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.caseholdrule

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies a unique name for the case hold rule.
Name.title: Name

Policy.description: The Policy parameter specifies the case hold policy that contains the rule. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the policy.
Policy.title: Policy

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

ContentMatchQuery.description: The ContentMatchQuery parameter specifies a content search filter. Use this parameter to create a query-based hold so only the content that matches the specified search query is placed on hold. This parameter uses a text search string or a query that's formatted by using the Keyword Query Language (KQL).
ContentMatchQuery.title: ContentMatchQuery

Disabled.description: The Disabled parameter specifies whether the case hold rule is enabled or disabled.
Disabled.title: Disabled

Ensure.description: Present ensures the rule exists, absent ensures it is removed
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.securityandcompliance.complian.description: This resource configures an eDiscovery Case in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.complian.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.compliancecase

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the compliance case.
Name.title: Name

Description.description: The description of the case.
Description.title: Description

Ensure.description: Specify if this case should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Status.description: Status for the case. Can either be 'Active' or 'Closed'
Status.title: Status

microsoft.securityandcompliance.complian.description: This resource configures an Compliance Search (eDiscovery) in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.complian.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.compliancesearch

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the complaiance tag.
Name.title: Name

Case.description: Compliance Case (eDiscovery) that this Search is associated with
Case.title: Case

AllowNotFoundExchangeLocationsEnabled.description: The AllowNotFoundExchangeLocationsEnabled parameter specifies whether to include mailboxes other than regular user mailboxes in the compliance search.
AllowNotFoundExchangeLocationsEnabled.title: AllowNotFoundExchangeLocationsEnabled

ContentMatchQuery.description: The ContentMatchQuery parameter specifies a content search filter. This parameter uses a text search string or a query that's formatted by using the Keyword Query Language (KQL).
ContentMatchQuery.title: ContentMatchQuery

Description.description: The Description parameter specifies an optional description for the compliance search. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Description.title: Description

ExchangeLocation.description: The ExchangeLocation parameter specifies the mailboxes to include.
ExchangeLocation.title: ExchangeLocation

ExchangeLocationExclusion.description: This parameter specifies the mailboxes to exclude when you use the value All for the ExchangeLocation parameter.
ExchangeLocationExclusion.title: ExchangeLocationExclusion

HoldNames.description: The HoldNames parameter specifies that the content locations that have been placed on hold in the specified eDiscovery case will be searched. You use the value All for this parameter. You also need to specify the name of an eDiscovery case by using the Case parameter.
HoldNames.title: HoldNames

IncludeUserAppContent.description: The IncludeUserAppContent parameter specifies that you want to search the cloud-based storage location for users who don't have a regular Office 365 user account in your organization. These types of users include users without an Exchange Online license who use Office applications, Office 365 guest users, and on-premises users whose identity is synchronized with your Office 365 organization.
IncludeUserAppContent.title: IncludeUserAppContent

Language.description: The Language parameter specifies the language for the compliance search. Valid input for this parameter is a supported culture code value from the Microsoft .NET Framework CultureInfo class. For example, da-DK for Danish or ja-JP for Japanese.
Language.title: Language

PublicFolderLocation.description: The PublicFolderLocation parameter specifies that you want to include all public folders in the search. You use the value All for this parameter.
PublicFolderLocation.title: PublicFolderLocation

SharePointLocation.description: The SharePointLocation parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to include. You identify the site by its URL value, or you can use the value All to include all sites.
SharePointLocation.title: SharePointLocation

SharePointLocationExclusion.description: This parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to exclude when you use the value All for the SharePointLocation parameter. You identify the site by its URL value.
SharePointLocationExclusion.title: SharePointLocationExclusion

Ensure.description: Specify if this search should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.securityandcompliance.complian.description: This resource configures a Compliance Search Action in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.complian.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.compliancesearchaction

Action.description: The Action parameter specifies what type of action to define. Accepted values are Export, Retention and Purge.
Action.title: Action

SearchName.description: The SearchName parameter specifies the name of the existing content search to associate with the content search action. You can specify multiple content searches separated by commas.
SearchName.title: SearchName

FileTypeExclusionsForUnindexedItems.description: The FileTypeExclusionsForUnindexedItems specifies the file types to exclude because they can't be indexed. You can specify multiple values separated by commas.
FileTypeExclusionsForUnindexedItems.title: FileTypeExclusionsForUnindexedItems

EnableDedupe.description: The EnableDedupe parameter eliminates duplication of messages when you export content search results.
EnableDedupe.title: EnableDedupe

IncludeCredential.description: The IncludeCredential switch specifies whether to include the credential in the results.
IncludeCredential.title: IncludeCredential

IncludeSharePointDocumentVersions.description: The IncludeSharePointDocumentVersions parameter specifies whether to export previous versions of the document when you use the Export switch.
IncludeSharePointDocumentVersions.title: IncludeSharePointDocumentVersions

PurgeType.description: The PurgeType parameter specifies how to remove items when the action is Purge.
PurgeType.title: PurgeType

RetryOnError.description: The RetryOnError switch specifies whether to retry the action on any items that failed without re-running the entire action all over again.
RetryOnError.title: RetryOnError

ActionScope.description: The ActionScope parameter specifies the items to include when the action is Export.
ActionScope.title: ActionScope

Ensure.description: Specify if this action should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.securityandcompliance.complian.description: This resource configures a Compliance Tag in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.complian.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.compliancetag

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the complaiance tag.
Name.title: Name

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

EventType.description: The EventType parameter specifies the retention rule that's associated with the label.
EventType.title: EventType

IsRecordLabel.description: The IsRecordLabel parameter specifies whether the label is a record label.
IsRecordLabel.title: IsRecordLabel

Notes.description: The Notes parameter specifies an optional note. If you specify a value that contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks, for example: 'This is a user note'
Notes.title: Notes

FilePlanProperty.description: The FilePlanProperty parameter specifies the file plan properties to include in the label.
FilePlanProperty.title: FilePlanProperty

FilePlanPropertyDepartment.description: File plan department. Can get list by running Get-FilePlanPropertyDepartment.
FilePlanPropertyDepartment.title: FilePlanPropertyDepartment

FilePlanPropertyAuthority.description: File plan Authority. Can get list by running Get-FilePlanPropertyAuthority.
FilePlanPropertyAuthority.title: FilePlanPropertyAuthority

FilePlanPropertyCategory.description: File plan category. Can get a list by running Get-FilePlanPropertyCategory.
FilePlanPropertyCategory.title: FilePlanPropertyCategory

FilePlanPropertyCitation.description: File plan citation. Can get a list by running Get-FilePlanPropertyCitation.
FilePlanPropertyCitation.title: FilePlanPropertyCitation

FilePlanPropertyReferenceId.description: File plan reference id. Can get a list by running Get-FilePlanPropertyReferenceId.
FilePlanPropertyReferenceId.title: FilePlanPropertyReferenceId

FilePlanPropertySubCategory.description: File plan subcategory. Can get a list by running Get-FilePlanPropertySubCategory.
FilePlanPropertySubCategory.title: FilePlanPropertySubCategory

ReviewerEmail.description: The ReviewerEmail parameter specifies the email address of a reviewer for Delete and KeepAndDelete retention actions. You can specify multiple email addresses separated by commas.
ReviewerEmail.title: ReviewerEmail

RetentionDuration.description: The RetentionDuration parameter specifies the hold duration for the retention rule. Valid values are: An integer - The hold duration in days, Unlimited - The content is held indefinitely.
RetentionDuration.title: RetentionDuration

RetentionAction.description: The RetentionAction parameter specifies the action for the label. Valid values are: Delete, Keep or KeepAndDelete.
RetentionAction.title: RetentionAction

RetentionType.description: The RetentionType parameter specifies whether the retention duration is calculated from the content creation date, tagged date, or last modification date. Valid values are: CreationAgeInDays, EventAgeInDays,ModificationAgeInDays, or TaggedAgeInDays.
RetentionType.title: RetentionType

microsoft.securityandcompliance.deviceco.description: This resource configures a Device Conditional Access Policy in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.deviceco.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.deviceconditionalaccesspolicy

Name.description: The name of the Device Conditional Access Policy.
Name.title: Name

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter specifies whether the policy is enabled.
Enabled.title: Enabled

microsoft.securityandcompliance.deviceco.description: This resource configures a Device Configuration Policy in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.deviceco.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.deviceconfigurationpolicy

Name.description: The name of the Device Configuration Policy.
Name.title: Name

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

Enabled.description: The Enabled parameter specifies whether the policy is enabled.
Enabled.title: Enabled

microsoft.securityandcompliance.dlpcompl.description:
This resource configures a Data Loss Prevention Compliance
Policy in Security and Compliance Center.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.dlpcompl.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.dlpcompliancepolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the DLP policy. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Name.title: Name

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

EndpointDlpLocation.description: The EndpointDLPLocation parameter specifies the user accounts to include in the DLP policy for Endpoint DLP when they are logged on to an onboarded device. You identify the account by name or email address. You can use the value All to include all user accounts.
EndpointDlpLocation.title: EndpointDlpLocation

EndpointDlpLocationException.description: The EndpointDlpLocationException parameter specifies the user accounts to exclude from Endpoint DLP when you use the value All for the EndpointDlpLocation parameter. You identify the account by name or email address.
EndpointDlpLocationException.title: EndpointDlpLocationException

OnPremisesScannerDlpLocation.description: The OnPremisesScannerDlpLocation parameter specifies the on-premises file shares and SharePoint document libraries and folders to include in the DLP policy. You can use the value All to include all on-premises file shares and SharePoint document libraries and folders.
OnPremisesScannerDlpLocation.title: OnPremisesScannerDlpLocation

OnPremisesScannerDlpLocationException.description: The OnPremisesScannerDlpLocationException parameter specifies the on-premises file shares and SharePoint document libraries and folders to exclude from the DLP policy if you use the value All for the OnPremisesScannerDlpLocation parameter.
OnPremisesScannerDlpLocationException.title: OnPremisesScannerDlpLocationException

PowerBIDlpLocation.description: The PowerBIDlpLocation parameter specifies the Power BI workspace IDs to include in the DLP policy. Only workspaces hosted in Premium Gen2 capacities are permitted. You can use the value All to include all supported workspaces.
PowerBIDlpLocation.title: PowerBIDlpLocation

PowerBIDlpLocationException.description: The PowerBIDlpLocationException parameter specifies the Power BI workspace IDs to exclude from the DLP policy when you use the value All for the PowerBIDlpLocation parameter. Only workspaces hosted in Premium Gen2 capacities are permitted.
PowerBIDlpLocationException.title: PowerBIDlpLocationException

ThirdPartyAppDlpLocation.description: The ThirdPartyAppDlpLocation parameter specifies the non-Microsoft cloud apps to include in the DLP policy. You can use the value All to include all connected apps.
ThirdPartyAppDlpLocation.title: ThirdPartyAppDlpLocation

ThirdPartyAppDlpLocationException.description: The ThirdPartyAppDlpLocationException parameter specifies the non-Microsoft cloud apps to exclude from the DLP policy when you use the value All for the ThirdPartyAppDlpLocation parameter.
ThirdPartyAppDlpLocationException.title: ThirdPartyAppDlpLocationException

ExchangeLocation.description: The ExchangeLocation parameter specifies Exchange Online mailboxes to include in the DLP policy. You can only use the value All for this parameter to include all mailboxes.
ExchangeLocation.title: ExchangeLocation

Mode.description: The Mode parameter specifies the action and notification level of the DLP policy. Valid values are: Enable, TestWithNotifications, TestWithoutNotifications, Disable and PendingDeletion.
Mode.title: Mode

OneDriveLocation.description: The OneDriveLocation parameter specifies the OneDrive for Business sites to include. You identify the site by its URL value, or you can use the value All to include all sites.
OneDriveLocation.title: OneDriveLocation

OneDriveLocationException.description: This parameter specifies the OneDrive for Business sites to exclude when you use the value All for the OneDriveLocation parameter. You identify the site by its URL value.
OneDriveLocationException.title: OneDriveLocationException

SharePointLocation.description: The SharePointLocation parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to include. You identify the site by its URL value, or you can use the value All to include all sites.
SharePointLocation.title: SharePointLocation

SharePointLocationException.description: This parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to exclude when you use the value All for the SharePointLocation parameter. You identify the site by its URL value.
SharePointLocationException.title: SharePointLocationException

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.securityandcompliance.dlpcompl.description:
This resource configures a Data Loss Prevention Compliance
Rule in Security and Compliance Center.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.dlpcompl.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.dlpcompliancerule

Name.description: Name of the Rule.
Name.title: Name

Policy.description: Name of the associated DLP Compliance Policy.
Policy.title: Policy

AccessScope.description: The AccessScope parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that's based on the access scope of the content. The rule is applied to content that matches the specified access scope.
AccessScope.title: AccessScope

BlockAccess.description: The BlockAccess parameter specifies an action for the DLP rule that blocks access to the source item when the conditions of the rule are met. $true: Blocks further access to the source item that matched the rule. The owner, author, and site owner can still access the item. $false: Allows access to the source item that matched the rule. This is the default value.
BlockAccess.title: BlockAccess

BlockAccessScope.description: The BlockAccessScope parameter specifies the scope of the block access action.
BlockAccessScope.title: BlockAccessScope

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment. If you specify a value that contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Comment.title: Comment

AdvancedRule.description: The AdvancedRule parameter uses complex rule syntax that supports multiple AND, OR, and NOT operators and nested groups
AdvancedRule.title: AdvancedRule

ContentContainsSensitiveInformation.description: The ContentContainsSensitiveInformation parameter specifies a condition for the rule that's based on a sensitive information type match in content. The rule is applied to content that contains the specified sensitive information type.
ContentContainsSensitiveInformation.title: ContentContainsSensitiveInformation

The rule isn't applied to content that contains the specified sensitive information type.
