ContentPropertyContainsWords.description: The ContentPropertyContainsWords parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that's based on a property match in content. The rule is applied to content that contains the specified property.
ContentPropertyContainsWords.title: ContentPropertyContainsWords

Disabled.description: The Disabled parameter specifies whether the DLP rule is disabled.
Disabled.title: Disabled

GenerateAlert.description: The GenerateAlert parameter specifies an action for the DLP rule that notifies the specified users when the conditions of the rule are met.
GenerateAlert.title: GenerateAlert

GenerateIncidentReport.description: The GenerateIncidentReport parameter specifies an action for the DLP rule that sends an incident report to the specified users when the conditions of the rule are met.
GenerateIncidentReport.title: GenerateIncidentReport

IncidentReportContent.description: The IncidentReportContent parameter specifies the content to include in the report when you use the GenerateIncidentReport parameter.
IncidentReportContent.title: IncidentReportContent

NotifyAllowOverride.description: The NotifyAllowOverride parameter specifies the notification override options when the conditions of the rule are met.
NotifyAllowOverride.title: NotifyAllowOverride

NotifyEmailCustomText.description: The NotifyEmailCustomText parameter specifies the custom text in the email notification message that's sent to recipients when the conditions of the rule are met.
NotifyEmailCustomText.title: NotifyEmailCustomText

NotifyPolicyTipCustomText.description: The NotifyPolicyTipCustomText parameter specifies the custom text in the Policy Tip notification message that's shown to recipients when the conditions of the rule are met. The maximum length is 256 characters. HTML tags and tokens (variables) aren't supported.
NotifyPolicyTipCustomText.title: NotifyPolicyTipCustomText

NotifyUser.description: The NotifyUser parameter specifies an action for the DLP rule that notifies the specified users when the conditions of the rule are met.
NotifyUser.title: NotifyUser

ReportSeverityLevel.description: The ReportSeverityLevel parameter specifies the severity level of the incident report for content detections based on the rule.
ReportSeverityLevel.title: ReportSeverityLevel

RuleErrorAction.description: The RuleErrorAction parameter specifies what to do if an error is encountered during the evaluation of the rule.
RuleErrorAction.title: RuleErrorAction

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords.description: The AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for words or phrases in recipient email addresses.
AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords.title: AnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords

AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns.description: The AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for text patterns in recipient email addresses by using regular expressions.
AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns.title: AnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns

RemoveRMSTemplate.description: The RemoveRMSTemplate parameter specifies an action for the DLP rule that removes Office 365 Message Encryption from messages and their attachments.
RemoveRMSTemplate.title: RemoveRMSTemplate

StopPolicyProcessing.description: The StopPolicyProcessing parameter specifies an action that stops processing more DLP policy rules.
StopPolicyProcessing.title: StopPolicyProcessing

DocumentIsUnsupported.description: The DocumentIsUnsupported parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for files that can't be scanned.
DocumentIsUnsupported.title: DocumentIsUnsupported

ExceptIfDocumentIsUnsupported.description: The ExceptIfDocumentIsUnsupported parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for files that can't be scanned.
ExceptIfDocumentIsUnsupported.title: ExceptIfDocumentIsUnsupported

HasSenderOverride.description: The SenderOverride parameter specifies a condition for the rule that looks for messages where the sender chose to override a DLP policy.
HasSenderOverride.title: HasSenderOverride

ExceptIfHasSenderOverride.description: The ExceptIfHasSenderOverride parameter specifies an exception for the rule that looks for messages where the sender chose to override a DLP policy.
ExceptIfHasSenderOverride.title: ExceptIfHasSenderOverride

ProcessingLimitExceeded.description: The ProcessingLimitExceeded parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for files where scanning couldn't complete.
ProcessingLimitExceeded.title: ProcessingLimitExceeded

ExceptIfProcessingLimitExceeded.description: The ExceptIfProcessingLimitExceeded parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for files where scanning couldn't complete.
ExceptIfProcessingLimitExceeded.title: ExceptIfProcessingLimitExceeded

DocumentIsPasswordProtected.description: The DocumentIsPasswordProtected parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for password protected files (because the contents of the file can't be inspected). Password detection only works for Office documents and .zip files.
DocumentIsPasswordProtected.title: DocumentIsPasswordProtected

ExceptIfDocumentIsPasswordProtected.description: The ExceptIfDocumentIsPasswordProtected parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for password protected files (because the contents of the file can't be inspected). Password detection only works for Office documents and .zip files.
ExceptIfDocumentIsPasswordProtected.title: ExceptIfDocumentIsPasswordProtected

MessageTypeMatches.description: The MessageTypeMatches parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for types of SMIME message patterns.
MessageTypeMatches.title: MessageTypeMatches

FromScope.description: The FromScope parameter specifies whether messages from inside or outside the organisation are in scope for the DLP rule.
FromScope.title: FromScope

ExceptIfFromScope.description: The ExceptIfFromScope parameter specifies whether messages from inside or outside the organisation are in scope for the DLP rule.
ExceptIfFromScope.title: ExceptIfFromScope

SubjectContainsWords.description: The SubjectContainsWords parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for words or phrases in the Subject field of messages. You can specify multiple words or phrases separated by commas.
SubjectContainsWords.title: SubjectContainsWords

SubjectMatchesPatterns.description: The SubjectMatchesPatterns parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for text patterns in the Subject field of messages by using regular expressions.
SubjectMatchesPatterns.title: SubjectMatchesPatterns

SubjectOrBodyContainsWords.description: The SubjectOrBodyContainsWords parameter specifies a condition for the rule that looks for words in the Subject field or body of messages.
SubjectOrBodyContainsWords.title: SubjectOrBodyContainsWords

SubjectOrBodyMatchesPatterns.description: The SubjectOrBodyMatchesPatterns parameter specifies a condition for the rule that looks for text patterns in the Subject field or body of messages.
SubjectOrBodyMatchesPatterns.title: SubjectOrBodyMatchesPatterns

ContentCharacterSetContainsWords.description: The ContentCharacterSetContainsWords parameter specifies a condition for the rule that looks for character set names in messages. You can specify multiple values separated by commas.
ContentCharacterSetContainsWords.title: ContentCharacterSetContainsWords

DocumentNameMatchesPatterns.description: The DocumentNameMatchesPatterns parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for text patterns in the name of message attachments by using regular expressions.
DocumentNameMatchesPatterns.title: DocumentNameMatchesPatterns

DocumentNameMatchesWords.description: The DocumentNameMatchesWords parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for words or phrases in the name of message attachments.
DocumentNameMatchesWords.title: DocumentNameMatchesWords

ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWor.description: he ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for words or phrases in recipient email addresses.
ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWor.title: ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressContainsWords

ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatt.description: The ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for text patterns in recipient email addresses by using regular expressions.
ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatt.title: ExceptIfAnyOfRecipientAddressMatchesPatterns

ExceptIfContentCharacterSetContainsWords.description: The ExceptIfContentCharacterSetContainsWords parameter specifies an exception for the rule that looks for character set names in messages.
ExceptIfContentCharacterSetContainsWords.title: ExceptIfContentCharacterSetContainsWords

ExceptIfContentPropertyContainsWords.description: The ExceptIfContentPropertyContainsWords parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that's based on a property match in content.
ExceptIfContentPropertyContainsWords.title: ExceptIfContentPropertyContainsWords

ExceptIfDocumentNameMatchesPatterns.description: The ExceptIfDocumentNameMatchesPatterns parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for text patterns in the name of message attachments by using regular expressions.
ExceptIfDocumentNameMatchesPatterns.title: ExceptIfDocumentNameMatchesPatterns

ExceptIfDocumentNameMatchesWords.description: The ExceptIfDocumentNameMatchesWords parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for words or phrases in the name of message attachments.
ExceptIfDocumentNameMatchesWords.title: ExceptIfDocumentNameMatchesWords

ExceptIfFromAddressContainsWords.description: The ExceptIfFromAddressContainsWords parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for words or phrases in the sender's email address.
ExceptIfFromAddressContainsWords.title: ExceptIfFromAddressContainsWords

ExceptIfFromAddressMatchesPatterns.description: The ExceptIfFromAddressMatchesPatterns parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for text patterns in the sender's email address by using regular expressions.
ExceptIfFromAddressMatchesPatterns.title: ExceptIfFromAddressMatchesPatterns

FromAddressContainsWords.description: The FromAddressContainsWords parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for words or phrases in the sender's email address.
FromAddressContainsWords.title: FromAddressContainsWords

FromAddressMatchesPatterns.description: The FromAddressMatchesPatterns parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for text patterns in the sender's email address by using regular expressions.
FromAddressMatchesPatterns.title: FromAddressMatchesPatterns

ExceptIfMessageTypeMatches.description: The ExceptIfMessageTypeMatches parameter specifies an exception for the rule that looks for messages of the specified type.
ExceptIfMessageTypeMatches.title: ExceptIfMessageTypeMatches

RecipientDomainIs.description: The RecipientDomainIs parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for recipients with email addresses in the specified domains.
RecipientDomainIs.title: RecipientDomainIs

ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for recipients with email addresses in the specified domains.
ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs.title: ExceptIfRecipientDomainIs

ExceptIfSenderDomainIs.description: The ExceptIfSenderDomainIs parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for messages from senders with email address in the specified domains.
ExceptIfSenderDomainIs.title: ExceptIfSenderDomainIs

ExceptIfSenderIPRanges.description: The ExceptIfSenderIpRanges parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for senders whose IP addresses matches the specified value, or fall within the specified ranges.
ExceptIfSenderIPRanges.title: ExceptIfSenderIPRanges

ExceptIfSentTo.description: The ExceptIfSentTo parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for recipients in messages. You identify the recipients by email address.
ExceptIfSentTo.title: ExceptIfSentTo

ExceptIfSubjectContainsWords.description: The ExceptIfSubjectContainsWords parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for words or phrases in the Subject field of messages.
ExceptIfSubjectContainsWords.title: ExceptIfSubjectContainsWords

ExceptIfSubjectMatchesPatterns.description: The ExceptIfSubjectMatchesPatterns parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for text patterns in the Subject field of messages by using regular expressions.
ExceptIfSubjectMatchesPatterns.title: ExceptIfSubjectMatchesPatterns

ExceptIfSubjectOrBodyContainsWords.description: The ExceptIfSubjectOrBodyContainsWords parameter specifies an exception for the rule that looks for words in the Subject field or body of messages.
ExceptIfSubjectOrBodyContainsWords.title: ExceptIfSubjectOrBodyContainsWords

ExceptIfSubjectOrBodyMatchesPatterns.description: The ExceptIfSubjectOrBodyMatchesPatterns parameter specifies an exception for the rule that looks for text patterns in the Subject field or body of messages.
ExceptIfSubjectOrBodyMatchesPatterns.title: ExceptIfSubjectOrBodyMatchesPatterns

DocumentContainsWords.description: The DocumentContainsWords parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for words in message attachments. Only supported attachment types are checked.
DocumentContainsWords.title: DocumentContainsWords

SentToMemberOf.description: The SentToMemberOf parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for messages sent to members of distribution groups, dynamic distribution groups, or mail-enabled security groups.
SentToMemberOf.title: SentToMemberOf

ContentIsNotLabeled.description: The ContentIsNotLabeled parameter specifies if the content is labeled. A True or False condition.
ContentIsNotLabeled.title: ContentIsNotLabeled

SetHeader.description: The SetHeader The SetHeader parameter specifies an action for the DLP rule that adds or modifies a header field and value in the message header. You can specify multiple header name and value pairs separated by commas
SetHeader.title: SetHeader

ContentExtensionMatchesWords.description: The ContentExtensionMatchesWords parameter specifies a condition for the DLP rule that looks for words in file name extensions. You can specify multiple words separated by commas.
ContentExtensionMatchesWords.title: ContentExtensionMatchesWords

ExceptIfContentExtensionMatchesWords.description: The ExceptIfContentExtensionMatchesWords parameter specifies an exception for the DLP rule that looks for words in file name extensions. You can specify multiple words separated by commas.
ExceptIfContentExtensionMatchesWords.title: ExceptIfContentExtensionMatchesWords

microsoft.securityandcompliance.labelpol.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.labelpolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name for the sensitivity label. The maximum length is 64 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Name.title: Name

Ensure.description: Specify if this label policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

items.description: This resource configures a Sensitivity label policy in Security and Compliance.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_SCLabelSetting

AdvancedSettings.description: The AdvancedSettings parameter enables client-specific features and capabilities on the sensitivity label. The settings that you configure with this parameter only affect apps that are designed for the setting.
AdvancedSettings.title: AdvancedSettings

ExchangeLocation.description: The ExchangeLocation parameter specifies the mailboxes to include in the policy.
ExchangeLocation.title: ExchangeLocation

ExchangeLocationException.description: The ExchangeLocationException parameter specifies the mailboxes to exclude when you use the value All for the ExchangeLocation parameter.
ExchangeLocationException.title: ExchangeLocationException

ModernGroupLocation.description: The ModernGroupLocation parameter specifies the Microsoft 365 Groups to include in the policy.
ModernGroupLocation.title: ModernGroupLocation

ModernGroupLocationException.description: The ModernGroupLocationException parameter specifies the Microsoft 365 Groups to exclude when you're using the value All for the ModernGroupLocation parameter.
ModernGroupLocationException.title: ModernGroupLocationException

Labels.description: The Labels parameter specifies the sensitivity labels that are associated with the policy. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the label.
Labels.title: Labels

AddExchangeLocation.description: The AddExchangeLocation parameter specifies the mailboxes to add in the existing policy.
AddExchangeLocation.title: AddExchangeLocation

AddExchangeLocationException.description: The AddExchangeLocationException parameter specifies the mailboxes to add to exclusions when you use the value All for the ExchangeLocation parameter.
AddExchangeLocationException.title: AddExchangeLocationException

AddModernGroupLocation.description: The AddModernGroupLocation parameter specifies the Microsoft 365 Groups to add to include the policy.
AddModernGroupLocation.title: AddModernGroupLocation

AddModernGroupLocationException.description: The AddModernGroupLocationException parameter specifies the Microsoft 365 Groups to add to exclusions when you're using the value All for the ModernGroupLocation parameter.
AddModernGroupLocationException.title: AddModernGroupLocationException

AddLabels.description: The AddLabels parameter specifies the sensitivity labels to add to the policy. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the label.
AddLabels.title: AddLabels

RemoveExchangeLocation.description: The RemoveExchangeLocation parameter specifies the mailboxes to remove from the policy.
RemoveExchangeLocation.title: RemoveExchangeLocation

RemoveExchangeLocationException.description: The RemoveExchangeLocationException parameter specifies the mailboxes to remove when you use the value All for the ExchangeLocation parameter.
RemoveExchangeLocationException.title: RemoveExchangeLocationException

RemoveModernGroupLocation.description: The RemoveModernGroupLocation parameter specifies the Microsoft 365 Groups to remove from the policy.
RemoveModernGroupLocation.title: RemoveModernGroupLocation

RemoveModernGroupLocationException.description: The RemoveModernGroupLocationException parameter specifies the Microsoft 365 Groups to remove from excluded values when you're using the value All for the ModernGroupLocation parameter.
RemoveModernGroupLocationException.title: RemoveModernGroupLocationException

RemoveLabels.description: The RemoveLabels parameter specifies the sensitivity labels that are removed from the policy. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the label.
RemoveLabels.title: RemoveLabels

microsoft.securityandcompliance.protecti.description:
This resource configures a Protection Alert
in Security and Compliance Center.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.protecti.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.protectionalert

AlertBy.description: Specifies the scope for aggregated alert policies
AlertBy.title: AlertBy

AlertFor.description: This parameter is reserved for internal Microsoft use
AlertFor.title: AlertFor

AggregationType.description: Specifies how the alert policy triggers alerts for multiple occurrences of monitored activity
AggregationType.title: AggregationType

Category.description: Specifies a category for the alert policy
Category.title: Category

Disabled.description: Enables or disables the alert policy
Disabled.title: Disabled

Ensure.description: Specify if this alert should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Filter.description: The Filter parameter uses OPATH syntax to filter the results by the specified properties and values
Filter.title: Filter

Name.description: Specifies the unique name for the alert policy
Name.title: Name

NotificationCulture.description: Specifies the language or locale that's used for notifications. For example, da-DK for Danish
NotificationCulture.title: NotificationCulture

NotifyUserOnFilterMatch.description: Specifies whether to trigger an alert for a single event when the alert policy is configured for aggregated activity
NotifyUserOnFilterMatch.title: NotifyUserOnFilterMatch

NotifyUserSuppressionExpiryDate.description: Specifies whether to temporarily suspend notifications for the alert policy. Until the specified date-time, no notifications are sent for detected activities.
NotifyUserSuppressionExpiryDate.title: NotifyUserSuppressionExpiryDate

NotifyUserThrottleThreshold.description: Specifies the maximum number of notifications for the alert policy within the time period specified by the NotifyUserThrottleWindow parameter. Once the maximum number of notifications has been reached in the time period, no more notifications are sent for the alert.
NotifyUserThrottleThreshold.title: NotifyUserThrottleThreshold

NotifyUserThrottleWindow.description: Specifies the time interval in minutes that's used by the NotifyUserThrottleThreshold parameter
NotifyUserThrottleWindow.title: NotifyUserThrottleWindow

NotifyUser.description: Specifies the SMTP address of the user who receives notification messages for the alert policy. You can specify multiple values separated by commas
NotifyUser.title: NotifyUser

Operation.description: Specifies the activities that are monitored by the alert policy
Operation.title: Operation

Severity.description: specifies the severity of the detection
Severity.title: Severity

ThreatType.description: Specifies the type of activities that are monitored by the alert policy
ThreatType.title: ThreatType

Threshold.description: Specifies the number of detections that trigger the alert policy within the time period specified by the TimeWindow parameter. A valid value is an integer that's greater than or equal to 3.
Threshold.title: Threshold

TimeWindow.description: Specifies the time interval in minutes for number of detections specified by the Threshold parameter. A valid value is an integer that's greater than 60 (one hour).
TimeWindow.title: TimeWindow

microsoft.securityandcompliance.retentio.description: This resource configures a Retention Compliance Policy in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.retentio.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.retentioncompliancepolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the retention policy.
Name.title: Name

Ensure.description: Specify if this policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

DynamicScopeLocation.description: Location of the dynamic scope for this policy.
DynamicScopeLocation.title: DynamicScopeLocation

Enabled.description: Determines if the policy is enabled or not.
Enabled.title: Enabled

ExchangeLocation.description: The ExchangeLocation parameter specifies the mailboxes to include.
ExchangeLocation.title: ExchangeLocation

ExchangeLocationException.description: This parameter specifies the mailboxes to remove from the list of excluded mailboxes when you use the value All for the ExchangeLocation parameter
ExchangeLocationException.title: ExchangeLocationException

ModernGroupLocation.description: The ModernGroupLocation parameter specifies the Office 365 groups to include in the policy.
ModernGroupLocation.title: ModernGroupLocation

ModernGroupLocationException.description: The ModernGroupLocationException parameter specifies the Office 365 groups to exclude when you're using the value All for the ModernGroupLocation parameter.
ModernGroupLocationException.title: ModernGroupLocationException

OneDriveLocation.description: The OneDriveLocation parameter specifies the OneDrive for Business sites to include. You identify the site by its URL value, or you can use the value All to include all sites.
OneDriveLocation.title: OneDriveLocation

OneDriveLocationException.description: This parameter specifies the OneDrive for Business sites to exclude when you use the value All for the OneDriveLocation parameter. You identify the site by its URL value.
OneDriveLocationException.title: OneDriveLocationException

PublicFolderLocation.description: The PublicFolderLocation parameter specifies that you want to include all public folders in the retention policy. You use the value All for this parameter.
PublicFolderLocation.title: PublicFolderLocation

RestrictiveRetention.description: The RestrictiveRetention parameter specifies whether Preservation Lock is enabled for the policy.
RestrictiveRetention.title: RestrictiveRetention

SharePointLocation.description: The SharePointLocation parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to include. You identify the site by its URL value, or you can use the value All to include all sites.
SharePointLocation.title: SharePointLocation

SharePointLocationException.description: This parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to exclude when you use the value All for the SharePointLocation parameter. You identify the site by its URL value.
SharePointLocationException.title: SharePointLocationException

SkypeLocation.description: The SkypeLocation parameter specifies the Skype for Business Online users to include in the policy.
SkypeLocation.title: SkypeLocation

SkypeLocationException.description: This parameter is reserved for internal Microsoft use.
SkypeLocationException.title: SkypeLocationException

TeamsChannelLocation.description: The TeamsChannelLocation parameter specifies the Teams Channel to include in the policy.
TeamsChannelLocation.title: TeamsChannelLocation

TeamsChannelLocationException.description: This parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to exclude when you use the value All for the TeamsChannelLocation parameter. You identify the site by its URL value.
TeamsChannelLocationException.title: TeamsChannelLocationException

TeamsChatLocation.description: The TeamsChatLocation parameter specifies the Teams Chat to include in the policy.
TeamsChatLocation.title: TeamsChatLocation

TeamsChatLocationException.description: This parameter specifies the SharePoint Online sites to exclude when you use the value All for the TeamsChatLocation parameter. You identify the site by its URL value.
TeamsChatLocationException.title: TeamsChatLocationException

microsoft.securityandcompliance.retentio.description: This resource configures a Retention Compliance Rule in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.retentio.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.retentioncompliancerule

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the retention rule.
Name.title: Name

Policy.description: The Policy parameter specifies the policy to contain the rule.
Policy.title: Policy

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

ExpirationDateOption.description: The ExpirationDateOption parameter specifies whether the expiration date is calculated from the content creation date or last modification date. Valid values are: CreationAgeInDays and ModificationAgeInDays.
ExpirationDateOption.title: ExpirationDateOption

ExcludedItemClasses.description: The ExcludedItemClasses parameter specifies the types of messages to exclude from the rule. You can use this parameter only to exclude items from a hold policy, which excludes the specified item class from being held. Using this parameter won't exclude items from deletion policies. Typically, you use this parameter to exclude voicemail messages, IM conversations, and other Skype for Business Online content from being held by a hold policy.
ExcludedItemClasses.title: ExcludedItemClasses

ContentMatchQuery.description: The ContentMatchQuery parameter specifies a content search filter.
ContentMatchQuery.title: ContentMatchQuery

RetentionComplianceAction.description: The RetentionComplianceAction parameter specifies the retention action for the rule. Valid values are: Delete, Keep and KeepAndDelete.
RetentionComplianceAction.title: RetentionComplianceAction

RetentionDuration.description: The RetentionDuration parameter specifies the hold duration for the retention rule. Valid values are: An integer - The hold duration in days, Unlimited - The content is held indefinitely.
RetentionDuration.title: RetentionDuration

RetentionDurationDisplayHint.description: The RetentionDurationDisplayHint parameter specifies the units that are used to display the retention duration in the Security and Compliance Center. Valid values are: Days, Months or Years.
RetentionDurationDisplayHint.title: RetentionDurationDisplayHint

microsoft.securityandcompliance.retentio.description: This resource configures a Retention Event Type in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.retentio.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.retentioneventtype

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name of the retention event type.
Name.title: Name

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

microsoft.securityandcompliance.security.description: This resource configures a Security Filter in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.security.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.securityfilter

FilterName.description: The FilterName parameter specifies the name of the compliance security filter that you want to view. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks (\").
FilterName.title: FilterName

Action.description: The Action parameter filters the results by the type of search action that a filter is applied to.
Action.title: Action

Users.description: The User parameter filters the results by the user who gets a filter applied to their searches. Acceptable values are : The alias or email address of a user, All or The name of a role group
Users.title: Users

Description.description: The Description parameter specifies a description for the compliance security filter. The maximum length is 256 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks (\").
Description.title: Description

Filters.description: The Filters parameter specifies the search criteria for the compliance security filter. The filters are applied to the users specified by the Users parameter. You can create three different types of filters: Mailbox filter, Mailbox content filter or Site and site content filter
Filters.title: Filters

Region.description: The Region parameter specifies the satellite location for multi-geo tenants to conduct eDiscovery searches in.
Region.title: Region

Ensure.description: Specify if this label policy should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.securityandcompliance.sensitiv.description: This resource configures Sensitivity labels in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.sensitiv.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.sensitivitylabel

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name for the sensitivity label. The maximum length is 64 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Name.title: Name

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment.
Comment.title: Comment

items.description: This resource configures a Sensitivity label policy in Security and Compliance.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_SCLabelSetting

AdvancedSettings.description: The AdvancedSettings parameter enables client-specific features and capabilities on the sensitivity label. The settings that you configure with this parameter only affect apps that are designed for the setting.
AdvancedSettings.title: AdvancedSettings

DisplayName.description: The DisplayName parameter specifies the display name for the sensitivity label. The display name appears in the Microsoft Office and is used by Outlook users to select the appropriate sensitivity label before they send a message.
DisplayName.title: DisplayName

items.description: This resource configures Sensitivity labels in Security and Compliance.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_SCLabelLocaleSettings

items.description: This resource configures a Sensitivity label policy in Security and Compliance.
items.title: Schema for MSFT_SCLabelSetting

LocaleSettings.description: The LocaleSettings parameter specifies one or more localized label name or label Tooltips in different languages. Regions include all region codes supported in Office Client applications.
LocaleSettings.title: LocaleSettings

ParentId.description: The ParentId parameter specifies the parent label that you want this label to be under (a sublabel). You can use any value that uniquely identifies the parent sensitivity label for example name.
ParentId.title: ParentId

Priority.description: The Priority parameter specifies a priority value for the sensitivity label that determines the order of label processing. A lower integer value indicates a higher priority.
Priority.title: Priority

Tooltip.description: The ToolTip parameter specifies the default tooltip and sensitivity label description that's seen by users. It the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Tooltip.title: Tooltip

ApplyContentMarkingFooterAlignment.description: The ApplyContentMarkingFooterAlignment parameter specifies the footer alignment.
ApplyContentMarkingFooterAlignment.title: ApplyContentMarkingFooterAlignment

ApplyContentMarkingFooterEnabled.description: The ApplyContentMarkingFooterEnabled parameter specifies whether to enable or disable the sensitivity label.
ApplyContentMarkingFooterEnabled.title: ApplyContentMarkingFooterEnabled

ApplyContentMarkingFooterFontColor.description: The ApplyContentMarkingFooterFontColor parameter specifies the color of the footer text. This parameter accepts a hexadecimal color code value in the format #xxxxxx. The default value is #000000.
ApplyContentMarkingFooterFontColor.title: ApplyContentMarkingFooterFontColor

ApplyContentMarkingFooterFontSize.description: The ApplyContentMarkingFooterFontSize parameter specifies the font size (in points) of the footer text.
ApplyContentMarkingFooterFontSize.title: ApplyContentMarkingFooterFontSize

ApplyContentMarkingFooterMargin.description: The ApplyContentMarkingFooterMargin parameter specifies the size (in points) of the footer margin.
ApplyContentMarkingFooterMargin.title: ApplyContentMarkingFooterMargin

ApplyContentMarkingFooterText.description: The ApplyContentMarkingFooterText parameter specifies the footer text. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
ApplyContentMarkingFooterText.title: ApplyContentMarkingFooterText

ApplyContentMarkingHeaderAlignment.description: The ApplyContentMarkingHeaderAlignment parameter specifies the header alignment.
ApplyContentMarkingHeaderAlignment.title: ApplyContentMarkingHeaderAlignment

ApplyContentMarkingHeaderEnabled.description: The ApplyContentMarkingHeaderEnabled parameter enables or disables the Apply Content Marking Header action for the label.
ApplyContentMarkingHeaderEnabled.title: ApplyContentMarkingHeaderEnabled

ApplyContentMarkingHeaderFontColor.description: The ApplyContentMarkingHeaderFontColor parameter specifies the color of the header text. This parameter accepts a hexadecimal color code value in the format #xxxxxx. The default value is #000000.
ApplyContentMarkingHeaderFontColor.title: ApplyContentMarkingHeaderFontColor

ApplyContentMarkingHeaderFontSize.description: The ApplyContentMarkingHeaderFontSize parameter specifies the font size (in points) of the header text.
ApplyContentMarkingHeaderFontSize.title: ApplyContentMarkingHeaderFontSize

ApplyContentMarkingHeaderMargin.description: The ApplyContentMarkingHeaderMargin parameter specifies the size (in points) of the header margin.
ApplyContentMarkingHeaderMargin.title: ApplyContentMarkingHeaderMargin

ApplyContentMarkingHeaderText.description: The ApplyContentMarkingHeaderText parameter specifies the header text. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
ApplyContentMarkingHeaderText.title: ApplyContentMarkingHeaderText

ApplyWaterMarkingEnabled.description: The ApplyWaterMarkingEnabled parameter enables or disables the Apply Watermarking Header action for the label.
ApplyWaterMarkingEnabled.title: ApplyWaterMarkingEnabled

ApplyWaterMarkingFontColor.description: The ApplyWaterMarkingFontColor parameter specifies the color of the watermark text. This parameter accepts a hexadecimal color code value in the format #xxxxxx.
ApplyWaterMarkingFontColor.title: ApplyWaterMarkingFontColor

ApplyWaterMarkingFontSize.description: The ApplyWaterMarkingFontSize parameter specifies the font size (in points) of the watermark text.
ApplyWaterMarkingFontSize.title: ApplyWaterMarkingFontSize

ApplyWaterMarkingLayout.description: The ApplyWaterMarkingAlignment parameter specifies the watermark alignment.
ApplyWaterMarkingLayout.title: ApplyWaterMarkingLayout

ApplyWaterMarkingText.description: The ApplyWaterMarkingText parameter specifies the watermark text. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
ApplyWaterMarkingText.title: ApplyWaterMarkingText

ContentType.description: The ContentType parameter specifies where the sensitivity label can be applied.
ContentType.title: ContentType

EncryptionContentExpiredOnDateInDaysOrNe.description: The EncryptionContentExpiredOnDateInDaysOrNever parameter specifies when the encrypted content expires. Valid values are integer or never.
EncryptionContentExpiredOnDateInDaysOrNe.title: EncryptionContentExpiredOnDateInDaysOrNever

EncryptionDoNotForward.description: The EncryptionDoNotForward parameter specifies whether the Do Not Forward template is applied.
EncryptionDoNotForward.title: EncryptionDoNotForward

EncryptionEncryptOnly.description: The EncryptionEncryptOnly parameter specifies whether the encrypt-only template is applied.
EncryptionEncryptOnly.title: EncryptionEncryptOnly

EncryptionEnabled.description: The EncryptionEnabled parameter specifies whether encryption in enabled.
EncryptionEnabled.title: EncryptionEnabled

EncryptionOfflineAccessDays.description: The EncryptionOfflineAccessDays parameter specifies the number of days that offline access is allowed.
EncryptionOfflineAccessDays.title: EncryptionOfflineAccessDays

EncryptionPromptUser.description: The EncryptionPromptUser parameter specifies whether to set the label with user defined permission in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
EncryptionPromptUser.title: EncryptionPromptUser

EncryptionProtectionType.description: The EncryptionProtectionType parameter specifies the protection type for encryption.
EncryptionProtectionType.title: EncryptionProtectionType

EncryptionRightsDefinitions.description: The EncryptionRightsDefinitions parameter specifies the rights users have when accessing protected. This parameter uses the syntax Identity1:Rights1,Rights2;Identity2:Rights3,Rights4. For example, john@contoso.com:VIEW,EDIT;microsoft.com:VIEW.
EncryptionRightsDefinitions.title: EncryptionRightsDefinitions

EncryptionRightsUrl.description: The EncryptionRightsUrl parameter specifies the URL for hold your own key (HYOK) protection.
EncryptionRightsUrl.title: EncryptionRightsUrl

SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowAccessToGuest.description: The SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowAccessToGuestUsers parameter enables or disables access to guest users.
SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowAccessToGuest.title: SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowAccessToGuestUsers

SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowEmailFromGues.description: The SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowEmailFromGuestUsers parameter enables or disables email from guest users.
SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowEmailFromGues.title: SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowEmailFromGuestUsers

SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowFullAccess.description: The SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowFullAccess parameter enables or disables full access.
SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowFullAccess.title: SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowFullAccess

SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowLimitedAccess.description: The SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowLimitedAccess parameter enables or disables limited access.
SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowLimitedAccess.title: SiteAndGroupProtectionAllowLimitedAccess

SiteAndGroupProtectionEnabled.description: The SiteAndGroupProtectionEnabled parameter enables or disables the Site and Group Protection action for the labels.
SiteAndGroupProtectionEnabled.title: SiteAndGroupProtectionEnabled

SiteAndGroupProtectionPrivacy.description: The SiteAndGroupProtectionPrivacy parameter specifies the privacy level for the label.
SiteAndGroupProtectionPrivacy.title: SiteAndGroupProtectionPrivacy

SiteAndGroupExternalSharingControlType.description: The SiteAndGroupExternalSharingControlType parameter specifies the external user sharing setting for the label.
SiteAndGroupExternalSharingControlType.title: SiteAndGroupExternalSharingControlType

microsoft.securityandcompliance.supervis.description: This resource configures a Supervision Policy in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.supervis.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.supervisoryreviewpolicy

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name for the supervisory review policy. The name can't exceed 64 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Name.title: Name

Comment.description: The Comment parameter specifies an optional comment. If you specify a value that contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Comment.title: Comment

Reviewers.description: The Reviewers parameter specifies the SMTP addresses of the reviewers for the supervisory review policy. You can specify multiple email addresses separated by commas.
Reviewers.title: Reviewers

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

microsoft.securityandcompliance.supervis.description: This resource configures a Supervision Review Rule in Security and Compliance.
microsoft.securityandcompliance.supervis.title: Schema for microsoft.securityandcompliance.supervisoryreviewrule

Name.description: The Name parameter specifies the unique name for the supervisory review policy. The name can't exceed 64 characters. If the value contains spaces, enclose the value in quotation marks.
Name.title: Name

Policy.description: The Policy parameter specifies the supervisory review policy that's assigned to the rule. You can use any value that uniquely identifies the policy.
Policy.title: Policy

Condition.description: The Condition parameter specifies the conditions and exceptions for the rule.
Condition.title: Condition

SamplingRate.description: The SamplingRate parameter specifies the percentage of communications for review. If you want reviewers to review all detected items, use the value 100.
SamplingRate.title: SamplingRate

Ensure.description: Specify if this rule should exist or not.
Ensure.title: Ensure

items.title: baselineParameter Schema
items.description: Schema for entity baselineParameter
